Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Fun Boutique Hotel-Highly Recommend but Beware Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie C
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very trendy- it felt as if it belonged in Miami. The concierge staff was very helpful and gave us great recommendations for dining and off the beaten path excursions. The beach front was well kept with helpful staff to provide umbrellas, towels, and chairs. I would definitely recommend this hotel and was very happy with my experience. Finally, the location was ideal because it was halfway between Old San Juan and Fajardo, where many of the excursions like snorkeling, kayaking, and el Yunque take you. Warnings: Breakfast is not included. The hotel breakfast is $14 but there are excellent $3 breakfasts to be had at Ruebens and Mi Casita, both within walking distance. The papaya milkshake at Ruebens is a must! You cannot access the hotel directly from the main street with all of the restaurants. Instead there is an alley way. As two young women traveling, my friend and I always walked the extra block at night to access the hotel via another main road and then the beach road.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: shifrapple
Reviews.Content: We had a phenomenal stay at this hotel. Everyone on staff was so nice and went out of their way to make our stay as great as possible. The staff on the beach serve complimentary snacks while you're laying in the sun and the two restaurants have amazing food. The lighting and decor is awesome and the you can't beat the beach across the street - we woke up looking at the waves every morning. There are a bunch of other hotels in walking distance down the street and there is a walgreens just a block away which was super convenient. It's also in a very safe area - we walked around late at night without a problem and enjoyed the other hotels/restaurants. I really can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel - I would definitely go back and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Pete4633
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one wek from April 14th--21st. The beach is right outside the hotel; The service is very friendly and accommodating; Tours are right at your door; (Be sure to say Hi to Carlos and his wife Frances who work for the tour company). The rooftop view and deck is amazing; Our oceanview room is very clean, and trendy; Nothing fancybut very clean, and comfortable; but who spends time there; Casinos, restaurants, and other hotels very close; Recommend the mediterran cafe on the beach at the Intercontintental Hotel; Be sure to go on the rainforest, luquillo beach and cave tours; you get to see other parts of the island this way; Old San Juan is a must, about 15 minutes by cab; Eat lunch at the Hotel El Convento(an old convent); the courtyard restaurant for lunch was great; service and food excellent; If we were to go back we would stay here! (say hello to the day valets Jose Guzman and Xavier from the crazy guys from OHIO.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: pic-y
Reviews.Content: We stayed Thurs April 12- Mon April 15th Pros: - Great location - right on the beach and close to restaurants/bars/other hotels (Intercontinental, san jose), walkway to isla verde avenue. - Great beach - beautiful, clean beach. And the staff was always around when needed. Whe we arrived we were greeted and provided towels, and chairs & umbrella were set up where ever we wanted, and the waitresses were around and very attentive. We were also pleasantly suprised when one of the staff came out with free freshe fruit - Safe location - we walked everywhere day and night without any issues. - Great staff - from cleaning crew, to door men, to front desk staff, to beach staff. - Nice rooms. Comfortable bed. We were on the 4th floor. The rooms were always cleaned. - We were allowed to check in early. - We got a free upgrade to ocean view - The terrace was absolutely beautiful. The pictures are accurate. It's a great view and the atmosphere is great at sunset and night. - Free wifi and computer room where you can print Cons: - The blue lighting in the halls and elevator was dim and made me feel uneasy because it gives the feel of a cheap motel that is trying to hide something, but I got over it. - I was relieved we did not pay for the ocean view because the windows were dirty, which would have bothered me if I paid for the view. - There was a morning or two when the maids were loud enoug to interrupt our sleep (doors slamming and talking loudly) OVERALL - GREAT HOTEL!!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, awesome location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: little_debster
Reviews.Content: Just got home from an amazing trip today.. and we could not stop talking about how friendly and helpful the staff were at this hotel. We really felt welcome and were sad to leave!! They were super helpful with suggestions of restaurants and also with driving directions and suggestions on how we were to get to our day trip to Culebra (rent a car from Charlies which is across the street rather than taxi/bus). Also they supply you with complimentary fresh beach and bath towels (with 2 girls believe me we used a lot!), bring out fruit right on the beach in the afternoons, free lounge chairs and umbrellas (which they even set up for us during a rain spell when we wanted to stay on the beach cause we were so excited to be there). They have a few computers and you can print off them for free. The beach itself is great and literally steps from outside the hotel, chic lounge on the rooftop, good location between Old San Juan and to the east coast for day trips leaving from Fajardo. The only thing I would say is we would have liked a little more storage/places to hang wet towels/clothes in the rooms, and maybe a little more bright lighting. However, these were so minor and definitely easy to work around! The positives at this hotel DEFINITELY outweigh these minor minor things. We HIGHLY recommend staying at the Water Club! You will have a great time :)

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Please clean up the beach daily!”
Reviews.Author: SharonH312
Reviews.Content: We had a really lovely time. Please do have your staff pick up the garbage on the beach that drifts in, there was a lot of it. If they could do that it would be great and environmentally sensitive. But the stay was excellent....

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be closer to beach...”
Reviews.Author: Hunnybun44
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at this Boutique style hotel and enjoyed it's facilities and great position right on the beach. Reception staff were welcoming and very helpful. Juan at reception was an incredible font of knowledge!! Breakfast was expensive!! Great roof top bar with fabulous views. Easy to reach the main road and a great selection of restaurants. Took local bus to Old San Juan. An easy journey but you need the right money for the bus. Reception will tell you the correct amount. Our room was not large but modern, with built in wardrobe but only a small bedside chest of drawers, ok if only staying a couple of nights. Bathroom was clean and well equiped. It was a good 1st experience of San Juan before our cruise. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.....

Reviews.Title: “Great service, mediocre rooms”
Reviews.Author: Tom42532
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed here two nights last week. We had booked an Isla Verde condo but the owner canceled at the last minute due to water damage and we scrambled to find a suitable place to stay. The location was fine, right on the beach, although it is at the end of an alley that was a bit scary. The common areas were nice. The hotel has a chic-looking restaurant (though we did not eat there) and a very nice rooftop terrace with a bar and pool - great views of the area. The staff and service were outstanding. Every staff person we encountered was extremely helpful and friendly. The room was sparsely furnished and small - it did not even have a dresser in the bedroom or a cabinet in the bathroom. On the plus side, the room was perfectly clean and everything in it worked. I would not opt to cram four of us into a standard room again, but I recommend it to couples and singles and if you want to be lieterally steps from the beach at a reasonable price, this hotel is a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IscMcAllen
Reviews.Content: I just love this hotel, staff is very nice, rooms are ok and the best part is the terrace is great for drink, eat and dance, the location is so great I really like it :)

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Fiona D
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from a very memorable stay at the San Juan Water Club! It is an outstanding hotel for the price..top notch customer service, premier beach service, comfortable and well kept rooms, sexy and innovative style are a few things that come to mind when describing our experience. Juan (front desk manager) went out off his way to make us feel welcome and provide us with all of the information we needed. I cannot say enough good things about this property! You must see it for your self. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Mem04006
Reviews.Content: We got in on a Saturday and it was loud - to say the least! The party was on the beach directly in front of the hotel and went on until 4:00 am. Also another negative was the fact you can hear people talking in the halls and the slamming of their doors as they leave. Generally the staff was very nice with the exception of one girl who wouldn't make me a drink at 10:30 am because she was "still setting up." when I asked if I should come back she snipped to "give her a minute" so I walked away, angry. Some man who appeared to be a manager followed me and asked me what I wanted and returned shortly with the drink I wanted. Another negative is the bottled water in the room is 3$ a bottle! You think it would be free but no! My advice to you is to stay elsewhere..... And if you're going to stay here, do not do it on a weekend !!!!

Reviews.Title: “I Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Bivion N
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the San Juan Water Beach Hotel, I was totally impressed. First off I love the location right off the beach, the service was top notch, anything I needed was provided. The hotel staff including housekeeping and the young men at the front door were all curdious and helpful. I loved the roof top area, very classy. I love the whole ambience of the hotel, very sexy. The rooms were very clean and well maintained during my stay. I was very impressed with the friendliness of all the staff especially the manager. I would definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, even better beach”
Reviews.Author: Bpflyerone
Reviews.Content: This place was in the middle of everything and located right on the best beach in PR. The staff was great, the rooms were great too. The only problem with the rooms was that there were no closets, or dressers (there was a place to hang clothes though), but really for the price and location, who cares about dressers.

Reviews.Title: “More than satisfy!”
Reviews.Author: cmdelgadom
Reviews.Content: Nothing bad to say...the experience was great!!! Excellent service from the valet to the director, value, accomodation, location. The hotel is decorate with good taste, very trendy style. We also celebrate a birthday party at the lounge, located at the roof and the service and attention received was formidable. The olny thing I would change is the check-in time, but if you call before and the room is available, thay allow you to arrive earlier.

Reviews.Title: “They should omit the "hotel" part and just call it a club.”
Reviews.Author: Sharon K
Reviews.Content: I am surprised how well-reviewed this hotel has been despite some major issues I saw there. If you are looking for a hotel to relax at and are expecting a comfortable, homey feel, this is most likely not the hotel for you. This "hotel" is more of a club, that happens to have rooms if you need to pass out after partying upstairs at their bar. I think I also saw a couple of snookis. As soon as you walk into the hotel, there is a blinding blue light. The concept of the hotel seems to be "as much as blue as possible so we can hide all the imperfections and cracks in the wall." I am no perfectionist but for the amount of money we paid, this was off-turning. The elevator also shines blue light down you and pumps loud music into your ears. We stayed on the 3rd floor so we just took the stairs after the first time. I was hoping the rooms might be better but the hallways leading the the rooms were dark except for the blue, and when I turned on the room lights.... BLUE. The blue lights are strong enough to be migraine inducing. One good thing is that the staff are nice enough and so we had the blue light bulbs changed out to normal ones (which then the maid changed back to blue lights the next day.) Despite the information travel agencies offer, there is no American breakfast, iPod whatevers, iron boards, etc. There also is no ice machine available so the staff had to bring us a bucket of ice to our room. They used a sand bucket. Also, the room has a horribly loud AC and it also leaks water across the floor. I would not be criticizing this place so much if it were actually worth the money but it was not. The slight advantage they have is that the beach is right in front of you. You could roll down the stairs out the door and be at the beach. That being said, the beach wasn't spectacular, it was just okay. I would rather pay the same amount of money and stay at the Embassy, which was a block away.

Reviews.Title: “It's a club, not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: s_front_row
Reviews.Content: It's midnight, and I just called the reception and asked them when they will stop playing the ridiculously loud club music which travels down all the way to the 4th floor where I am (it's even worse on the floors above). I was told they have activities going on till 3 am!! I came here for some R&R on the beach, not to feel like I am in the middle of a nightclub. I can't hear the sound of the ocean waves or the wind with their DJ going at it on the rooftop. Maybe if the construction was a bit better, the sound wouldn't travel as much. For now, the sleep quality is compromised. I am not excited about 4 more nights I have booked here.

Reviews.Title: “On the roof all night long!!!”
Reviews.Author: rasbrat
Reviews.Content: What a cool Hotel! I was at the same hotel a few years back visiting friends and what a major improvement since them. We hung out on the roof top bar for a long time. It was so relaxing and even though the beach was right there and beautiful this bar was so chic and trendy you just wanted to stay. The staff at the hotel were so nice and helpful, they just went out of thier way to help you any way they could. Jada at the front desk was a sweetheart and she works so hard but still has a unbelievable smile on her face all the time. Verna the concierge could not do enough for my wife and I, she was a true professional. Those are just two of what seemed like over a hundred staff because everyone was so nice and friendly. I would recommend this Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: khepk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in February 2012. We received fabulous service, room was adequate, it could use a little sprucing up here and there, but not bad, they need to put ice machines in, but they are working on that. They provide you with beach chairs, towels, and beach umbrellas. This is a big plus on a beautiful stretch of Puertorican Beach. The hotel is undertaking a remodeling, and so far everything that has been done is A+. The rooftop bar is really beautiful and a must see. The staff is extremely friendly and go out of their way to help you out with all your needs and wishes. Most afternoons they come around and serve you some fresh fruit on sticks or iced coconut cups on the beach, as a treat too! A nice touch. I highly recommend this hotel, its staff, the location, its amenities are worth the trip!

Reviews.Title: “Beach front beauty”
Reviews.Author: B0ri
Reviews.Content: Love this place. Located right in front of the beach. Newly renovated. The entire hotel is designed on aqua theme. Everything is white and shades of aqua. Very clean and well maintained. Rooms are small but fine for a vacation. One bedroom with a small storage area. No closet. Decent bathroom. Rooftop restaurant and swimming pool plus a ground floor restaurant. Food is good. Rooftop restaurant serves italian-spanish fusion. Room Service is expensive though. Parking is valet with $15 per night charge. Free to go in and out. We were charged 10$ for towel rental which was bad. We were not told about it. So beware. Internet speed was good. Perfect location. Central to all sightseeing. Staff is very friendly and very attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely come back!......”
Reviews.Author: LINLIN2216
Reviews.Content: So here is the scoop, the hotel was very chic and modern. Reminded me much of the art deco hotels in Miami. I loved the roof top and the view was amazing and relaxing. Lunch was delicous on the roof top bar too. The elevator waterfall was cool and different. Wish the room was a little bigger with a closet but it is a boutique hotel. My boyfriend loved the black light which turned the room blue it was different for sure. The beach was picture prefect and the service on the beach was on point. They brought over fruit, water, and coconut drinks. The service at the hotel overall was superb. The front desk service was outstanding. I recommend renting a car so you can travel the island. The rainforest and old san juan was a great experience, the views were awesome. Ask the front desk for directions and great places to eat. Location was def a plus for this hotel. Everything is in walking distance and 5 mins for the airport can't be beat. So go enjoy and relax. Overall I would come back and recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Beachfront great roof patio”
Reviews.Author: CanadaRockiesgirl
Reviews.Content: Not really crazy about the doubles room You need to stay oceanfront king

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelChic
Reviews.Content: My second stay at Water Club.... one of my favorite spots in San Juan! This small boutique hotel, allows you to relax, with style! Trimmed in blue neon lights, with waterfalls inside the elevators, and a wonderful, relaxing scent in the halls.. The roof top pool and restaurant/ bar is fabulous... great food and drinks! With dancing and music on the weekends. The beach is beautiful. The service is excellent, all the way around!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely coming back here!”
Reviews.Author: kelly s
Reviews.Content: My first trip to PR was in Sept 2011 with my bf and although i'm horribly late with this review, the comfort offered at this hotel is still fresh in my mind. Everyone at the hotel was wonderful and the beach was quiet and relaxing. It was everything I was looking for in my short vacation as we went from Sat to Wed. When we went there where not a lot of guests in the hotel, which made it even better. I definitely recommend this location as it's 5min from the airport and the staff was so friendly. Enjoy PR!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Michael V
Reviews.Content: What a great find! This small ocean front boutique hotel can't be beat. The location is outstanding, directly on the beach at the end of a quiet cul de sac, yet seconds away from Isla Verde Ave with all the restaurants, shops, and casino. We stayed four nights in an ocean front suite. The room was clean, airy, quiet, with stellar ocean and beach views. The staff was outstanding. Every request was made with a sincere smile. You couldn't ask for a more outstanding hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel to my friends and if I am ever back in San Juan, there will be no other hotel I would stay in, The San Juan Water and Beach Club. Five Stars!!

Reviews.Title: “Top 3 Vacations yet...”
Reviews.Author: emalee337
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4nights, the staff was very pleasant and helpful. Not family friendly but good for couples. My bf and I didn't enjoy all the emeneties the hotel had to offer but we enjoyed a good nights rest, nice shower, towels, and the pool/club at night. Room was clean and housekeeping did a good job. This is prime location very close to old san juan and the airport we had to drive about 30-45min to get to el yuqune and to get the ferry to culebra but it wasn't bad. I recommend taking the ferry to culebra or vieques island its very beautiful. The only down fall is that they charge for valet parking $15 a night and food/drinks are very expensive. Since we rented a car we drove out of isle verde to get food and drinks. There is an area close to the hotel that you can park for free that we used 2nights but its hard to find an open spot.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Find”
Reviews.Author: Professor10_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if you want comfort and great service. It's art deco design is clean and neat lacking clutter. There is a fabulous beach just steps from the front door. It's much less crowded than Condado are and equally beautiful. Also, still a short ride to Old San Juan. I strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grrrreat hotel”
Reviews.Author: curly1018
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Puerto Rico and it won't be our last. We love everything in this hotel we felt like the royal family. All there staff is so wonderful we felt at home. Thank you everyone from the Gomez family see you next year.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely 100% Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ClearviewCat
Reviews.Content: This gem of a boutique hotel -- situated just steps away from the vast sandy beaches and balmy breezes of Isla Verde -- provided me with the most relaxing and enjoyable vacation I've ever had. From the billowing white sheers that greet you at the entranceway, to the warm, friendly and incredibly accommodating staff - -and the chic blue-and white decor (replete with blue waterfalls in both elevators!), this hotel has all the hospitality and ambience you could possibly desire. It also features the most gorgeous rooftop restaurant I've ever seen -- beautifully and comfortably furnished, with commanding views of the coastline. And the food? Simply scrumptious. We loved the food so much we ate there four out of the five days we stayed there! Don't miss the calamari in a soy lime dressing, the salmon ceviche in a soy-lime-avoccado-cilantro-champagne and orange foam, or the ricotta donuts glazed in a grand mariner-caramel. And the mojitos were the best we've ever had. I am hard to please, but I just cannot say enough good things about this hotel. We're already planning our return trip next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Water & Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: 216Susan
Reviews.Content: Water & Beach Club was just awesome. The service was excellent. Pedro, Steve & Danny on the beach were the best. The front desk staff were always helpful. The rooms were clean and bright. This is our third stay there and it gets better every time we stay. The beach chairs, towels and umbrellas add to the reason we stay there. Continental breakfast was plentiful and good.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, super relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Caprice164
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, great location right off the beach, great place to eat in the neighbor on the cheap and to hang out the tangerine restraunt in the hotel , not cheap but was excellent . Warnings--- not for families especially of staying on Friday and weekend because the music is so loud on roof top lounge you will not sleep. The the blue light can be distracting and annoying at times. Expect slow room service, because the hotel is so smal,l not many employees. If this hotel is not for you and like the area the San Jaun hotel and casino is beautiful and massive , starbucks in hotel also.

Reviews.Title: “Hipster Hotel in Isla Verde”
Reviews.Author: Jimmz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this chicly remodelled hotel in February with my 27 year old daughter. It was probably designed more for her age group than mine but I didn't feel out of place. We arrived late after our plane was delayed at JFK (from the West Coast) and the desk staff was welcoming and offered late night food menus etc. We stopped for a drink at the rooftop bar, which was nice but the DJ was playing such loud dance music (with no one dancing) that we were reduced to screaming our drink orders at the bartender. Drinks were generous but we didn't return. The room is simplicity itself, perhaps a little too minimalist for most travellers. It's the sort of thing that looks great in a travel magazine; white bed centred in front of a huge window with a beautiful beach view, sheer white curtains, watery blue lighting and no, repeat no, extraneous furniture. We found the small wardrobe barely adequate for our hanging clothes and by the end of our five nights living out of our suitcases was getting a bit messy. There is no iron or ironing board but there is a safe and a (smallish) tv. You are not there to watch tv, hopefully. No bedside tables but small reading lights are convenient. The bathroom is good size and and clean and attractive although the "rain" shower is more like a drizzle. Stylish but it took me 15 minutes to rinse my hair! I'm trying to be honest but I would absolutely stay here again. All the beds seem to be kings, so my daughter and I shared. The mattress was very comfortable. The beach across the cul-de-sac is really lovely, and there seems to be no shortage of lounge chairs and umbrellas available for the cost of tipping the young man who carries them for you. There is (expensive) beachside service from the bar. We did have a short wait one day for more chairs. Isla Verde is probably the best of the city beaches, and this portion of it is very quiet and not crowded, unlike the busy area near the El San Juan and The Intercontinental. The smallish restaurant on the lobby floor is fine for breakfast, albeit a little expensive. Food was average, service smiling and friendly, although I think there was a mistake with my order every day that I ate there! My daughter's meals were fine, I think confusion resulted in the kitchen from my requests to omit meat and replace with fruit etc. As with many restaurants we encountered, they were usually out of one or two items. Coffee is fabulous almost everywhere in PR. I did use the small gym one day, and regretted not running on the beach instead. The windowless basement room was small, as seems reasonable for this small boutique hotel, and had two treadmills (one broken), two exercise bikes and some free weights. There were no towels available and the tv was not working on the one operating treadmill. The treadmill was a smooth and up to date model. It wasn't well air conditioned but to be fair, they may have been working on the room when I was there, as there were signs of ongoing construction. The rooms were quiet, we were on the 9th floor and couldn't hear the music from the disco. There was occasional noise from staff outside the rooms early in the morning. The cleaning staff was excellent, they seemed to swoop into the room as soon as we left it - if we went to the beach for a couple of hours the room was always made up when we returned, and the cleaning was thorough. I ordered a drink from room service once and it arrived promptly without an extra service charge. Drinks and food are expensive, which is typical for San Juan. The quality is almost always exceptional, which helps make up for it. Coming from pricey Vancouver we didn't have too much sticker shock. The valet and doorman were accommodating also, and there is 24 hour valet and front desk staffing. We had no difficulty getting taxis to go to Old San Juan, Condado and Plaza Las Americas. Each of these is about $20. All the Isla Verde hotels, with their casinos and restaurants are walking distance and the hotel is minutes from the airport. I have stayed at two larger resorts in San Juan, the El San Juan and the Caribe Hilton. I think I preferred the personal feel of this small property, and the price was very good. Imaginative decoration that suits the surroundings and very personable staff made it an enjoyable stay and I look forward to returning with my husband one day.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointing..”
Reviews.Author: princessnoleah
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very conveniently located. Beach was literally across the street. Upon arrival to our room, our ocean view was marred by a filthy window. Also, there was no where to hang our clothes! No closet or dresser, ironing board or iron. We called down to the front desk and they moved us to better room. Problem solved. The rooms are cold looking which can be easily fixed by adding an area rug and maybe some pictures on the walls. Bed was comfy and clean. Very easy to walk to different places, we didnt eat at the hotel once as there are so many local places out there with authentic food for half the cost. Not a bad stay for the price we payed.

Reviews.Title: “BYOLB ( bring your own light bulb)”
Reviews.Author: Lee C
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a perfect location, right on the beach, and an easy walk to lots of attractions, dining, casino, and shops. Our room was oceanfront and you could like in bed and look out at the ocean. The hotel is quite stylish and unfortunately that is often it's downfall, it seems that they have chosen style over practicality. First the lighting, most of the lighting is blue to follow the water theme of the hotel, however it is just too blue, making the elevators and hallways too dark you can hardly find your way to your room. The blue lights even extend into the room with little light available besides the dark blue florescent lights; we had only one 11-watt compact florescent in a lamp and two tiny bedside LED lamps. We visited the local Walgreens and bought a real light bulb for the lamp to enable dressing and reading in the room. The room is furnished in an attractive minimalist sort of style but there again that is the downfall as there is almost no room to put anything away. We had one very small chest that was put into the very small closet. The three drawers in a chest that was the size of a small bedside table would not have done for one person on a 2-night stay let alone 2 people on a week long vacation. We ended up living out of our suitcases for the week. I would stay at the hotel again, but only at the bargain rate we got for this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, extra charges =/”
Reviews.Author: Lizzey83
Reviews.Content: We are due to check out today. Overall I can say its a nice hotel, very modern and stylish. The room is small, but its big enough for a couple. Be aware that they charge 14% per day! For a "resort fee" although this is not a resort! Its supposed to include the use of the beach amenities and internet even though when asked we were told the wifi was complimentary. Its not a bad place to stay, but for the price we pay I'd rather stay at the Marriott. The "resort fees" are optional and the breakfast is free! We didn't have hardly any amenities here sad to say we wont be returning here on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “next trip”
Reviews.Author: mommy10466
Reviews.Content: I just booked another trip and stay to this Hotel. I thought about going for another hotel with slightly cheaper prices but I couldnt do it. My husband and I stay at this hotel every time with visit P.R. This would be my 4th stay there. We have seen changes through out the years, the very first time we stood here about 3 years ago I must say was the best. The following years besides the rooftop pool being closed I think it was under different management and just felt a bit off. After reading recent reviews I am so excited to return once again. This hotel is located right on the beach and the hotel itself is chic and just relaxing. I guess that the complimentary breakfast is no longer included with stay as previous years but thats no big deal for us ...it was a nice extra but honestly the hotel and staff itself are way more worth the stay. I cant wait to try out the new restaurant..Mist and check out the new renovations....!!! C U SOON

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Jennie W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing! It was right on the beach, with all the amenities that offers (beach chairs, umbrellas, towels, etc, brought right to you) The view from the rooftop lounge and pool was breathtaking. The decor of the hotel was so modern and chic. Everything inside was beautiful! From the white sheer curtains in the lobby, to the "pebble" tile in the hallways, to the sound of the ocean waves piped into the corridors and lobby. It was so nice to finally stay in a hotel like no other. The rooms were so clean, with the same modern decor as the lobby. The bed was perfect! The staff was wonderful. They were extremely helpful and friendly, every day. When we checked in, the room wasn't ready and we had to wait maybe 20 minutes (which was NO big deal at all) As a result they upgraded our room to ocean view and gave us free breakfast for all 3 days that we were there. The location in Isla Verde is definitely the place to stay. When we go back, we will be staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “love the modern flair”
Reviews.Author: CindyLou408
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this place. Rooftop cabanas were awesome along with the rooftop bar. The lighted rooms gave a different ambiance that my husband and I thoroughly enjoyed! Location right on the beach and great views.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth S
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a quick but wonderful stay at the San Juan Water and Beach Club Hotel. The staff was consistently friendly and helpful- especially Danny and Ramsey. With the beach a short stroll across the cul-de-sac, it was hard to believe we were in a major city. Being so close to the airport really maximized the time on the beach. The room was clean and spacious. Loved the novelty of the waterfall in the elevator and the roof top couches. Skip the fast food restaurants and try real Puerto Rican cuisine at Don Jose, a short walk from the Club.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lilmissychloe
Reviews.Content: Hotel is good - the decor is nice and has a very modern look. The room we stayed in was average and very simple, but we didn't need anything more. The best part about the hotel is that the beach is right outside the front door. The hotel provides towels, chairs and umbrellas. It is a very touristy area but a great place to stay for a night or two.

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward...”
Reviews.Author: PCJhollywood
Reviews.Content: One of my friends from Brazil was there last year and he really enjoyed, the only complain he had was that the pool was closed for remodeling, I just google some reviews now to make sure before I book, and I am impressed with the glowing reviews, and the care that Virna has to reply to them, I just booked from 03/22 to 03/27 my birthday will be on the 23, and I am looking forward to have a great time, and I will review again after I come back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at the Water Club”
Reviews.Author: cbe0824
Reviews.Content: Hi, The Water Club is a nice place to stay in San Juan. It is like South Beach meets Virgin America airlines. All of the rooms and the hotel have the neon blue/purple light in the rooms and throughout the hotel. The staff is very friendly. Food is good and the coffee is fabulous. Pay the extra $30 for a balcony room facing the water.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: mygaby
Reviews.Content: I just returned from week long stay Sunday February 12, 2012 to Saturday February 18, 2012. My husband and his friend were playing in a baseball tournament so they both decided to take the wives to spend valentines week in Puerto Rico. Upon arrival to this Miami - esque boutique hotel, we were greeted by the valet (who by the way kindly opens the hotel doors with each entrance and exit of guests) The receptionist was very kind and accommodating. We had two rooms, 401 and 406. We stayed in 406 and because it was a room along the side of the hotel we were told the room is a bit bigger then the rooms in the back or facing the beach. The larger room did help with storing luggage and baseball gear. They only have closets to hang clothes, with limited drawer. We ended up living out of our luggage for the trip which was fine - just request a iron and ironing board to help witht he wrinkles. The elevator ride to our room was unique - In all my travels I have never seen a waterfall with a glass top in an elevator - very cool. Upon entering our room, there was a black light which made all the white walls, white curtains and white bed glow - that too was a unique experience. You can turn the black lights off as you please as they don't provide the best lighting and use the regular lighting instead. Everything was clean, neat and welcoming. The bathroom is also chic with glass showers and bowl sinks. There is a roof top pool opened 7am - 7pm which no one used as the beach is a few steps away from the hotel. They do turn the roof top pool into a "club" on the weekends but we didn't get a chance to see it. I do recommend going to the rooftop during the day to get some great pictures. My husband and I had our morning coffee on one of the roof top lounge sofas and enjoyed the views before we started our day. Every morning I walked the beach which was great exercise and a great way to get moving in the morning. They do comb the beach and remove most of the seaweed each morning so walking the sand was very easy. We did enjoy the beach a few days and Pedro, the towel guy, was able to set up our complimentary chairs, umbrella, and towels for us. He even came by and gave us skewers of fresh fruit which was very refreshing under the hot sun. Pedro was very nice and his service was commendable. One of the days it did start to rain, so we walked down the street to a bar and grill called El Alambique. This place does have a local feel as many locals visiting the beach will dine and have some drinks here. The food is also very good. We also ventured off to see other parts of the island and to help us plan we used the business off to do some internet searches as well as utilizing the front desk's knowledge about the island. The the front desk staff was very helpful with directions and tips. I wish I had their names as with each inquiry we had (we had quite a few) they were all very attentive to providing excellent customer service. Not once did we feel like we were a bother or rushed. I felt like were treated like family. They even started to recognize us as we entered and exited the hotel and greeted us as we passed by. Myself and the other wife left on Saturday 2/18/2012 so our husbands can focus on the remainder of their baseball games. We asked the front desk for taxi service to take us tot he airport. They do have taxis waiting outside during the day and only cost us $11 and $1 per bag - $13 for the one way ride. as an aside, one late night when we came off the elevator, we did hear some shall I say... "noises" coming from another room.. So couples -- be careful sound does travel. Another tip - since the hotel is on a dead end street there is little traffic as you are not allowed to park on the street. You can pay valet $10, but we just parked ended up parking on the side streets. The hotel is also adjacent to a walkway to the main strip so we had many options for parking. There were times were we just left the car and walked to Walgreens, restaurants, etc. I had a fabulous stay and would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Flyman
Reviews.Content: I stayed a Saturday night at this hotel. It is a fun place and the rooftop pool, bar and restaurant are spectacular. It is right on a beautiful sand beach. Hard to believe you are only five minutes by taxi to the San Juan airport. My room was adjacent to the elevators and yet noise was not an issue. I'll stay again on my next trip to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from hotel lobby restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Twinkie2154
Reviews.Content: If you want to wait an hour for pancakes when you are the first customers in the place, be my guest. The waitress has an attitude and the front desk gal must be her best pal because both of them will give you an attitude. The place is nice and location is good, but those two need to be on the unemployment line.

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise”
Reviews.Author: Rican2010
Reviews.Content: I was there six months ago and the hotel was ok, but the staff was very friendly (small hotel i got to know everyone). I just got back from a stay over Christmas and Wow a new pool, roof top tanning beds and really hot rooftop bar. For the money it can't be beat. Plus I believe they are just finishing a remodel of the rooms. Be back in June.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eunice C
Reviews.Content: this was a nice hotel i enjoyed my stay there...i just left and wanna go back...great location..and the staff were awesome very helpful...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: snoopfernee
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel that is located right on the beach and has fantastic staff. The price was more than reasonable, and everyone was very friendly. The hotel has a trendy euro/south beach type feel to it. There is a restaurant downstairs and a rooftop bar/pool (it was open). The ocean view room I had was all white, had a flatscreen tv, and most amenities that you'd expect (hairdryer, toiletries, a safe, etc.). The good: 1. The staff - Everyone from the front desk people, the wait staff/bartenders, beach service staff, and the door people were extremely friendly. Everyone said hello and asked how things were going. The doorman offered us an umbrella when there was threat of rain. If the elevator was taking too long, staff would apologize. The beach staff made sure they addressed us by name, would set up your chair, towel, and umbrella, bring free fresh fruit and desserts, spray you with a mist machine, and of course, deliver food and drinks from the restaurant. 2. The location is great since you're on the beach and 10 minute from the airport. You are in the middle of Isla Verde so you can walk down the beach to the other hotels, casinos, restaurants, etc. There is a Walgreens a few blocks away and some high quality, low price restaurants around. They usually have cabs waiting out front as well, if you want to venture outside of the area. 3. The rooftop bar is beautiful. 360 degree view of the area. There is a bar (with appetizers) and a pool, plus couches to lounge on. In fact, it becomes a lounge at night. This might be a con if you're not into this type of scene, but it is great for couples or young people who want to socialize (very South Beach - like). Cons (minor nits, none of which would keep me from staying there again): 1. The pool is not large. More than 6-8 people in it would make it weird. It is great for cooling off and getting a quick dip. That said, I never saw anyone in the pool bc the beach was so close. 2. The rooms have a few little design quirks. Nothing major, but little things like not enough plugs near tables and not enough places to hang wet bathing suits. All in all, I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Suprice! And very modern decor!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa F
Reviews.Content: I am the owner of a travel agency, Mojo Travel. I recently stayed in San Juan at the Water & Beach Club for a pre-night cruise stay. What a fantistic little hidden gem. I didnt notice right away because it was dark on arrival but it is literally right on the beach. Cab was $20, hotel is in their transportation Zone 2. Cruise port was 10 miles by cab and in Zone 4 (if I remember) and it was another $20 to get to the cruise port from this hotel. HOtel is close to many eateries (Ponderosa, KFC, BK, and Walgreens) there is a charming eatery on the corner as well. Staff was awesome. Friendly, attentive, someone opening the door for you each time. Very cool bar/breakfast room with wall to wall water feature. Breakfast is included, simple but enough food. Two elevators with the same water feature behind a plexi glass wall, very cool. Room was ultra modern, something like we have never seen before. Very clean, linens were crisp, comfortable bed (though a little hard for me) Pillow choices. Rooms are completey white. All walls adorned with white sheers with a blue back light. Bed floats in middle of the room. Entertainment center is on a pivoting poole. Amoire was in need of a desperate replacement. Just due to wear and tear. there is an in room safe. Bathroom was modern & very clean. We had an ocean view facing room. There is an smell to the hotel but you need to expect that from a location with high humidity and located on the beach. You notice at first but then you forget about it later. I would definatley stay here again. I am a travel agent, I know where to look for the dirt and negatives, this hotel had very few negatives. I would definately go back and I would stay longer to take advantage of the fabulous beach.

Reviews.Title: “Very cute boutique hotel and very nice staff”
Reviews.Author: sebaillet
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally on the beach. Free chairs and towels on the beach. Large rooms and very helpful and friendly staff. The rooftop bar and loungs area is pretty cool. The pool is quite small though. Given location of the hotel , a car rental is necessary to go to old San Juan or el condado areas. The car rental place called charlie is 2 min walk from hotel and very cheap. That rental place has also a free shuttle to and from the airport so it is very convenient to join the hotel! The hotel complaint I would make about the hotel is that the A/C units in the rooms are noisy.

Reviews.Title: “They made me feel like I was apart of their family! The BEST service!! Miss you guys!!!”
Reviews.Author: Michelle H
Reviews.Content: My overall experience in Puerto Rico I have to say was an experience i will never forget. I traveled here alone, for my birthday and knew no one. If it wasn't for the amazing staff at San Juan Water and Beach Club hotel this trip would have been terrifying and boring. Right away handsome Raphael was at the desk, with a big smile and was so warm and welcoming. He and his partner Ramsey aka best salsa dancer gave me the best customer service possible. They found the best salsa clubs, partnered me up with an amazing rain forest tour, introduced me to the bio bay and zip lining tours. They knew the right contacts and made things happen!!! Then thereâ€™s Virna, the hotel's Ambassador! What a wonderful woman. This woman made me feel part of her family. I was traveling alone, it was my birthday and when they got wind of this info I had a bottle of champagne in my room after having a private food tasting with the General Manager. What star treatment!! The food during this food tasting was phenomenal! The menu is diverse, delicious and unique. Iâ€™m a major foodie and every dish I tasted was full of flavor and melt in your mouth delicious! They specialize in aroma eating where the smell of herbs and perfumeâ€™s enhance the taste. This is even more of a reason I will be back in the very near future! Keep up the great work Water club team!! I love you guys so much and thank you for making this Birthday one I'll NEVER forget.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Pia-Loves-2-Travel
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel in Isla Verde right on the Beach and at the end of a road so no traffic/noise at all! On check-in the concierge upgraded us to an Ocean View room which had a fabulous view every morning. The things I loved about Water Club : Trendy Decor Extremely Clean Great Location Friendly staff Fabulous Rooftop Pool Bar The Continental Breakfast which was included in room cost Free 24x7 Cyber Cafe Things other travelers might want to be aware of: The only reason I would take away 2 stars for the rooms is that they are almost bare, down to a minimum requirement and the quality of the construction work is not exactly that great specially the bathroom fittings & tiling. The walls are paper thin and we could hear our neighbors getting busy a couple nights, which we thought was quite hilarious, but something to keep in mind if you are traveling with kids. The first thing that will hit you when you enter the room is the neon blue lighting which we did not care for and kept off the whole time we were there. That being said, this stuff had absolutely no effect on our vacation since our main focus is always to explore the Island and not be stuck in the hotel at all and we had a GREAT time at the Water Club Hotel. We will return for sure if we are ever in Puerto Rico again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff gave 110%..Excellent Stay Solid A rating from me!!!”
Reviews.Author: SunsetInStyle
Reviews.Content: Im extremely critical in all my reviews as trip advisor has served me abounds for 10yrs so now its time to pay it forward. First off my reasons for selecting this hotel were 1)My event for NYE was nearby at El San Juan hotel who was commanding a ridiculous $500 per night when I had stayed prior 2 years ago it was only $150 so forget it 2)Last time in PR my friends had taken me to this hotels rooftop for sunset drinks it came off like a "W" hotel style modern so it peaked my interest more than others nearby & was directly on the beach. Ok so I had read the TA reviews both good & bad but decided on Beach Club based on my above stated explanation with a average level of accomodation expectations for a hotel that was basically almost 1/2 price compared to the ESJ Hotel I was intially planning to stay at. I was after 5 days stunned all around at the level of service and quality for the price during a holiday week. Staff gave a level of service I have encountered really only in 5 star hotels worldwide. Front door opened day & night nearly EVERY time I walked in, asked almost a dozen times how was my stay, is there anything you need today etc. Free beach chairs & umbrellas set up for me always 2 people there to help on the beach, & free continental breakfast. One morning my girl & I had a tour to meet up with and the staff actually packed our free breakfast to go because we were running late!! THIS IS HOW YOU KEEP YOUR CUSTOMERS!! NO noise from the maid she was polite and asked when it would be a good time to clean when we went to breakfast, internet was consitently fast and FREE, I was on the 8th floor partial ocean in view near rear of hotel so I slept great. Bed was comfy, four pillows provided as they should be. The rooftop had just reopened week prior to our arrival I would say you probably wouldnt want a room on the floor below roof to avoid any potential noise. Finally, I had the opportunity of getting 50% off tapas the first nite on the rooftop, food was amazing but to be honest I wouldn't pay the 100% price it would be too expensive. Only two concerns really, the shower head was too heavy for the pipe coming out of the wall had to keep adjusting it, and the water pressure seemed weak. The other concern was the room lighting, I really like the neon thought it was a great touch, but as others have stated room needs an actual normal light as well. Otherwise great job, keep up the good work and keep the great staff!!! Last word: Navigation is 50/50 in Puerto Rico, if you type in the Beach Club Address it will NOT take you to the hotel it will take you somewhere up the street, here are the coordinates for your navigation that will take you to the front door (at least they did for me) n18Â°26.589' w066Â°01.315'

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here December, 2011 for a couple of nights pre & post cruise. Overall the hotel is good. Few things need attention, but overall I am very happy. If you're looking for a good room, good bed, great views, etc., then stay here! If you want an ocean views book this hotel! Our rooms were on the 5th floor overlooking the beach/ocean. Amazing view and sounds to fall asleep too & wake up too are great. One thing I would strongly suggest you ask in advance is about private parties. During our pre-cruise stay, there was a VERY LOUD party happening just two floors below us. The people yelling/music/noise went until around 3am. Phoning the front desk, I was simply advised that it was a private function and that she would let the events director know. When complaining further, I was told to shut my balcony door. NOT happy with that. The breakfast included with the rate was good enough for us. You get to chose a couple of pastry items, OJ &/or coffee. You can also order food- We did this one day, but we felt it was overpriced and not that good. The happy hour was a large disappointment as itâ€™s highly confusing and very restrictive. Pretty much if you plan to do the happy hour, just plan to drink rum and coke, sprite, or just rum; or the local beerâ€”which was pretty good. However, we did enjoy a few free drinks; simply coke & rum. There is a Wal-Green within a short walk on the main street behind the hotel. There are several fast food places to eat as well. We didn't get to use the pool or the top floor because it was under construction-- disappointed as we were told it would be ready when I booked this in January, 2011. The staff-- mixed reviews. Juan is great to work with-- if you need something I suggest asking for him. Otherwise mixed reviews; some of the staff nice/friendly/helpful... Others- not so much. Overall had a GREAT/ENJOYABLE time at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, hotel need improvements”
Reviews.Author: Velezclan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 week and and a first glanced its a great hotel. Let me just give you the pros and cons. Pros: Right by the beach Great staff, great customer service Free chairs and towels on the beach Beautiful beach views Clean rooms Cons: No lighting except the blue light and reading light by the bed There was water leaking either from the window and ceiling when it's raining or the floor from who knows what. They said it was from the AC but the water was coming up from a crack in the tile in the middle of the floor. Paper thin walls, don't stay here if you have children because children can get very loud They just need to touch up the rooms and be consistent with them. We stayed in 3 rooms during our stay and each one was different.

Reviews.Title: “Great service! Great location! Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: tracye w
Reviews.Content: We purchased the Groupon and really didn't know what to expect. I've been to magnificent hotels and a few dives and was hoping for the best. I was planning a romantic getaway for my boyfriend's birthday and crossed my fingers that it would be good. Boy! Were we surpised. This place is wonderful! Right on the beach with Miami, South Beach feel. We were upgraded to a beautiful,stunning ocean view room w/balcony and truly were treated like royalty. I asked for a little something special for the bday and we got rose petals and Happy Birthday spelled out in his name on the bed, along with champagne & chocolate covered strawberries. Wonderful! If you're looking for the Ritz, this is not your kind of place. It has its dings and imperfections but take this from someone who stays in hotels, unless you're obsessive, it's all really terrific. If you want a lovely, clean boutique hotel, steps away from a glorious beach, with people who make you feel like family, this is your spot. We didn't miss the rooftop pool/bar (because there's a big ol' beach and ocean outfront! --DUH!) and the renovations/elevator noise, etc. were non-existent during our stay. Big hugs and thanks to Virna (HUGS, HUGS, & more HUGS!), Ziorenes(sorry about the spelling), and Pedro. It was a glorious 4 days and you and your team stand above the rest. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “trying to get past the paper thin walls.”
Reviews.Author: Zachieus
Reviews.Content: hotel was pretty nice, great location right on the beach. But wow, weekends are a bad time to stay here, the walls seem non-existant, was woken up several times last night by what sounded like people in our room, sadly they were above us and next to us. we can hear every word of the tv next to us (and its not that loud)... so its quite a community living experience, as i type this i know that our neighbors are watching law and order in spanish. Service is great!! the roof top is currently being remodeled, but looks like in the future it will be pretty cool. free happy hour is an awesome bonus too. and there are no lights in the room, just a black light wall...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, needs some improvements”
Reviews.Author: Karthik_NK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a part of our vacation in PR. they had the rooftop pool getting renovated when we went, which was a bit disappointing. the staff were very friendly and helpful, an A+ for that. We just ate breakfast there, and liked it. The room was pretty good, probably can be done a little better (with the floors and the bathroom) - The biggest plus for this is the location- and they have the complimentary beach side service, with chairs/umbrellas/towels which is another major plus. Would recommend if you're traveling as couples, and probably go there again, if we visit PR.

Reviews.Title: “recent trip”
Reviews.Author: MzPickles2011
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Puerto Rico and a 3 night stay with this hotel. I used the groupon and it was a nice deal. Free Pastries/juice/coffee each day, free happy hour and a coupons for free mojitos, which were the best! We were up on the 8th floor with a partial ocean view. The room was very clean, bed from comfy. The view was gorgeous, but the outside of the windows needed cleaned, but still a gorgeous view! We had one problem with the toilet but within 5 minutes of reporting, it was resolved. The staff was awesome! I can't wait to see the hotel after rennovations are complete. You really can't beat the price for the fabulous location. you're right on the beach. Which is very clean and the staff is right there to give you towles/chairs,etc. I loved the decor and the miami vibe of the hotel. It's really a nice place to stay. Our room was cleaned each day, no complaints at all. The blue lights are romantic but you can turn them off it you'd like. Not sure about those cab drivers, we were told the rate to hotel was $10 but he charged $13 to take us, we were thinking maybe for luggage? but on the return trip he charged $15?! A great place for breakfast with reasonable prices is right down the street same side as hotel and across from Wendy's it's part of a bakery shop. You can't miss it. but the food was delicious and not expensive. Another great place for dinner is the Intercontential Hotel next door. Great pasta dishes with huge shrimp! If you're planning on just staying in the room and watching tv, this isn't the place for you. but if you want a clean place to sleep, eat, have drinks then hit the streets and beach, this is it!We would def stay here again and refer friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Ali A
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (in our mid/late twenties) had a lovely time in the hotel. We used a Groupon we bought, so the deal was outstanding for 3 nights! We didn't spend too much time in the hotel; just during the FREE happy hour 5-6pm. We also took advantage of the complimentary chairs and towels on the beach on the last afternoon. The blue lights were fun and added something special to the atmosphere. The staff was VERY friendly, too! We were about 10-15 minutes from Old San Juan and about an hour from El Yunque. There was a nice car rental spot right behind the hotel with friendly staff. We got a car for $30/day and I totally recommend doing that if you like to explore on your own. Cabs can get expensive and there isn't too too much close by. We recommend La Playita for the first night because it was in walking distance. My husband was very happy with his snapper (still with the face and tail). If you head over the to bioluminescent tours to the far east part of the island. You MUST go to Calizo Restaurant! Other than the pool and bar up top being closed, we had no complaints. Had a great time and honestly, they had some of the BEST mojitos we tried!

Reviews.Title: “It is ok”
Reviews.Author: Holly b
Reviews.Content: It is in a great location, right on the beach. The rooms are small and have very few amenities. The staff is really nice and helpful in booking activities.

Reviews.Title: “Modern with a view!”
Reviews.Author: BakerCan
Reviews.Content: We had one night in San Juan and arrived to our hotel via taxi (around $15 USD). The vibe of this hotel is modern and sleek. Our room had ocean view and large king size bed, not much more. The a/c worked awesome which was bonus since our flight was rather warm. The bathroom is small with no vent, but there is a small window you can crack open. The blue lighting is cool but you can turn it off. We strolled down the street to find dinner and found like 10 American fast food restaurants right in a row. Luckily, we found a little neighborhood place and a couple of bars. Had a cold Presidente and some latin food. The beach looked gorgeous and clean but we didn't get to stay long to utilize. Free breakfast is a juice and pastry. A nice little boutique hotel close to airport!

Reviews.Title: “A WONDERFUL TIME”
Reviews.Author: youtt
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. the staff was absolutely wonderful thoughout the entiret process from booking to departing. I actually purchased a groupon for the hotel for a steal of a deal and had no problems reserving the room. I had a really late check in at 1am and had no problems. I paid a small amount more for a partial oceanview room which had a great view. this hotel has a miami feel to it and the staff was absolutely delightful. My only complaint was quickly fixed. my room was next to the elevator and I could hear the elevator in the morning, Juan quickly moved us to a lovely full oceanview room at no additional cost. look at the other reviews as well. I purchased drinks from the restaurant a few steps away, they are very cheap and have a daily special every day for like $3.50..saturday we drank sex on the beach all day. I opted to rent a car and do my excursions on my old. I drove into old san juan, very easy drive and also did a ATV tour with tropical trails who gave very detailed directions. Oh and the hotel is right on the beach and it is a beautiful beach and very clean. the area is patrolled frequently by police. I deflinitely noticed a police presence.

Reviews.Title: “NICE BOTIQUE HOTEL, GREAT LOCATION, BEST STAFF EVER!”
Reviews.Author: Ted F
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently spent a week at the San Juan Water & Beach Club. Not only is the hotel clean, comfortable and cool, it has the best service I have ever experienced. If needed, we could have had a great beach side experience without leaving the hotel grounds. However, we decided to explore the island and quickly found out that the hotel staff was our greatest tool. The staff assisted us in planning our excursions around Puerto Rico every day. Their advice, suggestions and ability to plan was impeccable. From arranging pick up times to confirming reservations they were on point. Further, the bell boys and towel boys are over qualified for their jobs and make sure you always have what you need on your way out the door. They even check up on you while your on the beach, offering to bring you a drink or extra towel. The free happy hour everyday at 5 is a great way to get the night started and meet some other interesting world travelers. The complimentary breakfast items taste great and if you decided to order extra, I assure you the food is great. The on site beach is steps away once you leave the front door. The beach is a top PR beach with clean white sand, great views and clean water. There are always taxis nearby and the area is very safe at all hours. I encourage everyone to try some of the restaurants within walking distance of the hotel, all pretty good. The gym is serviceable for the active bunch. I can't imagine how awesome this place will be when the pool opens back up this winter. I will definitely be back and refer all of my friends and family to this hotel. Personalized service at its best. Big shout outs are deserved by Tania, Lleyde, Rafael, Joel, Sebastian and Joseph who went above and beyond to make our stay memorable. Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “I will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: jjtravelagain
Reviews.Content: The internet was down in the business office for guests and the roof with pool was closed for renovations- yet, I had an amazing time! The hotel is right on the beach! The staff is very professional and friendly and the rooms are quite nice for such a good deal. I will definitely stay here again. When using cabs to get back to hotel tell them you are staying at the Water Club in Isla Verde otherwise it's confusing when you mention "San Juan Water and......"

Reviews.Title: “peacefully gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: SandyJan88
Reviews.Content: I leave in puerto rico and work in the hotel industry. I needed a time to be in a peacefull and relaxing place with my husband and Water Club was the perfect place =) . Employers at front desk where very attentive. we had the king bed room with ocean view. Was very pretty with low lights and an ambience perfect to be with your husband and have an alone time in the city. Just had a few problems like we didnt have hot water in the shower and the guest charge for valet parking is higher than what they charge the visitors, however that didnt change the great and relaxing experience we had. KEEP UP THE GOOD WORK! GREAT PLACE! im in love with it hope to stay soon!!! =D

Reviews.Title: “Great Place and Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: rfrontal
Reviews.Content: great place to stay with step way from a great beach. If I come back to PR I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “POOL ON HOTEL ROOF IS *C-L-O-S-E-D*”
Reviews.Author: Z Z
Reviews.Content: Disappointed to find roof pool closed AFTER we arrived. Not cool. Staff, however were as helpful as possible. Really wanted to have a pool with a bar in/next to it for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: foggydogs
Reviews.Content: We were looking for an easy place to relax without having to go home and work overtime to get back above water...and this place was perfect. The beach is steps from our room, we have two six year old kids with us and the staff has been superb about helping us every step of the way. The nice thing about the beach is that the water is a great temp and you are not pulled three miles away by the current...you get out of the ocean right where you got in...the airport is a ten dollar cab ride 5 minutes away so not losing a day traveling to your destination. We are here now as I write this..it wa important to me to say how pleasant this has been. Small boutique hotel that has done so much with what they have...small touches of class everywhere...and that amazing morning coffee with steamed cream on the side...my favorite! If you share an omelet with the continental breakfat they give you, you will do fine. Now off to the local kids muesum!

Reviews.Title: “Ok but outdated”
Reviews.Author: Lwalters25
Reviews.Content: They tried to update the hotel but the rooms have popcorn ceilings and are just not as nice as some other hotels for the price.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: SANDY_SANDYAustralia
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Water & Beach Club Hotel for a week. Fantastic location! Across from one of the nicest beaches in PR. Very close to local restaurants, car rental, shopping, bars, transport. Got a fabulous room upgrade for being a first time visitor to PR. Chic, stylish, clean decor. All amenities you need, wifi, business center, gym, lounge, restaurant, beach chairs/umbrella. The winning factor is the EXCELLENT SERVICE. The staff are super professional, efficient, friendly, welcoming, always smiling and eager to make your stay enjoyable and comfortable. Lleyda and Rafael offer exceptional service and are willing go the extra mile to make sure that your stay is next to perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Place, Great location”
Reviews.Author: carloatx
Reviews.Content: Its a pretty cool hotel, the blue hue gives off a kind of nightclub atmosphere yet hotel style at the same time. There is free happy hour, GREAT DEAL!, beach front location is awesome (on the best beach in San Juan area). Staff is friendly and will help you out with anything you might need.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice beach. So-so hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pko57
Reviews.Content: We were referred to this hotel by a friend. I do not know how long ago it was that she stayed here, but I'm guessing things have changed since then. I booked through Expedia after reviewing the hotel web site and reading many reviews here on Tripadvisor. We were attracted by the beach front location, the free happy hour cocktails, the on site restaurant, and the rooftop pool. The only feature that was actually available was the beautiful beach. And it was wonderful! The happy hour did occur on our last evening. Something about needing to renew a liquor license. The pool and restaurant we were told have been closed for maybe two years. Our room was okay, a great ocean view room on the eighth floor, #804, which I would happily recommend if it were not for these other problems. Things are clean enough, water pressure in the shower is not the greatest, but I've had worse. If you want ice, you have to ask the front desk to get it for you, and it comes in a bucket, like a sand bucket for playing on the beach. There is an included continental breakfast. This consists of choice of juice, choice of hot beverage, and various forms of bread. For convenience shopping there is a Walgreens very nearby, but they do not sell beer or wine.The location of the hotel is very near the airport, so the cab ride is reasonable at $10.00 with a $1.50 surcharge for fuel right now, and $1.00 per piece of luggage. Throughout Puerto Rico a 10% tip is always sufficient, and check your bill in restaurants because it often already included. The beer special at happy hour at most bars is the local Medalla Lite, usually $2 or less for a 10 oz. can. The long cab ride to Old San Juan is $20, but catch the bus near the hotel during the daytime for .75 (exact change ONLY) each way. At night the cab is the safer way to go. My husband recommends bringing binoculars if you have them, for better sight seeing at the beach. We enjoyed swimming in the ocean, which was warm and just a little choppy. There is no sea life in the water due to a large reef running parallel to the shore which keeps fish large and small away from the shore. As far as food in the area, we ate plantains several different ways, and if we had stayed any longer would most certainly have gone to the Outback Steakhouse at the Embassy Suites nearby. We enjoyed the casinos at the El San Juan Hotel and the Intercontinental Hotel(where I would look into staying if we go back to isla Verde).

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for beach and modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mplove84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the first part of our trip and were very happy of the location. Just next to the airport, it was very fast to arrive. The rooms are nice, all white with total or partial ocean view, which we LOVED! We paid 99$ a night with Expedia. I would'nt have spent more than this. Goods: - On the best beach in San Juan (we saw Ocean Park and it's really not as good) - Happy hour: get as many free drinks as you want form 5 pm to 6 pm (Laura made a mistake saying from 5 to 7 but the bartender let us have a drink at 6:15) - Simple but good breakfast: juice+coffee+bagel+pastry - The view from your room - The staff is very nice. Bads: - Miss of information (we received some wrong info from the front desk staff about renting cars, local calls, happy hours) even though they were very nice and friendly. we haven't been told about the terrace on the second floor, we discovered it ourselves the last night of our stay. - No frigo bar in the room. - Not many good restaurants to eat around. We went to a Japanese one, and decided to go in the Old part for the other nights. - Far from the Old San Juan. If you are there to visit, you better stay in this area instead - The toilet wasn't working well. We had to call to make it reapair several times during our stay. - Some mornings the service at the restaurant was slow, even though we were very few people eating and enough staff. - No pool Some tips: - Rent a car!!! We found some online at 17,95$ a day with enterprise (at the Ritz and they come pick you up at the hotel) - If you have a rental car, park it in the street, it's free and a block away from the hotel. You'll save 15$ a day - Don't book the tours, they are way too expensive compared with the real value, do it yourself with a car - Take the bus to go in Old San Juan, it costs 0,75$ per ride (!!!) instead of a 20$ cab ride, but the last bus depart at 21:30 from the old town - For the best beach, go to the Ritz, it's a few minutes walk from the hotel If you visit Old San Juan, here are other tips : - there is a supermarket where you can buy alcohol, water, drinks for cheap, it's worth it when you spend few days. - Eat a good meal and enjoy amazing ambiance at El Picoteo (great tapas) in the wonderful hotel El Convento - Go watch the sunset at El Morro and near the cemetery and then go down at the Princessa passerelle - Have a breakfast at the popular Cafeteria Mallorca (mallorca sandwich with ham and cheese is amazing) - Have a lunch and pastry at La Bombonera (more than 100 years restaurant, dinner style, very popular with the locals) - If you want to treat yourself and spend 150$ and more for an unfogettable dinner, go to Marmelade... and don't forget to try their pastry called Quesito! - Plaza las Americas is not worth it... same shops you can find anywhere in USA and Canada don't loose your time going

Reviews.Title: “Overall we enjoyed our stay! Great location on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: cumaylin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Waterclub for 5 nights. It is a great location, hotel provides lounge chairs, umbrella, and beach towels. In addition, you get free Wifi service, which worked great in the room. Free cocktail hr, and a very small continental breakfast. Even if you want a cup of coffee you have to turn in your breakfast voucher. The maid service was great. The neon lights became a tad bit annoying, but we enjoyed our stay and will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OrangePeach
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all you would expect. The location is perfect just min. from the Airport and from Old San Juan, where you should have dinner most nights. The beach is steps away, the service is great, the breakfast is good (the restaurant serves only breakfast). No kids to speak of, that is nice. The bad news is this, the bed in our room was old and lumpy. I am not sure if that is the case in every room, we did not request a transfer. The view was great, the wi-fi is fast and we would stay there again, if we called ahead and arranged for a better bed.

Reviews.Title: “OFF THE CHARTS PHENOMENAL”
Reviews.Author: Solburn
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Puerto Rico for our honeymoon and we stayed at the San Juan Water and Beach Club Hotel. It was a 10 minute taxi ride from the airport. The level of service and friendliness from the staff was OFF THE CHARTS PHENOMENAL. Marie, Jada, Joseph, Carlos, Lauren, and many others that I had the pleasure to interact with were always professional, helpful and courteous. Thank you all so much!!! The hotel itself is a chic, hip boutique hotel. It definitely has that "club" vibe to it with the blue lights, the elevator with a water wall and see through ceiling (yes you can see all the way up the elevator shaft). The rooms were contemporary with a minimalistic decor, yet it was warm. The bed is in the middle of the room, perfectly positioned for the fantastic view of the beach in Isla Verde. Included with a night's stay is continental breakfast server until NOON!!! In addition, you get a complimentary happy hour from 5-6. All the DonQ and/or Medalla you can drink! The hotel itself is located in an absolutely prime spot. Literally on the beach! There is a Walgreens, a super market, plenty of restaurants and bars all within walking distance. Nearby hotels have casinos you can play in too. Lastly, don't forget all of the excursions you can take like, zip lines, rain forest tours, snorkeling, bio bay tours etc. All of this can be arranged at the FRONT DESK. You don't even need a car!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: bbandky
Reviews.Content: I have read the reviews and let me say that I must have not been staying at the same place as most of these folks. The outside looks the same but the inside has really changed since these photos! Check out the ones I have posted. Iâ€™ll keep it simple and list pros and cons. Pros: Happy Hour Carlito the bartender Across from beach Really good coffee after 7:00AM Cons: Musty Moldy In need of major repair Nosiest hotel ever Water pipes bang Air conditioner doesnâ€™t cycle Windows wonâ€™t close Holes in floor (could look down into room below by the bay window) Electrical wires taped together Barking dogs in rooms Sheets not changed in three nights No wash cloths We changed rooms due to noise levels and on the second night they placed a dog next door to us that barked 20 out of 24 hours. We did stop by the front desk to express our disappointment and we did not receive any type of comment, seriously the little guy just looked down at the desk. Desperate for sleep we checked out the next morning and went somewhere else even though we had another night pre-paid in our package. We lost one nightâ€™s fee but gained 7 hours of much needed sleep.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, friendly staff, beach, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: bobbypink05
Reviews.Content: 2nd visit to PR and this trip was amazing! perfect location on beach, walking distance to nice restaurants, shops, casino, and fast foods. rented a car across street for very good deal. rooms are spacious clean and comfortable. (however no dressers). loved the free happy hour rum drinks. free basic continental breakfast. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware, there are problems at this hotel !”
Reviews.Author: AirlineGuyNYC
Reviews.Content: This hotel has deteriorated, and there are much better places to stay in San Juan and/or Isla Verde! First they misrepresent the rooftop deck and pool, when you ask they say "it is not open today." Truth revealed to me by a hotel staff member is IT HAS NOT BEEN OPEN SINCE EARLY WINTER LAST YEAR!!! That same staff member also told me they ran out of money running the restaurant, therefore that is closed now also. They do serve a continental breakfast, but it is very skimpy.
