Bulb burned out in bathroom for entire stay, never replaced, leaking water in the bathroom never fixed. Housekeeping was inconsistent. Hallways are so dark you can't even see your room number, especially after coming in from a day in the sun on the beach and your eyes have not adjusted (not to mention security concern of dark hallways)! I've been trying to contact hotel management multiple times to rectify a billing problem, and they will not even return phone calls. Buyer beware, from what I see and experience, this hotel is NOT what it used to be and I strongly suspect they are having financial problems trying to keep it open. If you want a reliable and reputable place to stay, I'd look at other options versus the Water Club.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most AMAZING hotels in Puerto Rico!”
Reviews.Author: richamorr
Reviews.Content: A good friend of mine has traveled to Puerto Rico counteless times and always manages to come back with plenty of great stories of her experiences from the powdery white sands to the amazingly clear blue waters to the outstanding hotel accomodations! All of which I believed and thought was really nice, but even with her outstanding reviews over the last several years it just wasn't enough to get me to book a trip to Puerto Rico. That all changed when we were trying to determine what the plan would be for her birthday when we concluded that since she loved Puerto Rico SO much we should finally make the trek together. With 0 expectations I arrived on the "Island of Enchantment" to be completly enchanted! The food, the people, the culture were all just as incredible as described, but what was more incredible then described was the TREMENDOUS stay at the San Juan Water & Beach Club. THE ROOM: The room was spacious, clean, and completely comfortable. Eventhough there's minimal time spent in the room, the time there was comfortable, sexy, and exactly what I look for in a hotel. The modern amenities in the room included an iPod radio clock, a mini-fridge, a "kickin" a/c, soft bed, plenty of mirrors for getting ready, a modern bathroom, sexy blue lighting for the evening hours, and the list can go on if I let it. The room far exceded any expecations that I may have had. THE STAFF: I can't reiterate how fantastic Nailin, Vierna, Rafael, Pedro, Neldise, Xavier and the everyone who works at the hotel was to me and my friends. They helped pull off a surprise birthday celebration during the daily free happy hour, they were accomodating always willing to lend a helping hand, engage you in conversation, and offer you a smile or giggle (in Xavier's case). The service was SUPERIOR to any hotel I've visited during my adult life and I travel quite a bit for work and pleasure. I would highly recommend that you stay at the San Juan Water and Beach Club your next visit to Puerto Rico. The hotel is close by the airport, the beach which is directly in front of the hotel is clean, the beach staff is super helpful and kind, the water was AMAZING and where the hotel is situated is close to EVERYTHING! I know everyone who visits will feel the same! I'm planning on going back in August!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cool, modern setting and management”
Reviews.Author: Kristina062
Reviews.Content: WIth mixed reviews on the web, I didn't know what to expect but everybody working there made us fall in love with the place. Welcoming and ready to tend on every need or request. The room and its amenities reminded me the furniture at IKEA: efficient and small footprint. Loved the comfortable bed, convenient restaurant, blue hidden lights day and night everywhere. I am not a big fan of continental breakfast but if you are theirs was not the best you'd find. Also no drawers or enough hangers for clothes.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: askali13
Reviews.Content: My conclusion is that we loved the hotel and had a wonderful and high value experience and have already recommended it to friends! This was meant to be a relaxing trip with my sister - and unfortunately fell during college Spring break. At the end of the trip, we rarely found ourselves surrounded by or annoyed by loud drunk college kids and definitely got the incredible vacation we were looking for. I spoke with many friends who had previously been to PR and after days of reading reviews and checking prices, was at a crossroads between El San Juan and San Juan Water & Beach. For the price difference, I decided to go with the San Juan Water and Beach and our experience was wonderful! Need to know: While I have heard they have a fantastic rooftop - I would not know as that was "under construction" while we were there. I don't get the vibe they are working on it efficiently or care to move fast - so call and inquire if it's open before booking if that is a deciding factor for you. And, if you need a hotel with a restaurant in it, I think this is something they are working on also. Aside from that, we were able to walk downstairs and onto the beach (literally steps away) and have the employee bring us huge (twice as large as any I have ever seen) lounge chairs, towels and (if applicable) an umbrella onto the beach. We can get a pool anywhere in America but not the beach! If we were thirsty, the hotel does haphazardly send a cocktail waitress for drinks. OR you could get up, walk a few hundred feet (restaurants / bars next to hotel) and buy your own food and drinks (beer can $3, pina colada $6 instead of hotel $12). We did this to save money and not limit ourselves to indulge. Everybody who goes to PR should make a day trip to Old San Juan. If you want to save money, there is a bus stop in back of the hotel (street side) that takes you there. it's a few dollars roundtrip and you get a taste of the local flavor. There are mutliple fast food restaurants and TONS of other restaurants as variety within a 10 minute walk of the hotel. In case you need anything, there is a Walgreens 5 minutes walk. To summarize this - the value of our hotel was AWESOME. They also have a free happy hour everyday from 5-6. Take advantage of it. They book the excursion trips for you - GO KAYAKING in the bio-luminescent bays. It is BEACH SIDE. You can walk anywhere for food or toiletries or to go out dancing. Go to El Taquito (we did daily) for $2.50 breakfast meals and buckets of 5 Corona bottles for $5. WE LOVE THAT PLACE.

Reviews.Title: “Ok stay - need repairs”
Reviews.Author: sasita70
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 weeks and even though it wasn't terrible it definitively needs repairs and some sort of upgrade. It seems as when it opened it was stunning but now, after a few years it has decayed. The room was ok, big but the wardrobe was inexistance, not enough space for two or form more than a few days, the bathroom is spacious but the door of the shower is not complete and water keeps going out. The bed is nice and comfortable but the linens quite updated. The breakfast, if included, was average but of good quality. The staff was friendly and helpful but I would recommend to paint everything again and change some mirrors/doors/cushions that were broken, chipped or dirty. I would return because the beach is just a few steps away from the front door and the beach towels and chairs are included in the fee.

Reviews.Title: “Another AMAZING Stay At My Favorite Property In San Juan!!!”
Reviews.Author: prloverDC
Reviews.Content: I have been a staying at the Water Club since 2004 and there is a reason for my loyalty, which is not easy to win over. I was just there for 2 weeks in May and per usual, it was a fabulous experience and a wonderful stay. This is the only boutique-style hotel on the Island and they are true to the boutique form. By far the best part of this hotel is the amazing staff. From the moment you arrive until the moment you leave, you are treated like royalty. The level of professionalism, courtesy, responsiveness and attentiveness is top of the line and first class. I've yet to meet a staff member who wasn't warm, welcoming and who wouldn't go out of their way to at least try to accommodate your desires. This is a testament to both the management and the lovely people of the Island alike. The decor is minimalist and chic. I've traveled extensively for business and pleasure, and prefer the warm, simple ambience of the boutique hotel. This is not Miami, this is an island in the Caribbean - let yourself surrender to island time, respect the culture and you will have the time of your life. As for the renovations to the rooftop terrace, yes the view is unparrallelled there, but honestly, with the beach 3 steps from the front doors, I did not miss it at all (although I'm excited to see the final result when it's completed!). As for the lighting? The theme of the hotel is water, Slightly dim/bluish lighting builds on that. I find it totally relaxing and Zen. Leave the flourescent lighting for the office, thanks! And honestly, if you can't find your room because of the lighting? Invest in new glasses - it's never been a problem for me. And I must address the shower complaints. Flooding? Really? I would like to know what people are doing in the showers...running laps perhaps? :) In my 2 weeks there I had nary a DROP of water on the floor. Tip: stay behind the glass partition and you're fine. This shower design is actually quite common in modern hotels in the States, for example one of my faves, The W. I've stayed in several that had a "rain" shower head in the middle of the shower area and no door/partition. Welcome to modernism! The improvements that I've seen since my first days at the Water Club years and years ago are fab. Housekeeping was perfect and gracious. They always took care of me, even when I called to request late service due to work emergencies that kept me in the room later than planned. Love the beds, major comfortable and I never felt a spring. All told, you get what you give. If you want a resort experience, shell out the extra $$$ and stay at the El San Juan or La Concha. If you appreciate a sexy, intimate atmosphere and staff who treat you like friends, I highly recommend this property. I love what this place is now and look forward to what it will be in the future. Form your own opinion and give this unique hotel the chance it deserves. I've stayed at the resorts here and this place wins hands down! It's now my second home and I cannot wait to return. Take the negativity with a grain of salt when weighing your decision. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “YOU WILL BE DISAPOINTED~~Blue lights =Creepy and lotsa bedbugs”
Reviews.Author: oceanlover010
Reviews.Content: The staff were excellent ..that was it..when I arrived it was simple I paid under 15 dollars and got to the hotel..taxis are awaiting. The staff always open the door upon leaving and arriving to the hotel. When I got to the hallway of my hotel,,it was so creepy..there were blue lights..I couldnt see my room num,,it was soo dark..there is ni closet or dressers there is an opening in the wall to hang a few items.,there floors are bare w/o carpet,,the bed which was pillow top..was uncomfortable and I could hear the springs. Then to the shower lol..what happened to the other half of the door? I spent time mopping up water after showering! the rooms dont have balconies you can sit on..there are sliding doors and thats it not enough room for a chair..dont worry about what others said about the loud a/c,,you will appreciate it when you are laying in bed listening to the ocean..ahhh and all the sudden at dusk every night for a week arrived,,the hotel is on a dead end street and its the perfect hangout! They blasted their music as loud as it could get..the police make rounds and once they are gone they turn it back up, I just turned the ac to avoid the noise,,oh the pool is closed..the second floor has a nice relaxing balcony ..but if you dont mind choking on cigarette smoke from the cab drivers who stay all day there waiting for calls,,Its honestly was just a matter of mgmt keeping it quiet and not allowing these things..ohh the BEDBUGS! I walked to get food nearby at night ..I wore short sleeves and shorts,,I didnt get bit not once..as soon as I got in bed ,,I could nt sleep,,I have bite makes all over my legs..I itched so bad..so I knew it was bedbugs, There were some nice hotels up the street,,I didnt need a rental car,,I caught the bus,,straight to Old San Juan..the locals were very nice and sure we did ride thru some rough neighborhoods but that didnt make them bad people..just honest people trying to earn a living..they were extremely respectful and thankful to the driver..I was impressed by their mannerisms. The bus is A5 across from walgreens ..keep in mind they are very relaxed there and there is no hurry so you may need to wait for the bus..just stay on A5, Finally there was no hot shower water ..the cool water felt good so I didnt complain..honestly the view I had was great but the noise was horrific..If you stay in a room with just windows it looked like it wouldve been very depressing..the water was muddy and it was not clear blue ..sometimes during the day it became a pretty shade of aqua marine..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place with great staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: JMcCalister
Reviews.Content: Fabulous stay at a great boutique hotelâ€¦. WOW!!! What a great find among the giants on the beach. The staff absolutely pampered us and treated us like family. If you like huge anonymous cookie-cutter hotels, then this personal treatment will not suit youâ€¦ Our room was completely done in white, new plasma TV, redone bath, with unique shower, that was big enough for two!!! Beach view, free internet, beach chairs and umbrellas, happy hour for guests, yes I said free! The staff helped us everyway possible, made reservations, early check-in, served us drinks on the balcony; with my husband in a wheelchair this was a blessing. Special Thanks to Valerie, the valets and all the staff, you made our stay truly remarkable. Cannot wait to visit â€œThe Water Clubâ€� again. FYIâ€¦ The hotel cannot be held responsible for the streets in the area needing sweeping, the area around the hotel was very well maintained and we felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “"Whatever you do please don't stay at this hotel"”
Reviews.Author: sheri10_11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to this hotel for vacation. Orignally we weren't going to stay but the reservation department convince us to come and wouldn't be disappointed. Wrong move!!! When we got there and check in on 5/26/2011 our room was not clean like it should have been. No complete shower door in bathroom.Shower wasn't fully clean. Mirror in bath had chips in it. My husband and I couldn't sleep that evening. We tried to find another hotel that same evening but nothing available until next day. We ask for our money back and didn't get full refund. Thank God for Doubletree by Hilton who made the rest of our stay wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay Here - Not So Good This Time”
Reviews.Author: norman2
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay here again and although the hotel advised me that the pool was closed and the restaurant only would be serving breakfast, without those two amenities this place had nothing going for it. They need better housekeeping. The rooms are tired and not clean enough. The staff can't do anything for you because their is nothing they can do. It was a interesting concept to go boutique.. they just need to update the rooms more and train the staff to be more engaging.

Reviews.Title: “JUST AN AMAZING PLACE!!”
Reviews.Author: uniqueplanner
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a group of friends and we couldn't be happier to have chosen this boutique hotel. we read other reviews and I have no idea where these people stayed! even though they don't have the pool open , we didn't even miss it! There is so much to do in the area and the beach is just incredible...what a view from our room!! The rooms are understated, simple and have just what is needed...with a "green" twist...check out the bathroom amenities! They serve breakfast in their lounge and wonderful local cocktails. The staff mentioned that they are working on new menus for appetizers to go with the cocktails. We are looking forward to go back...and let me tell you, you will not find a better spot in San Juan!!! Simply amazing!! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: Jvrn5
Reviews.Content: The room was very small, bed was hard, sheets felt like cardboard, air conditioner did not work, bathroom window had no blinds fir privacy eve thou there is a building in front of it that people can look in. No were to hang your clothes. Room light did not work. Once staff was notified of this they stated we needed to wait til the morning. Yeah we left went to a real hotel. Avoid this place !

Reviews.Title: “Management should take some suggestions!”
Reviews.Author: dls7609
Reviews.Content: Having never been to PR before, my husband and I decided to book a week at the San Juan Water & Beach Club. The location steps from the lovely beach and the mostly pleasant staff (except for the breakfast waitresses), are pretty much the only positive attributes of this hotel. The fact that the room has no storage for clothes is really inconvenient and frankly unacceptable. I know that the hotel "vibe" is contemporary, but really, whoever designed the rooms could have easily added an armoire or a bureau for guests' clothing. The air conditioner was extremely noisy, and the towel bar in the bathroom kept falling off the sink. Also, the biggest complaint was the "breakfast." Our package included a "Continental breakfast" which consisted of juice, coffee or tea, and two(!) "bakery" items. Considering the value of the Continental breakfast and that we were willing to use that value towards another menu item (fruit, eggs, etc.), we were really upset that we could not do that. Many other guests we spoke to during our stay complained about exactly the same thing - if you're offering a breakfast that's worth $13, why not allow guests to use that value for something else on the menu or pay an up charge? The surrounding area around the hotel (the walkway to the street) was filthy and though Isla Verde has many very upscale hotels, the whole area really could use a good sidewalk sweeping. Other than the beach location, this hotel really needs management to take into consideration some of the reviews here to heart.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - motel-quality facility”
Reviews.Author: LauraFit_10
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, however the hotel lacks the basics that you would expect. The room lacked storage, a bedside table, in-room coffee (option to pay $3.25 at the bar), glassware. There were not any ice machines - we had to ask for ice and an ice bucket from the front desk. The furniture, other than the bed/desk, was flimsy. The rug was so cheap we rolled it up to prevent tripping. No pool! The windows were filthy and we had to keep the draperies closed to avoid the nasty view. Noisy, noisy air conditioner. Nice staff and location. Happy hour helped ease the pain.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Relaxing Experience”
Reviews.Author: DizzyEC
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time reading everyone's reviews on trip advisor and was a bit nervous about staying here, but that all changed once I got there. My husband and I went on a last minute vacation to Isla Verde for our anniversary. We went with open minds and ready to relax. The moment we arrived we were treated with excellent service. Xavier was the person at the front desk at this time and he was wonderful. They allowed us to enter our room earlier than their check in time, which was great for us since we had a very early flight and were exhausted. The room was very clean. I did not see any mold or any of the things that other travelers experienced. We had a regular room with partial view of the beach. People complained about the blue lights, but they are optional there are regular lights in the room so no need to have the blue lights on unless you really want them on. The bed and the pillows were very comfortable and the air conditioner worked well. We had hot water the entire time we were there and the water pressure in the shower was great. The staff was amazing always opening the doors for us at the front, they were always able to answer our questions and offer suggestions on the best way to get around town. Cabs were always available at the hotel. We never ate at the hotel but it did look like a nice restaurant. The hotel was overall very quiet and peaceful. We were not aware that there was a complimentary breakfast, so we never made it to this. We were aware of the happy hour, but we never made it there on time since we were always out and about. It is a nice gesture of the hotel. We did have excellent service whenever we wanted beach chairs and umbrellas on the beach and beach towels. The hotel has a lounge on the second floor that is very peaceful and clean. Here you can sit have a drink and relax with the view of the ocean. I heard great reviews about the rooftop bar and pool, and unfortunately it was closed. I would definitely go back here and enjoy this hotel. Isla Verda is a great location with the beach right there and lots to do. There are lots of local affordable restaurants and hang out spots. The casinos and local clubs are within walking distance. My husband and I took the local bust for .75 cents to Old San Juan and walked along the strip at night feeling safe. My two favorite restaurants were Casitas a few blocks away and La Lechonera de Latin. Both were very affordable and great local food. For some cheap drinks and beer go to Taquitos only a few blocks from the hotel. If you are looking for affordable souvenirs, try and get them at Old San Juan, because all the souvenir shops in Isla Verde are very expensive. A few suggestions for the hotel are as followings, maybe the management team can consider getting some rugs to put in front of the bed since the floor is cold in the morning. The blind in the room we stayed in had holes in them, the air conditioner was very noisy and in the morning it was a bit difficult to sleep past 8am with the noise from the cleaning lady's cart. Also even though I'm not against the blue lights I think that it is a bit scary to have only blue lights in the hallway. If I was traveling alone I would not feel safe walking down the hallway with poor lighting. Also let travelers know ahead of time about the 50$ a day that they will be put on hold in case they buy something there? I think maybe you should just charge the person for whatever services they get instead of putting a hold on your credit card. Also you should consider the set up in the rooms. It was a bit weird to have the bed in the middle of the room. It made the room look a lot smaller than it really is. Maybe if you had the bed up against the wall and the side table on the side it would be a better layout. Also besides the small chair behind the bed there were no other options to sit in. Having everything white can be a challenge because you have to work very hard to maintain it clean maybe adding some color in there. There was no comfortable in the room like the description says, just sheets. The water in the shower kept coming out because only has a half a wall. Let the travelers know when they arrive that the pool is closed and t he upstairs lounge. Maybe the hotel can invest in having a shuttle to and from the airport, since it is only a 5 minute drive and the cab drivers are very expensive. Also please have more information on excursions and trips. We had an amazing time here and know that with a few suggestions this hotel can be one of the very best in Isla Verde. And for the price you pay you are getting a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Chic party hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexTravel253
Reviews.Content: The San Juan water and beach club is an up and coming property. Physically the fixtures and elevators are a little dated. But the new management has updated all the bedding, tv's and put free wifi through out the hotel and even out to the beach. The service staff at the beach and front desk are great. the roof top pool and bar are currently under renovation. When completed it will be the place to be in Isla Verde day or night.

Reviews.Title: “Every picture does not tell a story! Pool closed until at least July 2011”
Reviews.Author: DreamOnn
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel, which claims to be a resort, you may consider skipping this one. They had the nerve to charge us an extra $13.58 per day for a "resort tariff"...what a joke. Their argument was because they serve a breakfast and happy hour and because we booked on Priceline, they can charge you this. I highly disagree!! How can you argue that you are a resort when you are merely a bed and breakfast and that is it and they have the nerve to charge an extra $55 upon checkout!!! The only thing this MOTEL can offer you is a bed and a great location, right on the beach...nothing more,nothing less!! Our check out was at 12pm and our flight was at 7pm. We asked for a late check out which would have been 3pm with a $75 charge. The front desk staff did not seem to care or accomodate us one bit. They claim to have a rooftop pool which is closed and seems to me, like they have no plans on reopening in the near future (July 2011). The rooms are in dire need of a few simple amenties like furniture to store your clothing and shelves or sink space to store your toiletries or even perhaps a FULL shower door, not a half of pane of glass. Unless you are on a tight budget and can get this place for $100 a night, go for it...otherwise skip it and pay a little extra and go to the Intercontinental a few doors down, which is beautiful, has an awesome staff and wonderful amenties... A REAL RESORT ON THE BEACH. We spent most of our time there and would recommend the Intercontinental over this place HANDS DOWN!! Beautiful pool, great restaurants on the beach or indoors!! Forget this place, skip it all together until they get their act together!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic beachfront location, but not "luxury"”
Reviews.Author: thewisetraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Juan Water and Beach Club for one week in early March. This boutique hotel is conveniently located only a few minutes away from the San Juan International Airport. The hotel fronts a dead-end street right on a Isla Verde beach in Carolina. There are numerous dining options all within walking distance- everything from fast food, to casual sit-down, to upscale dining. I recommend getting out and exploring the nearby area, as well as Old San Juan. We booked a suite online well in advance of our stay. The website showed a well-appointed room with a small balcony. Unfortunately, when we got up to our suite, to our surprise, it didn't have a balcony. A visit back to the front desk informed us that all of the suites with balconies were reserved. This was disappointing, as one of the primary reasons for choosing a suite was the balcony and view. The suite was still nice, but there were some noticeable cons: - No ironing board or iron in room, even though the website said there was one. - Rooftop pool closed - The tacky "South Beach" style blue lighting - No ice machines or vending machines in the building (had to request ice at bar) - No mini-fridge. We resorted to purchasing a disposable cooler at a local drug store. - Glass shower door doesn't seal correctly and water leaks all over the floor - Multiple scuffs and damage to bathroom counter - Outside room windows look like they haven't been washed in years - General cleanliness issues, nothing serious- but the place could use a good scrubbing - Broken telescope in the room- it would be a nice feature, if only it worked. - Bathroom lighting was insufficient - Noisy, raucous guests in next door room one night during our stay (this was brought to the attention of the staff the next morning who sufficiently addressed the issue.) - The restaurant only serves breakfast And the pros: - Location and view - Staff friendliness - Free beach chairs, towels, and umbrellas - Daily happy hour - Large walk-in closet in the suite - Free WiFi - Taxis are always right outside the hotel (but consider renting a car if you plan to visit the National Forest and Old San Juan.) Overall, if you're looking for a nice beachfront hotel, without all the added luxuries of a four or five star brand, the Water and Beach Club is a good find.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: thehob
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the San Juan Water & Beach Club for a few days before heading to Vieques. We had an absolutely wonderful stay, and especially considering what we paid for the room (we got a great deal online), we had absolutely zero complaints. After reading some of the tripadvisor reviews I was unsure about booking here. I'm so glad that we didn't listen to all the complainers! The location is great, our room was huge and had beautiful ocean views, and the staff was wonderful. seriously, we couldn't stop saying how sweet everyone was - they really go out of their way to make you feel welcome. we liked that it was a smaller hotel - we're NOT fans of mega resorts like the ones surrounding this hotel, and this was a perfect alternative. The only downside to this hotel was its distance from Old San Juan, but being right on the beach was a fair trade-off! we just hired a car to drive us into town - no big deal. I'd definitely stay here again and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends or family looking for a fun, convenient, smaller hotel in San Juan...it was the perfect choice for the first stop on our Puerto Rico trip!

Reviews.Title: “Not a luxury hotel, but has lots to offer”
Reviews.Author: HoyaLaw2015
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not a luxury hotel, so if that's what you're looking for, stay at the El San Juan or the InterContinental, both just steps from this hotel. However, if you're looking for a slightly edgy hotel that is RIGHT on the beach, minutes from the airport and Old San Juan, and within walking distance of good restaurants and bars, this is a great find. Our room had a BEAUTIFUL ocean view, a plasma-screen TV, a king bed, and an MP3 player/radio. The shower was seriously lacking water pressure and sometimes ran out of hot water. The hotel offers free beach chairs, towels, umbrellas, which is great! The beach is lovely and is right out front of the hotel. The rooftop bar/pool was CLOSED when we were there, which was a disappointment. The hotel did offer 1 free drink at the bar between 5 and 6, which was fun. Parking was $15 per day, but if you don't have a car, there are ALWAYS taxis parked outside the hotel waiting to take you wherever you need to go. Also, there are tons of restaurants, bars, and even a Wallgreens Pharmacy within steps of the hotel, which is very convenient. Overall, it was a pleasant experience, though not a 5-star hotel by any means.

Reviews.Title: “This place is absolutely amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: moralesg1
Reviews.Content: Our stay was wonderful at the hotel,it felt like a home away from home. The hotel employees are amazing,very helpful,kind,warm,and welcoming. I would definitely recommend this hotel to everyone who is looking to have a great time and puerto rico and a relaxing stay. I will most definitely be booking with them on my next trip to puerto rico. :)

Reviews.Title: “It coulda been a contender!”
Reviews.Author: Vamanos_Now
Reviews.Content: The SJW&BC is in an incredible location, just 10 minutes from the airport & just steps from a beautiful beach. Unfortunately the inside of the hotel isn't as incredible. Our room did not have the MP3 player, alarm clock/radio, coffee maker, or iron advertised on their web site. The effect they're going for with the blue lighting unfortunately makes the room look like an operating theater (we finally realized that just using the reading lamps was much better). The bed was comfortable, but the air conditioner was very noisy & couldn't be shut off. We also had to have our keys reprogrammed 3 times during our 4-day stay. That said, every staff member we encountered was extremely friendly & helpful, breakfast was good, though pricey; the happy hour was a nice way to to meet other guests & there's nothing like having a frozen pina colada brought to you on the beach. We didn't find it to be dirty, just not kempt. We like smaller hotels, so if the price is considerably less than other area hotels, we might go back.

Reviews.Title: “Staaay away!!”
Reviews.Author: Joanna013
Reviews.Content: This hotel seemed OK from the reviews and pictures, but when we got to the destination the problems began piling up: 1) We were never notified that the rooftop lounge and pool were under construction until we got there. 2) The room was EXTREMELY DIRTY and GROSS!! The room was covered with glass stains, dirt, and gross walls and windows. The decorating job was also a disaster. I think they were trying to go for some all-white sleek summer fresh feel but with the fluorescent blue lighting and dirty white walls/bed/floor (without any color in the room) I felt like I was trapped inside a dirty igloo. The hallways and hotel bar were also dirty. People, pick up a sponge and mop!! 3) Although the staff members at the front desk were very nice, they were also incompetent. On a few occasions they made mistakes in our excursion bookings and didn't correct them properly. 4) It is actually beachfront, which is nice. The location however is not that exciting. At night I was told I (a female in my 30's) could not walk around by myself for it would be too dangerous. 5) They are very dog-friendly which is great. Dogs are also allowed on the beach. Both were pluses for me even though I didn't bring my dog... 6) The hotel is being renovated by the Morgan Hotel group so hopefully there will be positive change soon.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to come back to!”
Reviews.Author: BobandEileen
Reviews.Content: "Welcome home!" The greeting was unfailingly offered each time we returned to the front entrance of this remarkable - and remarkably located - hotel. The "Water and Beach Club" has got to be the best hotel on the best beachfront in the Isla Verde area of Puerto Rico. Everything seemed to come together in one low-stress, easygoing swirl of pleasant people, delightful decor, amazing views, and million-dollar location. The Water Club is an easy walk to every local amenity imaginable: supermarket, drugstore, souvenirs, casinos, fast food, fine dining, or local cuisine. And, oh, that beach! Just amazing. People-watching, warm ocean waters, soft sand everywhere, and the exuberance of Puerto Ricans themselves enjoying la playa publica. The hotel staff were always eager to please, and usually able to do so. Taxis and mini-vans for pre-arranged excursions easily rolled right up to the front door to take you snorkeling, to the rain forest, to Old San Juan, or (sadly) to the nearby airport. Chief among Water and Beach Club friends was Verna, who said, "things happen for a reason." I think the thing that happened was our visit...and the reason was to give us an excuse to return to this relaxing and beautiful place next time we visit Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Beach Vacation”
Reviews.Author: EricandBettina
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect. 10 Minutes taxi ride from the Airport as well as Old San Juan. Pedro the beach attendant took great care of us throughout the day. Don't miss Danny's Mojitos and make sure to ask Jeff Palmer, the GM for the latest hot spots in town. The staff was excellent throughout and we would absolutely stay there again. Cant wait for the rooftop to reopen! See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: conley44
Reviews.Content: We read every review on this hotel prior to booking, and after having stayed there, I have to wonder about the legitimacy of the reviews. First, there is no pool or rooftop bar as their website indicated when we booked in December (the website has been changed now but we weren't notified prior to arrival). Also, there was mold in the shower, the sheets felt like sandpaper, the staff was rude, the floor in our room was dirty, and the walls are paper thin (we were woken up TEN times in one night by noises). Finally, the hotel sits at the end of a small road with a gated, run-down complex to the left and plenty of fences with barbed wire running between the complex the and beach. Unless you are in your early 20s and looking for a cheap, loud place to party, don't stay here. We were extremely unhappy (as were all the other people we talked to), and we moved after one night. Attempts to talk to management were met with "no one is here now" w/each request.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for location but not fabulous hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: Hayley417
Reviews.Content: I read alot of reviews before I left for my trip to San Juan and I felt alot of them were very mixed reviewed so I'm going to try to break this down for all of you who are contemplating staying at the Water and Beach club. First, this hotel is great for location. GREAT. You are directly on the beach, the hotel rakes the beach every morning so the hotel's part of the beach is gorgeous and clean (alot of other hotels didnt). You get free chaises, umbrellas, and towels (just tip the guy that sets it up for you). You are also located right on strip with many restaurants, walgreens, fast food places, the San Juan Casino (which is fun and beautiful) and the bus stop that you can take to Old San Jan which is also beutiful (otherwise a cab is 20 bucks). The service at the hotel is great, super nice people. But do not eat at the restaurant. They only serve breakfast, they are SUPER SLOW, and they food was not good or worth the cost. The rooftop is closed UNTIL SUMMER for renovations, so no rooftop bar, pool, etc. Be prepared for that. Also be prepared for a "resort fee" when you leave, which every place charges. We had one room for 2 people and it was 90 dollars. For food, I would suggest going to Gallaza Cafe for breakfast (SO GOOD AND AFFORDABLE) or the cafe in the plaza with Baskin Robbins, affordable, pretty good, service is a bit slow because they are always busy. These are both located when you take the little walkway (its like a hallway) next to the hotel to the strip and then take a left. Old San Juan is beautiful and you must visit, gorgeous. El Morro was very cool as well as El Yunque, The Rainforest....which has beautiful waterfalls and a nice hour long hike through it with a path. Bacardi Factory wasn't super interesting but it's free to get in and each person gets free 2 drinks so it's a cool experience. The hotel has nothing extra, at all. You get a bed, tv, bathroom. Thats about it. The sheets suck, horrible thread count (and I'm not a picky person that complains by the way), you get no tv guide, no ipod speakers as I read on another site, we had to request an iron. I will say that the maid is very nice and did a good job cleaning our hotel and would clean the bathroom and organize everything for us every day. I always left all of my jewelry and nice things out and nothing was ever moved. The whole hotel has a blue lighting, more so at night, which is cool and goes with the water theme but made it hard to see when doing my makeup and trying to pack,etc. If you walk down the dead end street that the hotel is on there are 3 bars right in a row, which are nice and chill with a beach view. Everyone in the San Juan area is bi-lingual...it is very americanized. So if you don't speak a lick of English you will still be fine. I even met a handful of people that worked there and originally lived in the central States. OVERALL I would stay here again because the location was so great and staff were nice, just don't expect alot within the hotel and you'll be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view, staff and sounds of the ocean”
Reviews.Author: kcaulfield
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at the last moment. Most important thing was being close to the ocean. We were taken back when the cab stopped infront of a BLUE hotel. All white with blue lights! very cool! The staff was warm and friendly. Our room was delightful, all white, bedding, draps that covered the bathroom doors. We slept on the second from top floor with the door open. in the middle of the night my husband woke me to ask me to turn off the tv. It was not on.. the sound of the ocean was that loud! we loved it! We woke early as we were heading to the airport to return to below zero weather and wanted to take in as much sun as we could. A yummy breakfast overlooking the ocean. A pleasant walk on the beach at night and in the morning. We asked to have a umbrella and chairs set up for us. it was a wonderful hour in the sun! staff was very helpful! water falls in the glass top elevators was really fun! I would love to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel with outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: vivdancing
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights and truly enjoyed it. There is no restaurant service, however, there is always breakfast, a bar and a happy hour between 5:00-6:00 p.m.with free drinks. The hotel is in a GREAT location so you can literally walk outside and voila, there is the beach. There are also other restaurants and bars walking distance and other hotels with restaurants so is not a huge deal not having a restaurant. I personally like to venture out of the hotel anyways. Walgreens is close too, should you need to purchase misc. items. We mainly ate at Old San Juan where the food is Amazing and lots to choose from (please get out and venture out or you miss out on Puerto Rico) , or at a small bar that was walking distance from our hotel. Service was outstanding, itâ€™s a small boutique hotel and found their service and customer skills better than the other fancy big chain hotels we walked to. (Had horrible experience at the Italian restaurant at Intercontinental) Hotel looks nice from the outside, breakfast area was beautiful, there is a small fitness room that we used, rooms are nice, clean, neat looking, furniture and bedding was primarily all white giving it a Miami/tropical flare to it. Our window overlooked the ocean with a perfect view of the beach. We did not want to leave. You can take a bus to Old San Juan for 75cents a person or cab for 20 bucks, about 10 min in cab, 20 via bus â€“ we did a little of both as the buses took longer BUT for that cost I suggest the bus at least a couple of times. The beach area was wonderful and we actually noticed that the beach area by Intercontinental, Ritz and those other fancy big hotels next to it had a ton of seaweed and our beach area was a lot cleaner. Overall, if you are looking for an americanized big resort to eat and hang out, this is not it, but if you are looking for a more tropical hotel with great location and service, I would totally recomment The Water & Beach Club. We loved Puerto Rico and look forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing”
Reviews.Author: soccermom2011
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I unfortnately came back from our honeymoon, and wanted to say we enjoyed our 1st but not last trip to Puerto Rico.... The staff were very helpful and pleasant to talk to.... From the front desk Juan and Jada, to the funny Luis, even the housekeeper( don't know here name).. We felt welcome with all the smiles and good conversation, because that's what we are all about... We hope to see you again soon. We enjoyed the happy hour and some of the attractions....(thanks Juan and Luis for the help) What would make this hotel a 5 out of 5, would be... Microwaves in the rooms, a shower attachment so the water isn't all over the floor or a shower door.. Keith and Natasha

Reviews.Title: “great service, but property is a little tired”
Reviews.Author: GoToIbiza
Reviews.Content: overall, this is a good value for its location, quality, and service..... just be aware that it is quite modern style and is more south beach Miami than classic beach resort. Service was great + service (from the front desk to the bellman to the valet, everyone was great and willing to help) location - right on isla verde beach, within walking distance of El San Juan hotel, Intercontinental, and other larger hotels with dining and casino options price - stayed here over valentines day and found a good deal on their website "specials" for 30%-40%off prepaid advanced stays views - from what i could tell, every room in the place has a full or partial view of the ocean - the building itself is a little tired (looks like this was a hotspot about 5 years ago) though there were workers there every day that appear to be rehabbing certain areas.... rooms are in very good condition though (and modern/updated) no pool (its right on the beach, so this was not an issue for me, but may be for others) the rooftop bar, WET, is closed for renovations.... i called and asked when it would open and was given no answer.... but during my stay i was told "summer 2011"

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return!! Great experience & GORGEOUS views.”
Reviews.Author: honeyloves2travel
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here and we enjoyed it. My boyfriend has been to this hotel before and he was really looking forward to the rooftop pool which is closed.. but we still enjoyed our top floor suite which had some amazing views, a huge walk-in closet and was really nice and clean. The staff were friendly and the location is right on the beach.. Room service brought us breakfast to our room in the AM which was lovely. This hotel is perfect for young couples who like a laid back and cool atmosphere. Overall we enjoyed staying here and we can't wait to come back when they are done renovating the rooftop pool.

Reviews.Title: “Really cool place”
Reviews.Author: meinohio
Reviews.Content: Loved the beach and water club! The decor is so cool....the lamps tables ect.are all well thought out. I had to go to front desk and ask who designed it because every detail was interesting. It's doors open up to the beach with a friendly doorman waiting there for you. They even provided chairs for their guests. The white curtains and lightening was a sight to see. My only regret is we were here pre cruise and only spent one night.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service”
Reviews.Author: PeggyR53
Reviews.Content: We were bumped from our flight to St. Lucia, and the airline set us up at the Water & Beach Club Hotel. When we first arrived, I wasn't sure what the experience would be like, because we typically prefer more traditional hotels, and this one was contemporary, hip and trendy. We're in our late 50's and I thought it might be for a younger group, but during our stay saw other guests in our age group. It was a smaller hotel, and we had outstanding service - every single employee went over the top to make sure we were comfortable. We were listed in their system as "distressed travelers", and it seemed like they wanted to make up for whatever hassle we had experienced with our flight. It's right across the street from a great beach, and their beach employees were also wonderful. I would definitely stay again, and would also refer friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great ocean front hotel”
Reviews.Author: michaelturlte1
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel without knowing much about it or San Juan for that matter. Read a bunch of reviews and was a bit worried, but was very pleased with the 6 days we spent enjoying the beautiful beaches and wonderful hotel. Upon arrival, the doorman was incredibly friendly, the front desk staff was also friendly and quite helpful getting us situated for our stay. We upgraded upon arrival to an ocean front room, which I would highly recommend as the view is just about perfect. The amenities and furnishings in the room were more than sufficient, the linens could be better but they got the job done. Location is one of the most important attribute of a hotel and the Water Club is in a great location, the beach was wonderful with free chairs to relax on, the beach is raked every morning and is in just about perfect shape when you wake up. There are a great number of shops and restaurants near the hotel, you do not need to go far for a great meal or to pickup any necessity. Free happy hour drinks were welcomed but the drinks that you purchased from the bar were even better. At the end of the week, my wife and I were completely satisfied with our choice in hotels. The only things that could make the Water Club better would be a restaurant, a dedicated concierge, the front desk did their best but a dedicated concierge would really help, and the re-opening of the rooftop pool and lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: TripsPR
Reviews.Content: The place is ideally located right off the beautiful Isla Verde beach. The place is pretty clean and the room is clean and modern and very basic. Has adequate space for two people. Our package included the complimentary beach chairs , towels, continental breakfast and one hour cocktail hours. The staff was great and helped us plan our day very well. Gisel (hope I got the spelling right) was great help and helped us get a early check in on the day of our arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Hip atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: monscul
Reviews.Content: What the hotel lacks in amenities it makes up in style. Cool boutique style hotel on the beach. The rooms are large and bathrooms small. Staff is young and friendly, great free happy hour (with the best Pina Coladas of our entire trip). Doesn't have the amenities of a big hotel, but it is a nice change of pace. Rooms do not have coffee/tea service, refrigerators or ice vending. But overall very fun place, would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great but no room service or pool”
Reviews.Author: pinoynoir
Reviews.Content: Overall experience was great, really cool and laid back but did experience a few glitches along the way. This hotel is referred to simply as The Water Club not the entire name you find online. The pro's: First impression was great. Modern, sleepy, intimate, airy hotel tastefully decorated and proximity to the beach was fine. Loved that the hotel was at the end of the dead-end street so not a lot of traffic noise, plus it was set off the main strip - preferable. Also loved that it was an adult-only hotel. However, the main strip was only a block away and was near a pathway to/from. Within easy walking distance of other hotels, casinos, stores and restaurants. The room was spacious, partial ocean view, clean and quite. The con's: the food - or lack thereof. The continental breakfast - you're not missing anything here if you skipped it. They should just offer a buffet with fruit, pastries and juices/coffee. No room service - not even cold sandwiches. Pool under repair - I felt they should have disclosed this prior to booking - or even during check in! Did witness a wedding onsite - really beautiful and intimate. Only a few changes need to be made and they could really capitalize on something.

Reviews.Title: “Good Times”
Reviews.Author: Ohiotraveler037
Reviews.Content: My first impression of the Water Club was one of mild disappointment, but after our 4 day stay, I have to admit that the place was starting to grow on me. First the bad news, the hotel is trying very hard (maybe a little too hard) to have a South Beach feel. There are blue fluorescent lights everywhere (trying to look like South Beach neon?) And the rooms are decorated too simply, maybe Spartan is a better word. Now the good news, the main lobby is about ten seconds walk to one of the best beaches in Puerto Rico. The front desk staff is excellent, (ask for Verna, she can get anything you need!), and the nightly hour of free rum drinks and local beer in the bar is a nice way to end a busy day. At night, walk 50 yards to the east to the Waldorf-Astoria El San Juan hotel for dinner, (4 dining rooms, 4 price ranges). As you walk around the El San Juan, no one will know that you are staying next door for about one third the price.

Reviews.Title: “The mattress was worn out two years ago.”
Reviews.Author: Willzsales
Reviews.Content: First, I booked this room using the "Name Your Price" feature of "another website." It was billed as a 3 star. I would call it a 2 star. The price locked in, of course, did not include the "resort fee." Apparently the offer and acceptance wasn't what I was led to believe it was. Staff called asking how was the room. I reported the light above the bath mirror burned out. She said she would send somebody. They never came. The towel bar on the sink was hanging by a thread. It fell and swung down narrowly missing my foot by inches. The mattress was shot a long time ago. Bad shape. All else was pretty cool. I know it's easy to complain and maybe we got the "bad room."

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and location make up for the smaller room.”
Reviews.Author: megan04rn
Reviews.Content: Location right on the beach, an amazing entrance with flowing white curtains and wonderful happy hour made up for the smaller rooms that lacked storage and sitting areas. It would be wonderful to have a small kitchenette in the room of even the floor you are staying on and maybe a larger dresser. But we were so busy enjoying the FREE beach chairs (everywhere else charges) and eating at local dives that we stopped really caring about leaving out clothes in our luggage. The staff is the most friendly people I've ever met with tips on places to go and eat and tours to take. I would totally stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy boutique hotel can hold its own”
Reviews.Author: DnDbees
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying here. The concierge helped us plan some wonderful excursions and arranged for taxis to pick us up whenever we wanted to go into Old San Juan. It was a short walk to a resort casino (don't remember the name...El San Juan maybe?) but we could retreat back to our quieter hotel when we wanted to relax. It is on the beach, has its own rooftop bar & lounge, and a restaurant. It has dark lighting & cool decor. I also liked the size and layout of our hotel room. I would definitely recommend it for people in their 20's and 30's.

Reviews.Title: “just put on the theme song to Miami Vice & you are there”
Reviews.Author: passthegreypoupon
Reviews.Content: Boutique Hotel. My wife & I never stayed in a Boutique hotel.It probably was obvious to the staff. And yet we were treated as if we were Mr.& Mrs . Gates.Truly professional staff,with such a devotion to customer service.I don't think sincerity like that can be feigned.Jada,William,Pedro and A couple of names I did not get.All beautiful people.The hotel bathed in soft blue light & wispy white sheer curtains,sea glass style floors in the restaurant & brushed aluminum wavy door handles.Elevators with water falls,backlight mirrors in sexy red glow.White rooms,white everything(try & keep that clean....and they do). The room,small but space utilized efficently & innovatively.May not be for the 7 suitcase traveler.Having said that,thoroughly enjoyable A side note,Jada,a receptionist,just a joy from the moment she greets you with the warmest of smiles. William,the valet,truly an infectious,spiritual & joyful soul.I didn't even have a car and yet I spent more time enjoying his love of life,people & desire to make you feel as if this were his home and you were his honored guest. Pedro,A cool dude and the bartender,who's name I never got(we just spoke a bit outside) is rocking A youthful style & just compliments the whole vibe of this hotel. My Wife & I accidently ended up here ,on a flight cancellation & priceline name your own deal. I had read about the hotel,but initially wasn't in my remaining budget.It's probably in yours. My first Boutique,and a standard setter. Thanks,Sincerely Al & Desiree P.S Beach Beach & more Beach.It's all at the SJWBC

Reviews.Title: “Best Honeymoon spot EVER!”
Reviews.Author: SandiHutchison
Reviews.Content: We had originally planned to stay in St. Thomas, but because of a tropical storm, were unable to land on that island. The San Juan Water & Beach Club was offered to us on the plane as one option. We are so, so happy we took them up on this offer! From the moment we arrived, we were astonished at the attention to detail that went into designing the space and lighting of this hotel. The theme is Water!, and it is set ideally right on the beach, so within seconds you can be swimming in the evening, then stroll back hand-in-hand, wash your feet in the gentle shower near the door, and go up to your room. As you enter the foyer, notice the avant-garde white couch which looks like a wave and is very inviting. immediately to your right is the cozy lounge which features live local muscial talent. The entire lobby and lounge are bathed in a cool-blue light, and everything from the ceiling fixtures to the custom glass floor tiles to the interesting cutouts in the walls to proclaim that the design of the interior space of this wonderful resort was given the closest attention to detail. The service was excellent. Our first night was a "panic" night because our plane couldn't land in St. Thomas. The hotel manager, Jeff, spent about 20 minutes with us carefully outlining some primo dining spots in Old San Juan. We made a beeline to Dragonfly Restaurant which featured some absolutely amazing sushi. (my new wife became the biggest sushi fan on our honeymoon!). We went back to the hotel, and were amazed at the real waterfall in the elevator, the cool blue lighting of the hallways, the pebble-photograph tile in the hall, and the thick, heavy doors to the rooms, which kept the hall sound out. The beds were VERY comfortable and we slept like babies. The rooms are done in white, so the room lights up if you keep the curtains drawn at dawn and you can see the beach sunrise from the room, or get up early enough and go for a romantic walk on the beach. The bathroom is unique in that there is no nasty shower curtain but a half-glass shower. We loved this feature, as everything is designed to keep mold to a minimum. The bathrooms are very modern, and the products they supply are high end H2O brand shampoos, conditioners and body wash. Since our next day was spent on a plane trying to land in St. Thomas, we were very relieved that the pilot went back to PR, and I immediately called the Water and Beach Club and reserved another Full Beach View room for 6 days. Pay the extra few dollars for this view if you can get it, it is totally worth the excellent view of the Isla Verde beach! We loved our week in Puerto Rico because of this hotel! The entire staff, from the housekeepers to the front desk, to the girls behind the bar, to the doorman William, were always helpful and friendly. We absolutely loved William! He provided great advice, and was always there to hail a cab. He could be featured on a poster for Puerto Rico travels! Valet service is available. We enjoyed walking down the street to some excellent little restaurants, featuring sushi, beef, chinese food, you name it. I can honestly say that we didn't have a bad meal in Puerto Rico! If you exit the hotel, turn left, and walk down the beach a ways, there is a lounge on the beach with beds set up (yep!) so you can enjoy live music and sip your drink with your honey, arm in arm enjoying the rhythmic lapping of the waves on the sand! So the hotel is very central to the area, and very accessible, yet tucked out of the way of traffic noise. The food in the lounge at the Water and Beach Club was very good. Sometimes you just feel like staying at the hotel, know what I mean? The drinks there were also very good. Our honeymoon, which was in jeopardy because of the tropical storm in St. Thomas, was completely salvaged by the superb General Manager, Jeff Palmer, and the following staff: William (hi William!), Paloma, Xavier, Tania, Giselle, Laura, and Ileana. Thank you so much for making our trip special! We are definitely coming back! Bill and Sandi Hutchison, October, 2010

Reviews.Title: “Funky and friendly”
Reviews.Author: ChesterArthur
Reviews.Content: This was a cool place. The staff was helpful and friendly, and as others have said, William at the door is helpful and pleasant. It is in a little need of sprucing up here and there. It is a good place to stay if you can get it for under $150 or so.

Reviews.Title: “For $60/per night...can't be beat.”
Reviews.Author: rudyrath
Reviews.Content: We got the hotel room on Priceline for $60/night. Found the staff very friendly and accomodating. Given the pool and rooftop were closed, we were able to upgrade our room to ocean front..we thank the hotel for this accomodation. William at the front door is friendly and really makes you feel welcome and part of the hotel. Although it rained for a day and a half, we were able to hang out on the second floor terrace in the evening. The location is excellent (right on the beach). Nice perk, happy hour every night: free rum. Careful for the shower, as the water spills into the floor and could be dangerous.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff, BUT....”
Reviews.Author: lajavaguy
Reviews.Content: One of the things about this place is that it has a few key limitations, like the fact that the roof-top pool and lounge are closed due to renovation. And NO, they didn't mention that when I book my stay. My first room had a bed that looked more like a hammock than a mattress, so I needed to change rooms, which was not a problem. The nicely redone baths are cute, but a bit dumb since they didn't bother with shower doors or large enough glass partitions, so the floor is either always wet or covered with towels. The blue lights are another cute idea, but I wished they had spent the money on better linens; the bedding felt worn and was somewhat soiled and stained in places. Overall, it was an OK place with a great location that's basically on the beach, which is why I would recommend it to someone. So if you're up for a quirky, trying to be trendy/stylish, small hotel that's not part of a big chain, this is the place for you. But if you're thinking this is a fancy, or even moderately sophisticated boutique hotel, you'll be disappointed. I had no expectations, so my weekend there was fine, but I guess I'm a bit fussy in the end -I like clean sheets and clean bathrooms.

Reviews.Title: “2nd Stay and won't be our last”
Reviews.Author: DoctorMT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last Dec and loved it, we decided to return. We were not disappointed. We felt very welcomed. We had a room with a balcony and the view is amazing. The breakfast that is included is pastries, juice, and coffee(I wish they would add some fruit like they used to have).....simple yet enough to get your day started. The location is awesome so close to the airport, across the street from a car rental place and a Walgreens, and walking distance to countless restaurants. El Alambique, El Taquito, Mi Casita, Coladas, Reubens, all good places to go. We also did the Biobay tour through East Island and swam in the Bay on Vieques.....AWESOME(Don't kayak it.....swim-it is way better)!!!! One of the most amazing things I have ever done! We did the rainforest tour arranged by the hotel, and I wished I had just rented a car for $24.99....the drive is easy and we paid way more for our tour. Our bed was comfortable, the people were very nice, the lounge chairs and umbrellas are great, this hotel is a GREAT VALUE, FREE Happy Hour is soooooo wonderful and a great way to get your evening started!!!!!!! We will be back~~~~and can't wait to see the roof finished(that was a bummer......but we will just have to go back to see it :-)

Reviews.Title: “Something different with nice aesthetics and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: DougieShap
Reviews.Content: So I just needed a one night stay close enough to the airport. But, I wanted to be near the ocean with access to good food. I found both at the Water Club. After a simple check-in process, I was in my contemporary style room with a HUGE bed and simple clean amenities, like good shower head and comfortable desk chair. I was informed of a nearby restaurant serving authentic local fare, which turned out to be better than described (La Casita). Internet worked great from the room and the bed was super, super comfortable. Digital thermostat and quiet AC topped off the comfort. Definitely recommend and will return.

Reviews.Title: “people should stop being so ridiculous, this hotel is nice”
Reviews.Author: Househead
Reviews.Content: there is nothing wrong with this hotel..i find it hilarious that people complain about such trivial things like the construction of the showers etc...we are currently staying now and we couldnt b happier...the view of the ocean from our room is beautiful, the room is very clean (i had all light on so back off people sayin this place is dirty)...the bed was huge, king size, and we slept wonderfully..the ac worked great, the water pressure in shower is great, the shower design i actually liked...they have full ipod deck for ipod, etc...the continental breakfast is okay, they dont offer much outside of danish and pastries..im not complaining bc we got a hell of a deal to stay here..also the valet parking is optional, so if you dont want to pay, go find parking like we did, which is very possible..im very pleased that i picked this hotel..the people at front desk are so helpful and friendly..haters hating on this hotel are out of their mind...great hotel, great deal..would stay again...we will be enjoying our final 3 days here, hopefully the sun will cooperate....juan welcomed us and made us feel at home..they really try their best to make the stay wonderful for their guests

Reviews.Title: “WONDERDFUL PLACE TO STAY!”
Reviews.Author: afjoe1
Reviews.Content: From the time we got there to the time we checked out it was the best. I read some of the reviews from other people on here and have to disagree with them. The valet parking guys were wonderful, very nice. We loved all the front desk people. We checked in and Juan was there. He took care of us like we were family. They we all so nice. The bar was great (especially the free happy hour). Housekeeping always kept our room clean. Can't say enough about the staff. Yes they have a lot of blue lighting in the hotel, but we loved it. The waterfalls in the elevators were very unique. The room was very comfortable, they accomodated us with a balcony, which we enjoyed. It wasn't very big, but worked for us. Only thing I would like is for the roof terrece to have been open. All in all, I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone. Even though they are doing renovations, we could not tell.

Reviews.Title: “William was the highlight of our stay, front desk at the bottom.”
Reviews.Author: lily3736
Reviews.Content: The valet/door man William was the best part of this hotel. He helped us with our bags and even offered to take our picture as we arrived. Very friendly and should be given a raise! He told us the best places to eat, to shop, everything the front desk is supposed to do! My friends and I had two rooms. One was ready, one was not (the unavailable one being mine). We decided to wait in the one room that was available while the other one was finished up. The girl at the front desk told me she would call me if the room was available, but it probably wouldn't be ready until 4. I think we got there at 12. We walked around for a little bit in between waiting. The location was great, the beach out front was great. While waiting in my friends room we kept hearing all this banging, not sure what it was. We just figured there was construction going on outside the hotel. We decided to take a trip up the to roof top pool/bar. We exited the elevator only to be met with pounding and jack hammering. We turn the corner and see everything is blocked off due to construction on the entire top floor! Now we knew where the construction was coming from. This was around 2p.m. We went back to the front desk and inquired about the rooftop. Why didn't any one let us know the pool was closed? What did they have to offer instead of the amenity? The only answer she had for us was the bar in the lobby. When I asked about the pool she rudely replied with "That's not my problem." Outraged we went back to the room to discuss what we planned to do. Part of our picking the hotel was the pool. We decided to stay and see how it went, seeing as we were already there. We went back to the desk at 4p.m. to check on the status of my room. The same girl was there, and she handed me the key, saying it had been ready for hours and that they had called me. I showed her my phone and said I had it all along and that we had already been to the front desk. She shrugged and walked away. When we had booked the room we had asked for adjoining rooms. We were told it was no problem. When we got to our room we realized that wouldn't be happening as there was no door to provide that. When I finally got to my room I was relieved. No jackhammering. My friends room next door, however, was completely different. Let's just say I had the lucky hand. Bigger bed, nicer set up, nicer bathroom, etc. It's fine to set your rooms up differently, but when two rooms are traveling together, someone is going to notice if one is nicer than the other. The downstairs bar was great. The young bartender was excellent and always made us something delicious. The breakfast we ate at the hotel wasn't bad either. It was just the first day that has us frustrated. I would give it another try, but first I would call and make sure everything is working at the hotel! But without William, I don't see how this hotel would survive.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing !!”
Reviews.Author: gitana0710
Reviews.Content: location, location, location!!! this hotel is within walking distance from all the good stuff Isla Verde has to offer, and most important steps from the beach. I stayed here with a big group of friends, we were all pleased. The rooftop pool was perfect to see the sunset. sat at the bar for a few hours and we still remember Gian and his amazing service. the only thing i didnt like was that we only had 1 small mirror in the bathroom and none in the room. the door-less shower was an inconvenience for some of us. I cant wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Trying a little too hard to be trendy”
Reviews.Author: expat_expl0rer
Reviews.Content: Fairly good value for money in a good location. The hotel's a tries a little too hard to be ultra modern and comes across as a little pretentious as a result. The rooms are a reasonable size but again trendiness has been prioritised over practicality with luminous blue lighting and bad positioning of furnishings.

Reviews.Title: “Great little Hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: reivaj2k
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my wife as a anniversary trip to San Juan. It has a very contemporary look and feel. It is a small building with not many rooms, so you get get the feeling of being lost at a huge resort. The beach is just a few steps away and it was great. We had a view of the ocean. Roof top bar was also great. They do play loud music, so if you are one to go to bed early, dont stay in the higher floors. Restaurant in the lobby was good. Great taste and quality. It may feel a little expensive but it compares with many other restaurants in the same area. The hotel is walking distance to the bigger Casino Hotels like Hotel San Juan. Great guest service by the front desk staff. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Walk out the door and onto the beach!”
Reviews.Author: ResortSpaLady
Reviews.Content: We decided to try a smaller, boutique hotel on this visit to Puerto Rico. After reading some of the reviews I was a bit worried about staying at the hotel. The hotel was easy to get to from the hotel. The taxi drove right up to the beach to the hotel entrance. The lobby area is very upscale and modern. I love hydrotherapy and waterso I was excited to see the water concept throughout the hotel. The hotel is small and the elevators small but I loved the water effects in the elevator--the propery is dark in many places but it seemed to add to a serene, secluded atmosphere. The first room we stay in was very small but a lovely view of the ocean. We were going to be on the property for a few days so we upgraded to a two room suite the next day. I will post pictures of both to show you the difference. We loved the WET bar on top of the hotel but the service was slow and no one seemed to care. It was almost an hour before we received an order of sushi and the restaurant was not that busy. The drinks arrived quickly but we did not go there for food again-(do not try to sushi--pass on it at this hotel). They have a pool on top of the hotel and the view from the pool and the WET BAR is not to be missed. The breakfast each morning was delightful--the staff was much better and so was the food We had a five course meal at Tangerine one night and the food and service was excellent. We would stay at this hotel again because of the intimate setting but would reserve a suite. This is a great hotel is you like the night life as the WET Bar was poplular but still quiet if you don't. The staff was great about setting up the chairs and towels on the beach and we loved walking out the door to feel the sand on our feet. Enjoy the pictures.

Reviews.Title: “It could have been so much more”
Reviews.Author: kjm31
Reviews.Content: Private beach, amazingly totally awesome top floor, cool-as-anything decor, what more could you ask for? How about... a door on your shower? Air conditioned hallways? First room we had flooded every time we used the shower. There was not even a little reservoir to collect the water, it just flowed freely to the rest of the bathroom. We just stared at it wondering who on earth could have created such a ridiculous configuration in the name of "trendy design". After 2 days we couldn't stand it and requested to be moved. We were moved to another room which had a door on the bathroom (yay) but... gigantically loud construction started about 10 minutes later (like right out of that commercial from a few years ago). Hoping this was a one-off, we hit the beach. When we came back, we turned on the shower, only to find... no water in our shower. At this point we just cracked up laughing and coughed it up to some bad luck. Ended up having fun laughing at just how bad our rooms were. Elevators and hallways were not air conditioned, so even leaving the building you'd break a sweat in June. Ridiculous given the hotel class, but I think this was actually due to said construction breaking something. This place COULD be amazing if they just fixed these little issues, but given our rather unfortunate experience, can't in good faith recommend it too highly. If you get lucky and don't run into these issues, you'll have a blast --- beach is awesome, location gorgeous, totally fun, and other great hotel bars and nightlife/casinos are nearby.

Reviews.Title: “The staff made the difference...”
Reviews.Author: dreamer92010
Reviews.Content: in the hotel's very basic accommodations and wanting their guests to enjoy themselves. No requests were ignored and the experience turned out to be a good one. Beautiful view of the beach and friendly people to make our stay a pleasurable one.

Reviews.Title: “"Fire the house keeper's"”
Reviews.Author: 604advisor
Reviews.Content: Extremely dirty! Blue lighting through out the whole Hotel... I m sorry, that is bad design, I think the purpose is to cover the dirty walls, doors, floors, toilets etc etc. Oh and the sheets..slept with clothes on! Checked out 7 hrs later. The photos on the Hotels page are for sure.. photo shopp'd

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Paradise just Minutes from the Airport”
Reviews.Author: jar4bwd33
Reviews.Content: Loved how the hotel sat right on the beach in very private section. A little paradise just tucked away that express the charm of Puerto Rico. The Ocean Front rooms are to Die! The open roof Top Deck and Pool is spectacular! Loved the running waterfall in the elevators and the sounds of the coquÃ­ in the hallways was magnificent. This art deco Hotel is a marvel in it self and so see it and be a part of it has left a happy imprint in memory. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely located steps from the beach”
Reviews.Author: Beachlovergirl10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this trendy boutique hotel on the last night of our Puerto Rico trip. Much cozier than the large resort style hotels where we have stayed in the past. The hotel was located walking distance to restaurants, souvenir shops, pharmacies, and a bus stop. Steps from the beach, just take the elevator to the lobby from your room and walk out to the beach...that was the best thing about this location. Beaches were nice. About the room, the room had unique blue lighting that was optional, all white linens, south beach style decor. We did not have a balcony in the room. The hotel pool area is on the rooftop, it looked like it is a small pool with cool views of the beaches and the Isla Verde hotel strip. We did not get to use the pool during our stay because it was being repaired. The hotel did offer a free happy hour from 5-6pm on the night of our stay. Overall, the room was clean and the bathroom/ shower was small, but adequate for our last night in San Juan. Updated boutique hotel near lots of little shops and walking distance away from the areas big casino's and resorts. It was nice for 2 adults. Front desk and bar staff was nice. The business center was a bit small and computers could be updated. Overall, good for our one night stay near the beach.

Reviews.Title: “what happenes in Puerto Rico, stay in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: Maggie0127
Reviews.Content: what happenes in Puerto Rico, stay in Puerto Rico Wwwwwwwweeeeeeeeeepppppppaaaaaaaaaaaa.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for hotel very close to the beach”
Reviews.Author: Pjay78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 8 days last September and overall enjoyed my stay. To be clear, this hotel is not beachfront. To me that means you can almost literally walk from the hotel into the sand. This hotel has a small street that lies in between the hotel and the beach.It's not like it's by any means an exhausting walk to the beach, though. It's right there in front of you. You just have to cross the street (which is not busy) to get there. You will have to walk a little ways to arrive at a nice clean area of beach. As soon as you are on the beach walk as far to the right as you can. That way you'll still be close to the hotel and someone can bring you a beach chair. They were very good about that. There is breakfast every morning (free) and yes it is very simple. Cereals, milk, toast, yogurt, juice and muffins. This should be expected however. I'm sure no logical person thought they'd be getting the full breakfast works for free. This is not an all-inclusive resort nor a bed & breakfast. But it is a cute boutique hotel. I didn't really have any issues at all during my stay. Well, the A/C leaked water on my 5th day there. I called and they sent someone up immediately to fix it. But it only fixed it temporarily because it leaked again the next three days. This became more of an issue because the rooms are not carpeted so the water would puddle. Now on to the shower situation. No the shower does not make any sense. It is only enclosed half way. Water WILL spill onto the floor. No way around that, even if you take a quick shower.
