There is a cool bar at the top of the hotel where you can sit with your cocktail and look out to the ocean. Bar staff was very friendly. Mingle with others. I met people from all kinds of places. Behind the hotel you will find a Walgreens, comes in handy to purchase things you may have forgotten at home, and also many many fast food places. Try to avoid these. If you're visting PR from the US then you are very accustomed to the customary fast food chains. Try to eat where the locals do. The hotel should recommend places. The bus was pretty easy to navigate on but keep in mind they get FULL. I never really felt unsafe and i walked the beach every night and explored San Juan. Old San Juan is pretty cool in the downtown area. The bldgs are different vivid colors. Overall, friendly people, handsome men and if you walk far down to the right of the beach its quite pretty. Also finding the hotel from the beach at nighttime is very easy. Just head to where you see all the windows lit up with blue. FYI while in your room, if the blue irritates you, it can be turned off. This is not at all a hotel for children. It's for adults wanting enjoy a fun beach stay without breaking the bank. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: theshacks
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate our 10th anniversary and I couldn't be more pleased! From the moment we walked in I was impressed with the decor. It was unique with blue lights and waterfalls everywhere (even one in the elevator walls!). The sheer draperies gave it a light, dreamy atmosphere. We had an ocean view room (it is worth it for the upgrade). It was only a few steps from the front door to the beach. Because it is a smaller hotel, you are treated more like friend or family. The staff tries to learn people's names to make it more personable. Virna helped us plan some amazing adventures and took care of all the details to make it easy for us to enjoy our stay. If you want to know what else is fun in the area, just as William! He will make sure you are taken care of! (Ask him to take a picture of you with the "special" beach background!). I cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel provides super friendly service”
Reviews.Author: BruceBlake
Reviews.Content: Hi there, My name is Bruce. If you want to super-charge your experience in Puerto Rico, then you should sure stay in the San Juan Water and Beach Club. From checking in, to relaxing on the beach, to being productive, this hotel has given myself and my other half Alissa the best experience we could ask for. Alissa is a model and she is picky about a few things and its great when we travel and i hear little to no complaining. The beds practically cuddle me when i sleep. The beach is beautiful. I was able to work out at the gym. The restaurant there is top-notch. We ate there way more than we planned. i danced on the roof top where there is a bar with friendly bar tenders and a swimming pool and beds to rest in or read or chat with buddies. I am using the business center to write this review this minute. Ive been using the Wi-FI in my room, no problem. Also, we like to party so the roof-top parties are our cup of tea. If you are a person that likes friendly folks, this is the place for you. All of the staff we've experienced so far the week and a half we've been here are just fantastic. Here are just a few of the great staff that made it great. Abraham and Paloma are consistently helpful at the front desk. William is super super positive and very very welcoming as if he is the humble heir to the place( I'm assuming he's not an heir) but even on rainy days he's smiling. And then there's Kevin (seen below), he gets the chairs and the umbrellas and towels and almost all of our beach needs. so don't worry about a towel because this really cool and friendly chap has your back. That's the best part for Alissa so during an impromptu photo shoot on the beach, we snapped one of him and her together because it was her favorite part...the beach. Imagine that!. lol I'm a people person so my favorite part was the Staff's hospitality. We will be back. Thanks for reading Bruce Michael

Reviews.Title: “You will never get service this good”
Reviews.Author: cjporsch
Reviews.Content: First off, I'm here on business and I get to stay right on the beach and the ocean, so it would be hard to complain. But, let's be serious, when you travel and spend money, you want people to care that you are here, and that is exactly what happens here. The people here treat you like they have known you their whole life, and would do anything to help you. If you arrive during the day, and get a chance to meet William (he takes care of the front and the valet parking), you would look at him and think he's a fictional character....he's not. He makes you realize there are good people in this world, and can take any bad day and make it better. The help here is impecable, and the ladies are very, very easy on the eyes (get a chance to meet Paloma!). The rooms here are decent, nothing spectacular, but decent. They have an outside pool on the roof and a great bar on the roof with a great bartender (Danillo). If you have the chance, come down here and be treated like family.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings”
Reviews.Author: isilmisil
Reviews.Content: My husband booked tickets to Puerto Rico for our honeymoon without booking a hotel last year...We started to look around to find a decent deal and finally decided to stay at San Juan Water & Beach Club Hotel...After reading many reviews by previous vacationers, we decided to ignore the negative and booked our vacation...OK so here's the breakdown for you: Hotel was OK but nothing as cool as the pictures portray it to be...If anything, it looks a little cheap...It looked like, they tried to turn around a residential apartment building into a hotel...Bar downstairs was looking cool but it was pretty dead during our stay over there (maybe because it was march)...Music was really loud at all times at all floors of the hotel - so if you want to relax and chill, this might not be the best place for you...My biggest disappointment was the roof top deck/pool areaâ€¦The rooftop deck is a great place to get a nice tan and the views are pretty nice but it's TINY...Hotel was really empty during our stay and even with that, if we didnâ€™t get up early enough (by that I mean no later than 10AM), all the spots would already be occupied...Donâ€™t expect anything extravagant with the pool on the roof, it's pretty much like a bathtub...If you're on a budget and think that hotelâ€™s breakfast buffet is going to be sufficient, think twice...Entire concept of â€œbuffetâ€� consisted of a few fruits (orange & bananas), couple yogurts and 2-3 kinds of cheap cereals...Best part of this hotel was the staff and the beach...Hotel staff was very nice, respectful and very friendly at all timesâ€¦The beach was very nice but mind you that itâ€™s not a private beach â€“ which means that it gets very crowded by the public on weekendsâ€¦Hotel is in a good location â€“ close to bars, restaurants, casinos, etcâ€¦It was an OK experience overall but not sure if I would go back there again â€“ next time, I would probably choose Old San Juan Hotel (which is right around the corner from San Juan Water & Beach Club Hotel) or somewhere downtown in Old San Juan â€“ which definitely is a must see!

Reviews.Title: “Needs Improvement!”
Reviews.Author: HenLo
Reviews.Content: This hotel wasn't what we were expecting at all. The location is great if you want to be near the beach. The hotel itself has the right idea but is pretty far off the mark. We had the understanding that it had just been remolded and was the hot place to be in Isla Verde. Although it had just been remolded it looked as if they had spent about a quarter of the money on the renovation that they should have. It looked aged and the rooms were below average. The rooftop bar has beautiful views but the furniture wansn't kept up and it was pretty dead the two nights we were there even though other places near the hotel seemed to be pretty busy. The staff was the bright spot. Everyone was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I lovedddd this place. Right on the...”
Reviews.Author: LaDuquesa
Reviews.Content: I lovedddd this place. Right on the beach. All the restaurants are walking distance. There was a bit of construction going on but that's understandable to update the hotel. Overall I would give it 5 but Because of the construction during my stay I and the pool being closed I rate slightly lower. The valet was great with customer service I will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a getaway”
Reviews.Author: ihochman
Reviews.Content: My partner and I just returned from this hotel and we were very happy with just about everything one could want from a trip to a Caribbean hotel. First of all the location is perfect. Ten minutes from the airport on a dead end street right on an absolutely beautiful beach. As soon as we pulled up to the hotel we could feel a friendly vibe from the doorman and the people at the front desk were great. Very helpful and accommodating. As a matter of fact, all the staff were fabulous. They were all knowledgeable, friendly and couldn't have been more helpful. We were then taken to our room by a blue light lit elevator. That's really my only beef about the hotel. The blue lights in the halls/elevators. Very old fashioned and hard to see anything. Maybe I'm not the audience they're looking for (I'm older than 50) but I think this is a piece of 80's decorating that is no longer hip or attractive. We then entered our room and were thrilled with the view and the size. We weren't oceanfront but had a good view of the water and loved the king sized bed facing the window. The best part of the hotel to us was the Terrace upper deck with pool, bar and couches and sitting areas all over. The trade winds were fabulous cooing off the hot air. We would certainly go back to the San Juan Water and Beach Club. Coming from NYC it was a quick getaway with no hassle.

Reviews.Title: “What a crappie hotel, no hot water on...”
Reviews.Author: Thewiz4u
Reviews.Content: What a crappie hotel, no hot water on bathroom, dirty floors, loud and slow service. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Less steps to the beach than to the elevator at a big resort”
Reviews.Author: yakiyaki
Reviews.Content: Location is fantastic. Right on the beach so just a few steps from the door to enjoying the sun and surf. Sleek and hip boutique hotel has charm the mega hotels don't. Easy walk to restaurants and large hotels. Our room had a great ocean front view, comfy bed. Decor was stylish but practical. Restaurant/bar was very nice but generally pretty quiet. Good happy hour deals on Monday. Roof bar was very cool and great for lounging. Pool is very small up there so don't plan on swimming laps.

Reviews.Title: “I had a great Time!”
Reviews.Author: janinaD
Reviews.Content: *This review is coming from a Puerto Rican* Not sure about the other reviews... I found this hotel to be very clean, staff very helpful and overall a really nice hotel. I was able to get an airline employee discount for this hotel, so I paid about $150 a night for a partial ocean view room. The room was very clean, the furniture was nice the bathroom was clean and stocked with toiletries and coffee maker/coffee etc. The restaurant in the lobby was pretty good. A little pricey but nothing I didn't expect. The staff were very friendly, especially the bell boy and Kevin on the beach who provided chairs and umbrellas. Now, the only reason we stayed here was to be close to the airport so that we could have easy access to an early flight going home. I don't know if I would pay the full rate, however If I had to stay in this area I would choose this hotel again because the others are bigger and more resort like and this hotel had a boutique feel and is smaller and chic. On the other hand I feel this is not an ideal area for a vacation! Isla Verde beach is very nice but there is nothing else in the area to see or do, and there is not much culture to be had. Old San Juan is pretty near by but taxi drivers rip you off. We rented a car and went to other areas for better food and culture. I do not recommend the restaurants nearby, they are not puerto rican restaurants (chain restaurants like KFC etc)

Reviews.Title: “Disco Sucks”
Reviews.Author: nschicago
Reviews.Content: I'm amazed at the arrogance of having your Guest endure the base pounding nightmare of trying to sleep and having an early flight. If the hotel wants to be a disco let your quest know it ahead of time. If think I'm entitled to at least a refund for that. We stayed for 7 nights. Public urination next to the hotel was the topping on the cake on this horrible stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location and excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: JohnGarbar
Reviews.Content: We were put here up by the airline for one night when bumped from our flight and had a very enjoyable experience. The hotel is right on the beach in Isla Verde next to the Intercontinental and El San Juan, and about 10 minutes drive from the airport. It's a contemporary-looking place with white walls and tile flloors and has a cool minimalist vibe. The room itself was clean and rather simply furnished with modern IKEA-looking furniture and accents of white drapery and soft blue ambient lighting. Our room was on the 9th Floor with a beautiful view of the ocean. Beds were comfortable and bathroom spartan but clean. There is a roof terrace that offers stunning views of the beach with a small swimming pool and sundeck, and a shaded lounge area with sofas and chairs for relaxing and taking in the view. There's also a full bar with food available. The terrace was a lovely and peaceful oasis and I could have spent the entire day up there! There is a lounge and restaurant on the ground floor and while I didn't eat there personally, my parents had breakfast and said it was good. There is also a popular restaurant down the street called La Casita well known for it's Puerto Rican cuisine. It was crowded and a bit noisy when we went there but the food was good and cheap. Overall, I had a very positive stay here and did not have any issues with the hotel, my room or the staff. Other reviewers have complained that hotel was dirty or cheap looking and in need of a major renovations but that was not my experience. Perhaps it has recently had a makeover? It was not as swanky as a more expensive hotel like the Ritz-Carlton, or The Delano in Miami Beach but was definitely a nice place. My room was paid for by the airline so I can't comment on the price but I would stay there myself next time I'm in San Juan, and did not hesitate to recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I'd stayed somewhere else...”
Reviews.Author: hobbieindianapolis
Reviews.Content: Front desk staff, 3/22/2010, needed better customer service skills. Hotel needs thorough cleaning and updates. Tiny pool/area with beds...needs chairs, small tables and lounge chairs to accomodate more people. We were on the 9th floor, for two ites of our stay we never got to sleep till after 2 am due to the horrifically loud music on the top floor. Our bathoom was terrible...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Stan24NewYork
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 nights at the Water Club. Overall, we had a great time. The hotel is within a 5 minute drive from the airport....I was on the beach w/ beer in hand within an hour of landing at SJU. All the employees were very friendly, especially William at the front door, and Kevin, the beach attendant. The hotel food was simple and very good, and the rooftop bar/pool is a great place for a drink. Also, there are several major hotels/casinos within walking distance for a change of scenery. Our oceanview king room had a great view and was small but clean & comfortable. They could definitely use new TV's though. Again, this is a great place to unwind for a few days. The location is tough to beat, and we would have no hesitations about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “stylish and sexy”
Reviews.Author: NewEnglandTraveler10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights mid-week. The staff was fabulous - everyone we encountered was ready to help with whatever we needed. We booked through Hotwire on an amazing promo deal, $159 for a king oceanfront room with breakfast and meal vouchers. Aside from the incredible view, the room was stylish but pretty standard (not "ultra-luxurious" as my guidebook described). Housekeeping was so-so, as others have written, but had we complained I'm certain things would have been corrected instantly. View from the rooftop pool/bar is beautiful, poolside beds super comfy, and we had the place to ourselves. Location is great - steps to beach (which was swept daily) with drinks service and chairs/ towels provided; all kinds of amenities within walking distance. Bus stop on the same block (but be aware that the bus, although cheap, is SLOW. Could easily be 40 min to San Juan. cab is $20 one way). Front desk arranged a car rental for one day through Charlie Car rental, across the street - $25 for the day, easy to get anywhere. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Quick, cheap but dirty...”
Reviews.Author: Bronsonjetset
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided, last minute, to join my parents in Puerto Rico after our stay in Aruba at the Riu Palace...Yes I know not the same category...(check our review... Aruba Bliss). My wife and I are very familiar with the Carribean and religiously travel in that awesome part of the world every year. This year my parents whom are veteran travelers decided to rent a condo in Puerto Rico. After our arrival from Aruba, in Ottawa, on the 14th of February 2010, we decided to join my parents in Puerto Rico. After securing a deal on Hotwire, we were on our way to Puerto Rico on the 15th of February 2010. We arrived at the San Juan Beach and Water Club on the 16th day of February 2010. Service was impeccable, check in was quick and the staff was very courteous and dilligent. Our first impression of the hotel was favorable... it was like a smaller version of the famous "W" in New York on Lexington...Hip dÃ©cor and very trendy. The cleanliness of our assigned room, ( #408), was a bit of a let down... Although the bed was very comfy, the sheets and the comforter were stained... someone had a very intense night with pink candles in the room prior to our arrival... pink wax was everywhere... sheets, comforter, wall, floor, and what was those drip stains on the television? ( I kid you not...) The washroom was cleaned everyday, we never ran out of fresh towels but the floors were never swept nor washed (at least not during our stay...) The dÃ©cor at fist glance is cool but a closer look makes you realize that everything is a quick fix... I'm certain that if we would have complained to the staff, they would have immediately cleaned our room and possibly upgraded us... We just did not hang out at the Hotel, places to see, people to meet... Great Hotel if you are just looking for a place to crash while in Puerto Rico... P.S. Thinking of renting a Jeep while in Puerto Rico? Try Enterprise located at the Ritz Carleton 7 minutes away (walking) from the San Juan Beach and Water Club... great service... great rates... great vehicles. P.P.S. Bring a towel and a change of clothes if you are planning to visit El Yunque...

Reviews.Title: “HONEST review. I LOVE this hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: Jollibee1980
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 3x since 2006, twice with pets, and am likely returning this June with my cousin and her bf. My husband and I have always had a positive experience here, but perhaps that is because we always get ocean front rooms? My only complaints were the bathroom lock being broken, but that was barely an issue, and the doorman the first day we got there - when I walked up to the door with bags in hand, he was on his cell phone and I had to say very loudly , "I guess you juggle your own luggage AND open your own doors in this place" before he snapped out of his cell phone trance to hold the door. Needless to say, that was the only time that happened. Everything else has always been absolutely PERFECT for me, they even have treats for your dogs upon checking in and inside the room! The staff has always been very helpful even prior to arrival. My husband planned many surprises for my bday ahead of time with the hotel and everything went off without a hitch :o) However, my friend and her boyfriend were with us last time, and they were not so lucky. The got an INSANE deal from Expedia so got one of the rooms in the back of the hotel. Let's just say the service they received was less than stellar. They had to change rooms 3x because the hot water wasn't working in the first one, the phone and safe were broken in the next, and finally the 3rd night they got a decent room but obviously by then they were put off. She also said the staff had attitude but like I said, she may have just already been put off by that point. They did credit her one night and offered her a free night should they return, which I doubt she ever will unfortunately! I'm not saying that what she experienced is excusable or should be tolerated by any guest, but I guess you get what you pay for sometimes... My recommendation would be to get an ocean view or partial ocean view room at least to avoid any of those problems. To me, the price is definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to relax and have fun”
Reviews.Author: mbellemax
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights and I wish I had the opportunity to stay longer. It is very clean, the staff is friendly and helpfull. The location is very convenient, close to everything. The view from the terrace spectacular. I love the retro look and the fact that is so close to the beach. This will be my only choice if I want to relax and had fun, specially for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “It depends on your style”
Reviews.Author: greenbeltdan
Reviews.Content: Had a very interesting experience at the Water Club. Had always wanted to stay here after reading about it in Conde Nast Top 100 Hotels in the World a few years back. The service is good, but I almost walked out without staying here over a pretty stupid issue that they could have easily resolved. My oceanfront suite was very hip and unique, including a telescope and a condom lollipop (!) in the minibar. However, I wouldn't recommend staying here on a Friday or Saturday night if you're over 40 (as I now am) or looking to sleep. The rooftop bar was happening, but you could hear the music in your room (and a block away) until about 3:00 a.m. I was completely unimpressed with the breakfast in the Tangerine restaurant and lunch at the rooftop bar. I'm glad I gave this place a shot, but I'd think twice before staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mn-ta
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at The San Juan Water and Beach Club was a very nice stay. I experienced a very pleasant, friendly and attentive staff who really worked hard to make sure the guests were well cared for. The location was in the Isla Verde area, on the beach, near the airport. While the location was near the airport, I found that noise was not a problem in the hotel or on the beach. When making my reservation, I received a clear description of what my room would be like and it's location within the hotel. Service was excellent in all areas: the front desk, housekeeping, on the beach, in the restaurant and started with a warm, attentive greeting from the front door staff. The facility is an older boutique hotel and is well maintained. There is a small pool on the roof, as well as a bar with food service. The main resturant and bar are on the main floor, they have nice menu with excellently prepared meals. In short, I very pleased with my stay, plan to return and would recommend it to singles and couples. I was very impressed with the level of service by all staff members.

Reviews.Title: “Not for us, Unfriendly staff, Strange Vibe”
Reviews.Author: sidney7474
Reviews.Content: This place is a not my type of hotel. It is extremely trendy, almost too much so. The staff is doing their jobs but never made us feel welcome. The entire time the gentleman checked us in, he was on the phone and never made eye contact. We were there a good 15 hours before a worker finally made eye contact and said Hello. At first glance this hotel seems really neat, but the more you look the more you see litle things that just make it seem 80 % finished. The room wasn't really clean and had these weird blue lights in it. They worked really hard to make the room seem super chic and then had a 22 inch 20 year old TV in it with horrible reception. The kind of Tv you would expect to find in a roadside motel. For such a modern room that crappy Tv seemed really out of place. There are some thoughtful touches in the room but the overall feeling is uninviting and cold. The upstairs rooftop lounge and pool seemed neat, we went up there at 11 am and they stil hadn't cleaned up the place from a party the night before. The location is great, good beach, tons of inexpensive and expensive restaurants all within easy walking distance, also many casinos in walking distance. A quick 10 min cab ride into Old San Juan. This place is very similar to the older remodeled hotels we stayed at in South Beach minus the customer service. I can see where some people would be impressed with this hotel on the surface but once you get in there they have a lot of work to do.

Reviews.Title: “San Juan Water and Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: EdR7
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in Carolina and thus very convenient to the airport, but also right on the beach. If you like modern, trendy decor you will love the San Juan Water & Beach Club. Drinks NOT included with our package were ABSURDLY expensive. We enjoyed jaunts to El Yunque, Old San Juan and Culebra, it was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshing change from boring brand hotels!”
Reviews.Author: norman2
Reviews.Content: What a refreshing change from the typical boring brand hotels. The staff is wonderful. William, the doorman is a real gem! The hotel is kind of cool and hip. Yes, they may need a bit more updating, but if you are looking for something different, this is a great option. The rooms were very nice, great lighting and amenities. The rooftop bar is very cool and very South Beach. I loved it and would stay again! Beautiful oceanfront views! The restaurant (Tapas in the evening) was very good and the complimentary Continental breakfast we received included two fresh rolls, and fresh fruit as well as juice and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “NOT worth it!”
Reviews.Author: longbeachbums
Reviews.Content: True, this boutique hotel is beachfront, but certainly not worth the price. True, the staff are very good, from the bellman who runs to open the door and park your car for a fee, to the check- in and restaurant staff. However, this is not enough to advise you to stay here. Unless, however, you want to stay in a bed and breakfast type environment. Yes, there is a water feature in the tiny elevator, but look around and you will see an old, dirty, rusting, unkempt and uninviting environment. They say they pay attention to detail, not true. Their internet service never worked. They are hoping you will not notice their lack of attention to detail with the use of lighting and curtains. This hotel lacks in quality, cleanliness and privacy. The rooftop bar is nice, but the cheap outdoor furniture is broken, the cushions torn and dirty and the one person pool disgusting with rust and mold everywhere. I recommend you check out the Intercontinental Hotel or ESJ Towers right down the block. This is not a good value and Conde Nast is wrong on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing, private reasort on the island!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelChic
Reviews.Content: We Loved this place! It's a botique hotel.... so it's small and private. Excellent customer service! Great restraunts! Very relaxing! The waterfalls and blue neon lights are a relaxing, fabulous touch. The pool, on the roof, is a unique touch. Great views! We reccomend a suite! The views are breath taking! We will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: annapuorro
Reviews.Content: So let me start with the fact that I would definitley recomm, this hotel for people in there 20's and 30's...Most of the time, when your traveling your out of your room more than in it! The room is white with blue lights so it gives off a nice ambiance! What the room offers! mini bar, our radio didnt work, wish it did :) ...basically theres nothing special besides the nessecities needed! Let me add, the aircondition was GREAT! if you dont like sleeping in a nasty hot envir. The hotel staff were very nice and friendly! The restaurant in the hotel "tangerine" , was amazing!!!! The bar/club on the rooftop was nice, it was good to go up there and have a few drinks before u headed out in the town! and their drinks were stronger than the ones in the clubs. The pool on the rooftop is very very small, ur better off going to the beach. The hotel is across the street from the beach , so that was great, besides the fact that the weather was not so good! So if you think this suites you book it now! If your not to picky you will enjoy your stay here!

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: gbgb53
Reviews.Content: A very enjoyable experience. Small boutique hotel with a great staff and very comediting. The pool and bar on the roof was the best in all San Juan. Good food and done creatively, Hotel is on the most popular beach on the area. This was a great experience for me after checking out of El San Juan hotel, one of my worst experiences.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful gem on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: hotels007
Reviews.Content: The water & beach club of Puerto Rico was a wonderful experience. The service was great, as well as the cleanliness of the building. VERY personable staff and two restaurants located in the building. A rooftop deck and swimming facility all make for an extremely enjoyable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Special ambiance, water team, right on a wonderful beach, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: courtrat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at the San Juan Water & Beach Club Hotel before taking a cruise from Puerto Rico. The ambiance is special, clean, fresh, modern, relaxing. Water is the theme: waterfalls on back walls, even in elevators. The rooms have wall to wall light white curtains with blue neon lights behind which create a wonderful peaceful effect, confortable beds, high speed Internet connected with a modem. The modem didn't work in our room on the 4th floor so they changed us to a room on the 8th floor with an ocean view without any charge, the view was breath taking. There's a pool with elegant white bed/couches on the roof adjacent to a bar. My husband can walk only short distances: the hotel is located on the beach. William the doorman opens the door and three steps more Kevin is waiting with fresh towels and asks you where you would like him to put your chairs and umbrella. The beach is clean with fine soft sand without rocks or pebbles, the waves are perfect. A continental breakfast was included... bare necessities and the orange juice wasn't freshly pressed but it was the only dent. Food was expensive at the hotel but there are plenty of restaurants, fast food in the area. A big drug store was nearby where you could find whatever you needed. We had a very pleasant stay, the staff was all smiles, very attentive and friendly, it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique "South Beach" style hotel with the Friendliest Staff on the beach”
Reviews.Author: BobbyCNY
Reviews.Content: From the minute my girlfriend and I arrived we were overwhelmed by how GENUINELY FRIENDLY all of the staff is. Maria at the front desk greeted us and made us feel welcome immediately. Nicole served us a couple times in the restaurant downstairs and was extremely nice. William was amazing at the front door--always smiling, and Kevin went above and beyond with helping us at the beach with chairs, towels, umbrellas etc. whenever we needed (which are all free for hotel guests by the way). Every staff member from the top to the bottom was extremely friendly. The hotel also has a great unique "vibe" due to the staff, size of hotel, and style of restaurants/bars it has. We did not want to stay in a gigantic-typical-tourist-every-amenity-hotel which usually dominates in places like this and costs at least 2X as much. We loved the pool and Wet Bar on the roof. The rooms were very cool and Miami-like with the blue lights etc. We loved the decor in the lobby and restaurant downstairs. The location is great and at the end of a cul-de-sac on the beach---so not much car or pedestrian traffic and right on the beach!! We met the friendliest people at the hotel as well with one local literally driving us to the best "local" places to go for the best food. We loved our stay, got an incredible value and are looking to plan a return trip to the Water and Beach club again. Thanks to all the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: DoctorMT
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this through orbitz without reading the reviews, once I read the reviews I became very nervous about the trip. Our stay was perfect!!!!!!!!!!!!! Check in was easy, our room was not ready but they offered a place to change into swimsuits and held our luggage for us to go to the beach or pool. Loved the chair/umbrella/towel service on the beach. We only waited an hour for our room to be ready and it was still earlier than the gaurunteed check in time. Our room was gorgeous we had a spacious ocean front suite with a balcony (Room 704) with plenty of storage for our clothes and a GREAT rain shower. I would not have wanted to be on a higher floor for Saturday night, but every other night was soooooo quiet. The rooftop bar was picturesque, as were the lanais.....we went there every night and lounged.....people previously complained they were dirty.....lay a towel down they are free and clean. Complimentary breakfast was adequate and if you wanted a BIG breakfast there were places very close by. We ate at El Alambique which is a bar overlooking the water for appetizers and good pina coladas(right on the corner). We also ate authentic Puerto Rican food at Ajili Mojili(Condado), Mi Casita(close by), El Jibarito(Old San Juan), ate ceviche at Tangerine(in hotel) and it was good, and had mexican at El Taquito(by Walgreens). The free happy hour 5-6 was fantastic!!! Walgreens being across the street was convenient for snacks, water, or any other incidentals. We took a Sailboat to Icacos and snorkelled on East Wind and that was spectacular I would highly recommend it~The hotel decor was quaint, very boutique style, I loved it(the blue light could be turned off if you don't like it)! We would go back next week and highly recommend to a friend. We are experienced travellers and appreciate a good value accomodation and this exceeded that. This was worth every penny we paid and then some. The staff were all great, when we asked for late check out it was granted until 2pm!!! That was beyond what we asked for. We did not park or rent a car, but took a cab around. We took the bus on our last trip to San Juan and that was easy and cheap.....just slower, either way is sufficient. I will go back, and would again choose San Juan Water and Beach Club! I would be happy to answer any questions you may have

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: mardnise
Reviews.Content: First off, I'd like to point out that this review is based on their customer service only since I didn't end up staying here. After already having spent 5 days in Puerto Rico, we were set to stay at this hotel for our last night in town. During checkout, we were informed by the manager that they had a big party that extended their stay and they therefore didn't have a room for me and my husband. BUT to make up for the fact that they didn't have a room for us, they set us up in a nearby FIVE STAR hotel! When they asked if we wanted anything to drink while the manager was writing the letters for us to take to the next hotel, we told her we just wanted water. Instead of giving us a glass of water, they brought out two Voss waters. After everything was done, the manager paid for our cab ride to the next hotel and gave us a letter to send to Priceline in order to get Priceline to refund us our money! As we were leaving the hotel, the manager insisted that they carry our luggage to the cab and she invited us to come back and make use of their amenities such as their evening Happy Hour and use of their beach amenities. They really treated us like VIP's and definitely know how to "right" a problem!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service, Great location!”
Reviews.Author: BeeGirlNC
Reviews.Content: I'd read the reviews, knew that this hotel was trying to attract a cool crowd, and knew that I wasn't exactly their target audience. But, I needed a convenient place to stay for a wedding down the beach, so I chanced it . . . When I walked in and saw the slick Miami look, I wondered if I had made a bad decision. But from the time I checked in until I checked out 4 days later, my elderly mother and I were treated to fantastic service. The staff was uniformly warm, pleasant and helpful. The free breakfast was good, as was the restaurant. The towel and chair service was excellent. I would heartily recommend this place to anyone seeking a San juan beach hotel. And, don't be concerned about the "across the street from the beach" description. While it is true, it is a technicality.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place on the beach”
Reviews.Author: radboard
Reviews.Content: This is a great small hotel located right in the heart of a great beach near the airport. good access to Old San Juan and the rest of the area. The beach is right outside your door and Kevin the beach chair keeper will take good care of you! The staff is all fantastic, be sure to book online for a free voucher and don't miss the free beer & wine at happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Already planning our next trip!”
Reviews.Author: bsfarmer
Reviews.Content: The "Water Club" is not a Walnut paneled resort dripping of brass and cigar smoke, but if you would like a clean room with exceptional service that gives you a true taste of Puerto Rico, this is the place! We loved it and all the staff!

Reviews.Title: “Someplace unique for a great price”
Reviews.Author: RobNYC77
Reviews.Content: The hotel is decorated and set up in a way that is trying hard to be as 'maimi' or trendy as possible. It pulls this off but does feel like it's held together with scotch tape. The exception was the elevators, which seemed like a good idea but not well maintained. We went to the rooftop club a few times both day and night. It was very solid. Good music, drinks, and views. The crowd was pretty young and cool for an off time of year in a tourist heavy location. The pool is a joke. Don't expect to spend real time there. The hotel itself is in a good location, though there was construction nearby when we went. The beach outside was just perfect. You are within easy walking distance of several other big hotels and the casino. Also there are water sports right outside the hotel, not cheap, but real easy. We did the tandem para sailing tour and it was a blast. The service went from one extreme to the other. Seems if you want help you need to work with the valets outside. The front desk staff were some of the least helpful I've ever seen, but they were trying. The blue lighting in the room could be a deal breaker for some. We thought it was unique and cool for the 3 nights we were there, but not exactly how we'd set up our bedrooms at home.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing for the price!”
Reviews.Author: tantan220
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved our stay at the Water Club! We booked our hotel though Expedia and got an incredible rate of $75 a night! The hotel is very hip and modern. It reminded me of a boutique hotel you might find in San Francisco or Miami. The hotel is right next to the beach and they supply you with towels and chairs. The staff was so friendly and nice to us during our visit. The best part of the stay was the daily happy hour from 5-6. FREE DRINKS on the roof! And the drinks were excellent. Be warned though, if you stay on the 10th floor during the weekend you will hear LOUD music coming from the roof bar, as they bring a DJ in to spin until 3 in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlejandraM4
Reviews.Content: Small hotel, but very clean and very nice. When we checked in we had requested a room with the view of the street as opposed to beach view because of the price. The receptionist told us they no longer had that room available but they did have a suite with an ocean view that we could stay in for the same price! The suite was AMAZING!!! We had a great time and would love to go back and would definitely stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel that caters to the younger set”
Reviews.Author: meristar2205
Reviews.Content: I am a 28-year-old professional and I stayed at the Water Club for a week with my two younger (20-something) siblings. I thought the accomodations were worth the price that we paid (about $100/night for the room), but I would also stress that this hotel definitely caters to a distinct subset of the population - a younger subset. Blue lights and a rooftop bar that pumps out tunes until the wee hours of the morning are not for everyone (i.e. me). But my brother and sister loved every minute of it! Our room was clean but needed a few minor touch-ups. We did not have a particularly nice view. I did not have any problems with the AC or the bathroom. I do think that full shower doors and ventilation fans in the bathrooms would have been a good idea, but we got along okay without them. What I did like: The hotel was literally steps from a fairly clean, quiet beach, where beach attendant Kevin was always happy to set up a trio of umbrellas for me and my siblings. The hotel staff were unbelievably friendly and hard-working. The area around the hotel felt fairly safe, although I did not go out after 11pm. The free continental breakfast was good (cereal, muffins, yogurt, fruit, toast). There is a car rental operation and a Walgreens right across the street and a guy named Cotto who gives surfing lessons just a few blocks away Our room had a safe in it and Internet service (standard, not WiFi). What I didn't like: The decor was not my style and the common areas and lobby are in need of a little TLC. The fitness center had nice equipment but smelled very strongly of chemicals each time I visited it. The hotel is not located near many good/interesting restaurants or near any of the popular attractions in San Juan - we spent a lot of time waiting for/riding the bus to and from downtown San Juan and Old San Juan. The hotel's rooftop bar got pretty loud on Friday and Saturday (although some people, including my sibs, will see this as a plus). If you are young (or young at heart) and your idea of a fantastic vacation involves late night parties and lots of time in the sand, I would recommend this hotel to you! If you like NPR and going to bed early and are interested in exploring all the sights and sounds of San Juan, I would suggest that you consider other accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Try. Needs A Lot of Maintenence”
Reviews.Author: arubaseabreeze
Reviews.Content: We are just back from the San Juan Water and Beach Club in Puerto Rico and are most surprised by the raving reviews we've seen here on Tripadvisor. On a more careful inspection, I found this hotel has been given about the same number of poor reviews as it has good ones. There is good reason for this. I cant quite figure out what to attribute the positive reviews to, other than lack of experience, sheer luck, friends of friends, or what the reviewer is used to. While the property has potential, it misses the mark by a wide margin. I love staying in these small designer boutique hotels, but I was more than disappointed in this one. At arrival we noticed that the inlaid lights on the steps were nearly all broken The facade showed a lot of rust running from the air conditioner units and a real need for some major painting. As far as location, this hotel has it made. The beach is beautiful and expansive. The road in front of this hotel is more of a driveway and not at all a bother. Also happening for this hotel is an open roof-top with restaurant and bar from which you will be rewarded with amazing ocean vistas. The Cubano sandwich; a mere ham sandwich with mustard and pickle that anyone could make at home, was very expensive The white leather/pleather beds that look really inviting and sexy on their website, are in fact, dirty at first glance with an alarming amount of mold on them underneath the pillows and on the reverse sides of the pillows themselves. I picked one up to place it under my head just to uncover this wet, slimy, black-moldy underside. This isn't something that happened overnight and reveals the type of care this property receives. The pool, only a few steps away is about the size of two or three standard hot-tubs. One couple seemed to be really enjoying it and having their own private party in it however. The lobby is inviting and the elevators are trying really hard to be hip and perhaps if the glass roof-tops hadn't been so dirty and marked-up, it would have made them appear a bit more chic. The hallways are dark and cool, but its difficult to find your room number as it is embossed into the door handle and has no distinct coloring. When we entered the room, it was freezing cold, which I attributed to a nicely working air conditioning system. I was once again disappointed. After less than a day, I realized the environmental controls were badly lacking. First of all, there is no ventilator fan in the bathroom, which would be fine if that were the only issue. Secondly, there was no balcony and you cannot open the windows as they are nailed shut. And back to the air conditioner, there were two choices: we could be freezing cold, as in 60 degrees F, or turn the unit to a warmer temperature and have the condensation from the unit all over the floor. Not just a little run-off, but a slippery skim over half of the room all around the bed. And, yes, as stated in previous reviews, your shower will run off into the floor as well. All of this adds up to all of your towels on the floor to sop up all of the water, absolutely no fresh air, damp clothes, a bathing suit that never dries and getting out of bed to put your feet down on a wet floor. Very uncomfortable. We never felt comfortable or dry in the room. We expected high humidity in the natural environment, but certainly not quite this much in our room. In our Ocean Front King room, the hotel provided us with mismatched bathrobes that were hanging in the bathroom over the room's only full length mirror. That's because there is no where else to hang them or much else for that matter. There is no closet in the room, but the hotel provides a wardrobe cabinet instead. The only problem with the wardrobe is that it is a fraction of the size, vertically speaking, that it should be. You can hang a shirt, but nothing longer. We stored our backpacks in here too since we couldn't leave them on the floor and of course ended up bumping our heads a few times when we had to get something from them. Their website distinctly states that they have updated and made modern their bathrooms. What this really means is that they have installed a counter top sink and a modern shower head. The floor tile was badly marked-up and did not look modern or newly installed. The Desire Program they have partnered with, again, on their website, turned out to be a little bit of a joke. To sign up, I completed a survey and answered the question of what we would prefer to drink and have as a snack upon arrival. About 15 minutes after getting to our room, we had delivered ONE bottle of water and a bread plate with loose peanut M & Ms poured onto it covered with plastic wrap. We shared the water. Thanks for being attentive to our desires! However, for nine dollars, we could have another bottled water and each of us a full pack of peanut M & M's from the mini-bar. There is absolutely nothing classy about skimping. I realize this was free, but to advertise something so lush (Desires) and fail to deliver is only going to set the customer up for disappointment. The lighting in the room is your choice of black light, or dim reddish/yellow reading lights attached to the bed. Both are fine, cool, hip, chic and all that jazz, unfortunately there is no real illumination for you at night which can be a little frustrating if you really need to see or are trying to pack your bags. So the black lights are forced on you, like it or not. On their website they write extensively about how they are set to cater to the business traveler with all of their high tech amenities, however, when we went to the second floor to use the business center, we found two computers in a closet. One computer was a PC, the other a Mac. The Mac could still be trying to locate the address I typed in for all I know, we could never get it to work. Both of us, by the way, are in the computer industry. And, when we tried to print our boarding passes, we found that the PC did not have the Adobe Reader installed, so we couldn't get the simplest of tasks done. We were even going to use the back side of our hotel bill to print the boarding pass as there was no paper in the printer and none in the computer closet. Any claims that are being made that this facility is equipped for the modern business traveler is questionable at best. I didn't see any evidence that a designer had attempted to pull things together here, with tired, old furniture and hints of 1970's paneling veneer mixed in with the tile and door jams that have had no attention whatsoever paid to them. The black lighting was a consistent theme as well as the white paint . Other than that, it was hodge-podge and flea market/auction items that must have been limited in quantity. The employees are very nice, pleasant, generous, warm and professional, with the exception of the wait staff, who were cold and unresponsive and not at all service oriented. Checking in was quick, the front doors were always opened for us, taxis hailed and chairs set up for us on the beach. They provided us with a map of Old San Juan and gave us some direction for our outing. The employees always had a pleasant greeting and wished us a nice day as we left the hotel or a welcome back greeting when we returned. Obviously this was an initiative, but they carried it off sincerely. I don't stay at places like the Ritz because they are usually out of my price range. I do like honesty and good value for my money. I felt like I received both through out Old San Juan and Isla Verde with the exception of this hotel. I do appreciate places that are cared for and clean, regardless of a glamorous environment. A hotel does not have to be expensive and plush or luxurious to be a comfortable retreat as your home away from home. A lot of TLC and attention are needed here if this hotel hopes to be anything close to what it represents itself to be. I loved Puerto Rico and Old San Juan in particular and plan to come back to the island often. I won't be staying here however and wouldn't recommend you stay here either.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you lock up your stuff!”
Reviews.Author: dhodge30
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great! My husband and I went a couple of days before our cruise left on Sept. 20, 2009. The hotel was really cool! The blue lights were fantastic! And they were everywhere! Water was everywhere! Kevin who took care of the beach chairs and towels for the beach was FABULOUS!!!! Really impressed with him! The happy hour from 5-6 with free drinks was the bomb! The bartenders were very accommodating! Our problem started when we were leaving! We had packed everything except the passports and my wallet with cash and a Visa debit card inside. We went to get some breakfast and when we returned I pulled the passports and my wallet out of the safe but ended up leaving it on the bed!! My mistake!! We had a rental car and toured the island before taking our car back and going to the cruise ship about 3 pm. Upon arrival I realized I did not have our passports!!! I called the hotel and they said they would ask housekeeping because nothing had been turned in! After several calls and no return calls, no passports and no wallet! We had already booked our room for after the cruise so upon return to the hotel they could have cared LESS if we recovered our passports and my wallet! We could not believe how they didn't care if we got our passports back or not! After the cruise was over the immigration officer imformed us that our passports were stolen and Puerto Rico was known for selling passports to drug dealers! If you go here keep up with your important stuff!!! You leave it and it is gone!!! And nobody cares!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel falls short from being mediocre...very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Sweetp1981
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little dilapidated...it needs maintenance. The people are very nice, but the quality of the place falls short from being mediocre. My boyfriend felt deceived. From outside the place looks nice, especially since it's right by the beach. We were a little disappointed with the room, although we had been upgraded to an ocean view. The windows in the ocean view room could not be opened, and were dirty. The room smelled a little strange too; especially the bathroom. The upstairs area is nice with the couches and pool, but the pool is small and the couches look weathered. The food was ok. We had an issue with our room because the door would not lock. The maintenance staff had to bang the door a few times to get it to work...we weren't even offered another room. My boyfriend and I looked at some of the different hotels in the area and decided that although we had already pre-paid for our room at the San Juan Beach and Water Club, we were going to stay at a different hotel. We ended up staying at the Continental (down the street), and WOW, what a difference. The Continental's room was AMAZING compared to what we had before...wow...we were upgraded to an ocean view, and it was truly an ocean view...with a balcony and all. It really saved our trip. I guess if you don't really care where you stay and just want a cheap place to sleep then San Juan Beach and Water Club is the place for you. However, it was my boyfriend's first time in Puerto Rico, and our stay at San Juan Beach and Water Club was simply disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Overall my eperience with this hotel was nice.”
Reviews.Author: jasmineharris1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small, from the rooms, to the swimming pool. When traveling I am used to Hilton size resorts, this was no hilton however for its' size it was decent. It has a blue theme. The scenery is nice, and it does have a boutique feel to it. They have a happy hour from 5-6 which is nice, but they use the cheap liquor. (but it's free) I would not recommend the restaurant that is located in hotel, food is bad, expensive, and service is not where it should be. The swimming pool is wayyyyy tooooo small for a resort. So we did not swim there. The beach water right outside the hotel was dirty and filled with seaweed. I did not attend any parties they had at the hotel, however the night like in the area is great. From parties, to dining. Virna Concepcion, and the door men would be my only reason for returning to this hotel, they were great. The house keeping barged into the room several times saying they did not know someone was in the room. I informed them wether they know or not they should still always knock! Overall the hotel was nice for what it was, small cozy, and intimate; but it was not no grand hotel like a hilton. Do not eat at Los Platos nasty food! also do not eat in Piu Bello Gelato, this dinner made me throw up every where. I actually threw up vomit in this dinner. The management are not torists friendly, it's just a horrible place. Don Jose is nice place to eat. mi casita is mice as well there is just a bad smell, and rotten service. I do recommend you do a tour to another island. We did icacos, it was beautiful. I also recommend a spa we did the spa next door the el san juan casino, one of the waldorf collection hotels. This spa I do not recommend, expensive and bad service. I recommend the Coach store in old San Juan for shopping great deals. Jet skiing is 70$ for 30 mins, do not recommend the water is dirty and it not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “The Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Sherineuk
Reviews.Content: I thought that this hotel ws beutiful. I loved the lighting, the Wet bar was amazing. I also ate there on the last night and enjoyed the food. The staff were very very nice. They were friendly and helpful and pofessional. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay and had the staff not been so nice maybe the experience would not have been as perfect as it was (it always helps to have nice poeple around). I thought the location was great. I could take a walk to the beach, or go and find somewhere to eat with ease. I think being close to the airport is a bonus!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: wehavethetravelbug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel for labor day weekend and found it to be really trendy and very comfortable. The bed and pillows are welcoming and the hotel staff is very friendly and accomdating. One nice little perk is that if you ask, you can check out at 1pm instead of noon which worked out for us - we were able to get in some last minute beach time before we headed off. I thought the location was great - it almost felt secluded in a way - its literally 2 steps from the beach and located right behind the strip so you're away from street noise. I loved the fact that its right on the beach in isla verde! I did have the following disappointments, but by no means are these reasons not to go back, because I would definitely go back to this hotel! 1. Continental breakfast: This was lacking! There's some toast and a few muffins, but definitely not worth bothering to go... there are many other places you can go to for breakfast, like Mi Casita, across the street or the Espana Bakery which offers up some nice pastries and good breakfast sandwiches. 2. Parking: You have to pay for it. Its appox $22 per day, which is something you should consider if you're renting a car. I highly highly highly recommend renting a car if you can b/c the public transportation system hasn't caught up to the times yet! Besides, its very easy to get around the island and there's sooo much to do in PR! 3. Bathroom: There is no shower door and its part of the design so there's no way around it. Its a standing shower with half a glass door - the part thats shielded by glass separates the toilet from the shower head - but thats it! Water was all over the bathroom floor and eventually leaked into the bedroom so we put alot of towels down to prevent the water from escaping the bathroom. Also, the toilet paper is in an odd spot. 4. Hallways: Too dark! I understand the whole cool, trendy theme, but really the hallways don't need to be that dark - its a dark blue light that to me was a little annoying. 5. Weekends: The rooftop gets LOUD! For myself and my husband, we were fine with that but the music is very loud and doesn't stop till 2:00 am. Its great if you're joining the crowd, but if not, dont plan on getting any sleep earlier than 2:00 am! 6. Pool: Very small!!! Don't bother when you have an incredibly beautiful beach right there infront of you! As I mentioned before, these reasons would not prevent me from going back. I would definitely go back! Its location is priceless but I wouldn't want to give a review without explaining everything I got to see for myself and provide my opinion. I read the reviews that are posted on this site and I make my decisions based on the reviews so I just want to give anyone who's reading this, the same exact courtesy I get from reviews by others. One other thing worth mentioning is that their spa services are a bit overpriced - we found a great little spa with more available treatments in Old San Juan. All in all, you couldn't ask for a better location. Its right across from a gorgeous beach and literally 10 mins from the airport and the hotel was definitely comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “The Best! DEFF RECOMEND GOING!”
Reviews.Author: HectorFAO
Reviews.Content: This was a wounderful trip! Too much excellent things to explain. 1st of all the staff was excellent, Rooms are beutiful, location is awsome. My wife and me had a wounderful view of the ocean/beach (room 702). The Wet Bar (floor T) was beautiful and absolutly conftable. Just to explain a lil, Bar, Pool, Beds aswell as beach chairs and good music, its like hitting the jackpot! Your greeted by Willie right at the door aswell as awsome front desk clerks. Building and everything is all white filled with black lights( dont worry it wont hurt the eyes) which made it special. The rooms are great ( conftable beds, luxurious bathrooms for you and ur partner, your own bar to fill wat ever your needs are. Excellent view of the ocean/beach to make it that much extra special. We had room 702) Then that leads me to "The Wet Bar" which I called it the king floor. You get to order from the resturant on the lobby floor, Drinks etc. Cant forget that you drink for free from 5 to 6pm (recomend Mojitos and Long Islands Blue or Reg) and after that any drink you want, they have it! The Wet Bar has the best view of all which is the whole beach strip up and down the coast. Gotta let you know why they call it "The Wet Bar" , there is a pool up there with a better view of everything! ( Recomend once you get settled in your rooms, go straight to the "T" floor to to enjoy all of that before you do anything. It makes it real special for you and your spouce, Sets the tone and mood on the rest of your Vaca or buisness trip) Most chances Demilo will greet you at the bar and he knows his stuff ( Thank you for everything). They have a buisness room for you hard workers out there that want to have your meetings Luxurious. Ofcourse they have the computer room for you Mac & Windows ursers for what ever your need is but, I doubt you'll go there because you'll be too entertaned with your partner and evrything else going on. At the beach youll be greeted al the time by a gentlemen which i forgot his name(so sorry) but, hes on point with what ever you may need. Everything around there is good because your in a great location. I can go on and on about how great The Water Club is but, what put the icing on all the cakes was that my wife and me were at a location where there is no taxi around no bus nothing b/c ofcourse we wanted to explore. We called the Hotel and they sent a taxi right away within 10mins that taxi was there and took ur straight to the hotel. So we felt like #1. Going sight seeing to Old San Juan, no problem 3 options. Rent a car for cheap, Taxi or even Bus( .75cents. WOW) Overall we deff enjoyed ourselfs. My wife and me normally dont hit the same spot more than once but, We will deff keep going there when were in Puerto Rico. Thank you guys and gals ya deff made it a worth while vaca. See you guys soon, real soon. =) Patricia & Hector.

Reviews.Title: “It was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: adventureousNewYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 9 days. Staff was helpfull, friendly, and courteous. Room was clean and comfortable. Overall, we really were satisfied with service, infrastructure, and amenities in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hell on earth”
Reviews.Author: jjbrittraveller
Reviews.Content: cheesy, tacky place. Por quality masked by low lighting and white paint. Beds were cheap and small, service terrible and really, really noisy. I have never been more desperate to get out of a hotel. I can't imagine what the people who gave positive review were on, but i don't get it. Please, take my advice.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, but service & quality was so bad we changed hotels”
Reviews.Author: philippefraser
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online for $213 + taxes per night, and were really looking forward to staying there. The pictures on their website and the comments on Facebook made it seem like a fantastic hotel, however, we were so disappointed when we arrived. Like many hotels in this part of town, It's just around the corner from the airport - although this isn't really a problem (compared to everything else). Although the hotel is right next to the beach, there's actually a little road which finishes in front of the hotel. From the photos we thought you walked out from the hotel onto sand - but you don't. It's really just the case of crossing this quiet end of road, so no big deal - but not what we had been lead to believe from the photos. When we arrived, nobody helped us with our bags. The hotel looks quite run down during the day from the moment you arrive. At night they cover this well with clever lighting, but it looks as if a major renovation is way overdue. The style is not to my taste; it's very tacky and cheesy, and it all looks so dated now (although some how, this doesn't show in the website photos). There's a fountain encasing the elevator, but it's so old and dirty. The light doesn't shine through it properly, and it's very unpleasant to be in as the light is so gloomy. The corridors of the hotel seem like an old night club, with dim grubby lights - the wifi didn't work in the bedrooms. We couldn't get it to work in the communal areas upstairs where it is supposed to work. The bedroom had an old window which was double-glazed, but with condensation in it,obscuring part of the view. The air conditioning unit was built into the window frame (which again is a shame given we'd chosen a room with an ocean view), but the air-con made SO much noise, you wouldn't possibly sleep with it turned on - and Puerto Rico isn't somewhere you want to have the air conditioning off, as it's very humid, as well as hot. The room was much smaller than I would have expected, but the quality had no relation for the price- the previous week I'd stayed in a cheap cheap ($30) hotel in Tampa which had a much nicer room than this one. The door to the room didn't lock. We went to the roof terrace to have some lunch (not knowing that our room wasn't locked - luckily for us, nobody else knew, and nothing was lost!)... We had to wait 40+ minutes for the lunch to be served, however my fried food was absolutely served cold, and my partner's "grilled chicken ceasar salad" only contained limp salad, with no dressing, and boiled or steamed chicken. I personally quite like steamed chicken, but that's not what we ordered - and we certainly shouldn't have had to wait 40 minutes for it. I have rarely seen less appetising food. The swimming pool and deck area is also run down and looks dirty. I don't know if it was dirty, or just old and aged - but the trouble is, the hotel has a minimalistic look, with lots of white, and white looks terrible when it's old - and that's the trouble with the hotel through out. It's looks cheap and nasty now. Whilst complaining about the room and service we overheard another guest being told the hotel had run out of towels. In the end, we felt so ripped-off that we looked for another hotel, and found the Ritz was available near by (also near the airport), but for only a little more money - basically the cost was the same (perhaps slightly less) but didn't include breakfast whereas this hotel did include breakfast. To be fair, once we complained, we where shown another room with a door which did lock, and the manager tried his very best. We were given a free evening meal (which was better than the lunch we'd had), and a free bottle of wine. We even obtained a 100% refund, including for the first night, which I appreciated. His conduct was very professional - and I wish him the best of luck. But even he conceded that the hotel was looking very shabby around the edges, and was overdue a refurbishment. I advise against staying here until some major work has been carried out. The quality of the facilities bear no relation to the price. If it was the last hotel with rooms available to book, I still wouldn't book it, and I'd go to a different destination. In comparison, for the same amount of money, our stay at the Ritz Carlton was delightful - which I found surprising, because I usually much prefer small little boutique hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Jiffybox
Reviews.Content: So, I live and work in the bustling chaos of Manhattan. I haven't taken a real relaxing vacation in 3 years and after much research around the Caribbean/Mexico area, I found this gem on CheapCaribbean.com. I couldn't recommend it more. Awesome location just a cheap cab ride from the airport, the beach faces one of the finest stretch of beaches you could ask for in an inexpensive tourist area. And I mean that in the best way. I ended up spending my entire trip in or around the hotel because it was so enjoyable. Comfortable rooms with great lighting that face the beach, free continental breakfast that is filling and appreciated, steps from the beach where they provide chairs, towels and umbrellas, and a staff that were above and beyond helpful and friendly, it was hard to leave this hotel. But, I will be back again in the future, this I know. If I had any gripes, it would only be that the hotel is not the quietest hotel I've ever stayed in, with doors slamming in the halls and often trucks in front, but I don't think this is a problem unless you want to go on vacation to sleep. The Wet Bar on the roof and Tangerine off the lobby are both fine places to relax and up and down the beach there are cozy, fun restaurants and bars. Thank you Virna and the rest of the staff for such a great stay, I can't wait to come back and stay for longer!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Incredible Staff!”
Reviews.Author: nycgirl77
Reviews.Content: Right on the beach and gorgeous views from my room. Staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating - every request was met with a smile and handled without question. Food was fantastic and rooms are very clean and cool. Loved the water motif throughout the hotel and had a truly wonderful stay. Wold definitely go back : )

Reviews.Title: “Cool and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysOnAPlaneLA
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay with friends. Great location and amazing staff. You don't feel like you're in an impersonal hotel - they really get to know you and cater to your every need.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: morganmcneill
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and so much fun!! Immediately upon arrival we were told our room was upgraded to an oceanfront and it was PERFECT! The staff was wonderful (except for Kevin who gets chairs and umbrellas for you on the beach... we had to ask him numerous times for an umbrella and he seemed annoyed that we asked him to do his job, but maybe we got him on an off-day.) William is the sweetest man in the world and cannot wait to open the door and greet you! Maria makes the best cranberry mojito at wet bar i've ever tasted! And Virna is all smiles and truly wants to make your stay desirable. Tips for saving money: Don't book airport transportation through expedia or orbitz... it's only around 12-15 dollars to and from the airport in a cab. Buy a foam cooler and case of beer/liter of Don Q on the first day to bring to the beach & even up by the pool (they don't mind). Beers & liquor drinks on the beach and at Wet Bar after happy hour are expensive. Be sure to go to Wet Bar every day from 5-6 for happy hour!! Also, if you go on a snorkeling trip that promises free pina coladas and rum punch... it's true... BUT, they are very weak!! So bring a water bottle or two of Don Q to spike them up ;) El Ambique, next door practically to the hotel, has wonderful food. We got grouper and sweet plantains and i highly recommend both! Also, it's fairly priced. Old San Juan is a must! It's beautiful and quaint. Rent a car and go the rainforest. There's a car rental place behind the hotel on isle verde ave. called Charlie's that's good. Snorkel and/or dive (although it's no great barrier reef). We went on the Spread Eagle II which was a good sized catamaran that wasn't overpopulated and the staff was really friendly. Go now!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Arianaflwr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for five days and it was one of the best hotel experiences that I have every had. The staff was absolutely amazing! They were friendly, helped get tours set up, and were very knowledgable about the entire area. The beach is reserved during the day for the hotel guests so there is privacy on this beautiful beach. The rooms have great views, they are clean and the ambiance is very relaxing-perfect for a vacation. There is a complimentary breakfast, but if that doesn't fit your needs their prices are reasonable and there is a patio with a beach view to enjoy it all. The top level has a view that lasts for miles, white lounging couches and a full bar. Not usually a heavy drinker, but their mojitos were heavenly! I strongly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Puerto Rico. Its perfect, quaint, private, relaxing and the essence of paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service and View”
Reviews.Author: travelbug6670
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the SJ Water Club and were completely bowled over by the staff and service. They went above and beyond to make sure our stay was exceptional and that we enjoyed our vacation. We had a generous sized suite with a great view of the ocean and beach. The beach was just steps away, as were restaurants and a Walgreens!

Reviews.Title: “Great place with superior service”
Reviews.Author: mercury777
Reviews.Content: When I was down in the lobby I made the offhand comment that I wondered if I'd be able to get my computer hooked up to the internet, within five minutes a staff member was knocking on my door with an extra ethernet cable and an offer to help me get set up. It was that kind of place -- the staff was totally "on" and just aware of everything, and everybody took a personal interest in how my stay was going. I can't rave enough about the place- I've been to San Juan before and I've never had such a great experience at a hotel. Really just top-notch; cute rooms, great access to a nice stretch of beach. Awesome roof-top bar that reallys comes alive at night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely unless you're just freaky picky”
Reviews.Author: Been2Seychelles
Reviews.Content: Everyone at the San Juan Water & Beach Club was incredibly helpful and gracious. We loved the roof-top bar and the hotel's restaurant was excellent. This place is intimate and well appointed. This is not an enormous impersonal hotel (but those are nearby and have casinos!). This was a great location to relax & enjoy & also explore the San Juan area. The rooms were lovely, the service was superior, the beach was beautiful. Yes, there is construction because they are putting in fancy sidewalks. And there is traffic (San Juan is a CITY btw) but drivers constantly stop to give way to pedestrians. We were there when the "big wedding" was happening and the staff managed the wedding and still gave us very excellent personal service. You can send some folks to Nirvana and they would find something to complain about. We would absolutely go back to the San Juan Water & Beach Club.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was the best!”
Reviews.Author: gothetravelbug
Reviews.Content: I really dont understand some of the negative reviews for the San Juan Water & Beach Club. The staff was nothing but polite and professional! The hotel is located on beautiful Isla Verde beach. They provide chairs, umbrellas and towels. They even have a waitress on the beach serving you drinks and food. The room was cleaned everday. They have happy hour with free drinks of your choice, every day. The bartenders were very polite and a pleasure to be around. I would reccomend this to anybody. They treat you great & they have reasonable prices!! We cant wait to go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible if you have any kind of finesse”
Reviews.Author: Ladyzion
Reviews.Content: Although the staff were extremely nice and welcoming-i still wanted to leave because the rooms were not as stated in the photo. The beach was full of locals and dogs their feces, and broken glass and beer bottles all over the place. The sand looked as if a building fell and they just grind it up and called it brown sand. Or perhaps, with all the construction going on maybe they borrowed the grout and debris and threw it out there. It appeared that the police made this a hang out for what ever reason. The balconies with the side views are not even a foot wide so don't waste you money on a room upgrade. I requested towels, some little kid brought them to us with dirt spots and blotches of blue. And OMG the traffic, getting across the street was a real nightmare. It was very clear that the assistants wanted money even if they opened the door. The room was not as it looked in the photo. The waterfalls in the elevator was not appealing at all. The mattress on the bed was the worst! This hotel is basically a bump and grind for the locals. And a high price for the tourist. As for food delivery to the room, I was terrified to eat the food.

Reviews.Title: “The Roof is on Fire :)~”
Reviews.Author: sugein
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nice. My boyfriend and I stayed for five nites and we had a great time. The staff were polite always with a smile on their face. Free drinks during happy hour from 5 to 6pm mojitos were delicious. On the weekends on the open roof is a DJ playing music which was great. The music is really loud if you are going on vacation to relax this is not the hotel for you. The room were not as small as i though by reading other reviews. It was a good size. The only bad thing was the parking there is a $20/day charge which is a bit too much. I will be visiting P.R. again next yr and will defently be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Cool, and Welcoming”
Reviews.Author: DXH
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week at the San Juan Water and Beach Club. A boutique hotel- it has a hip and trendy vibe. I really loved my room overlooking the ocean. The staff was friendly and helpful. I decided to have dinner at Tangerine-the hotel restaurant. I enjoyed every bite and found myself slowly savoring the last few bites of meal...lol! The proximity to the beach can't be beat. Leaving was the hard part. I actually thought about extending my stay, but reality set in and it was time to go back to work in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “the ultimate effort to please”
Reviews.Author: jkaillinois
Reviews.Content: Every single employee did their utmost to accommodate my needs and desires. I've never encountered such excellent service, ever!

Reviews.Title: “There's better available”
Reviews.Author: ellep
