Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Water Club for four nights. It was not my first choice and there were not many other hotels available, and after reading the reviews I decided to stay here. The staff: not as friendly as helpful as I expected. There were a few, it depends on who's there at the moment. The first night I talked to a lady at the frontdesk about places to eat in Old san Juan. While she did give some good suggestions, she failed to mention that virtually all of San Juan was in Condado for a culinary festival. Old San Juan was like a deserted ghost town that night, luckily found out from a waitress there about what was going on. The culinary festival was awesome btw. The room: I would definitely not stay in any other than the oceanview room that I was upgraded too. It was decent size but pretty dirty and dingy. While the view of the ocean was the only redeeming factor the window itself was so dirty, greasy, and just plain filthy and falling apart. Does that make any sense at all for an oceanview room? I hate to think what the other rooms looked like. Also the coffee maker was right next to the bathroom sink. Who wants to drink coffee from something that is covered with toothpaste stains? The shower has a stupid design like other reviewers mentioned but if you lay some towels down it's not that big of a deal. The bed was lumpy and towels, sheets were dingy with stains. The walls are RIDICULOUSLY thin. Could hear the couple next to us having every conversation, and fight when they came back from the bars at 5am. Definitely DO NOT STAY here if you are a light sleeper, you will be miserable. The rooftop pool: really dirty with bugs and other stuff floating around in it, but I wasn't planning on using the pool at all. The beach: this was a beach trip so I was pleased with this factor of the hotel the most. Right next to a clean and beautiful beach. It seemed like Isa Verde had much nicer beaches than in Condado. Chair and towel service was OK, no umbrellas btw. It was only from 9-5. While I was there they ran out of towels everyday. One day it rained a couple of times and they closed up at 2/3 pm "because of the rain". Went to look out the window after leaving the beach to see an event crew setting up for a wedding, how convenient for them that the beach area in front of the hotel was now free! If I wanted to stay in Isla Verde for the beach again I would stay at one of the other hotels. The Isa Verde area: pretty run down compared to other areas in San Juan. There is absolutely nothing to do at night, unless you only want to go to one of the other hotels in the area. Went to either Old san Juan or Condado area every night by taxi. The nightlife in Condado is much, much better, really good restaurants. Got to see my first choice hotel that wasn't available, La Concha. It looked like such a beautiful and well-maintained hotel. If I ever go back to PR I will hopefully get to stay there, even though the beach area was not as big.

Reviews.Title: “Great service - trendy hotel.”
Reviews.Author: alpineprincess
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time researching hotels before I booked here. A lot of people posted negative reviews and said the hotel was noisy. However, I think that those people must have been older or had families. I am in my mid 20's and went here with a friend. We had a great time. This hotel is a small boutique hotel and has excellent service. There is a continential breakfast and free happy hour. Also, we were lucky as there were Salsa lessons one night. The roof is AMAZING. It is a 2-floor roof - the first floor has the bar and lounge area - the second level has the pool. The pool is small - but who cares if you have a big pool when you have the whole ocean right infront of the hotel? The only downfall to the hotel is that it is about a 15 minute taxi ride ($20) from Old San Juan. Other than that, its great. I highly recommend it and would be happy to answer any questions you might have. Will definitely be going back here in the future!

Reviews.Title: “On the Beach and GREAT location, but no Self Parking & Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: gr8travel12
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week during our honeymoon in May. We really lked the staff, everyone was so nice, especially William, the parking attendant... he was the one giving us directions to places to visit. You have to do Valet parking, which is about $23/day... they have no self parking... a bit pricey, but convenient. The hotel is pretty small... no casino, no shops, no gym inside. But they do have a bar/lounge upstairs, which was very nice and relaxing... and an asian restaurant in the 1st floor. The hotel decor is cool and modern.... however, the room was a bit small... but it was ok for us since we went out most of the day. It's right on the beach, so that was great... there are so many shops and restaurants in walking distance. High speed internet was free. Overall, we enjoyed our stay there. It's just a regular cool hotel... nothing too special or exciting about.

Reviews.Title: “Nirvana at the Water and Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: SeekingNirvana
Reviews.Content: The research I did on both the property and your staff prior to our arrival paid off greatly. From the moment, we arrived at the property we felt incredibly comfortable and it was almost as if we had known the staff for years... The room (703) with it's great ocean view and balcony was magnificent. It was spacious, laid out well, and provided a very comfortable envirnoment for both Linda and myself. The view of the ocean as you laid in bed was breathtaking and mesmerizing. The continental breakfast in the morning at Tangerine was a welcome addition and being able to sit outside and peruse the ocean to start your day was awesome. Matteo greated us every morning with his fabulous attitude and engaging smile and could never do enough for us. Not to mention the cost of the buffett, FREE.... Free Happy Hour nights, what a concept. Seriously,it was a great feeling going to the Wet Bar high above the hotel with the open air feeling and great views of the ocean. What a way to unwind on a nightly basis. Not to mention, the greeting from Danilo and Pedro with my Medalla light Day after day and night after night, we were greeted at the front door by both William and Ricky with their infectious smiles, constant great greetings, and warm attitudes. Most people at hotels such as this just do their jobs. Clearly, these two guys LOVE their jobs and are a great ambassador to the hotel. A picture of William is attached, just look at that smile and you'll undertand my thought process. The front desk staff, Gretchen, Maria, Cynthia, and Mardeliz, were always warm and engaging when we either came downstairs or just needed information. Both Linda and I would continually comment on their incredible attitudes and willingness to assist us with information or restaurant recommendations. I travel a great deal and believe me, the staff at a hotel can either make or break your visit. This group of individuals is a great asset to the hotel and a welcome sight to seasoned travelers such as Linda and I. My man Kevin at the beach was a great guy and a joy to speak with everyday. He would always bring us chairs and towels, greet us with his engaging smile and introduced us to his lovely wife and beautiful new daughter. Another employee who takes great pride is his job. Finally, what can I say about the Manager of Desires,Virna Concepcion. She is an incredibly warm, engaging, generous, and giving person whom both Linda and I felt after a week like we have known her for a lifetime. Even before our arrival, Verna was constantly calling and emailing us to make sure all aspects of our trip were taken care of with great detail. She made all the necessary arrangements for our Kayak, Catamaran, and Snuba trips. Set up our evening at La Perla, one of the best restaurants we have ever seen and provided us with recommendations for local establishments which we love. Linda and Virna really felt a bond and special relationship during our time at the property, a sort of Sister ship, if you will. I attached a picture that illustrates this bond. I wanted this trip to be very special for Linda and Virna ensured that it was one of our best trips ever. If you look in Webster's under great customer service, you might just find a bio and picture of Virna Concepcion. On a personal note, I would like to thank Mr. David Lopez personally for taking the time to meet and greet us and for being so available for us during our stay. It's rare a GM spends that much time with his guests and we truly appreciated your time and efforts on our behalf. In closing, I want to say that I went to the Water and Beach Club seeking rest, relaxation, and a great time. Instead, in a word, we found NIRVANA. It was truly a great vacation in every aspect of the word. The staff clearly is truly the epitome of customer service and relationship management. We plan on coming back to the property soon and to continue our relationship with all of the staff. In the future, if you every need a recommendation for the hotel or anyone on the staff, please don't hesitate to ask. Edward and Linda

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: CampTravel5
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so nice. The decor was so sheik. The entire staff was incredibly nice. We truly enjoyed our time in Puerto Rico. The hotel was very clean and extremely accomodating. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a romantic getaway for two. The hotel is right off the beach and the view is breathtaking.

Reviews.Title: “Good Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: gruk
Reviews.Content: Just returned. Service was personable and always with a smile. Folks could not do enough. Know guests by first name. Not your typical hotel experience. Small, quaint, easy walk to beach, bus stop and great restaurants in area. Free breakfast and drink at Happy hour...good deal. Rooms were small but served the purpose of a place to sleep ( great bed) and shower. Pool small. For the price, do it. Serves as a good base for your visit to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “nice people and great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: pologeorge1
Reviews.Content: nice people and great place to stay nice people nice people and great place to stayand great place to stay nice people and great place to stay nice people and great place to stay nice people and great place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Great service, but noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: otrudato
Reviews.Content: The complimentary breakfast every morning and open bar happy hour were both great. My girlfriend and I took full advantage of both all 4 days. From the moment we checked in, the service/staff was awesome. I paid through a third-party internet site for a basic room which was not with an ocean view and was smaller. But in the notes I had asked for a ocean view room if possible. They did this when I checked-in and we were hooked up with one of hte best rooms in the hotel, 8th floor, direct ocean view, and very roomy (unlike the sample photos of rooms you see on their site which is of much smaller rooms). Doorstaff was great also. On the downside, the reviews I read prior to booking of paper thin walls are absolutely true. You can hear everything from your neighbor coughing to their alarm clock very clearly. Also, a lot of locals would sneak into the hotel pool to get all of the sand off of hteir bodies from the beach. It was ridiculous at a point where some kids would make it to the rooftop pool and then yell from the top to their friends still at the beach to pretty much say come up here its so easy. And soon after, groups of 5 would come up, jump in the pool, not caring for the people actually paying for the use of the pool/hotel and making a ruckus. This happened multiple days. The pool itself is TINY. If you are looking for a hotel with a nice, big pool, this is absolutely not the place. But we mostly went to the beach which is right in front of the hotel. If you want a beautiful, big pool go to El San Juan, Intercontinental, or the Ritz. But expect to pay up for rooms. I wouldn't pay for meals at the hotel , you can get much better meals for better prices by walking a few blocks. I have to give it 4 stars though because the value was great relative to the prices of other hotels in the area. And given it was a smaller, boutique hotel, we got to know the staff well and they took care of us.

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest hotel on the planet....”
Reviews.Author: prat88
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at an adjoining hotel and were kept awake for 3 nights IN A ROW by this hotel...never in my life have we heard music played this loud. How people stay/sleep in this hotel is hard to imagine...we couldn't sleep and we were several hotels away. It must damage the people's ears in the hotel--amazingly inconsiderate. People can dance without having their brains blown out by the music.

Reviews.Title: “Love it! Very modern and sexy & in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: NYCBrit
Reviews.Content: This hotel is funky and fun and perfect for anyone who admires individuality. The staff is very friendly and helpful; the restaurant has delicious food and the bars make great pina coladas. Best of all is the gorgeous beach just footsteps away. Our room had a very comfortable bed and was designed to maximize the view and make the most of a smallish space. (Being from NYC, this is a good sized hotel room.) We were even treated to free Salsa lessons one night. This was a very romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jojokisser
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Puerto Rico..I must say that this was the best hotel that I have ever stayed in! The staff was the friendliest most professional people to deal with. The rooms were kept immaculate. As soon as you enter the hotel you can sense immediately that you were going to be in a great hotel. The location is perfect, you cannot get any closed to the beach..the rooftop lounges were beautiful..I highly reccomend!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Honest187
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this paticular Hotel was not what it described to be. The rooms were small, kinda of like a dorm room studio. You would constantly bump into someone whenever you walked around. The dresser to put your clothes in, was also a problem, considering there were 3 draws no bigger than a shoebox. The pool also closed at 10pm which was great to hear when you would like to take a nice dip in the pool with the person you went with. Over all if your into bumping into someone and leaving your clothes in your bag for your stay or even looking at that state of the art 1986 JVC television that weighs more than a safe on a stand that weighs 2 pounds, this is the place for you. Enjoy and drink heavily so the tanning lights in the room that won't shut off can give you that all around tan.

Reviews.Title: “Overdue for renovation & improvements”
Reviews.Author: Dominco
Reviews.Content: I can see how this was a cool & trendy hotel when it was first opened, I think 2001. However, the hotel seems to have been maintained pretty poorly since, and lost its cool as a result. The location is decent (effectively on the beach), although the beach can get very loud (Reggaeton-loud) and crowded, especially on the weekends (it is a public beach after all). Our room was spacious for a boutique hotel, otherwise no-frills. Claims of wireless internet to be taken with a grain of salt - signal in room was very weak to non-existent, reception suggested I go up to the roof to get better signal, still didn't work so ended up borrowing a neighbor's signal on the roof. I could not find a LAN line in the room and reception did not know if one existed. Business Center was also experiencing tech problems as indicated by a fellow traveler. Amenities are largely there to fulfill a checklist - pool is a dipping pool, rooftop bar is inadequately staffed and stacked, beachside chairs and umbrellas on concession and inadequate (although guy is quite helpful and friendly), beachside service is painfully hit-or-miss, restaurant serves uninspired food in the most basic sense of the word. That being said, elevators have glass ceilings and a waterfall wall - both of which contribute to the heat inside the elevators and the a/c in the elevators (assuming it exists) is very inadequate. Also, no a/c in the room floor hallways, so by the time you are out of your room to go to the lobby it is time for another shower. Room a/c's are older-type stand-alone units - loud and irregular function, and no a/c in the bathrooms. A hot shower and/or blow-drying in the bathroom can heat up large parts of the room very quickly. The room was not attended to and cleaned until 430pm - 500pm. Odd mix of clientele, from semi-hipsters who thought it would be a cool hotel to older couples who appear totally out of place to spring-breakers (although not the rowdy ones) to others who are trying to make sense of it all. This mix could be as a result of the various promotions the hotel runs through online travel agencies, possibly to fill the rooms. If you can reserve for $150 or below a night, it presents an OK alternative to the nearby Ritz and El San Juan (where last minute deals could be had for as little as $229 at the time). At their "list" price of $250 or so, better alternatives exist. The staff was well-meaning but could offer limited help given the types of shortcomings the hotel has.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed, but would not pay premium dollar”
Reviews.Author: BobcatNewEngland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked a deal for this hotel. It is in a nice location and the beach is beautiful. We liked the fact that there were no children. We had a partial ocean view room that really had a great view and the bed was comfortable. There is a lot of white, so if you prefer color this isn't it. We had a very warm greeting from William on our arrival, but other people did not go out of their way. Even at their Happy Hour, it seemed selective who the staff chose to talk/network with. This hotel is definately trendy and geared to a younger crowd who like to party. It is not a quiet hotel and you can hear doors slam next to you. The room we had had a half panel shower as in another review, and we figured out that it must have been tested out a smaller stature person since it did not flood out with me, but did with my husband who is over 6 foot. There was no bureau in our room. The floor was kind of sandy and gritty, and while it did get cleaned, it wasn't thorough. We were disappointed in the continental breakfast. Each day we had to ask the staff to replenish the fruit. There were no juices and only bread for toast and pastries. Some yogurt, cheeses, granola/cereal, or even hard boiled eggs would have been a nice addition. Having stayed at other boutique hotels and B&Bs, this was by far not worth the $10 extra a night. You can go across the street to El Taquito's (it doesn't look like much) and have a delicious breakfast burrito for approximately $4. Would I recommend this hotel? It depends on who is going and what they are hoping to get out of their vacation. We enjoyed our stay but we wouldn't pay premium dollar.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy in a Bad Way”
Reviews.Author: rrzzll
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I have nothing against being trendy. I do however have issues with being trendy at the expense of practicality. For instance, my shower had a half-glass partition which did not block the water from flooding the room since the showerhead was not adjustable. The elevator, very trendy with see-through views of the elevator shaft and purple mood lighting, did not stop even with the floor so that you were constantly tripping in and out of it. The computer room, very trendy with Apple equipment, did not allow you to access the printer without climbing over the person next to you. I can go on and on but you probably get the general idea. On the plus side, the hotel is very clean and the service was good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: mxl747
Reviews.Content: My partner were in San Juan as we were staying one night after a cruise. We were staying at the Marriott Court Yard (see my review - great hotel) for one night. Unfortunately, our flight was delayed another day due to the weather and we had to spend another night in San Juan. I would would have preferred to have stayed again at the Marriott, but was unable to get another night at the great rate I had obtained previously through Priceline. While at the Marriott, we used the computer in the business centre and were able to get the SJ Water Club (3.5 start), for $90 a night. Their regular rate is $250. The hotel seems to cater to the trendy crowd with techno music playing, water cascades over glass, white sheers and blue lighting. Everything is painted white. If you look closely, you will see that the paint covers up scratches and dents, and sometimes not even that. After waiting for almost an hour past the 4 oclock check in, we were given free drink coupons and since our room was still not ready, the girl at the front desk gave us an upgraded ocean front room. That was appreciated. The room is very nice, but again, as I said, don't look too closely at the scratches on the furniture, the mold on the shower ceiling, etc. The room was ocean front and we were able to sleep with the door open and listen to the waves. We had to, the air conditioner was so noisy, we wouldnt have been able to sleep with it on. I know this sounds negative, but if I had had to pay the top rate, I would have been very dissapointed. Even some senior citizens who stayed there only got a discounted rate of $190. A continental breakfast was included, which was very nice. The service was excellent. For example, they let me use their phone to make calls, including long distance, and there was always someone available to open the front door, or store your luggage while you waited for your room to be ready. I am a simple person. Give me a clean room in a nice location. This hotel was more for those who are impressed with techno music and a roof top bar location. The bar location has lounging beds which are dirty.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home... Only Better”
Reviews.Author: caribbeantraveler28
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I must say that the Water Club's ambiance is absolutely amazing. From the moment you walk in, you feel like a celebrity without all the pretentious attitudes. The staff at the valet, the service desk, the bars, restaurants, housekeepers, and even the attendants on the beach never allow you to complain. Everyone is genuinely at your beck and call, and not once during our stay did we hear 'no' or 'I'm sorry we can't". The rooms, even the most standard guest room is treated with detail. Flat screen t.v's, iPod alarm clocks, clean and chic bathrooms, linens, etc. And as much as I love the hotel for all it offers, nothing compares to the staff.... nothing. If you're in the area, you must try the San Juan Water and Beach Club. PS - it's located on the cleanest and most tranquil beach I've experienced in the San Juan area.

Reviews.Title: “interesting concept - few amenities”
Reviews.Author: crunchead
Reviews.Content: We were here for an anniversary weekend trip and wished we sprang a few extra bucks for the Ritz. The hotel is very hip at night with blue neon lights all over (look great), but the rooms are small and the walls are paper thin. Definitely a hotel for younger crowd / partiers that like night life.

Reviews.Title: “Convienent”
Reviews.Author: Mickey4444
Reviews.Content: I work for JetBlue and was able to book a last minute stay here! My co-workers had previvously stayed here and recommended it to me. The location was very convienent because it was right on the beach!!! To get to the hotel it only took like 5 mins from airport ($10 cab ride plus $1 per bag) Couldn't get any better. The people were so much fun, very friendly, and extremely helpful. They literally would do anything to make your stay there more enjoyable. The restaurant was really good but I think it was overpriced and the drinks were somewhat expensive-but hey your on vacation ENJOY! I had the most amazing breakfast there every morning though and I miss it. (esp. those pancakes : p sooooo good) I definately would recommend staying here if you looking to have fun in a trendy atmosphere, but still have a comfortable and relaxing stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: Edolgas
Reviews.Content: I had not been on vacation in a year and a half and needed to get away. This led to a couple of days worth of research before I determined that Isla Verde in San Juan, Puerto Rico would be the perfect location to get some rest and relaxation. From there I thought the San Juan Water and Beach Club would be perfect. My expectations were surpassed 40 times over. The customer service at this hotel cannot be compared to anything I have ever experienced. Every employee from the General Manager, to the Sales and Conscierge staff, all the way to the Bartenders, Waiters, and Beach Staff were generally concerned that I was having a good time. Everyone wants to make sure that you are maximizing your time in paradise and that everything is meeting your expectations. While I was at the hotel I always had a smile on my face. You are well taken care of, the beach is beautiful, and everyone at the hotel can point you in the right direction whether you are looking for a good local place to eat or some activities to do at night. Beyond that, the hotel has a great rooftop bar and hosted a few parties during my stay that were AMAZING. Moving forward, I have been recommending Isla Verde to anyone interested in a relaxing vacation where you can still let loose. Beyond that, there is no hotel I will EVER stay at in Puerto Rico other than the San Juan Water and Beach Club. It was Heaven on Earth, and could not be more satisfied with my decision to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: jerseyboi2009
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was nice, however, it was not worth the price. I booked the hotel through Priceline.com. When I checked in the front desk authorized over $1,000 on my credit card for incidentals for 3 days because they lost priceline record of booking. The room was nice and clean. The upstairs lounge with pool and bar is another story. To use the upstairs deck you have to buy drinks which are priced four times over local bars and clubs $8 and up for each drink. Also the deck had lounge chairs which were not clean and infested with bugs. The hotel pool is very small and not fit for swimming. The beach by the hotel (Isla Verde) is not nearly as good as Condado Beach and has filthy water with all kinds of stuff swimming in it. Locals also bring their dogs to the beach here. Not recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay on a budget”
Reviews.Author: sputnik78
Reviews.Content: My friend and I wanted booked a vacation package with this hotel and we were worried at first, because it was getting very mixed reviews. The deal was great and we were not disappointed. The room was small but clean, no bugs (that's my big issue). Bed was moderately comfortable. Beach was beautiful and staff was great. It's perfect if you don't want to spend a lot for a hotel room that you're barely using. Sure, it was glowing blue, but you can turn the blue light off in your room and it makes it easier to find the hotel if you get a few drinks and wonder off. We didn't eat at the restaurant downstairs, but there is a great bar with very decent food and best mojitos i've ever had just around the corner. It's called El Alambique. A lot of things are within walking distance. We went to a cock fight (about 20min walk) and had a lot of fun, even for girls like us. after a couple of beers the locals will bet with you and ladies get in free! There is a supermarket very close by, so you can stock your fridge with beer if you don't want to pay a lot for drinks. We went gambling at the Intercontinental casino, about 5 min away. If you want swans made out of a towel on your bed, this hotel is not for you. They do have parties that get loud, so i wouldn't say it's for anyone who wants peace and quiet. Rooftop bar is quite nice and it has a small pool with a great view. We didn't have one issue or one bad day. For us, it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Water Club Hotel Review”
Reviews.Author: Jarama
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, south beach hotel atmosphere, great ambiance, hard to beat location. Just one step away from the ocean. Will come back just because the best dog friendly hotel. Will recomend to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Mediocre overall”
Reviews.Author: erin5wilson
Reviews.Content: First let me say, the San Juan Water & Beach Club was NOT a bad place to stay - it was quite nice! It just wasn't what we expected. We are a very fun and open minded couple, and don't let much get to us - but I have to say, there were three things that I did not enjoy. First, the blue neon lights EVERYWHERE was a bit too much. Blue light itself is very unnatural, and we would much rather have enjoyed a more serene environment. Secondly, the waterfall in the hallways and elevators was a bit moldy, and my allergies were angry with me the entire trip. And lastly, the rooms are TINY - and there is no where to store your things. We could barely walk in the room without tripping over our luggage and clothes. Okay, now that I got the bad stuff out of the way - let me now discuss the good things! First, I have to give props to the service. Everyone was awesome, and they had a relatively young staff. The door man was quite charming and pleasant, and Kevin - the beach chair guy - was amazing! We were always made to feel as if they were there to serve any needs we may have. Although we never visited Tangerine for dinner, or the rooftop bar Wet, it looked very nice. We did have breakfast at Tangerine most mornings, and it was good yet standard (not free). The beach location is probably the best thing about this hotel. And if you walk down the beach a few blocks, you are able to enjoy the amenities and bars/restaurants of the other fancier hotels - especially El San Juan hotel. (If we go back, we will definitely be staying there - that place was awesome). Overall this place is fairly decent, and with the great staff it made for a pleasant stay. If you're active and plan to be "out" most of the day and night and just need a place to crash - this is a great spot. If you would rather lounge at the hotel all day... keep on looking.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique MOTEL”
Reviews.Author: FoodiePam
Reviews.Content: The good news: the people who work are incredible. They are friendly, efficient, and accommodating. They felt like family (and I mean that in a good way!). The location is great as is the beach. The bad news: this â€œboutique hotelâ€� fall short of its earlier reviews. Yes, it is stylish and comfortable. But, the furniture is cheap--and it shows. There are too many examples of disrepair. The hot water runs out too quickly. The restaurant runs out of basics like breads, meats and decaffeinated coffee. I wanted to love this hotel because of the amazing staff but I came away feeling that it was more of a â€œboutique motelâ€�.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: Sana1723
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 10 day vacation in Puerto Rico (San Juan). We were there with our friends (3 more couples) and had a wonderful time. We were staying in the Water & Beach Club Hotel and couldn't have picked a better place to stay. From the minute we arrived we new that we are in the right place. The staff was phenomenal. They were there any time we needed them. They band backwards to make sure we are taken care-of. The rooms were cleaned and nicely prepared every day. Restaurants were nice and food was delicious. The New Year's party was outstanding, and we will go back for more vacationing time at the hotel. We can not thank enough the staff of the hotel for making our New Year vacation fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “No Substance at all...”
Reviews.Author: Bergo4ever
Reviews.Content: I was there for New Year's party. I called & made a reservation. I was told that the tickets will be in the reception. I went there to find nothing... The party started with bad techno music with no latin flavor at all. There was no dance floor, they closed the pool area most of the party for an unknown reason & they let a few people there... My admission included a free champaign glass & when I went to claim it, the bar tender told me they were out of champaign... It was ridiculous... The hotel's ambiance is trendy but nothing with the flavor of San Juan. The employees tried to be courteous with no real good service provided there. I decided to leave around 1am & not wait for the Brazilian singer they feature. The space was inadequate & the party lacked excitement & entertainment. At midnight they let us up on the top level to watch the fireworks by the ESJ (el san juan hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “No Substance to the Name "Boutique Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: traveljack2000
Reviews.Content: This is not really a boutique hotel- I can see how it was trendy when it opened, years ago, but no upkeep has been done since. Not worth the money, unless you get your room for half the price of the InterContinental or El San Juan. The staff is friendly, but incompetent: We tried to get a drink at the roof top bar, Wet, but could not get served, despite the place being empty with less than 10 customers. We then could not get served at the lobby level restaurant, which again was nearly empty. We had nice days at the beach, but when there was a brief rain we came in to get a drink- only to be told the empty lobby level bar/restaurant was closed, and of course the rooftop bar was closed due to the rain, which brings us to the room: it is SMALL- no closet, even, just a half size piece of furniture/wardrobe. The bathroom was small, but the real problem was design- the shower had no curtain, just half its length in glass, which could have worked, except it didn't. The shower head was not adjustable, and sprayed water out of the shower, onto the bathroom floor, which had no drain. The bathroom floor was flooded our entire stay- gross. Also, the bed mattress was saggy, with a deep V in the middle.

Reviews.Title: “The Staff are Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: 1erCru
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the San Juan Water & Beach Club Hotel on 2 different trips 1 year apart and the exceptional level of friendly, professional service was identical on both visits. I travel a great deal with my job (30-40% of the time) and this is by far the best team of staff I have experienced anywhere. I was recommended this hotel by a local business colleague for my first visit to Puerto Rico. The staff make you feel as though you are the only guest staying at the hotel from the moment you arrive until you are on your way to the airport. The hotel itself is very chic and at night has a blue glow from all of the black lights used in the hallways and guestrooms (that can be turned off if desired). The rooms are not huge but are plenty roomy with an extremely comfortable bed, small desk and internet connection, flat screen TV and the best stocked (and affordable) mini bar ever! I never eat anything from the mini bar because the prices are usually ridiculous but not here - they are slightly more than you would expect to pay at a convenience store and the offerings are much better (I indulged a few times). The airconditioning is so efficient I had to turn it down when going to bed at night. The Water & Beach Club has a gourmet restaurant on the main floor and a rooftop bar. I never made it to the bar (and I never heard any noise from there either) but the food in the restaurant features exceptional fusion cuisine and is available via room service too. The hotel is located at the end of a dead-end court and looks over a white sand beach. It is barely 10 minutes from the airport and has many resturants within walking distance. Both of my stays were for business but I would certainly return for a romantic vacation with my wife since I found this hotel to be a relaxing destination at night after putting in long hours at work. All of this contributes to a great stay but it is the staff that make your stay exceptional and make you want to return. I was always impressed with the staff that addressed me by name as I came and went. The front doorman who negotiated my taxi fare in Spanish with the driver to ensure I was in good hands after leaving the property (without me asking him to do so) and giving me an ice cold bottle of water for my travels. The service is friendly, prompt and professional - what more can you want? It is all of these little things that are not so little that make The San Juan Water & Beach Club my only choice in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “If you like cold showers this is your hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Consultant7
Reviews.Content: I am sure this hotel was great a few years ago, but they have not maintained it. First when we checked in, they guy at the reception had us booked on the 10th floor, which I specifically had asked not be on as I had read it was loud. He moved us to a room on the 8th floor. We went to the room and opened the door and it was occupied! We went back down and he said he had no record of anyone in that room...strange. Secondly, it wasn't a suite which is what we paid for. I told him we would just take the 10th floor. The room itself wasn't bad in general. Nice view, balcony, etc. However, there was no hot water! I told them at the front desk, and was told alot of people complain about that, you just have to "play with it" to make it work! I asked if she could send someone to look at it and she said she would. Never heard another word from them...so we took cold showers for 5 days! The noise wasn''t bad as some have complained about on here. My complaint is for $500/night I expect hot water!. When we checked out she never asked how the stay was...I guess they don;t ask because they don;t like the answers they get. Its really a shame, the place has potential.

Reviews.Title: “Tacky, tacky!”
Reviews.Author: davysmom
Reviews.Content: My in laws were treating us to a fabulous cruise vacation departing from San Juan. We stayed overnight at this "boutique" hotel. It was a very lame attempt at being "boutique" at best. The location on Isla Verde is great, close to airport, and ocean views. The property is very poorly managed. The decor is almost disturbing. The blue lights were nauseating with the pale white walls. The furniture is very impractical and there is zero counter space for anything. The room is tiny so you have to use the floor to store your items. The water falls they have in the elevator and the lobby smell so badly of mold. They should use treated water because it is not very pretty or pleasing to the eye to see moldy water streaking down the walls. Everywhere smelled of mold including the terrace which was the nicest part of the hotel. The cushions all smelled again of that familiar moldy smell that greets you in the lobby. Our rooms were also not ready even though we arrived close to 3pm. At 3:30pm we were ready to check in. I think they need more staffing so that they can turn rooms over a bit faster. I only gave this 2 stars because of the property's location. I was happy to leave just after one night. Stay at El San Juan if you want to be in Isla Verde. The best hotel on the island is the El Conquistador.

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Takes Guest Relations To New Heights~”
Reviews.Author: LouieATL
Reviews.Content: I just spent 6 wonderful days at this magnificent property. A group of us rented a block of rooms for my 50th birthday and boy did we make the right decision. The location is perfect as it is 2 miles from the San Juan Airport and not far from Old San Juan and many other wonderful attractions.From the door staff to beautiful front desk staff, these employees could not bend over enough to make sure our stay was an exceptional one. David Lopez (general manager) and the entire staff came to the gorgeous beach in front of the hotel to sing happy birthday and bring "presents." Their dining recommendations were spot on and the roof top bar is like no other on the Island. If you are thinking about Puerto Rico as a vacation destination you must stay at this 84 room boutique gem!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!”
Reviews.Author: hirschinatl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best choice by far for the Isla Verde section of San Juan. 5 minutes from the airport, right on the beach, very cool looking, hip hotel. Awesome roof deck with a pool. But the best part is the staff - always cheerful, helpful, attentive, they really made our vacation great.

Reviews.Title: “Checked out early”
Reviews.Author: bob1492
Reviews.Content: We left after spending one night of a planned three night stay. Our bathroom had a window without a shade or curtain that was in plain view of a large apartment building next door. Our room was tiny and crammed with furniture featuring a bed located in the center of the room. When I asked the front desk for a change of rooms due to the small size and bathroom window I was told that all rooms were the same size and that nothing else was available. I later found out that this was not true. The halls were extremely hot and the decor lacking. I was charged a penalty for leaving early but it was worth it to get out of that place.

Reviews.Title: “So trendy it made it uncomfortable at times but will stay there again”
Reviews.Author: LittleKittenTraveler
Reviews.Content: I will have to say the hotel it's self is very nice and I found it extremly clean while I was there. However, it was so trendy that it made it uncomfortable at times. Let's start with the hallways and elevators, there is no AC at all in them. So, when you are coming back from 90 degree heat back to the room you really feel it going up the elevator that seemed to take forever. I think I lost 5 lbs just riding in the elevator and sweating. However, the ambeance of hallways was neat with the waterfalls in the hallway. We had a king size partcial view room. The rooms seemed really clean as well as the bathroom but there was no alarm clock, or clock for that matter at all in our room. The lack of dresser space didn't bother me since I like to keep my thing in my suit case but I could see how it would be bothersome for someone who enjoys unpacking. (We were there for 10 days so most people would unpack that long.) The blue lights in the room are VERY annoying. We kept ours off and used the only floor lamp but the maids would turn them back on. The TV tube was going out so it would go back and forth between color and black and white. The bed was very comfy and there were plenty of pillows, which was nice since it was really the only thing in the room. The walls were "thin" we could hear everything in the room next door so we know they heard us. I know they cleaned the bath room every day cause they would pack all my stuff back into my travel bag (which I really didn't appreciate, felt like they were going though my stuff). I also would leave my shampoo on the shower floor since there was not enough caddy space to put it and they would move it to clean the floor. The shower is great for two! And yes, if you are in there by yourself no matter what you do you will get water on the floor. The 1/2 glass wall just doesn't come out far enough. So be sure to put a towel down. There is ZERO counter space but I guess that goes for them minimal feel with the rest of the room. The staff is GREAT. They all will bend over backwards to help you and they are sincere about it. We were there during hurricane Omar and they made every accomendation to entertain the guest. They brought out a Wi and provided drinks and cookie, they went the extra mile since everything closed at 10 pm that day to prepare. Kevin and the door guys are the best. They will give you the low down on everything. Where to go, where to eat, what things are open before you spend the day driving there. (i.e, the caves). They make up what the rooms lack considering you really aren't spending that much time in the rooms. The amenities were so so. Wet, the roof top bar and resturant, was closed most of the time we were there but that was due to the hurricane. The pool is really a 5 foot wading pool but the leather lounges are nice. Tangerine was nice as well. We didn't eat there because it was so expensive but we had a drink there. The gym was closed when we where there so I just walked on the beach. I do have to say it is the best location for the beach. Yes, you walk across the street but it's like 10 steps and the other hotels you walk further. It's on a side street so not a lot of people hit that part of the beach. The El San Juan Hotel and Intercontinental are right there for the casinos, shopping, and dining so you can walk there in less than 5 min to enjoy those. Plus, you can really tell the difference between the staff when you visit the others. Water and Beach has MUCH better staff. Overall, I would stay there again and do recommend it but parts of it were too trendy and made it uncomfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very swank!!!”
Reviews.Author: Trvlgrl101
Reviews.Content: The hotel is literaly a $9 cab ride from SJU. My boyfriend and I stayed a full weeek and it certainly was NOT enough to truly explore and see all the sights Puerto Rico had to offer. The Water Club is VERY chic and posh if you're into all that trendy vibe. Our room was on the 10th floor (so if youre looking to get some sleep request a lower floor since they have DJs on the weekend and you will def hear the music banging) -which didnt disturb us since all we were doing was partying!!! I was IN LOVE with the staff members, they really answered our questions and were VERY kind and welcoming (shout out to Cynthia and William) and let us in on the places where locals goon restaurants, bars, clubs...etc - try Ediths Restaurant up Isla Verde Street, theyre open 24hrs and its GOOD PRican food!! The only complaint we had was their bathrooms....yah yah some water did splash onto the floor but not as much as others describe...just put that towel on the floor and its all good; BUT the shower head itself made a LOUD noise and seemed like it was coming from the plumbing rather than the shower head itself. Really....thats MY ONLY complaint. For the location (RIGHT ON THE BEACH) and the superb service.....its not that big of a deal. Their restaurant Tangerine is SO CUTE and CHIC although quite EXPENSIVE....the meal was finger lickin good and it was my birthday so I wanted to splurge. Get the lobster rolls - theyre worth it! We actually ate breakfast and dinner down at Tangerine once and had lunch upstairs on their rooftop lounge. Oh...take advantage of the coupons on their website...but 1 drink get 1 free...theyre there for a reason! The rooms are cute and a decent size...we were upgraded to an ocean view, but they dont have dressers so you leave everything in your luggage. Enjoy your mornings with a nice swim in the ocean...the hotel will provide towels, umbrellas, and lawnchairs on request for guests. The pool on the rooftop is pretty small but has a GREAT view and hey...what more can you ask for than sunshine, drinks and a great view? Hope you enjoy it as much as we did. We would certainly be back!!! Oh...their elevators have waterfalls which just adds to the ambience of the theme. Ahhh...how im missing it already!

Reviews.Title: “Seduction at the Water and Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: JB1313
Reviews.Content: Flew in from Boston for a long weekend; easy direct flight. From door of my apartment to cocktails at the pool in 5 hours; suites were ready when we arrived at noon, and drinks were sent up immediately. Walking into the lobby is the start of a special weekend, and by the time you arrive in your suite you are completely seduced. With the pool and bar/club on the roof, my girlfriend and I never left all weekend, except for our afternoon walks down the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley loved it!”
Reviews.Author: lam012
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the San Juan Water & Beach Club from Sept. 3-8 and all i can say that it was a wonderful experience. The hotel is literally 5mins away from the airport. The employees at the hotel were reallyyyy friendly. They would greet you every time you come in, and at times some of the front desk agents will greet you by your first name...excellent customer service skills. The bell boy in the morning and evening were really kind. They know all the places to go and will tell you how to get there. Also, Kevin the beach guy was very cool and down to earth. I asked for a room upgrade with a better view and the accommodated us the very next day with an ocean view room! Our rooms were really nice and clean. The bed was a king size very comfortable. Our mini bar was full and they had a basket full of snacks and some other products that we might need for an extra charge. The cool thing about the room is that they had and Ihome where you can plug in your ipod an listen to your own music. Also the blue lighting was ok...but it makes the hotel unique. Bathroom was small, but clean...no complaints..and cable TV. If I had to suggest something for the hotel i would suggest them to upgrade their TV to a Flat screen...it would make the rooms feel more chic and modern. The beach was literally across the street from the hotel...was absolutely beautiful. The roof top was really nice and chic. The pool was really small...and i didn't spend too much time in the roof unless if it was in the evening. The drinks were really good but a tad expensive. We had some drinks at the Tangerine bar and the bartender (young guy around mid 20's) was sooo friendly and yet he made great strong drinks. If you do want to save money a block away was a Walgreen, you can buy some snacks and beer and not waste money at the hotel...it will cost you! We didn't have dinner at the Tangerine restaurant, we went to Mi Casita which is a 5min walk from the hotel and i highly recommend it for breakfast and Dinner (inexpensive) and sooooo yummy try their Pork Chops and Mofongo... it's soo yummy! Old San Juan is about a 45min bus ride from the hotel. It is totally worth it and beautiful. If you do go their, you must go to La Bombonera in Calle San Francisco...delishes pastries and Cafe con Leche...so delish! Overall, i loved the hotel because of the Chicness, friendly employees, and the convenience of the beach. I recommended for young couples who likes to enjoy the night life at the roof top or just fun vacation goer's if you're looking for just plain boriness...stay at the Holiday Inn!

Reviews.Title: “A complete disappointment!!”
Reviews.Author: Disturbia
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a complete disappointment! Although it claims to be a boutique hotel on the beach, it lacks any of the amenities a boutique would offer. The rooms are definitely minimal; thereâ€™s a bed placed conveniently in the center of room, blue fluorescent light fixtures (nope, they are not on the building exterior, but in your room to serve as the roomâ€™s only lighting) and sheer curtains to cordon off the bathroom. The obtuse armoire that can barely equip your carryon luggage is mismatched and beat up alongside a mini-bar that is in no better shape. The room dÃ©cor reminded me of a seedy motel with bare white walls, fluorescent lightning and floating bed perhaps just a mirror on the ceiling is whatâ€™s missing. The food is inedible, despite which part of the hotel you eat from â€“ the rooftop bar or the restaurant; it all comes from the same kitchen. The hotel staff offers incompetent concierge service, the few times I tried, was advised to visit old San Juan or a shopping mall because El Yunque was too far (youâ€™d have better chances of getting advice from the valet [William/Kevin] or booking tours/visits yourself). The gym was closed during my visit for renovations so that was one less of the few features available. The pool is so small you may as well call it a wading pond albeit on the roof. The â€œclubâ€� as the hotel is referred to on the island caters more towards a late night party scene than to its own guests. If youâ€™re looking for a relaxing or rather pleasant holiday, Iâ€™d recommend the Intercontinental, the El San Juan or the Ritz hotels, all of which are nearby. This hotel claims big but offers littleâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Top-Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: KeithKong
Reviews.Content: My stay at the San Juan Water and beach club was fantastic. The staff is top-notch, attentive and courteous from the top floor to the door. Special thanks to William, Kevin, Eddie, Matteo, Valerie and Aisha for friendly smiles and a warm welcome. The hotel is right next to the beach, with easy access and an attendant waiting to get you a chair and a towel. The beach itself was marvelous, calm and clear. One can stand in water to their shoulders and see their feet. The only drawbacks, for me, were minor. The bathroom shower has kind of a "half door," which allows alot of water to spill out onto the floor. Also, the plumbing which propagates several waterfall effects in the walls is visible, and in some cases, in slight disrepair. Perhaps a piece of dark window tint could be used to hide the pipework. But hey, big deal! I have to say, it was sad to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Wished I lived here”
Reviews.Author: tavis_jr
Reviews.Content: Definitely will go back to Puerto Rico and stay at the Water and Beach Club. William, Eddie, and Kevin...when these three guys are there they will take care of you. Not a day went by that these guys didn't take care of us with smiles on there face. Aisha, Danilo, and Valerie are the best for serving drinks. Don't just take my word for it, go and see for yourself, I can promise that you won't be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Staff”
Reviews.Author: DanielitoNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week with a friend at the San Juan Water & Beach Club for one week this past summer. We loved the quaint hotel. Since it is a small hotel, the service was very personalized. We found the staff to be most attentive to our needs. They got to know us -- not just our faces but by name. They would make recommendations re: restaurants, day trips, etc . . . . each met our expectations -- and then some. We have a wonderful week -- a wonderful vacation and in no small part to the wonderful staff of the Wather and Beach Club Hotel. We would recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: GigiMexico
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Puerto Rico and we had a great time! We stayed at Isla Verde, Carolina. Isla Verde's beach is the most calm and clean from Puerto Rico. There are only 3 hotels on the beach and the Water Club is one of them, the rest are Condos. The hotel is super clean, it has excellent service, the Tangerine Restaurant is delicious and the Club at the very top it's very fun. I definitely would stay there if we go to Puerto Rico again. If you like the theme "lounge" then you definitely will like this hotel. The hotel is just 10 minutes away from the airport and 10 min from San Juan if you drive your car but if you take the "wuawua" (the bus) it's like 17 min to San Juan. There are two very small restaurant-bars next to the hotel on the beach that are very good. We found that the rooms with partial view to the beach are much cheaper and you can see the beach perfectly. Try and visit the "Marbella Supermarket" it's next to the hotel. The people at this super market are very friendly and helped us a lot with all off the tour questions that we had. The only thing we didn't use was the pool since it's to small, it's full of people, and not very clean, but we didn't care since we had a wonderful beach.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Eshelman
Reviews.Content: I loved it! As usual, your reaction will depend on what you expect. The staff was hands-down fantastic in every regard. The rooms were small (and yeah, a little old - they've covered it reasonably well, and the room was exceedingly comfortable). The air conditioner was NOT noisy, but I also rarely ran it while there - I slept with the windows open and awoke on my mid-westside room gazing out at the ocean and palm trees. The in-house restaurant is expensive - I only ate there once, and the food and service were worth the price, but I just wouldn't choose to spend that much every meal. The area is surrounded by many interesting restaurants. You have easy access from Isla Verde to anything else you want to do on, say, the north half of the island, and the hotel will book tours, give local bus information, etc. You're across the sidewalk from a very good (not excellent IMO) beach, and I especially enjoyed solitary dawn swims. I was comfortable enough when in my room, and had everything I really needed - but I also didn't go to PR to spend the week in my room. Highly recommended, and I'll be going back. Drink the local beer (Medalla) and Barrilito rum, see how many mofongo variations you can find, and don't miss the rain forests.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Class - a DO NOT MISS in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: daveggg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a DO NOT MISS in Puerto Rico - romantic, chic, scenic (insert your own adjective)! The Staff is super friendly, the hotel is clean and beautiful. The ocean views are imprinted in my memory for a lifetime, although i will return to see them again from the rooftop. The Restaurants are classy - breakfast, lunch or dinner you will find great variety and top notch quality and service. I recommend having Sushi on the rooftop for dinner before dancing the night away at the WET bar. all in all this hotel made my stay amazing! PS my girlfriend absolutely LOVED IT!

Reviews.Title: “romantic beachfront getaway”
Reviews.Author: lucca12
Reviews.Content: best white sandy beach water,light blue and like bath-water oceanfront room,with tiny balcony...aaahhhhh... trendy restaurants on 1st floor and roof...wow! rooftop bar and pool...yippee! wonderful and helpful staff would i return? what do you think?

Reviews.Title: “OMG~its fantastic!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lissa6626
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a girls weekend at the San Juan Water and Beach Club 8/8/08-8/12/08. We had the best experience ever!!! The hotel itself is very chic and modern. Think Miami SoBe art deco. The size makes it more intimate since it is not a big chain hotel. Everyone there knew you by name and used it regularly along with English. The service exceeded that of many 5 star hotels I have stayed in. Any questions I had they had an answer for. I had read a lot of reviews about how the nightlife there affected the rest of the hotel. I did not have this experience to the contrary. We did choose this hotel based on the fact that we would not have to leave to go party being it was a girls weekend, but things worked out otherwise. Unfortunately, the nightlife never seemed to be at the level we anticipated so we would venture a short walk down to El San Juan's Brava. This worked out well and really did not cause any inconvenience. So the notion that this hotel is not suitable for relaxation seekers or families is rubbish. We did notice that there were mostly couples there and from the people we talked to they also enjoyed their experience as well. Rooms- decent size, rm 401 with king size bed. Kind of awkward for us girls to share, but what do you expect when you book through Priceline? Check-in was simple, but there was no availability to check in early since hotel was booked. This kinda stinks when you get there at 11am and have to wait until 4pm to get unsettled. But it goes with the territory. Nice blue lighting in the room makes for some amazing pictures. Looks like the room is a giant tanning bed! Not good for makeup application, though! No dresser, just used the entire wall bench under the window. Bathroom and cleanliness adequate with nice toiletries. Pool- rooftop and very tiny! But being from FL where everyone has a pool, we were there for the beach! Which, by the way, is in no comparison to FL beaches! Food- let's face it, we weren't there to eat! We ate at the hotel very little, but was told the sushi bar was great several times. We did have breakfast at Tangerine which was quite good and reasonable. Was told dinner there was excellent but never got around to it. Service and coffee was great!!! Beach- just a few steps away and sooo gorgeous. Courteous staff even setup your umbrellas and chairs with pads for you!!! How fabulous is that? Great scenery, and I'm not talking about the beach!!!! Watch out for that sun, too!!! Location-perfect! Liked being at the end of the street which created less traffic. Short walk along beach will get you anywhere you want to go. Easy drive to El Yunque or Old San Juan. Staff- This is why I want to come back every year! They made our vacay!!! The personalized information and the attentiveness made our trip so memorable. A special thanks to William, Eddie, Verna, Pablo and Nataniel. They were outstanding! They don't come any nicer!!!! I can't wait to go back! Because of the Water Club, we are seriously considering a semi-annual trip back to PR just to have this kind of fun again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Memre
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed at the Water & Beach club between August 6th and 10th. -It has a very classy look to it. You feel it as soon as you enter through the main door. -The front desk staff was very helpful. Even though the regular check -in time was 3pm Lleyda gave us a room around 12:30pm. -The room was a little small, but since you are there just for a good night's sleep it doesn't really bother you. The decoration of the room was pretty good and the bathroom was high above my expectations. Very nice decoration! Blue fluorescent lighting is commonly used in the hotel, which did not bother us in the rooms at all. There is also a nice standing light that has a regular bulb. -The hotel has a roof-top bar and pool (pretty small, maybe 10' x 15', but does the job). The bar has huge leather cushions to lie on. The only thing that bothered me up on the roof bar was the blue fluorescent lighting that prevents you from seeing any starts in the sky at night. I think those are a little bit of an overkill. The bar is very popular around Isla Verde and it was packed over the weekend. -There is a nice guy called Kevin that provides you with beach towels on your way to the beach; which is in front of the hotel. You just need to cross a dead-end street. So, no traffic to worry about. -The housekeeping staff was very nice and helpful; which I am not very used to. A+ for those guys. Please keep in mind that you will be charged an additional fee of ~12-15% (I don't remember the exact percentage) for each night's stay. This is a mandatory fee. Even though we had a uncommon problem with the hotel when we get back home, it was resolved pretty quickly by the hotel staff. Overall, I do recommend this hotel to potential Puerto Rico travelers; especially to singles and young couples. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Hip & Trendy... Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: mrsalleyne
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from the 6th of August to the 9th, for our one year wedding anniversary. From the time we arrived from the airport until we left they were all pleasant. Kevin was the most pleasant of them all any questions we may have had he answered anything we needed he got, an all around nice man. While we were there, there was a music video being shot in the hotel. That meant a lot of expensive cars and camera equipment. But it did not interrupt our time much. We still had full access to all the hotel amenities. The view from the roof top pool is amazing and general location is great. I would definitely recommend this hotel for the young hip crowd say 21-30. There is a DJ on the roof top and the bartenders are not cheap with their liquor. The only 2 complaints are the whack black lights in the rooms. I don't know who's bright idea that was but that should have been vetoed from the beginning the main lighting is black florescent lights and the sub lighting is a regular lamp, a** backwards if you ask me. Also, there was a strand of hair scrambled in with my eggs, not cool. Also there is a cool little bar on the same street facing the beach. If you are looking for good old bar food and great drinks that's the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Dont listen to the bad reviews!! Excellent stay at Water Club”
Reviews.Author: dorasclone
Reviews.Content: Please don't be influenced by the bad reviews left about the Waterclub Hotel. My best friend and I stayed at the hotel for 4 days and had a wonder stay. Is the the hotel The Four Seasons or Ritz-Carlton? No..., but this is a nice, well kept luxury boutique hotel with all the amenities and impeccable customer service you would find in any 4-star hotel. I booked the hotel through a Travel Agent, but I did first read the reviews from TripAdvisor but my decision was not swayed by the bad reviews left. (one because they were trivial) We were greeted by courteous and helpful valet who immediately grabbed our bags and took inside while we checked in. The hotel decor was very hip and stylish and the aroma of fresh tangerine immediately appealed to your senses. We received complimentary breakfast receipts (which were not included in our package) and drink tickets valued at $10 (1per day per person) Our room was the 4th floor with a view of the beach and ocean. I dont believe the hotel has double beds, which is fine, the King suited us just fine. The room was nice, (its not spacious, but who stays in the room all day when you're on vacation) The ONLY thing about the room which I did have a problem with was the shower. There was only a half glass pane, which when you took a shower we had to lay a couple towels on the floor because water splashed everywhere. In addition to that, when would return from the beach to take a shower the sand would not drain properly in the shower so we had to call housekeeping to clean the shower out. Now, as far as the reviews in reference to the noise level. For one, this hotel is not for the 40 and older crew. This is a hip, young, party hotel. The rooftop constantly has activities every nite that normally don't start til after 9pm. I'm sure if you have room that is right underneath the rooftop (WET BAR) noise definitely probably is a problem, us on the 4th floor had no complaints. The hotel has a great location, the beach is just about 15 steps from the door to the sand. We didnt get a chance to eat at the restaurant Tangerine, but there were so many other places to go and eat. The airport is 5 minutes away. Housekeeping changed linens everyday ( and we didn't sleep under covers not one day) The hotel has a business center with 2 computers and one being a MAC, and a printer that actually works. Its open 24hrs. There was a gym with the basic equipment you would need. Walgreens is maybe a 5 minute walk to get anything you may need. I will definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who is 30 yrs old and younger and likes to have an AWESOME time! I will definitely be back again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and service, super attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: George_Vesa
Reviews.Content: The kind of boutique hotel where the general manager, Bob, knows all of his guests and makes sure your stay is 5 star. The staff goes to great lengths to make you feel at home and part of the family (Jada, William, Verna, Jerry). The rooftop lounge is super comfy and drinks are done right (try to mojito) and I strongly recommend the sushi bar for some great rolls and sashimi. The room had a great view, very comfy bed and the black lights add to the mood. Had a great stay and can't wait to return! Thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Time!”
Reviews.Author: KittyNoKrap
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from P.R. and loved the Water Club. From the moment we got out of the cab to the final hours spent at the hotel before heading back to New York, everyone was friendly, courteous, helpful, cleaning and always smiling. The first room assigned to us (406) was fine except for the barking dog every morning beginning at 5:45 am. There are 3 private homes to the left of the hotel and the one closest to the hotel has a dog that is put outside every morning and barks for approximately 2 hours. So if you are a light sleeper as I am, request a room on the right side of the hotel. After the third morning I requested a room on the other side of the hotel. They told us they could accommodate our request and that it would be ready at the end of the day. When we came back from our activities later in the afternoon and went to the new room, we found ourselves in an ocean front room on a higher floor (703). Now I don't know if it's because we belong to RCI or that they just had the room available and wanted to please us. Nevertheless, it had a flat screen TV with better reception, an armoire with draw space and a small balcony. The bathrooms are decent with the only real problem being the shower. Water does get on the floor and into the room if you are not careful when washing. And make sure to put down 2 or 3 towels. The water pressure is not great (especially for those of us who have long hair and need that extra force to get the shampoo out). The blue lights are fine but they should put more real lights in the room (in case you need to look for something). The hotel is pretty much centrally located on the strip. There is a small alley-way between the hotel and the private home that takes you from the front of the hotel to the main avenue. If you go to the right there is a 24 hour Walgreens. If you go to the left, there are many fast food places (KFC, Long John Silvers, Taco Bell, Pizza Hut, Ponderosa). There is also a Burger King which is in a strip mall that also contains a supermarket, Subway, Chinese, Mexican, surf shop, etc. In the same strip mall is a restaurant called Mi Casita. This place is cheap and has great food. On almost any given night there was a line out the door for this place. They serve authentic P.R. food as well as Italian. There is also a bakery further down the strip mall called Gelo's. They have good breakfast foods and are also cheap. The rooftop pool was great. There was never anyone up there so we pretty much had it to ourselves. The white cushions were clean for sunbathing and they provide towels for your use. The view is great, there is a bar menu and you can have both the food and/or drinks brought to you while taking the sun. The music on the roof is loud on Friday and Saturday nights. You can hear the base even if you are on a lower floor and it usually goes until 2:00 - 3:00 am. And you can definitely hear your neighbors in the next room (if you know what I mean). Make sure to check your mini bar as soon as you get into your room. When we switched from one room to the other, the mini bar was not stocked like the first room. We told the front desk and they had someone come to check and restock. But when we checked out they tried to get us to pay the bill ($25.00). We told the girl that we had spoken to someone the day we changed rooms about the mini bar. The charges were taken off ASAP. We had a great time and would stay here again. The blue lights are romantic, the staff is great and the location is great. The hotel is a bit older and could use some updating (they were painting outside by the pool and inside over the front desk as we were leaving) but if you can look past that you will have a good time. They also hold your bags if you arrive early or have a late flight the day you leave and allow you to use the facilities. A big shout out to William and Eddie (front door), Cynthia (front desk) and Kevin (beach chairs).

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Water Club”
Reviews.Author: very_fast_eddie
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7/17-20 2008. Booked 2 rooms through Priceline and was upgraded to an oceanfront w/ balcony and oceanfront no balcony. Traveling with my wife and I were our 16 and 20 year old daughters. We all loved it and hated to check out. Spent next 4 nites at Rio Mar and wish we could have reversed. Good things: 1. Friendliest staff I've ever experienced. Incredibly helpful to any request. 2. Kevin, the beach manager, was a true jewel. 3. Dinner at Tangerine was very good. 4. No problems with party noise; which i was dreading from prior comments. 5. My daughters loved the place. Overall, I think the place just isn't as trendy and hip as it was when it was The Water Club. And i think that's a good thing for groups like ours. I guess reviews on this website had my expectations set so low, I was blown away. I would never hesitate to stay there again, and probably will. [unless rumors we heard about taking it condo are true] Bad things: -None

Reviews.Title: “loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LeilaAntonia
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing time. It seems like the negative reviews come from trivial things like the blue light. Well the blue light is super hip and the rooms DO have regular lighting. About the loud noise... the hotel hosts events, not on an everyday basis. That was one of the reasons why we liked it so much. The hotel was hosting a party that night. Being guests at the hotel we were able to attend without paying a cover to get into both bars. This hotel is the hippest place to stay in Carolina. This is a boutique hotel in a fun, hip, city. It is a hotel for adults. It is not for 140 years old, bitter people. Everyone is happy and having a good time. The best thing about the hotel was the AMAZING service, and the convinience. Beach across the street, valet parking, tons of activities nearby,pool on rooftop, Resteraunt downstairs and a lounge on roof.

Reviews.Title: “Water Club... ok”
Reviews.Author: Chitown_Fafi
Reviews.Content: Stood at the Water Club with a group of friends. Its not at all a bad place. It's very shiek, very modern, contemporary and very trendy. However, it is not practical. The blue lighting in the rooms are cool to look at, but is again not practical. You can't use blue light when trying to look for something in your room during the night time. Of course there is the bathroom light, but when sharing the room with two other people, that's not always accessible. The showers are annoying, for whatever reason they only have 1/2 a door so all the water splashes out and drenches the throw towel that is used for the floor. The AC also did not work very well and in PR's July humidity, AC is a must. The staff is fairly pleasan, the valet men and the door men who hang about outside are absolutely terrrific! The most coolest and down the earth people I've ever met. The rooftop bar was pretty cool but they did charge $2 for a cup of ice... just ice! I am very particular about beds and my bed was very comfy. I stayed on the top floor and I didn't have any complaints about the noise coming fromt he rooftop... not sure what those other folks are talking about. Would I stay here again... not unless they fix the blue lighting. Relying on that blue light to look for something after the sun goes down gets annoying fast.

Reviews.Title: “ARGH!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: malted22
Reviews.Content: I just came back from this hotel and am furious that I paid anything to stay here. First of all, they try and create a romantic atmosphere in the hotel with dim blue lighting, but it only makes the place look scarier and feel like a hospital with all the white curtains and bedsheets in the hotel room. The lobby is quite small, as well as my room. But that's not the worst. On our 2nd day there, we got back to the room around 1 and nothing had been done to the room, no fresh towels, bed unmade, nothing new and we needed to take showers. I went downstairs to complain and the girl at the desk jotted down my room # and told me someone will go up soon. My friend and I left and came back around 3:30 and still nothing had been done. I went down a 2nd time and spoke with the manager. She got someone right away to go up, but my room should have been cleaned that MORNING! When my friend and I got back around 5, they were STILL in there, finishing up, so we had to wait in the scary blue hallway until they were done and even then, the maid came back because she had forgotten the toilet paper and soaps. As if that wasn't enough, that night when I went to go to bed, I noticed one of the pillowcases had several marks on it, which I don't even want to think about where they might have come from! The bus that takes you to Old San Juan is up the block, around the corner and down another block and after walking through the humid heat to even get to the bus, it takes close to an hour for it to come, hindering on your day greatly. We ended up taking a cab which cost us $15 after I talked him down. The only good thing I can say is it's very close to a supermarket, Subway, gift shop, Walgreen's, etc. And yeah yeah yeah, the staff was all smiles and friendly, but that means nothing to me if I don't get service I'm paying or. And that rooftop bar and lounge is a joke! NO ONE was up there all the times we went (Friday included), they played techno instead of latin music and the beds are covered in sand and water. I will never stay here again and am so sorry I did in the first place. If they were smart business people, they would have offered me a new room, but now all they get is non-referrals and bad mouthing from my friend and I.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel to stay at...”
Reviews.Author: yasseravila09
Reviews.Content: We arrived thursday morning and the first thing we got at the hotel was a very nice greet from the valet peeps.The staff inside the hotel "The best" from the beggining to end. And the roof top thats the place to be on friday nites and saturday.I really love the blue walls at nite, the hotel totally transform at nite...I just love it and will soon come back...

Reviews.Title: “Great Beachfront Hotel in Isla Verde”
Reviews.Author: jimbo89rho
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Water Club from Monday, July 7th through Friday, July 10th. The hotel was fantastic and lived up to its billing as a smaller, unique alternative to the large resort hotels in Isla Verde. The view from the rooftop pool and bar was beautiful. The staff were very friendly. Great beach and overall location for any trips in Puerto Rico. Drugstores and grocery stores nearby for supplies as well as the high end resorts with casinos for nightlife and gaming. I would definitely go back to this hotel. The hotel, decor and vibe are suited for younger travellers. Great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Keep Searching, Don't fall for the well kept website!”
Reviews.Author: soji5
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at this hotel because of the cool website and amazing pictures. This was a huge mistake! We drove up to the hotel and first noticed that it was located on a very dirty part of the beach. The valet doormen were very nice but that was about all the professionalism you will get out of this hotel. I am trying not to be so one sided because this was my personal experience but this place did not live up to half of what it displays on the website and that was dissapointing. Alot of people rely on the information that they find on the web. The staff was not friendly at all, I dont need all smiles and handshakes but smart remarks at concerns that I had are not acceptable.
