My room had not been properly cleaned prior to my arrival, gross sexual content was found under my bed. I tried informing the staff and recieved a smart remark as if it was my own trash. Management then offered to have someone clean up the mess but not change rooms. :( I was completely at a loss for words and felt disgusted to even try and stay the night. I checked out at my own loss. This place needs new management! We later found many other hotels in San Juan that were extremely polite and unique such as El Convento. Keep searching, their are many others to choose from. Dont make the same mistake.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small hotel”
Reviews.Author: HollyWItt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the recommendation of my sister who came last year. This is a lovely small hotel. The staff is delightful - especially William at the front door! For someone who travels for work, I prefer to stay at a more intimate hotel than a big "chain" hotel. Food at the restaurant is very good. The pool on the roof is really just a pool in name, but refreshing for a quick cool off. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others if they are looking for personalized attention over lots of amenities like a casino etc.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Have Your Wedding Here!!”
Reviews.Author: jessng83
Reviews.Content: Well we found this hotel through long internet searching. We planned for a small beachside destination wedding in Puerto Rico. We both have never been to the island and not sure what to expect. We then found and spoke to the wedding and catering sales manager, Marilyn at the Water and Beach Club. There she said not to worry about a permit for they have there own platform and quoted us a price. We were happy to have found a place that seemed to good to be true, that's because it was! After receiving her rate we sent our contract back to the hotel through air mail. She said that the canopy priced increased and because she had not received anything, this was the price to set. Ok, not happy about that but will get over it. Then THREE weeks before the wedding they tell me they can not do the beach side wedding without a permit. This permit was a non refundable extra $500.00. And still this permit may not have enough time to review and if it was denied we would still lose the $500.00. THIS IS AFTER THE CONTRACT HAD BEEN SIGNED AND ACCEPTED! This is very upsetting so close to the date and the worst part was they did not seem sympathetic at all or offer any compensation. After settling for the site on their terrace I ask for some compensation. After a week of not hearing anything from them, even after multiple emails and messages. I call the GM and he does not offer anything, we had to demand a free stay at there hotel for failing to live up to their contract. This was a small feat at which should have been easy for them to arrange and still that was a struggle. The worst is yet to come. When we arrive THE DAY OF Marilyn says the seating arrangement we had would not be able to comfortable seat the people we had in its original spot. So she offers 3 other sites within the hotel. After we choose another alternative, she then says we can not have the space due to THE POSSIBILITY THAT THEY HAVE PAYING PATRONS USE THE SITE FOR MASSAGES!!! Then after expressing my distaste in this hotel she says that I may use that site for an additional 250 charge. This hotel does not care at all about the thoughts and feelings of there guests!! A wedding is a special event and should be treated as so. Yet massages for other guest were more important then my dinner reception. These people falied to first know the limitations of their beach permits then treat me like it didn't matter to them how we felt about the situation. Not even to offer something to ease the situation. Even the GM did not give any consolation. I felt as if they cared only for the money they previously received and since they knew we couldn't leave after such short notice and took full advantage of that. DO NOT use this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Something different”
Reviews.Author: PonceUnclejack
Reviews.Content: -Stayed on june 2008 for wedding anniversary -water themed hotel, water running everywhere -10 steps from the beach - breathtaking pool and lounge area on top floor - contemporary decor - friendly staff - valet parking....everything is easier - Tangerine restaurant on lobby.....must eat there!!!!!!!!!!! - Choose room far from elevator.....middle of building...to avoid elevator noise and loud music on top floor during weekends...but don't get me wrong the parties at the Wet Bar are great!!! -NO complimentary breakfast - I paid about $220 per night incluiding taxes and fees for ocean view room, king size bed, cableTv, safe, mini bar, radio ipod ready, great room decor and lighting. will I return?.... definitely YES!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: JuneSNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 5 days at San Juan Water & Beach Club Hotel back in March. Previously, we stayed at Ritz Carlton when we visited San Juan. But, since Ritz Carlton changed the pet policy (we like to travel with our pet Chihuahua, Bruiser), we decided to give Water and Beach Club a try. Normandie Hotel, another dog friendly hotel in San Juan, was a disaster. Since we read a lot of negative reviews about the hotel, we came prepared, mentally as well. One thing that we worried the most was the noise level due to loud music from the roof top, as this loudness seemed to be the common complaints based on other people's reviews. So, we brought ear plugs, so that we could sleep at night. Surprisingly, it was not anywhere near as bad as we expected. What bothered us more was that walls were so thin that you could hear "everything" from the room next to you. Other than that, we were suprised to find that we had a very pleasant experience at the hotel. All staff were extremely warm, friendly, and helpful. In fact, I just received an email from Virna, Manager of Desires (membership that you can enroll when you visit the hotel site), wishing me Happy Birthday. Our ocean front room was very nice, good size for San Juan hotel, and had a great view of the beautiful beach. The hotel is also conveniently located to go to Old San Juan and visit other beaches etc. We did not eat at the hotel, as we have been to San Juan so many times, and we have our favorite restaurants. Here are a few restaurants that we recommend : 1) Marmalada located in Old San Juan - amazing food. This is our favorite. 2) Pikayo located at Museum of Art of Puerto Rico - great food and amazing service. We could not believe that the restaurant staff remembered where we sat and what food we ordered 6 months ago. 3) Aguaviva located in old San Juan - great seafood. For breakfast, we were initially going to Inter-Continental, as this hotel is a short walk from San Juan Water and Beach Club Hotel. But after 2 days, we found a local diner nearby and had breakfast there each morning instead of spending $60 for two at Inter-Continental. Getting back to the resort, one thing that we loved was that the hotel is extremely dog friendly. Every one loved our Chihuahua, Bruiser. It was so cool that we could bring him with us to the roof top where the swimming pool was and hang out there all day. So, for pet lovers, we highly recommend this hotel. The beach across from the hotel is not like the US Virgin Island or British Virgin Island beach with powderly white sand and turquoise blue water. But, it is very pretty and it goes on for miles. The hotel will provide you with beach chairs and towels. All in all, we were happy with the hotel. This hotel is great for a quick getaway, not for long vacation. Staff are pleasant, nice size room with great view and the location is pretty good if you have a car. Most likely, we will return for another quick getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Trying to Be Chic & Trendy Boutique But Falls Short of Expectations !!”
Reviews.Author: AnonXer
Reviews.Content: Maybe my opinion of the San Juan Water & Beach Club Hotel in Isla Verde is a bit jaded since I live in Miami, Florida where I'm accustomed to experiencing a certain level of decor, fashion, comfort, and style from South Beach Hotels. Whomever said the Beach Club is 'good' chic hotel was probably blinded by the horrible ultra-violet lighting that makes everything pale blue! The stark bone-white walls illuminate the hotel and rooms like some crazy Halloween nightmare turning everything you see into a haze. Try to look closely and you'll find filthy walls, old curtains, poor lighting and dirty water walls, tacky glass elevator with cracked mirrors, roof top bar with mismatched seats, torn leather coaches, compact rooms with little closet space and small closed hallways that hide the cave of rooms. The place was simply unkept to a standard of Chic Boutique Hotel !! Fridays/Saturdays are impossible to relax as the hotel hosts parties on the roof top patio that lasts until 3am! AVOID the food at the hotel's restaurant as it is flavorless of what true Puerto Rico cuisine should be!! Concierge was unknowledgable about local restaurants with delicious cuisines only recommending high end places. Valet is almost mandatory charge of $15-20 bucks per night since there is no parking for guests. The hotel is situated at a Dead End street off the main "Popular" tourist avenue called 37 Ctra Avenue of Isla Verde. Good Luck finding free parking on the side of the roads since almost everyone takes their claim by 6PM. The waters off Isla Verde was merky with violent swirls of sand that polished your skin with abrasions. And this is typical. The Beach Club certainly tries to be chic, hip and trendy but fails horribly by any standards. Maybe this is was Puerto Rican's call Miami Art Deco style. The hotel had potential 5 years ago but today it certainly needs to lower it's expensive rates and invest on repairing the interiors that are out-dated and used.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Service Needs Renovation”
Reviews.Author: DaveConnecticut
Reviews.Content: I just returned last night from 8 days in San Juan; we spent the last three nights at the Water Club. I had high expectations for an awesome experience and chose the Water Club sight unseen. I heard and read a lot about it and felt that it was a match for the experience I wanted; luxurious, great service, cool aesthetic. I must say the service was GREAT. They really do a great job. Eveyone smiled, they refered to me by my name, the doormen introduced themselves, shook out hands, very very positive and happy -- all the time. Eveyone gave off the impression of kindness and concern. They all have great personalities. That's the positive. The negative - the aesthetic needs a total overhall. The concept is cool and in its day Im sure it was. Magazine clippings framed on the lobby walls indicte that it was selected as one of the top hotels "in the world." When you look at the date of the article, you find its 2003. There is no way its one of the best hotels in the world. Walking up the front steps to the entrance you see chucks of the concrete stairs missing, concrete railing pillars crumbling (not exaggerating). Not a great first impression. The lobby looks cool overall but when your eyes focus on the details you notice that its all tired -- all the walls are covered in out of date white polyester shears, floor to ceiling, The blue light that illuniates all the common areas including the lobby hides the dirt well, but if you're a clean freak like me, its dirty. The water fall in the elevator is cool but dated, it needs repair and you can see that the glass is stain, there are blue mozaic tiles missing, etc. You get off the elevaor and step into common halls which are extremely dark, lit only by blue light. All walls are covered by white sheers which are dirty - how could they not be?. The sound of the ocean is piped thru the halls, which is cool. You feel in a way that you're under water, the concept is cool. I walked into the room and the stench of dirty water which had been slopped over the floor by a dirty mop hit me like a ton of bricks, that was aweful. I told the maid that I didnt want the floors mopped at all during my stay. The room however is cool, no complaints, linens were great and very clean, bathroom was updated, but again, those white floor to celiing sheers on the walls and the blue light. Everything is lit by blue light; however the chioce to switch on headboard halogen and an incandescent floor lamp was available. The partial ocean view was just that, partial. You couldnt see the ocean unless you walked up agianst the window and looked to the left; you couldnt see the water from anywhere in the room. The room didnt have adequate storage for clothes, you had to live out of your suitcase, which isnt so bad if thats what you're used to. The location on the ocean is great, although I thought that the beach area in front of the hotel was dirty; its also a local beach and people on the island litter like crazy and no one cleans up, at least not for the three days I was there. The ocean front is great nonetheless. The area outside the hotel is nothing at all, many American fast food places around, the area is not glamorous at all, but it did seem safe, which is important. I prefer the Condado area; its much better in terms of choices of fthings to do, at night especially.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Water Club”
Reviews.Author: TENN_Beach_Bum
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at the Water Club. I'm not sure what was better: the room, the view, the beach or the service. We had a beach view and it definitely was worth the extra money. Every aspect of our stay was comfortable and relaxing. The water theme is carried out through the property and the rooms. The staff goes out of their way to provide to your every need. I highly recommend this hotel and I hope to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sexy Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: yasijoon
Reviews.Content: The Water Club is a sexy boutique hotel located right on the popular Isla Verde Beach. The best part of the stay are the parties on the rooftop on Fri & Sat nights. The hotel staff is extremely helpful and professional. It's a perfect place for a long weekend with friends. This hotel is not for families with small children, or older couples who want a secluded quiet trip. See Pics!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Really Made My Vacation Great!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chocreintx
Reviews.Content: I recently vacationed in P.R. and stayed at this hotel. My experience was great!!!! The hotel was very hip, chic, and trendy. The staff went out of their way to make us feel welcomed. The room's decor was very modern/art deco and we had a beautiful view of the ocean. At night, with a flick of a switch the room was illuminated with blue lighting (which made for very interesting nights!LOL). The roof top club and bar (WET) was definitely a hot spot to party and hang out, and the restaurant (Tangerine) had great food. If you are old, arrogant, bothered by noise, think your better than others, or have a stick up your ass for any reason,then this is NOT the hotel for you!!!! If you are hip, trendy, have a modern appeal to you, mix and play well with the "beautiful people", and like a party atmosphere this IS the place for you!!! Needless to stay, when I return to Puerto Rico (and you know I will) I will definitely stay at this hotel!!! Dr. C. Lewis Houston, TX.

Reviews.Title: “Thought it was a Sick Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nooromid
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this boutique hotel situated right on the beach in Isla Verde. The service was great, the ambiance was excellent, the location was ideal, and the people were interesting. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, particularly younger travelers since there is a bar/lounge on the rooftop where locals and tourists come to party on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “HEAVEN!”
Reviews.Author: KWMartinez
Reviews.Content: You are treated like you are family! From the day we arrived to the day we left, you made us feel like we were part of one big family. This is the most romantic, and relaxing hotel I have ever had the pleasure of experiencing.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE the Water and Beach Club!!!”
Reviews.Author: loverofvacay
Reviews.Content: San Juan Water and Beach Club is my new favorite place!!.. I have stayed in some very nice places but this was beyond my expectations.. It is a perfect sized boutique hotel with a very cozy/beachy/classy decor... The staff was over the top!! everyone went above and beyond what could ever be expected and they really had that "family" feel.. no one was just doing a job they all genuinely care! It made my time wonderful.. on the hottest day the beach attendant brought us icy cold wash clothes to cool off!!! I spent my birthday there and there were balloons and cake brought to my room.. and no hesitation to make dinner reservations for my friends and I .. I will deffinately be back time and time again..

Reviews.Title: “Night Club or Hotel???”
Reviews.Author: Pit388
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ©e and I, along with her parents, stayed at this hotel April 10-13.The purpose of our trip was to scout venues for our wedding. Despite a pleasant experience with friendly bell and front desk staff, Friday would entail the beginning of some major challenges. Upon returning to the hotel on Friday evening we recognized a multitude of activity both inside and outside of the hotel. It was clear the restaurant and roof top bar were both very popular on the weekend. The problem is the music being played, particularly the sound of the bass, made it impossible for us to sleep. The noise did not subside until 2AM, essentially destroying any potential of a good nightâ€™s sleep. Much to our chagrin, the unbearable noise levels would continue on Saturday evening and persist until after 3AM! My future mother-in-law called the front desk and complained about the intrusive noise. The front desk agent advised they could accommodate a room change, however this obviously was not a practical solution at that time of the morning. That afternoon we inquired about utilizing the venue for a Friday evening rehearsal type event. We were advised someone would call us on our cell phone. We did not hear from him and therefore requested he meet with us when we returned to the hotel in the afternoon. He briefly spoke with us and was smug at best. He advised there is a 10K minimum for the roof top space during that time frame. To be honest, we would not spend ten dollars with him based on his poor and unaccommodating attitude. Later in the day we spotted him standing on the beach. We called him over and attempted to again converse about the possibility of having the event there. He appeared annoyed when we asked him to put a proposal together for us prior to our departure the next day (Sunday). We asked him to leave it for us and of course he did not. Based on his insulting attitude we were not surprised. The most frustrating part of the experience was that there was absolutely no communication regarding the potential for noise disruption on either night. I do not have to guess if this was an accident. Every guest of that hotel should be made aware at check-in, or prior to booking, of the noise levels that persist into the wee hours of the morning. The hotel has obviously made a choice to be a night club on the weekends at the price of its unsuspecting hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: SFischbach
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and had a great time. The staff was exceptional, the room was clean and had a great view of the sea. I was nervous about all of the "noise" in other reviews, but on our Wed. Thur. and Friday night stay we never heard a thing. This hotel is close to everything and a great starting off point for doing and seeing many of the main things that PR has to offer. The staff could not have been more helpful. The valets, restaurant and front desk were very attentive and the beach guy came with the chairs before we could pick out our spot on the beach. Great location, great room and great staff -- you can't ask for more when travelling.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Racket!”
Reviews.Author: wlatc
Reviews.Content: Rule # 1 in the medical profession: Do no harm. Rule # 1 in the hospitality profession: Do not deliberately antagonize guests and potential guests. The San Juan Water and Beach Club, a boutique (read â€œsmallâ€�) hotel in San Juan, Puerto Rico attacks this rule â€œBig Timeâ€�! I climbed the crumbling steps up to the small lobby and discovered problem number one: In an effort to be â€œhipâ€�, I suppose, the public areas are lit in a strange blue hue. It does look cool, I admit, but you soon realize you canâ€™t see a thing, especially if youâ€™ve just come out of the bright tropical sunshine. I groped my way to an elevator and stumbled on the miss-aligned entryway. â€œMy friend has tripped on that twice,â€� a fellow passenger told me. To this point, I admit, my complaints are rather trivial. Here is how General Manager Bob Sassani really puts it to his guests: NOISE. Iâ€™m talking chest-thumping, window-rattling, concrete-vibrating noise. As many as four nights a week, DJ â€œTall Rickâ€� sets up a frightening battery of tweeters, woofers and sub-woofers and fires off barrage after barrage of ear-splitting racket in the outdoor, rooftop disco. This could be fun if you want to party until well past 2 AM each night; it is sheer Hell if youâ€™d like to get any sleep! Trust me, if youâ€™re over thirty, youâ€™re going to wanna take out DJ Tall Rick, GM Sassani and anyone else associated with this amateurish excuse for a hotel. I tried calling the night manager one morning after 2 AM to run up a white flag of surrender, but no one would speak to me. â€œCall back tomorrow,â€� desk clerk Cynthia instructed. A resort condo a few blocks away is organizing legal action to put a lid on this rude neighbor, a place that is giving Puerto Rico tourism a black eye. Water Club, take the racket inside, tone it down and . . . grow up!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gpw1967
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 nights at Water Club enroute home from the Carribean. The staff were very friendly and helpful but this was the only positive. From the moment we entered the elevator we knew we had made a mistake. We left the hotel after the first night [they can keep the $$] and found a great B&B in Old SJ. Water Club had its day about 10-12 years ago based on the decor and the place is in disrepair. The walls are paper thin, you hear everything and light coming through the door edges. There is absolutley no way this is a 4 star hotel. I would give it a 2. We booked based on the hotel website and the reviews posted, at $300/night figured it should be a fairly good choice.....NOT!! I am surpirsed to read the positive reviews about the hotel decor and the location. Isle Verde is a dump, at least for the well travelled. Try Old SJ.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: NaturalBlaze
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at The San Juan Water and Beach Club Hotel from 03/30 to 04/03/08. Besides a little complaint about the doorless/curtainless shower (which can make the bathroom floor very wet if not careful during a shower), WE LOVED IT!!!! Beautiful beach front, wonderful/helpful staff (offers any help you need, recommends excellent restaurants, and suggests cool trips/tours you can take during your stay), intimate atmosphere, modern design, and convenient location (walking distance to a variety of local & fastfood restaurants, souvenir shops, and even Walgreen)!!! We will definitely go back to this hotel and we strongly recommend it to whomever desires to have a vacation in Puerto Rico!!!! We had a wonderful trip!! This hotel is AWESOME!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at SJ Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: Almost40!
Reviews.Content: We stayed at SJ Water & Beach club for 3 nites at the end of march, 2008 as a way to finish off our Caribbean holiday. We have stayed in SJ 2 other times but this was our first experience at this trendy hotel. First location, location, location! We love the fact that you are in Isla Verde next to the other big hotels but you are on your own section of beach and have the more unique hotel service and amenities. It was a nice change from big resort feel to have the roof top lounge with comfortable day beds - loved ordering our breakfast to be delivered to the roof top and lounge on the big beds reading a book and sipping a coffee. The rooms are not large or well-appointed since it has the minimalistic, hip design flair. But they are attractive if you like a more modern approach. bottom line is that we felt the service of doormen, front desk staff, and lounge staff to be above average and we loved the location and modern approach in the middle of SJ. One tip for an afternoon/evening in old SJ - after spending an hour or so at the Fort you have to wander the cobblestone streets and then discover some of the best cocktails and tapas bars we have had in a long time. Our favorite pick other than the usual old stand by of Il Convento was "Toro Salvao" in old San Juan - fantastic tapas and we got a table outside in the square which made our last nite magical!

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but not great...”
Reviews.Author: AllisonTPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days at the Water Club and had an alright time. The staff is very helpful and the hotel was clean and nice in a very minimalist way that we appreciated. We really liked our room and loved the option of moving up to the roof top pool/lounge area when it got too windy for the beach (which it did...4 out of 6 days). We are a mid 20s couple and we left for vacation expecting to have a great time...We did like the beach, the weather, our room, and the cute coffee shop/bakery down the street. But generally, we were very disspointed by the surrounding area. Yes, you can get a great meal at El San Juan down the street (we went to Coco for Caribbean cuisine) BUT it will cost you. Pretty much every place you will find to eat is in a hotel. You will basically spend your entire vacation in various hotels eating, or on the beach. The area is definitely a bit seedy...we are from Philly and are used to a bit of ghetto flavor, but I have to admit, there were several times that I felt unsafe. If you are looking for a long weekend get away and you WANT to eat and sit on the beach and don't care about doing much else, this place is great. We were there for a bit too long and by the time we were leaving we were more than ready to go home. I would reccomend having this place be your arrival and departure hotel on your way to and from Fajardo and Culebra. Staying at the Water Club for your whole vacation is rather uneventful. If the weather isn't great you really will have nothing to do other than visit the other hotels along the strip or sit at the roof top bar. As a side note, we had a great experience with Little Shogun, the sushi bar at Wet. We ate there twice...it was delicious and very reasonably priced. All in all, the Water Club is nice. I would stay there for a quick get away, but not for a major vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: robiebobie
Reviews.Content: My family and friends have visited the San Juan Water and Beach Club 3 times in the last 13 months. As travelers to some the worlds best hotels and resorts we can undoubtedly say that this hotel is a small gem. The property is beautiful, hip, and well maintained. The staff from top to bottom are the best we have ever experienced. If you want a truly extraordinary vacation experience book the San Juan Water and Beach Hotel- you will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe the Negativity!”
Reviews.Author: micaron
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I always value peoples opinions on this site and use it whenever I travel. I have just returned from a trip to the Water Club and am so amazed at the negativity of some people. First the neighborhood being shoddy: This hotel is in Isla Verde and is walking distance to the El San Juan and some really nice restaurants. It is not in a dirty or bad neighborhood. I have visited San Juan many times and can tell you there are some bad areas - this is not one of them. Second this is not a star resort with tons of amenities: If you want that stay at the Ritz down the street. This hotel is chic and while it does tend to try to be a little trendy, the blue lights in the rooms were really calming and relaxing. The furnishings are modern with an Asian twist and spot on for the environment they are trying to create. The music that plays in the lobby is light trance music. And my room was on the highest floor next to the rooftop bar and it was a weekend and I could barely hear anything. Third: Definitely try your best to come up with the extra money to get an ocean front suite. It is really hip and has a totally seperate living room and much more drawer space and clothes hanging area. The beach was right out your front door... might as well be ocean front and was very clean and relaxing and it was easter weekend. In short, this is a great hotel with very good service and friendly people. The only negative - I have travelled the world and eaten sushi in many places and it is not good. I sampled alot and it was not fresh. But everything else is great. Definitely a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Beach_Traveller_Duo
Reviews.Content: Once again our stay at the Water Club was wonderful and a trip we look forward to all year, and when it was time to leave it was hard to do so. As usual, we stayed for two weeks (not long enough!!) and have been staying at the Water Club for the past ten years. Truly, it is our winter vacation retreat. Bob, Virna, Gerardo, Mateo and all of the staff (our hotel family) are exceptional and all are graciously accommodating â€“ itâ€™s like arriving at our second home. The young ladies at the front desk, and they know who they are, were always smiling and happy to see us, and always asked how our day or night was. And, William and staff were always at the door welcoming us back from any activity we were out doing. This is something that they all do, not only to returning guests, but also to new ones â€“ whether staying for business or pleasure. We cannot say enough about them all. They all make a great first impression - very important when travelling. Our room (as usual) provided fantastic views (from all angles) of the skyline, beach, and the planes taking off and landing. We love staying in Puerto Rico and particularly the Water Club, this spot is one of the best!!! Over the years, those we have recommended to stay here have enjoyed it and return when they can. The beach is one of the loveliest on the island and a main reason we return. Towels, chairs and umbrellas are provided for guests; Kevin had our usual spot set up and ready and waiting for us daily. There was always an opportunity to get food and beverages delivered to our chairs (with a smile) for those of us soaking up the sun and enjoying the surfâ€¦. Of course, those who prefer the roof top bar (Wet) will not be disappointed in the food, pina coladas, mojitos, etc., and, of course, the view. Our food at Tangerine and Wet was always very good and flavorful - and, the music â€“ well, letâ€™s just say there was music Friday and Saturday nights. Great for the younger crowd. While we return year after year and our relationships with everyone has grown over time, we feel we are treated very special and like close family â€“ but, the staff at the Water Club is genuinely caring and truly enjoy what they do, and when they say â€œmy pleasureâ€� they sincerely mean it â€“ from the GM to our dear friend Wilfredo (the Painter!!); we miss you.

Reviews.Title: “Super Charming & Alternative Welcoming!”
Reviews.Author: mrcoolgaytraveler
Reviews.Content: The Water Club is a charming boutique style hotel. It offers a fabulous beachfront location, but even more special are the staff, who make guests feel like returning family members. The staff here could give lessons to their colleagues at more exclusive hotels. They ALWAYS offered a smile and greeting. Housekeeping was diligent, and quiet. The Bar staff, friendly and outgoing. The Sushi Chef could be the most highly credentialed in the Caribbean. I've just returned from 5 nights there. I can't remember when I had a nicer time staying at a hotel. I was travelling by myself on business. In the evening, I hoped to have a little fun. After all this is San Juan. The hotel is clearly gay friendly, but hardly exclusively so. It's a great place to meet people, especially when travelling alone, as I was. Perhaps they should consider a "tea dance" one night on the roof. It could be FABULOUS! Even still, sitting on the roof alone is a pleasure, and the Mojitos, expertly made, bring it all to fruition. I loved the bath products, my oceanfront room, and the welcoming eye contact, greetings and smiles from all the hotel staff. It made me feel like this was my second home. If only all hotels trained their staff to smile and nod at their guests, it makes such a huge difference. Made me feel special. The lighting is a bit funky, and my room could've used a full length mirror, but these are minor. The main thing is I didn't feel like I was part of a corporate machine as guests often do at mainstream hotels like Ritz Carlton or Embassy Suites. This was fully personalized all the way. I can't wait to go back! The furnishings are a little bit worn, but the bed is comfy and the sheets are 100% egyptian cotton. The bath products are by H20 and make for a luxurious shower experience (though the shower has some leak challenges. I didn't worry about it though and left that to Housekeeping.)

Reviews.Title: “True Service”
Reviews.Author: thehappytraveler421
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the the hotel both last February and again this year trying to get away from the cold of NY. The hotel does need some work and they are honest about it but the level of service that they provide surpasses all the negatives. Yes, the music is loud from the wet lounge but why would you stay there if you werenâ€™t planning on being at the party. Staff makes you feel like you have known them forever from the first time you walk into the lobby. The view from the ocean front rooms is spectacular. The new menu at wet is great pricey but great. In all honesty if youâ€™re looking for total peace and quiet this isnâ€™t the place for you. If you want to relax on the beach during the day and party at night you should make your reservation after reading this. The other hotels in the area should model whatever type of service training is offered their because not even the Ritz can contest.

Reviews.Title: “Leaky Elevators and Loud Rooms at the Sinking Water Club”
Reviews.Author: abeckler
Reviews.Content: Two years ago my husband and I visited the Water Club for a night out on their roof terrace- back then the party was going, the hotels' lobby and fixtures were newer and much nicer. Unfortunately the hotel has worn very poorly- we returned last month to find one of the lifts was sporadically out of service and one of the glass walls in the other one was leaking water- all over my husbands shirt! The rooms were a disappointment. . . we actually moved from one room to a different one because the walls are paper thin and our neighbors next door were vigorously "testing" the mattress springs- the second room wasn't much better since paying a premium for an ocean view room means you are overlooking the valet parking area- so your choice is to be on a high floor and hear the music and din of people from the rooftop or be on a lower floor and listen to the cars pulling up and blasting music. The bathrooms are very small, there isn't any place to store your clothing (read: no real closet space to speak of), the lighting consist of a few cheap lamps and this weird blue florescent lighting, and finally the window unit AC is loud and needs to be replaced. This was a quick weekend trip my husband and IU were looking forward ot just unwinding and not doing much of anything but unfortunately we returned from the trip more exhausted than anything after losing sleep for three night between the noise of the people in the hallway, rooms next door, the street noise, the bar noise and the AC turning on and off TRYING to keep the room cool. All in all it was a massive disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “The Water Closet”
Reviews.Author: ajthompson76
Reviews.Content: This hotel has made a great investment in their stylish website, which is a good way to convince tourists of the value of a $300+ per night hotel room. The staff were very warm and personable. Everything else was dismal. The rooftop bar was resplendent with dying plants, torn and mildewing cushions, and a grimy pool. The room was small, the ocean-view window was in serious need of a washing. An antique cassette/CD player sound system was provided. The drain in the bathroom sink didn't work. The fashionably white furniture was glaringly soiled. The noise from neighbors and the hallway at all hours was reminiscent of a hostel. The maid left our door ajar for an entire day after cleaning the room. The celebrated waterfall elevator is surrounded with water scale, and the sound of the pumps is obnoxious. The stylish blue lights throughout the hotel do a good job of camouflaging the extensive lack of upkeep. I expect much more for this price - stay at a chain hotel instead.

Reviews.Title: “Gone Downhill”
Reviews.Author: MNDC
Reviews.Content: You can tell this hotel might have been kind of special at one time. Also, most of the staff are friendly and helpful. Now the hotel needs to be repainted and thoroughly cleaned, and the cheap materials they used when they rehabbed last (2002?) are falling apart. Mixed with the generally stuck-up attitude of the place, the price you pay, and the space-age aesthetic it's pretty pathetic. Other things I didn't like: * The phone system blocks you from using calling cards. * The "business center" is one clunky old Mac in a closet that uses Firefox. * The area (Isla Verde) is boring and has no charm unless you like overpriced food and throwing your money away at second-rate casinos. Spare yourself the disappointment. Stay somewhere in Old San Juan, and go somewhere else on the island for swimming and snorkeling.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BKxLatina
Reviews.Content: I LOVE this place! The staff is great and the ambiance is CHILL to the 10th power. The room was off the hook with a beautiful view of the beach and the lighting is something straight out of "Belly". Take two steps away from the hotel and you can be sipping pina coladas on the beach and bathing in the sun. Kevin will make sure you have all the chairs and towels you need and Willie will be waiting for you at the door to welcome you back from a long day of chilling. The rooftop is the perfect place to kick back during the day and shake what your mama gave you at night. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: mor526
Reviews.Content: My husband and I & another couple stayed for one week and loved it!!! It is right on the beach and the service is excellent. Every-one was very attentive. We would highly recommend this hotel to others. We will be returning to Puerto Rico this summer and will be staying at The Water Beach Club again. We are in our 50's and enjoyed the youthful atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “The Water Club is a third-rate hotel the Restaurant is wretched”
Reviews.Author: Larry66
Reviews.Content: Don't believe the ads! Rooms lack space to accommodate even carry-on-only travelers. Makeup: no space, no light other than weak sink fixture and blue fluorsecents behind sheer curtains, flaking the room, even covering over the bathroom door. Why fight a curtain before opening a door? Noise. Noisy? No, LOUD! You'd swear the iice machine is in your room's *non-existent* closet and hallway conversations are pillow-talk . Chest of 3 drawers: total unit measurements approx 18"w x 28" h. Stuff it all in that! Hang-up space for dresses, slacks? Nope, goes in that dollhouse set of drawers! Don't go think about watching Superbowl. TV recpetion = Fairbanks white-out! Don't bring books to read in room poorly lit with a single broken lamp, execpt for aforemntioned overbounteous blue fluorescents. Room so small, desk is small sheet of sculpt glass hung by cables fastened to peg board on reverse side of headboard. Noise from the roof-top band rattled bathroom mirror until 2 a.m. Friday night, 4 a.m. on Saturday night. The Tangerine restaurant: $17 for Caesar Salad (several pieces of lettuce slightly larger than the overlaying anchovie); Shrimp enedible, tasted & smelled sewer-farmed over linguini coiled in tasteless library paste. Snapper cardbard-bone-dry , inedible too. Housekeeping is spotty at best. Over-friendly staff is a blatant coverup to dilute impact of a very shoddy, disfunctional, facility, extremely over-photoshoped, glorified and overpriased for advertising.

Reviews.Title: “Weird, but interesting”
Reviews.Author: luvPR
Reviews.Content: The San Juan Water & Beach Club is definitely an experience! Have you ever seen a waterwall INSIDE an elevator? Pretty cool! The room had the feel of a disco with purple neon lights and gauzy curtains everywhere. The view from the 8th floor was gorgeous. The room was comfortable enough, but it was very noisy outside the hotel, inside our room, and in the hallway. I think it's because there are so many hard surfaces in the hotel that sound travels WAY too well! The bathroom was beautiful, but the shower wall leaked onto the floor, and the water pressure was a bit low--took a long time to rinse the shampoo out of my hair! Staff was friendly and helpful. The sushi chef was very friendly and knowledgable--made us some GREAT sushi too! The bar area was overrun with a VERY loud party, but we had the sushi bar to ourselves. I think our 25-ish daughters would enjoy this place more than we did. It was just a little too much.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Honeymoon Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Lomstradamus
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend The Water and Beach Club to anyone wanting to stay at a beach hotel that is clean and the staff is helpful and upbeat. We loved visiting San Juan on our 10 day Honeymoon and the Water and Beach Club made us feel right at home. The Valet William helped us plan and find places in Puerto Rico that we would have never found on our own and was like part of our family.

Reviews.Title: “LOUD Techno Party”
Reviews.Author: NateDogg2
Reviews.Content: The San Juan Water and Beach Club may have been a cool place to stay back in the late 1990's when black lights and techno music was in. Unfortunately in 2008, the hotel has obviously seen it's day come and go. The general look and feel of the hotel is one that is meant to overload the senses (once again, this may be cool if your on E). Most of the lighting throughout the hotel is by blue or black lights; in all of the rooms, hallways, elevators and common area's. There is a recurring soundtrack of waves crashing that is played ever so loudly in the hallways. That is layered on top of loud, cheesy techno music. So much so that you can hear it while you lay in your bed. The elevators and the ends of the hallways have waterfalls inside of them. The first time you ride in a elevator with a clear ceiling, a waterfall on the back wall, filled with blue lights, and blaring techno music you might think that it is cool(if your a raver-monkey). The WORST part of our stay at the hotel came at night. There was a planned rooftop party with 5 different DJ's that started at 11 and went until 5AM. The techno music was loud enough to keep even the soundest sleepers (such as myself) awake. But it was the drunken people in the hallways screaming that really put me over the top. I remember looking at my cool bedside IPod clock stereo when I heard the last yelling at 4:56AM. We were offered bottles of water in return for the worst nights sleep the next morning. The hotels restaurant "Tangerine" had an appetizing menu, and promised an award winning chef; however the food was nothing special. My sister had a $20 caprese salad, which consisted of 2 slices of tomato and one slice of mozzarella. I had a small $30 dish of linguine with 4 shrimp on it, with the most unflavorful cream sauce. My wife had $36 ribs that tasted great but were colder than room temperature. Our room had a very dirty floor. Sand had not been swept up since the last guests. Over near the window where the air conditioner was, the pergo flooring was all bubbled and peeling from previous water damage. In the bathroom, as you can read from many other guests reviews, there is a pane of glass that is far to small to block the spray of the shower head. Water will go all over the floor. Hot water lasted approximately 3 minutes before turning cold. As other reviewers have said, we had no safe in our room when we showed up. They did put one in shortly after, but it was not bolted down. Which leads me to believe that the hotel has a short supply of these and rotates them around, not securing them when they do. The supposed flat screen TV was a 19" ancient Zenith TV with a mismatched remote that had electrical tape holding it together. I would be remiss if I did not point out some of the hotels good qualities. The location is on a dead end culd-de-sac right across from the beach. The location provides easy access to many of the nearby attractions and the airport. The rooftop has a fantastic view of the beach and surrounding areas. The rooftop pool is pretty cool with J Lo like white lounge couches surrounding it. (However, some had large tears in them and were obviously dirty). The free little hotel soap and shampoo was some designer stuff that was actually really nice. The IPod clock radio was another nice little touch. I have hardly ever in my life complained about a restaurant or a hotel. But I feel the need to warn those who are drawn into this hotels cool boutique feeling and inviting photographs. It is not what it appears to be.

Reviews.Title: “Loud and way passed it's prime”
Reviews.Author: bekahblue22
Reviews.Content: While the photos look great and I can appreciate what this hotel was once trying to do, it is no longer the amazing Conde Nast praised destination it once was. The design of this hotel is great. The roof top bar and lounge area is great during the day. It has an amazing view and I was able to spend a good chunk of time in the sun there. Beware of the LOUD experience... on many levels. When entering the hotel you'll be greeted with the sound of rushing water... not only are there many fountains all over the building, they pump in (loudly) the sound of running water and crashing waves. While I appreciate what they're trying to do, the water sounds pumped into every level, on every floor in every nook and cranny, are way too loud and way over done. The upsetting part of the stay was the horiffic sounds at NIGHT. And I'm not talking 10 p.m. 11 p.m. or even 12 p.m... A roof top DJ party raged well it 6 a.m. While I was staying on the 8th floor (and the roof top is the 11th), I was kept awake by blaring techo music and crazy people screaming drunk in the hall ways all night long. I am a very heavy sleeper, and it was the first time I can remember being kept awake. I was not notified that this party was taking place (by expedia, or the hotel). Upon calling the front desk at 4 a.m. 5 a.m. etc, no one even answered so that I could complain about the rediculous noise and bed base shaking boom boom techo going on. (Please note that I am 22 and not a 60 year old... I like to party as much as the next guy... and I didn't even get to bed until 1 a.m. that night anyway) In the morning the "manager" of the hotel promised to comp money for the horrible time, however this never happened and I've been sent on a wild goose chase to try and get some type of compensation for my almost 300$ night laying awake listening to screaming drunks and techno. The only up-side to the loud techo late-night/early-morning techo party was that it music was beyond loud enough to drown out the annoyingly loud water crashing waves music that may have otherwise kept me awake as well. The area surrounding the hotel is unsafe. Speaking with the bell boys, I was able to find out the area was previously very over-run with drugs etc, and that police were constantly patroling the area to try and keep an eye on the safety of the tourists. While this might appear to be comforting, be aware too that you can take a short walk around the corner to one of the worlds biggest cock-fighting arrenas. Its a stange area to stay in. While its a pretty location and the decor in the hotel is great... beware of the LOUD music and water noises. Ask in advance if there will be an all night techo party before booking a stay at the San Juan Water and Beach Club Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could be 5 star with attention to small details”
Reviews.Author: sugarbee333
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Water Club for 7 nights. While the location was great, there are some things that could be attended to that would make this a great hotel. Our room was nice - on the 9th floor, with a french balcony. We booked a deluxe room online and we had an ocean view - not ocean front, but we could see the ocean. It had a king bed, with a tv. Very clean. Now the issues - there was no bureau in our room, so we had to live out of our suitcases. Not a big deal, but there wasnt even a closet in our room. There was a space that looked like it would be a closet, but there was this desk drawer thing that made it impossible to hang up a dress or pair of pants. The "mini bar" - and I use that term loosely - was set up on top of this desk drawer. It was a wooden tray with some snacks in it - no refridgerator or anything. We didn't have a safe or an ironing board in the room - we did have an iron. We called down and they brought us up a safe and ironing board. Well, if you can carry a safe up, you can carry it out of the room - it wasn't bolted down or anything. And, it didn't work. So I am glad that I didn't bring my laptop. We would just put our valuables in a suitcase and lock the suitcase - not the best security, but better than nothing. And nothing was ever taken. We were also missing the binder with all of the hotel info, room service menu, etc in it. So on a night when it rained, we went down to the front desk to ask for a room service menu - they said it was in the binder, which we didn't have. We were also missing the marker for the "Your Desires" board, so we could never communicate what we needed. These were all of the little things that we felt could have been taken care of and would have made a big difference. It in no way ruined our trip, just made for some annoyance. And our shower leaked all over the place - we just put towels down to absorb the water. The bar on the roof was great and we had some good sushi and drinks there one night. We booked the trio tour package through the hotel, which was to the Rain Forest, Luquillo Beach and the Bioluminescent Bay. We highly recommend it; Debbie our tour guide was great. We also spent one day in Old San Juan and toured the 2 forts - definitely worth seeing. We walked every night down to the other main hotels - Intercontinental, El San Juan & the Ritz. The ESJ is gorgeous - definitely check it out. We had a great dinner at the Palm Restaurant in the ESJ. Overall, we enjoyed our stay...but it could have been great if the hotel worked on their attention to details.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LPCAMA12
Reviews.Content: Sure, certain things about the place need fixing/replacing but it more than makes up for it with a friendly staff and a terrific location. The Hotel is close to everything! The beach is steps away. Great places to eat are but a short walk. I recommend Metropol over Mi Casita. The food and service are much better. We walked from the hotel to Metropol. A hands down favorite of mine for breakfast was a small bagel shop on the same shopping strip where Mi Casita is. They have the best cafe (coffee) con leche (milk). But if you want the usual, Denise is also nearby. Considering that there are so many places nearby...I was glad not to rent a car. We took the bus to Old San Juan and had a blast. San Juan has a very active night life. San Juan has many restaurants to eat...but be ready to spend $$$. For activities I recommend snorkeling and the hiking trip to El Yunque. Visit Puerto Ricoâ€¦the island is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and not trendy”
Reviews.Author: alonsocyn
Reviews.Content: After much research and what we thought would be a hip and trendy area, we were very much dissappointed with the hotel and the area. Yes the entrance of the hotel looks like South Beach Miami but the rooms are not. Just to give you an idea of our taste, I'm 28 and my boyfriend's 37, we've traveled pretty much to all the top destinations internationally. We consider ourselves part of the trendy crowd and easy to please. We usually hit the new trendy clubs but also traffic sports bars and wine bars. From the pictures posted on the hotel's website I'd say the photographer did an amazing job but in real life the furniture looked like it was purchased from Ikea, small rooms with a small closet area, the restrooms - shower does not have a sliding door or curtain nor exhaust fans to remove humidity - basically you'll have to crack the window in the shower to let out the humidity and let in hot air, plus you'll end up with water splashing out of the shower and into the restroom. Big mess and I can assure you I'm pretty low maintenance, this stuff usually doesn't bother me but I was annoyed by how much we payed, I expected 5 star hotel amenities for that price. And lastly the pool was dirty and the nice view blocked by the dirty safety glass around it. Hotel food is overpriced, instead we opted for a hotdog from one of the vendor's on the beach, yummy and only $2.00 each, oh and they come with shoe string fries on top. My boyfriend and I found better options in Old San Juan. The best food and atmosphere was here in Old San Juan. Try Dragonfly or Tantra restaurants. We tried several restaurants in Old San Juan area and were never dissappointed, can't wait to go back to eat here. In Old San Juan you will also find nice nightlife, not chic and trendy but better than what the Beach & Water Club has to offer. Back at the Beach & Water Club - beautiful lounge and you'll hear hip hop and some salsa all night long, would be nice if they alternated the music a little. We tried out the hotel's lounge one night and the music was way too loud, lounder than a club, I asked if they could turn it down a notch and they said no, crazy since I noticed other patrons were annoyed by it too, I'm sure I was not the first nor the last to request this. Anyway their response was, they were trying to bring in people from the other clubs around the area, not sure why since the crowd was kinda young and rowdy - Spring Break crowd - the lounge has a rooftop but is open all around, basically their theory was play the music loud enough so that everyone in a five block radius can hear it and come party. The best club we found at the time was at the casino, even Tommy Lee and his buddies partied there that night. I think as long as the music is enjoyabe and you're with good company then you'll have a good time. Things I recommend to try while in Puerto Rico - While there we toured the Bacardi factory, very fun and even better with free drinks. We also did the rainforest, loved it. FYI - wear you're bathing suit under your clothes so you can enjoy a nice cool dip by the waterfall, you'll need it after the trek down to it. Things I liked about this hotel, only two - the beach is beautiful and the lounge has a great view. Overall I give this hotel a 2.5 stars out of 5 because of the lack of hotel amenities, overpriced for the quality, the staff is not very friendly with the exception of the boutique owner - he's a sweetheart. We will not be staying at this hotel again. This hotel is lost when it comes to which crowd they are catering too. I recommend this hotel to the Spring Break crowd. My advice - The best part of town to stay in is Old San Juan, rent a car and drive out to the beach since it is public. .

Reviews.Title: “OK But Severely Overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: bg_nyc
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location, central location on Isla Verde, great staff, right across from the beach. Cons: Overpriced, dated, slowly falling apart, expensive food and drinks, across the street from the (public) beach. When walking in, you can see that someone put some thought into making it very trendy and modern. The problem is that this was apparently done a few years ago, and not much maintenance has been put into the hotel since then. Its literally falling apart in some places. Paint is chipping and dirty, walls are scuffed and you can see in some places where several coats of paint have been applied. But thats the lobby / public areas. Unfortunately, the rooms suffer from the same issues. While they are nice and modern and artfully decorated, they are not very well maintained beyond the standard cleaning that goes on. One thing that bothered my wife and I immensely was the loud air conditioner that did not manage to keep the room very cool even at the coldest setting. But because of the humidity we didn't really have a choice. Another thing that bothered us was that the restaurant on the rooftop never seemed to be fully functional. My wife and I had a ticket for a free lunch at the rooftop restaurant. We went up there, and nobody seemed prepared to greet us or take our order. It seemed very disorganized. But the food did arrive somewhat quickly. Much to our dismay, the pizza we ordered ($12) was not much more than microwaved frozen pizza. It was horrendous, especially given the quality that the hotel espouses. Its very cool to have the hotel right at the beach. Its actually a public beach. The hotel will provide towels. Get there early if you want to grab one of the limited beach lounge chairs. Overall, we give this hotel a 3 because although it is very cool and trendy, it is not well maintained, especially given the cost. The food (that we had) was overpriced. But the staff was very nice and very good looking, the rooms were relatively clean, and the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Cool beans”
Reviews.Author: NatTaggart
Reviews.Content: Excellent Hotel, cool location, centrally located near El San Juan, Ritz, and Intercontinental casinos. Lots of local good restaurants, bar on top of Water Club is great for a double gin and tonic and to see the San Juan skyline. Rooms have a modern slant, all look towards the Atlantic, and hotel is on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Vacation at the Water Club”
Reviews.Author: feltqueen
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and five days in one of the four ocean front suites with a package through Luxury Link. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and this looked like just the kind of place for us. I love the high end, eye-candy, every amenity type hotels, and my husband is perfectly happy with a tent and a sleeping bag. Finding the right combination of quality without the snootiness that comes with many of the 5-Star properties is always a challenge. This boutique hotel was perfect for us. The suite comprised one bedroom and a living room. Both were fashioned in a white on white minimalist style. There were plenty of lamps, tvs, cd players and even an ipod dock/player, as well as plenty of closet space. The bathroom was small, but more than sufficient. The room was very clean and spacious. The housekeeping staff were friendly and always willing to give us extra towels, shampoo, etc. I loved the rooftop bar, sushi bar, and pool area. Yes, the pool is small and it gets very windy up there, but the view is spectacular and we enjoyed several evenings there. We ate at the Tangerine Restaurant. The food and service were excellent. The beach was on the doorstep, and we spent a couple of days just lounging around on the reclininers provided by the hotel (towels and umbrellas were also provided). Staff from the hotel would bring you anthing you wanted. Water was available at the entrance after a hard day at the beach, and there were usually treats in the form of candy, cookies or little cakes at the front desk. The staff are all young and good-looking and every single one of them was pleasant, helpful, and friendly. We loved the muted blue mood lighting the room and public areas, as well as the music in the hallways and elevators, which we could not hear from our rooms. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a unique experience in a cool, trendy atmosphere. We would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and great people...”
Reviews.Author: dminner1
Reviews.Content: I really liked this place and will go back. You can find specials and packages on their website.. The drinks and the view at the bar on the roof are great, but the sushi was average. The staff is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, Hip Hotel”
Reviews.Author: writerwood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Water Club for just a mere 12 hours during an overnight layover. So I can't comment on the beach out front since it was dark! The hotel is bathed in blue light, and the rooms are all bright wight. The front desk was helpful and directed us to a local restaurant Mi Casita for some Puerto Rican fare. We came back and spent sometime at the rooftop bar, large lounge beds, good sushi, and mojitos. After a long journey the serene white of the rooms was welcome. The next morning we had a hard time getting a taxi because of the early hour, and one of the employees gladly gave us a ride to the airport. The location is perfect, very close to the airport, yet on the beach. We would stay again next time we are in Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Potential - Worth the Visit”
Reviews.Author: dherndon904
Reviews.Content: I just returned from spending four nights at the Water Club. The hotel is ideally located across a narrow road on a very beautiful stretch of beach. The area around the hotel seems to be going through revitalization as a number of the buildings were either being refurbished or new buildings were under construction. Of course, with all of the construction in the area there was a lot of noise by 10:00 a.m. every morning. So, light sleepers may have a problem with the noise factor. The hotel itself has great potential. The dÃ©cor is modern and crisp which is a refreshing break from the traditional â€œresortâ€� hotels. When you first walk in, the hotel shows quite well but if you slow down and pay attention to the details, you will see where some sprucing up would be in order. There are some areas that need attention, namely the elevators and the water features on the walls. The elevator was slow, and despite the dim light you could still see the worn and dirty carpet. The hotel has music playing pretty much all day but I actually liked it and it added to the overall atmosphere. The hotel has a wonderful feel to it overall and I think with a little TLC it can be a real standout. The room and bathroom was not as small as I had feared, and the room was decorated very nicely. Everything was clean, white and modern. There's an interesting bluish light surrounding the perimeter of the room that enhances the decor. If there is one issue it would definitely be the lack of storage storage. Thereâ€™s a tiny three drawer â€œIkeaâ€� type dresser in the closet. There was no place to store luggage so I ended up using the armchair during my stay to place my luggage. The lack of storage can be a definite problem for most people â€“ especially on an extended stay. There was not a full sized ironing board either but rather one of those small ones with no legs that are typically used in college dormitories. That was a bit of a hassle since I had to prop it up on a chair in order to iron my clothing. The bathroom shower has a half â€œdoorâ€� enclosing it but I did not have any problems with water going everywhere. The bathroom was not luxurious by any stretch of the imagination but it seemed to work well with the overall dÃ©cor of the room. It was clean, modern looking and everything was in good working order. I booked during off season and well in advance so I only paid $137 per night for a standard, non-ocean view room. I had a chance to see the inside of a full ocean view room and the view was spectacular. Frankly, with the close proximity of the beach, unless you are fortunate enough to get one of the ocean view rooms that has a walkout balcony, Iâ€™m not sure if it is actually worth paying the premium for the view. One of the highlights of the hotel is the staff. Everyone was professional, friendly and willing to help in any way they could. They really made the stay even more enjoyable. Just so you know, the cleaning staff does not change the sheets every time they clean the room. So, if you like your sheets changed daily, you may need to ask. A few things about the area surrounding the hotel. First of all, you can get to the casinos at the InterContinental, El San Juan Hotel and the Ritz Carlton by taking a short 5-10 minute walk with the Ritz Carlton being the hotel furthest away. There are a lot of fast food restaurants within walking distance, including Mi Casita (authentic Puerto Rican food) and Metropol. Thereâ€™s also an Outback Steak House, Ruth Chris and other well known American restaurants within walking distance. The area is heavily patrolled by police, especially at night. There are a few eateries as well as a Walgreens that is open 24 hours, and there are a lot of people walking the streets late at night. I and my friend (we are both women) actually walked from the InterContinental casino on two nights well after 2:00 a.m. and the streets were well lit and there were quite a few tourists and locals out and about. The police drive up and down the stretch every few minutes with their blue lights flashing. While it is always good to not take any unnecessary chances, I can honestly say that I never felt unsafe walking the main streets at night. You can get to Old San Juan by taking the A5 at a bus stop located just a minute or two from the hotel. The fare is $0.75 and the ride is about 40 minutes or so. The route meanders through a lot of the local neighborhoods and a few shopping districts, but the very last stop on the route is at the bus station in Old San Juan. Once you get off at the last stop, you can exit either through the front or rear of the bus station and will immediately see the shops of Old San Juan. I highly recommend taking the bus if youâ€™re planning a day trip to Old San Juan â€“ and it sure beats paying $19 one way. Overall, I really enjoyed staying at the Water Club and would definitely recommend staying if you visit the Isle Verde section of Puerto Rico.

Reviews.Title: “A three day stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Quartz575
Reviews.Content: My and my girlfriend spent a 3 day vacation at this hotel. I was not exactly thrilled with some of the negative comments posted on this website and yahoo and expedia. But we got the best package deal using this hotel. First of all, the room was not as small as I dreaded it would be. It was large enough for both of us; complete with hardwood flooring, neon blue lights, and a mini bar. Richard, the doorman out front was very friendly and was chock full of info for us...i.e where shops and restaraunts were located at. BTW, there were several within walking disance and the prices were just like here in the USA. It was a breez to go visit Old San Juan; just catch the bus 200 meters from the hotel,pay your dollar and enjoy the 45 minute ride! On the downside of this hotel was the unbelievable expensive restaurant they had at the main level. They charged $13 for a stack of pancakes and $16 for a hamburger and fries. Happy hour was a joke, it was by one get one free, but it was only for their cheap liquor...not for beer.The hotel was fenced off in some places,guess there are lots of shady people at night wandering around. Other than that,it was not too bad,especially if you want to be near the beach.....a 30 second walk from the front door. Mark

Reviews.Title: “It gets better and better!”
Reviews.Author: ajalm05
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel with a very friendly staff that is eager to meet all of your needs. The rooms are very comfortable and the beach is directly in front of the hotel! However, the best part about this hotel is the staff. They remembered our names and greeted us each day with a warm smile and friendly hello. This is the second time that we stayed at this hotel and it was excellent last time...even better this time! I recommend it to all of my friends and family and plan many trips in the future.

Reviews.Title: “RIDICULOUS!!!”
Reviews.Author: ariday333
Reviews.Content: WOW I just came back from my trip to Puerto Rico...it was my first time and definitely will not be my last. This hotel is SICKKKK...it's definitely for young couples or singles. I stood here for a long weekend and I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this hotel. Let me start by mentioning their hospitality...the minute we arrived the gentlemen at the door asked us our names and throughout the stay they would always say to my boyfriend, "Hey Alex How is everything?". No matter what any of the employees were doing they would always stop and say hi, they were definitely on top of their game. The Room: I knew my trip was going to be a blast the minute we checked into our room. Our view of the beach was just flawless. The bathroom, yes was small but I wasn't planning on spending my vacation in there...it was spotless and that means more to me than anything else. There's an Ipod Dock that allows you to place your ipod and play music...That was my favorite part b/c I got to listen to my tunes the whole weekend. Overall the room was amazing. The Food: We went to a couple of restaurants that were amazing. Levi's which is on Ave. Isla Verde was realllly good..it's located about 10 minutes (driving) as if you're heading to the Condado..if you go you must try the Mofongo (smashed green plantains)..one of the best! There's also 'La Casita' just a couple of blocks away that was cheap and excellent. Every morning and afternoon that we would pass by the restaurant there was a long line, so we knew then and there that we had to try it. The massage: It was my birthday and my boyfriend called the hotel in advance to book an hour massage for me. The hotel contracts the services of this young lady named Karen Lugo. This massage was like no other. It was the most spiritual massage I've ever had...she's a body healer and you can feel all the negative energy you have inside just release your body as she massages you. The massage took place on the second floor balcony of the hotel..it was surreal to look up and see the turqoise water as I was getting this amazing massage done. YOU MUST YOU MUST GET A MASSAGE...her phone number is (787)635-1440 or email her at bodyhealer@hotmail.com....TRUST ME you will love this! Activities: There plenty to do around there. For starters, the hotel has a lounge called 'Wet' on the roof, which also has a pool that yes is small but it's really nice if you want to just lay out in one of their white beds and soak up some sun. At night a lot of people visit the loung upstairs because the view of the island is amazing from up there. There's also El San Juan Hotel (ESJ)...the minute you enter the lobby of that hotel there's people dancing because of the salsa band that plays there at night. It was very crowded and a mix crowd of young and older people They have a really nice casino as well. And of course, you must go and visit El Viejo San Juan (Old San Juan), it's just mesmerizing beyond words. We spent a whole day just walking the beautiful streets...it was just so romantic. Altogether I have to say I've never had a vacation so flawless as this one. DO NOT THINK ABOUT IT TWICE..BOOK IT! Trust me you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PamperedQueenNy
Reviews.Content: I figured i'd try the Water Club ......for a change from the whole resort feel. Big mistake this "Boutique" hotel is way overrated. Upon first glance you think south beach swanky...not!!!! More like discontinued furniture from Ikea...Room service is a complete joke. There were never enough towels in the room. Our room was on the top floor so we could hear the music all nite from the club. The pool water was dirty. In addition people who aren't staying at the hotel can obviously go to club were hanging out in the stairwell of the hotel . I went out for ice and strangers are hanging in the hallway. On our last night the smoke alarms went off for several hours. After calling the front desk to inquire, they told me to all was fine. Some one is smoking in their room? The alarms went on and off for at least 3 hours. The front desk is a complete joke, a bunch of uncouth girls who need some training on customer service. If youâ€™re going to P.R. don't stay here. I'm sorry it took so long to submit this but i saw an ad they posted regarding a sale they have going on. Don't take the bait, youâ€™ll regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Listen and Read This Review From a Hotel Guy!”
Reviews.Author: caclemor
Reviews.Content: Before we left to go to San Juan, we read a lot of reviews and narrowed it down to Water Club and El Convento in Old San Juan. We made the right choice with Water Club. Being in the Hotel Industry, I am probably one of the most cricical of critics when it comes to hotels. My clients have included Ian Schrager, Leona Helmsley, Starwood, Marriot, etc. So I will be very candid in this review. 1) Does if have the vibe of Ian Schrager? Yes. It is totally South Beach Miamai and New York all wrapped up. Does it need some attention to maintain the vibe? Of course, but considering it is a tourist hotel with a hip, chic following, what more would you expect than a little wear and tear. 2) Rooms? Nicely appointed, very hip, great use of space (think HGTV's "Small Spaces). They take every square inch of space in a 300 sq. ft. partial ocean view room and utilize it nicely. My only observation was, "Why didn't you upgrade the bathrooms to be hip and chic? Air conditioning worked great and we had a nice "partial view" of the Isle Verde beach! After all, who is going to sit in their room and stare out the window. 3) Staff? All I can say is "WOW." Very attentive, friendly, and gracious. In fact, when we checked out yesterday, they were having a staff meeting in the lobby and each and every staff member wished us well and thanked us profusely for visiting. Favorites bartendar Philip (yummy), Julia waiteress in the "Wet Bar" on the roof, Kevin the beach guy, door man who I forget his name but an older (not ancient) guy who was just the best, Christina at the front desk, and the list goes on. 4) Location? Great. If you want a cool, hip, hotel without the overwhelming tourist traffic and over abundance of american eateries, then this is the spot. Isolated? Depends on your view. We loved not being in tourist central (Old San Juan), steps to the beach where chairs and umbrellas were always ready and waiting (thank you Kevin), drinks a plenty. Negatives - Isle Verde does not have an over abundance of restaurants unless you like Burger King (two within two blocks of the hotel) Wendy's, Subway, etc. However, the adventure of trying the local hangouts was good - Metropole(Puerto Rican/Cuban Cusine - recommend the Cuban Fiesta Dinner), Bachallina, Mi Casita (great local place next to the supermarket and subway), Ediths for true local, local dive hang out. However, be prepared to pay $15 - $20 each way to get to Condado or Old Town San Juan. 5) Tours? The tour group recommended by the hotel was top notch - Ask for Joey as your guide! He was awesome. We did the Rainforest (beautiful), another beach and the bioluminescent kayaking. Nice day, very long (9:30 a.m. - 10:00 p.m.) but worth it except for the beach (was just a public municiple beach). But as I said, ask for Joey!!! 6) Recommendations in Old San Juan - Sonne (Sangrias), Turkish Restaurant, Pina Colada Club next to the Fort for great iced frozen cool down drinks (non-alcholic and great on a hot day when visiting the forts and walking). Happy Hour at the hotel, drinks 2 for $5 from 5 - 6. Use the free drink welcome coupon at Wet for your free Mojito. Use your free lunch coupon at wet, just be prepared that if you have cocktails your bill will still be $40. Try the nachos. Interesting use of Wasabi Chips. 7) Disappointments but not complaints? Maid service lacked on a couple of days, but use the "Desires" board in your room and everything will be fine. Elevators slow. Drinks expensive at the hotel, but what do you expect. 8) Ignore the comments about the noise and music(we stayed in room 710, right next to the elevators which have the cool music that resonates day and night and never heard a bit of the music in our room nor the elevators), enjoy the oversized couches on the roof deck, bask in the chic atmosphere, ignore the comments about the gift shop (nice stuff), elevators are a very cool experience, enjoy the white pallette of the hotel and minimilistic approach, and most of all "take it all in." Was I overwhelemed by the experience? Being a hotel guy - not overwhelmed, but truly enjoyed the essence and experience and would stay there again when in Puerto Rico. And if anyone can tell me how to steal the beautiful wooden sculpture in the lobby just past the elevators as you head to the lobby bathrooms..."I want it for my pool area here at home."

Reviews.Title: “Perfect break from "resorts" & families”
Reviews.Author: Lewy8
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Water Club at the end of June. The hotel is for designed especially for singles and couples. The rooms are modern decor & efficient with high speed internet (not wireless), mini bar, snacks, and a safe that will easily store your laptop and other items. The candles they burned in the hallway by the front desk smelled incredible! (I cannot find them on the internet, so buy the one in the room if you can stand to spend the money on a candle) We enjoyed the lounge chairs on the roof in the evenings. The happy hours is only an hour long, and the pool was tiny, but the beach makes this one of the best places to lounge. The building is older, so it was not perfect, but all of the buildings around the area are older and restored. If you are used to the Ritz, stay at the Ritz...we heard they offer a free shuttle to Pinones. But if you appreciate the time away from the norm, as much as the "perfect hotel" then stay the Water Club. The beach is right out the front door, and it is gorgeous. The entire staff will accommodate you if you just ask them. You're more likely to see local residents playing football, volleyball, or tag on the beach than you are likely to get harassed by locals trying to get you to buy stuff. There are many restaurants within walking distance. The area was extremely safe. We saw women on multiple occasions jogging alone down the main strip at dusk. Food and drinks are pricey, but that is true everywhere I've ever vacationed.
