Some reasonable prices at El Alambique, just down the street; and when you finally get lonely for home, they make a better hamburger than you can get in the states. Shops and restaurants don't necessarily open according to their posted hours, but be flexible, and you'll find some good food. The Wave right next to El Alambique, has a breakfast menu and the breakfast cheddar wrap is very good, comes with a coffee.

Reviews.Title: “welcome oasis in isla verde”
Reviews.Author: adaiku
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at this hotel last week and had a great time. Honestly, I couldn't have imagined staying anywhere else in Isla Verde... great beach location, fantastic staff (esp. William at the door and Kevin on the beach), super views from the nicely appointed (modern style, good linens, ipod stereo) room and the rooftop bar (with a great happy hour). The hotel wasn't crowded at all during the week, so its small size was an even bigger plus. Cleanliness was never a problem. Sure, there's techno-ish music in the halls and upstairs (not too loud and did not bother us), services are overpriced (where are they not), etc... but after days driving around San Juan and the rest of the island, we were happy to return at night. imho great for younger / active / independent travellers who enjoy modern design and are comfortable with something of an urban feel/style... certainly not a substitute for the Embassy Suites (families) or El San Juan (older/more conservative/"resort" crowd), but would have been quite disappointed if it were.

Reviews.Title: “Second Visti; New Owners are Well on Their Way to Destroying a Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: divinemissmoe
Reviews.Content: We came here first in April of 2004 and had a wonderful time and returned over this Memorial Day weekend. We love that San Juan is a direct flight from Boston, and that within 10 minutes of landing, you can be on the beach or at the roof top pool. Because we loved it so much the first time, we actually came back (something we have never done)--and we invited friends. We had told them how wonderful the roof deck and pool was, how good the restaurant was, what a fun city San Juan is, etc. I had read that it had changed owners, but some of the reviews seemed to suggest it hadn't declined much. They could not be more wrong. This hotel went from a polished, south-beach-cool kind of place to a dirty, cheap (there is now a hat-rack in the lobby selling beach hats), over-priced place trying to do everything in its power to induce orgies. However, unlike a scenester places in NYC or South Beach trying to create an orgy-effect, this place doesn't discriminate as to who it lets in--which frankly can be a little disgusting. The result is a bunch of overweight locals wearing bikinis and terry-cloth short-shorts taking over the roof starting at 4 pm and staying until the night is over. You'd like perhaps to have it be the beautiful people of San Juan, but it's not. It's literally late teens and early twenties types who would wear terry cloth short-shorts in the evening to a place that ostensibly doesn't allow men to wear shorts after 6--not true by the way. As I mentioned, the chubby terry-cloth-short-clad girls are no accident. The hotel has clearly changed its target demographic. Probably the most overt example of this is the menu of the restaurant, Tangerine (which USED to be fantastic, e.g., one of the best soups I've ever had, a very rich Pumpkin-Galangal soup). This example will seem bizarre, but keep reading. The quality of the very expensive food should really be guessed at by the descriptions of the menu items. Literally every single menu item has some sort of soft-core porn sounding description; example: the "title" of the soft shell crab appetizer was "It's soft now, but can it get hard for me?" Literally every single one had something like that. It's not particularly obscene, it's just ridiculous. But, we figured we'd try it because last time it was very, very good. Well, turns out the title of the soft shell crab appetizer was actually rather apt; the tempura on the crab was quite soft and mushy. I hope that's not really what they were referring to. The crab itself was also not that fresh (disgusting really, when you think you're eating the whole thing), the ceviche too was not fresh. In fact, the only thing any of our party of four ate that was good, was our $37 half rack of tamarind-marinated lamb chops. But, you'd have to char that to wreck it. OK, but the restaurant was not the real problem. The biggest problem was the pool. Two of the three days we were there, it was closed until 2 pm. Now, this wouldn't have been such a big deal, except for two things. 1) the roof top pool was literally the driving reason for our taking this trip. My husband doesn't like sand (weird, I know), so we really do care about the pool. We like that it's so comfortable, that there's bar service, that you can see the beach, etc. The other reason that this made us absolutely livid, is that they had a "pool party" two of the nights we were there which caused it to be closed (it is also one of the reasons all of the teenagers were there in their terry cloth shorts). Well, they let all of these non-hotel guests into the pool, and as any pool owner knows, after you have a large party, you HAVE to completely clean the pool, shock it with chlorine, etc. Well, these guys had to do this, too. And, apparently their filter broke due to all of the gross stuff in the pool from these pool parties. Now, if the guests at this pool party had been hotel guests, and we were all hungover the next day until 2 pm, and had been the cause of the damage, I think I'd be ok with it. But, as I said, that wasn't the case. They let any one in, and they let any one into their pool. The result was that the main reason we came down was unavailable to us for 2 of the 3 days. This was unacceptable. When we mentioned it to the manager, he just blew us off. Then there was the music. The music was jacked up to dance party levels every day starting at 2 pm. Even if you were the only people on the roof, and you asked them to turn it down b/c you were reading, no dice. You couldn't even talk it was so loud. Now, I don't mind that at some point during the night, I actually like it, and I wouldn't have minded it if it were only some parts of the roof, but it was all parts of the roof, starting at 2 pm. As I mentioned, they weren't particuarly interested in whether any of this appealed to their hotel patrons. Going to this hotel is like watching something beautiful be wantonly destroyed before your eyes. I will say, we still had a good time. The fantastic public spaces that the original architect put in do a lot to keep the place on life support. But we won't be back. After all, there is very little evidence from this trip to suggest that the owners have any ambition for the place save turning it into a 24/7 disco. And if they turned on the music any earlier that would have destroyed the few hours I was able to enjoy on the roof. Sadly, I don't know where else to suggest to stay. I liked El Convento when we went last time, but the rooms are dark, and being in the city with no access to the beach and so little roof top seating makes that a hard choice in my eyes (San Juan is too hot to stay out shopping all day, so don't kid yourself that you don't need a nice hotel with nice places to relax for hours at a time). I'm not a big fan of the clientele or the general vibe of the big places like the El San Juan or the Ritz, either. They are stodgy in a flat-footed sandle and elastic-banded-waist kind of way that is surprising, especially in a Ritz. I think I can only hope that someone buys the Water Club and returns it to it's former glory by limiting the number and type of non-hotel patrons who can use the roof, and realizes that more money can be made as a boutique hotel than as a disco/brothel staging ground. Or two, that someone else will open up another boutique hotel and stick to those standards.

Reviews.Title: “Looks can be deceiving”
Reviews.Author: redtraveler
Reviews.Content: I travel often, and I can say this, if you're looking for a quiet, relaxing, clean hotel in san juan where you can unwind - find another place. I truly believe that the Water Club should be stripped of it's "Preferred Boutique" status. The best part of out stay was dealing with the staff - most of them are very friendly at the front desk, and the baggage handlers. Very friendly and courteous, with the exception of one guy who works on Sunday nights - he seems more interested in helping his friends find cabs, or chatting on his blue tooth then helping guests get a cab. The rooms are just awful and are in need of a desperate renovation. Walls and ceilings are cracked and falling apart, the sheets feel like sand paper, the bathrooms are okay, small, but better than a bathroom you'd find at a gas station. Hallways and elevators are not air conditioned, and the waterfalls in the elevators are just stupid, moldy, dirty, and disgusting. The elevators take hours to come and go. The hotel itself is a popular spot for the locals, so you'll be finding yourself dealing with loud, obnoxious drunks going up to the roof. The roof would be a pleasant place to relax, it has great views, the pool is small but it doesn't matter when the beach is right across the street. The music is beyond loud on the roof, you can hear it blocks away, and it makes for a less then pleasant experience. If you're looking to party and don't care about the rooms, stay here, otherwise, try El Convento or the Ritz. Not worth the money we paid at all. The Water Club needs to be completely renovated and management has to deal with non-guests who take over the place.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and shabby”
Reviews.Author: ___Liz012
Reviews.Content: We made a last minute decision to stay here after reading positive reviews by the travel magazines, reviews here, and books. I was more disappointed in this hotel than any I have ever stayed in in over 10 trips to the Caribbean or Mexico. I cannot stress enough to avoid this hotel. No amount to "hip" or "chic" makes up for extremely small rooms and bathrooms (smaller than you would expect in New York), shabbiness and just plain dirtiness. The elevator is hot, the floor is filthy, and there is always a maid cart or room service on it running over your toes. The edges of the floor and walls are unfinished in the halls. The room is too small to do much besides lay in the bed (and we asked if they had a larger room and were told no). and the bathroom is too small for 2 people to even stand in. The ceilings are popcorn, the fitted sheets are not fitted and too small and will not cover the bed and there is no mattress pad. You will find yourself sleeping directly on a dirty, stained, sagging, and creaky mattress. The sheets are of a terrible quality anyway, but at least they hopefully wash them. The walls, bedskirt and bedspread are visibly stained in many places. We only ate at the restaurant for breakfast once, it was not good and slow. The man with the beach chairs showed up late or whenever. The pool upstairs is tiny and slimy with sunscreen or whatever else, and the whole upstairs area is rented out for private parties often, so tons of people walk through the lobby, take the slow elevator up to the pool and essentially take over the whole area from about 3 pm to 3 am every day. So no naps in your room in the afternoon, and be prepared to be woken up all through the night by endless music and drinkers. All in all, I would think a very basic chain hotel would be much preferable at least for being clean, and I can think of no reason to stay here. I shared my concerns with the staff who were unconcerned, and I would like to share them with readers as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach, relaxing stay but not close to Old San Juan”
Reviews.Author: LittleMissTiny
Reviews.Content: We wanted a beach vacation and that is what we got at the Water Club! From the minute we arrrived, the staff was helpful and attentive. Our room was not quite ready so William, who is awesome, suggested Mi Casita, a small local place right down the street from the hotel. It was lunch time and we sampled MoFongo, which is mashed fried plaintains with garlic and topped with pork. It was delicious. Our short flight from New York was in the past as we enjoyed lunch at this little authentic restaurant. We were immediately taken with the ocean view and the gorgeous beach, which is literally steps from the hotel. Every morning, we would walk out of the hotel and be greeted by the wonderful staff and then the beach staff would set up an umbrella and chairs for us. The ocean itself was wonderful to swim in - clear, warm water, no seaweed and the ocean floor was not rocky at all. We spent alot of time in the water and walking on the beach because it was so beautiful. We had lunch at 2 separate beachfront cafes and I would recommend both. If you walk down the beach toward the el san juan hotel you will see the bar that serves lunch and you can sit at a table on the beach and look out over the ocean. We watched the sun set from there one nite with a pina colada! I would suggest the beachfront lunch places as opposed to lunch in the hotel which is expensive, although the waitress service on the beach is excellent. We ordered drinks only. The other lunch spot is set back from the beach on the small road that leads into the hotel. Its a bar and little cafe that serves salads, sandwiches, drinks, burgers. We had lunch there and each time the service was great and again you feel a great breeze since you are steps from the ocean. Breakfast in the hotel was ok. Pricey and nothing special. I really wanted some fresh fruit and it was just a mediocre fruit plate for $11. The same area where Mi Casita is, there is a bagel shop where you can have breakfast and coffee as well. Yeah, the blue lights and techno music are a little much but I never felt overwhelmed by it. The safe in our room was broken, and within 20 minutes someone had come to replace it. We reserved a partial ocen view as an upgrade and we could not have been happier. It was a great view and the bed is facing the windows which makes it lovely in the morning. You can tell they upgraded the rooms but only with trendier amenities. There was no fridge, but there was an iPod clock radio. The rooms are minimal, but the bed was comfortable. It was like they went to Ikea and decorated the rooms. At 4pm our room wasnt cleaned one day (it appeared they had just fogotten the 9th floor completely) and that was annoying. The cleanliness of the rooms is questionable but I am pickier than most. We were on the 9th floor and never really heard any of the late nite club music and dancing that others did. It rained one evening when we were going out and I thought the hotel should supply umbreallas but they didnt. You can walk to Walgreens but the area around the hotel isnt great. You really just want to be near the ocean because the ocean breeze and view are wonderful. When we stepped away one afternoon, we wanted to go right back to the beach! Restaurants we enjoyed: Raices in OSJ, Mi Casita, and Platos which is down Isla Verde Ave past the el san juan hotel. And Pikayo is inside the Museum. It was superb. We each had a chef's tasting menu and I cannot say enough about it. Our experience there was delicious, romantic and memorable. Beware of the trip into OSJ. While it is a very quaint area with many many bars and restaurants, its an $18 cab ride one way. Cabs are not cheap so try to avoid them. Overall, we enjoyed our stay very much. It was relaxing and just what we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Cool, but loud/expensive”
Reviews.Author: kja2007
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I recently stayed at the Water Club. The staff, for the most part, was extremely friendly and strove to be helpful (especially the doormen). The space is very chic and cool, which I really liked, even if the blue lights in a lot of spaces can get to you a bit after a while. The place is extremely cool, as I said, if expensive. It has clearly been renovated pretty recently. We didn't have a chance to have dinner there, but we did have breakfast in the main restaurant, and it was excellent (again, though expensive). The cosmo I had at the bar wasn't great (especially for $14 each), but my fiance said that his specialty drink was good and was plenty strong. The beach outside is gorgeous, as is the view from the top floor. If you want to check out the other big hotels around, it's not a bad location from which to do that - the Intercontinental, Holiday Inn, San Juan Casino Hotel, etc. are all within easy walking distance (even in heels). The biggest problems: 1) Noise: We were on the 10th floor. We had a fabulous view as a result, which was great - but we also had to listen to ALL the roofdeck noise. Since they have a club space, bar, pool, etc. up there, this was no small matter. Both mornings, we had to listen to them scraping furniture around starting at 6am - and I do mean LOUDLY! It was a bit better the second morning after we said something to the front desk, but we still heard it, and it still woke us up. And this was after listening to the club music until almost 1am, preventing us from going to sleep! 2) Expense: Even though we got a good AAA rate, it was still quite expensive for the small (though cool) size of the room, and given the noise issues. 3) Not much to do in the immediate vicinity: The hotel only has one main restaurant and a brief sushi bar time upstairs. If you just want to walk to other hotels, you can do that, but there isn't much past that. I would say that this hotel would be good to stay at if you sleep deeply, like cool decor, want to be right on the beach, and will be busy most of the day. It's probably not a bad base if you're seeing friends or family in the area, have business nearby, or will be taking many day trips. But this is definitely not a hotel for someone who wants to hang out there and have enough to do in or near the hotel. I would also say that the younger adult crowd (late 20s-early 40s) would probably be most comfortable here. So... when I return to San Juan, I will definitely eat at the Water Club, but I am not planning on staying there again. Everything taken together, the good food and cool ambience just can't outweigh the drawbacks of expense, noise, and limited available activities nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible location and substandard hotel”
Reviews.Author: katarie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel a couple of years ago and booked through a luxury hotel website. It is definitely a poor example of what a luxury hotel should be. It attempts to mimic an art deco South Beach hotel from the outside but when you walk in and closely look at everything from furnishings to design, it's completely shoddy. The bathroom was tiny and claustrophobic. It was dirty and something I'd find in a dorm. Good luck trying to put your clothes away because there was a small cabinet for hanging some clothes and no drawers. The rooftop deck bar area was o.k. with couches and a bar but the pool was simply horrible. I don't even understand the point of why a box of water they call a pool was up there? The beach in front of the hotel is just HORRIBLE! Every day I found broken glass from beer bottles and garbage in the sand. It was a very unsettling place especially when all the buildings there have barbed wire protecting their entrances. Terrible location and sub-standard accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Cheated and MIstreated”
Reviews.Author: Aremson
Reviews.Content: Being in the $400/night range, this hotel was a disappointment. Even if it cost $100 a night, I would have been let down because it was filthy and had bad service My bathroom was filthy and poorly designed. The service was rude and lazy. The sheets were stained (I am not kidding). The blankets had multiple tears in them. The club was noisy and serving underage partyers. The management was always available to BS, but magically disappeared when it is time to accept responsibility. The hotel was run down and badly in need of restoration. This hotel is a scam. Entirely smoke and mirrors. this hotel gives the impression it will be a top shelf experience on the web but upon scratching the surface, you'll see it is trying to get as much money as possible based on its overblown location. Towels and beach chairs were missing twice when I went to the beach. The waiters in the overpriced restaurant ignored you or treated you like you were bothering them. The rooms simply weren't cleaned properly. For two people in a room, they provided one robe even after I called and complained over and over. The room I was supposed to get was not available when I got there and I was given a lesser room (view of the parking lot) and they didn't adjust the price. I mentioned it twice, they said they would adjust it, then I did auto check-out and saw they still billed me at the more expensive rate. When I brought all of these things to the managements attention, they did nothing at all. They didn't even really accept responsibility. They offered a small discount and then never gave it to me. I fought over the bill with them for weeks afterward. They never gave in. I approached the management company of the hotel - they sent me back to the manager of the Water Club. It was like a bad dream. For a hotel that charges as much as the Ritz, the experience doesn't even come close. Just stay at the Ritz - the service is great, it's right on the beach (rather than crossing the road filled with bums to get to the beach) and has a great pool (unlike the WC's crappy and tiny pool). The Water Club ruined my vacation, don't let the same thing happen to you.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go back...”
Reviews.Author: RAR610
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my boyfriend for 3 days. The hotel is beautiful looking, smells good (think oranges and mango :) ) and the staff was EXTREMELY friendly whenever I passed them. The few problems I noticed was that there elevators are really slow, I know they were having some work done to one of them, but I read reviews before going, that said it was being worked on months before January. Also, as small of an obvservation, the room we stayed in, did not have a main ceiling light, only black light. That made it difficult to get ready for the evening in the bedrom portion of the room. Also, the bathrooms were not as modern and up to date as the rest of the hotel, which was random considering everything is very "South Beach-y". Overall, it was perfect for what we needed it for - sleeping and enjoying the view from the roof top bar. I'd go back - I just hope the elevators are fixed at that point :)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Syphrite
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our first anniversary and we were really pleased with the hotel. We're both in our mid-20's, and found the hotel to be perfect for our age group. The rooftop pool (ok it's 5 feet deep and small) bar and lounge couches were wonderful! The pool has plexiglass so you can look right out onto the beach/ocean. The couches on the roof were great because you could lounge around and even take a nap, which was so relaxing for us, especially after slaving away in New York City day in and day out. The hotel is pretty much right on the beach, you only have to cross the street to be on one of the most beautiful beaches in San Juan. Not only that but you can also rent jet skis (we had a blast) or go parasailing. Ask the hotel and they will direct you where to go. Our room was on the 8th floor and had an ocean front view as well as a french balcony (awesome!). We never heard our neighbors, the maids, or anything else for that matter. Maybe we just had quiet people staying around us, but we were never disturbed. The room itself was very much reminiscent of Ikea, but we liked it. Neither one of us is into the cheesy flower/carribean decor that all of the other hotels offer. The bathroom was indeed small, but it's not like you're spending your entire day in there so that's kind of silly to complain about (Re: another review i read). The rooms were always clean when we requested service and all everyone on staff was very kind to us. The front desk directed us to a few off the beaten path restaurants that we really enjoyed too. Ohhh, and the elevators are really cool! They don't have a ceiling so you can see all of the machinery. Very strange, but nifty. Overall I loved this hotel and would definitely return on a trip back to San Juan. I highly recommend spending the extra cash for the ocean front rooms. I would also request a high floor so you can be sheltered from any beach noise, etc. I think this hotel is better suited to a younger crowd and definitely suited to anyone who enjoys the vibe of hotels like "The Standard" in LA or "The Strand" in Miami Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it”
Reviews.Author: bunchofmarkerz
Reviews.Content: I went with my friend, first time to puerto rico. We liked the Water Club, it was posh very Miami like pretty beach we had a great view from the window, close proximity to old san juan, went to senor frogs had a great time there, over all a great vacation and I would love to go back to puerto rico. Altho I wanna stay at the Conquistador over on the east caribbean side, it's all i ever heard about when we were down there and how beautiful and great it is, so ill be going there next. The water club has nice rooms, bathrooms aren't great. Nice rooftop bar. the tiny pool is worthless on top, just stick to the beach. They have staff that set up the chairs and umbrellas for you. And staff that serve you food and drinks on the beach as well. Water wasn't too rough on beach it was pretty nice, warm, clear, caribbeanish for being the atlantic ocean. We went to the bacardi factory and the fort tour, that was fun, beautiful views from the forts and going through them was a lil creepy but loved it. You might feel like ur in a bad area when staying at the Water Club, but honestly we went walking through the streets to walgreens and we were fine, i think people leave review sometimes becuase they are way to over critical, if you want 5 star service stay at the ritz carlton 5 mins down the beach, Give the Water Club a shot!

Reviews.Title: “It's not bad”
Reviews.Author: kld100
Reviews.Content: I felt like I HAD to write a review after seeing some of the other reviews prior to going. I will say at first I was very underwhelemed with the Water Club. My girflriend and I have high standards and were not that impressed. There are no amenities at all, the rooms and bathrooms are tiny, there is no "pool" it's just an oversized hottub on the roof, the purple lights and dark hallways are annoying, our room was below the top floor where there is a DJ til 4am and it's loud.. dont stay on te 10th floor..and the area the hotel is in is pretty rundown. OK ..however, after a day or so the hotel grew on us. The rooftop is awesome. The bar is great and it's a great place to hang out at 5pm on the couches with an incredible view. Also we liked that the beach was less crowded (minus the crowds of locals that linger there) vs the Ritz or Intercontinental..the beaches are mobbed with people. For the price, the Water Club is fine but expect very little! My recommendation.. stay at the El San Juan Hotel & Casino. By far the most interesting and happening hotel in Isle Verdes. Girls- a tip: if you're looking to pick up attractive but high caliber men in general and are picky like we are, don't go to San Juan! But 85 and sunny and beautiful beaches!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price, nice location”
Reviews.Author: mapwhe
Reviews.Content: Held over in San Juan due to flight cancellation. Rates in San Juan very high however, not worth the price that I could have stayed at a different hotel. Roomâ€™s extremely noisy, slamming doors heard all night. Staff and location are nice but rooms are small and poorly constructed. Dance club on the top floor open all hours and appeared to be a very popular spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quick Get Away”
Reviews.Author: politicalbug
Reviews.Content: I was passing through San Juan on buisiness, and I needed a day at the beach. I stayed two nights mid-week at the Water Club, and it was just what the doctor ordered. Upon arrival, the doormen were all smiles. The check in was a breeze, and I immediately felt relaxed. The room I was assigned (410) was non-smoking as I had asked, but it had obviously been smoked in. They said they would "refresh" the room, but it did not make one iota of difference in the smoky smell. I did not spend much time in the room so I did my best to put it out of my mind. The room was comfortable and had everything I needed. The view was not great, as it was on the 4th floor looking out onto a small condo building next door. The bed was nice, and the sheets were good quality (though, to be fair, there was a bit of pilling). I had filled out the "desires" information on the hotel's website, and they did -- in fact -- have my requested snacks waiting for me in my room. Nice touch. Good shower with H2O brand products. The bathroom was very clean. The floors in the room did get quite sandy after a day at the beach, but the maid service would keep it in check. There is a roof top bar with lots of places to lounge and look out over the beach. The bartender makes great drinks (most mixed drinks about $10), and the service was good. It was a great place to lounge before dinner. They do serve sushi up there and will allow one to order from their asian fusion restaurant, but we were more for great Puerto Rican food that would not break the bank. The beach is ten steps away from the front door of the hotel, and they have complimentary chairs, umbrellas and towels for hotel guests. They also have a waitress who will come take your drink orders. Since it is not a big hotel, the beach out front is not crowded. The area is safe, and we walked to the Walgreens and the little grocery. We walked 10 minutes down to the big resorts and played a bit in the casinos, but it was good to come back to the great service and smiles in our small, comfortable hotel. One thing I should make clear to everyone -- this hotel is a boutique hotel that caters to adults. I didn't see any children there, and it seemed that everyone was happy about that. It really is a couples and singles kind of hotel, as there is not much for children except the beach. Personally, I was thrilled with the lack of children. I got a great deal on Priceline, and I would do it all over again tomorrow. Quick, $15 cab ride to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “WaterClub good for weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: FromNYto?
Reviews.Content: The Water Club is a great place to go if you want easy access to the beach, nice service, a really terrific roof bar that overlooks the beach and a smaller non cruiseship like hotel. It is not the place to go if you don't want trendy, you expect super high end upkeep, and a bargain. Overall, the hotel has a Miami feel to it...but not the same sort of better than you attitude. It is off of a very, very commercial gritty street. Good news is lots of local food and Walmart to load up on drinks...bad, it can distract from a chill beach vibe. It is also walking distance to the big hotel casinos and two great places to eat in town ( Mi Casita & Metropol) but will cost you 20 bucks to get to old San Juan. .

Reviews.Title: “amazing service! beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: voyageursny
Reviews.Content: What stands out about this hotel is definitely the service. Everyone, from doormen, restaurant staff, front desk, housekeeping - could not have been more friendly, accomodating and helpful. They were attentive, warm and friendly. The hotel itself is a great boutique hotel. Nice amenities. The only drawbacks we found with the room was there was no full length mirror nor mini-bar/refrigerator, which would have been helpful. The restaurant and rooftop bar are definitely great to have onsite. We usually stay at boutique hotels and would definitely return if staying in Isla Verde. - We wish there was more hotels & restaurants like the Water Club and Tangerine in the area. It's a bit walker - unfriendly.

Reviews.Title: “A Preferred hotel makeover”
Reviews.Author: JandJNYC
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel two years ago and enjoyed it alot. While it's not new anymore, the hotel is still great. Now it is a PREFERRED BOUTIQUE HOTEL and its service is impeccable. Some of the reviews on this site were probably during the "transition" from one management company to another. The front desk, valet, housekeepers, and rooftop bar/restaurant service and staff were excellent. The beach beverage service was slow and inconsistent... but that's our only complaint!

Reviews.Title: “The worst Hotel EVER!!!! Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: chrisssrock
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and thought how bad could this be. I booked the hotel. It ruined my whole experience of being the first time visiting Puerto Rico. The rooms were small. The service was very poor. Understaffed.Food was priced on the high end. I put a $500 sports coat in to dry clean at the hotel that I just bought beofre vacation. At first they didn't get it back to me until 3hours after the guaranteed time. They put it t back in my room with a huge tear in the sleeve. They didn't even tell me about it, they just pakcaged it and put it back in my room without saying anything. They said not worry, that I would be reimbursed for the full value. Nothing happened. Got back to NY and I am still fighting 3 months later to get reimbursed for my jacket. Customer service run around. Just really ruined my vacation experience in Puerto Rico. Very dissastified and will never go back there again. TRUST THE REVIEWS. Go with your gut. The reviews are true. This is totally, I TOLD YOU SO moment. There really need to be some kind of National Hotel standards committee, because this one doesn't even deserve a star.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: prnces2369
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to Puerto Rico last week and were booked at the Intercontinental. When we got there we learned that the pool was under renovations and our travel agent neglected to tell us. (Liberty Travel- never travel with them ever) But that's a whole other story. We instead found a room at the Water Club and moved all of our stuff there. At first we thought it was great. Smaller than most of the other hotels, so probably better customer service, you know more attentive. Boy were we wrong. Our second day there we went to the beach and the guy who was supposed to set up our chairs and give us towels was lounging on a chair with his girlfriend. We had to go back into the hotel and get someone else to help us. We came back from the beach to discover that the maid had left our room open all day. Not just unlocked, but open. My friend had her $3,000 laptop in the room, along with everything else we brought with us. When I called down to the front desk and told they said they would look into it. Nothing came of it. Then we were getting ready for dinner and my friend was in the middle of washing her hair in the shower, and the water shut completely off in our room. We called and maintenance and the Building Engineer finally said they had it fixed after about an hour and a half. Once I was in the shower, the water shut off again. They moved us to another room. The new room was much smaller than the first and right next to the club on the second floor. Management never came to speak to us. We decided to leave and while we were checking out, the Manager just stood there and went about his business totally ignoring us. Did not say one word to us. This hotel is horrible. Not worth the money. No customer service whatsoever. Do not stay there!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: caribchakita
Reviews.Content: I am often in transit at SJU and with new flight schedules on AA I have 5+ hour layovers in SJU so needed to find an oasis to get out of the airport hubbub and escape. Waterclub fit the bill Tue. It was an 11.00 dollar 15 min. cab ride to this respite on sandy Isla Verde. The staff welcomed me with an orientation and sent me off to the terrace. WOW, views, huge lounger beds, a lovely bar, snacks, lunches, super staff..stellar..the hotel is very eclectic. Stunning art and modern deco throughout. Tangerine looks like an amazing place to dine? Aquamarine, the trendy gift shop is chock full of unusual finds. Loved Kevin the store manager. Cannot wait to return to Waterclub. Email me if you want to see photos as TA software or my internet is not allowing photos to post. ann@bonairecaribbeancom

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: lizssi
Reviews.Content: The Water Club in San Juan is the worst possible hotel to book for a vacatiom (don't even think about bringing kids) My husband and I decided to try a boutique hotel instead of a typical resort like we usually stay in when we travel. All I can say is big mistake. We changed rooms immediately upon check-in for a beach front rather than beachview room. The first room was on the 10th floor directly under the night club with no closet or balcony. The hotel staff moved us to a beach front room on the 7th floor for $30.00 more/night. The new room had a better view and a balcony you could stand on, but no chairs. The bathroom was old and grimey and there was a small closet. The rooms are also really small and have about 2-3 feet of clearance around the king size bed. Now onto the public areas. There was only one elevator working so there was quite a wait for a 12 story facility and there were black lights everywhere (in the halls, lobby, elevator, bar, even the rooms but you could turn those off). There was really loud techno music playing incessantly. The pool was really small and the lounge chairs were all connected to one another instead of separate lounge chairs. It was basically unuseable. The beach is across the street and very public.The upstairs club was cool, but pricey. The whole surrounding area didn't have many restaurants or bars to choose from unless you went to another hotel. The next morning we awoke at 8 am to sledgehammers and construction noise. The front desk said the only construction was on the 4th floor, but it sounded like it was next door. Needless to say, we called Orbitz who got our money back for the next 3 nights and we moved to the Mariott in Condado. On another note the staff was very friendly and helpful, but don't stay there. The hotel tries way to hard to be trendy and hip, but falls short. We didn't bother taking any pictures.

Reviews.Title: “We really liked this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: izzyvet
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by this hotel after reading some of the reviews. We booked through Hotwire, so did not know exactly where we were staying until after we had payed. This definately is not a hotel for everyone, but if you like unique, boutique style hotels, you should check this one out. Positive: 1) Some of the most friendly staff we have ever encountered. The manager and assistant both introduced themselves to us and we chatted quite a bit with the assistant sales manager at the rooftop club. I mentioned in passing that I would like to rent a bike in the morning and how could I arrange this. She made a note of it and at 7 the next morning a note was delivered to our room stating that our bike was waiting for us at the front desk! 2) The room was very clean and the bed very comfortable. 3) Very close access to the beach (right across the street) with free use of beach chairs and umbrellas. Wait service for drinks is available at the beach. 4)Beautiful rooftop bar, restaurant and pool. Negative: 1) No coffee maker in the room. ( I miss my first morning cup horribly!) 2) Closet space very minimal. If staying for more than 2 or 3 nights this would be a problem. We only stayed 2 nights. We would very definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Alright”
Reviews.Author: ILUVSntJN
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel last week and after reading all the negative postings I was a bit apprehensive about staying here. Let me tell you that I was impressed with the property's location to the beach and the top floor where there is a really cool lounge area/bar/pool. YES, there is some renovation going on right now as is most renovations since it is the off season. Downside was there was one elevator out of service and the wait could be long at times. We stayed on the 4th floor and the room was GREAT, CLEAN and a BEAUTIFUL View. Only bad thing is that they dragged a bag of empty beer bottles down the floor at about 7 am and woke me up. I would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Horribly Overpriced and Bad Experience -- all smoke and mirrors.”
Reviews.Author: cubalibre3
Reviews.Content: My husband and stayed at the hotel in February 2006 and were so excited to stay in this exclusive and highly recommended hotel. However, we were quite shocked by what we saw. For the price of the hotel, I expected alot more. The bathrooms were that of a 2-star hotel. The showers were extremely loud and not well maintained. In fact part of the faucet fell off on my toe while I was in the shower. At one point during our stay, a window cleaner outside of my room, which was on the 7th or 8th floor peered into my window in the early morning as I was getting out of the shower. The hotel had failed to give me any notice that there was going to be a window cleaning that day. When we complained to the hotel, they were less then apologetic and only offered us a free stay if we came back to PR. I have been to PR many times and for the price and service, I would recommend staying at the Ritz, which is also overpriced, but is better than the Water Club by any stretch. While I was checking out, two other guests were also checking out. One guest's passport had been stolen and the other guest was completely unsatisfied with the accomodations and chose to check out early. While all this was going on the hotel manager refused to come out to speak with any of us. This is totally not worth anyone's time, money, or energy.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible "Boutique" Hotel--unless you like grime!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly*864
Reviews.Content: The hotel was VERY dirty and everything looked shabby--not at all a four star resort. When I went to take a towel to dry my hands, the rack fell off the wall. The shower leaked all over the floor. The staff was friendly but not knowledgable when it came to restaurants and city transportation. The black lighting ALL OVER got really irritating fast. I enjoy nightclubs, but not sleeping in them. We checked out and had a wonderful stay down the road at the Intercontinental Isla Verde. The room was much more comfortable and clean. The concierge answered all of our questions and the whole stay barely cost more than the Water Club would have. Thanks Intercontinental for saving our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced Filthy Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: XLNC
Reviews.Content: My Girlfriend and I stayed here for exactly 10 minutes before we decided to check out right away!!! The room smelled like dirty sweaty old sheets, which was exactly what was on the bed. The service at the front desk was absolutely rude! I would not recommend this dump to my worst enemy!! If there was a law for false advertising these people would be on death row. The place looks nothing like the pictures, the hotel is really dirty and smelly and the service completely sucks! DO NOT GO THERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything that sparkles ISN'T gold!”
Reviews.Author: naturallyme76
Reviews.Content: First of all I'd like to state that I am NOT a big complainer and when I do complain something HAS to be wrong. Be patient because this is a long complaint but worth reading. After numerous emails back and forth with the Desires Manager at the Water Club BEFORE I even left the US, I was assured my room would be available upon my late arrival. I even went as far as to email the manager copies of the negative reviews I had read to make sure I didn't have the same problems. She told me via email that she tagged my room for late arrival and that I would be ready to check-in whenever I got to the hotel. WRONG! CHECK-IN: With that being said. I arrived at the hotel around 2:00 a.m., on July 17th as planned...I was tired from the flight and just ready to crawl in bed for a few hours so we could hit the ground running that Monday. Upon checking in, the not so friendly lady behind the desk informed me they had NO rooms available for us and that our room would not be ready until 3:00 p.m., 12 noon at the earliest. You could have knocked me over with a feather. I even printed out the conversations the manager and I had via email and showed it to her and that email meant nothing...she rambled on and on about how the manager didn't know what I meant and therefore gave me the wrong information. She offered to call around to other hotels for us to stay. I was NOT paying for another room or taxi ride when it was there screw up. I was very upset by then...I told her that I would camp out in their lobby with my luggage for all their guests to see until my room was ready 13 hrs. later. She didn't care one bit...even offered to store our luggage in the back while we waited 13hrs. for a room. Me and my best friend rolled all our luggage right in front of the lobby doors and waited. FINALLY, after waiting about 30 min., the financial manager came out and told us that our room had been sold 2hrs. before we got there, he was very nice and apologized. He got on the phone, called the Hampton Inn & Suites hotel and got us a room, which they paid for..he also paid for our taxi ride over to the hotel. He told us to call back around noon to see if our room was ready. The Hampton Inn is a VERY nice hotel and I wish I had booked there..they even had comp. breakfast for us that morning. Of course the room wasn't ready, we only had one night at the Hampton so we checked out around 11 and wait edin their lobby with all our bags. Our tour guide had a cancellation that day and ended up pickin' us up tand driving us around until our rooms were ready. THANKS MIKE! Finally we checked in around 1:30...the hotel had NO WATER but they told us it would be on in a few hours. Thank goodness I didn't need a shower. We had booked an ocean view room at the Water Club and the room was FANTASTIC..I loved the room and the view..very beautiful. After finally getting into our room and enjoying some touring in Old San Juan and finally feeling better about the vacation. we got a freakin' call from the lobby saying we had to bring a credit card down for a room despoit..we gave them a card that didn't have a big spending limit (didn't trust them) and when they couldn't put a $400 hold on the card, we had to take $400 IN cash which would cover their $100 day room deposit, that we new NOTHING about, in case things got missing for the mini bar. The mini bar is a joke..it's NOT locked and not refridgerated so the cleaning crew could take whatever they want and blame it on us. I took pics with my digital camera of the contents of the mini bar and then I tied rubber bands around the handle on the doors so that I could tell if it had been messed with. I even went as far as to putting the 'DO NOT DISTURB' sign on the outside of the hotel door while we were out 'cause I didn't want anyone in the room, not even the cleaning crew. CheckOut: We got up extra early 'cause I had a bad feeling about getting our cash deposit back. We got to the lobby around 7 a.m. to check out...they told us they didn't have enough money to pay our deposit back and were gonna give us a bunch of $1 bills...we gave them (4) $100 bills. We had to wait almost 45 min. for them to get the cash to pay us back and it was all small bills. AAAIIIGGHHH It is in deed a beautiful hotel BUT save your money and stay somewhere like the Hampton Inn Suites where customer service is top priority.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, expensive and bad service”
Reviews.Author: frequentPRtraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Water Club based on what we saw and read on the Internet. It looked very nice online and seemed like a good place to go. Big mistake! It is not worth the price. The hotel has a chic look and feel but they fall short in so many areas. The bathroom in the first room we stayed in looked like it was in its original 1960s decor. We changed rooms becuase of the ridiculous noise of drilling, banging, etc. from renovations in the hotel. No where did anyone mention that the hotel is in the middle of renovations. There certainly were no renovation prices. Amazingly upon moving to a room where we were assured there would be no renovation noise, we faced it again and again. It started very early in the morning too. And then there was the night time noise coming from the roof top bar and lounge, which is a very nice place and the staff there was good. But no one should have to listen to music blasting upstairs at 1 and 2 a.m. We were four floors below and could hear the music over the TV and air conditioner that late at night. Calls downstairs were met with no response. Typical. Also, the restaurant Tangerine was not good and way overpriced. The prices were all in the 20s to 30s for entrees and nothing came with a side dish. Blah taste for 25 dollars. Gimme a break. Then you had to pay 7 - 10 dollars for a side dish that also was dullsville. On the plus side, there are some very nice staff that work the front desk and upstairs lounge. Karla at the front desk is extremely helpful and nice. And Marabella at the upstairs bar is a perfect waitress. If you're going to San Juan, stay at one of the other hotels that are the the same price or better. Don't waste your money or time on this place. It is not worth the headaches or costs.

Reviews.Title: “How far it has fallen”
Reviews.Author: FLA_Joe
Reviews.Content: "Trying to hard too hard to be Trendy" got it completely right. Filthy coushons on the roof deck, hotel restaurant closed for good, elevators that worked even less than the staff--who set the bar pretty low--and none of the charm, elegance and fun that characterized our stay two years ago. In fact, it appears the owners have not spent a nickle on the place since our last visit, leaving us certain we won't spend another nickle there either. Check out the Il Convento--we had lunch there and soooooo wished we had stayed there instead--not urban chic but so much nicer nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Trying to hard to be trendy and sanderson-esque, but fell short on basics”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read reviews before I stayed and expected the worst but was actually pleasantly surprised, at least with the service. The staff was very helpful and pleasant, contrary to reviews I had read. But to be honest, i wouldn't stay there again. What you get is basically an attempt at an Ian Schrager hotel, like the Sanderson in London, but it's only the trimmings without the basics. There's black lights and light white curtains everywhere, but there's also tired paint everywhere. Between 9 am and 9 pm, there's very loud techno music playing throughout the hotel. Even in the elevator shafts. In fact the speaker in the lift shaft is on the 6th floor...right next to my room (610 or 601) This music gets very repetative as they only play the one CD which they sell at the front desk. Even the staff admited to be sick of it. And it's LOUD. Even in the business centre/conference room. The rooftop bar is nice, but again, tired. The cushions/beds are dirty and the seams have split. My colleague got his white linen trousers dirty by sitting on them. But the pool was absolutly disgusting. Trash and bits of crud floated around, and there was a "ring around the tub" style ring of filth that sat an inch above the waterline. Ick. In the room, you get a big comfortable bed, but not much more. The bathrooms are grotty, dim and bloody awful. The windows in my room were dirty. And the fricking music was so loud in the hallway that I couldn't sleep. The food, it must be said, is quite good. There's a new chef and he's raised the bar by all accounts. Overall, it's an average hotel witha good menu, decent service, but tries way, way too hard to be "cool" when most of us would settle for "competent" You might stay somewhere else like El San Jan hotel casino.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience ever...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have lived and traveled the world for work and pleasure for the past 20+ years. The Water Club San Juan ranks at the top of the list of our "worst hotel experiences ever. We changed rooms twice and checked out two days early. At the top of the list were the following: 1) Non stop roof top disco cranking out music until 3:00am. It can be heard from the roof down at least 4 floors and, 2) Elevators were only sporadically in operation. So, we spent a large portion of our stay climbing stairs to the upper floors and, 3) A beach resort with no towels, chairs or umbrellas when needed. 20 or so like minded guests stood in the sun waiting for the beach essentials that sometimes never arrived and, 4) Ongoing room by room renovations underway so both of our rooms were adjacent to ongoing renovations and, 5) At the time of our stay, a movie crew had taken over the hotel and, 6) To add insult to injury, less then sincere attention from the General Manager. He kept calling my wife "honey"... Of special note however was the rest of the staff. Friendly, professional and head and shoulders above the GM and the facility. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel, great service, but probably not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: appellatereview
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Water Club over a long weekend of June 9-12. The Lonely Planet guide gave the Water Club its recommendation, so we gave it a try. It exceeded our expectations. The hotel is located in the middle of Isla Verde, within walking distance of a number of good restaurants (I would particularly recommend Fontana di Roma at the Howard Johnson). The only downside is that cab fare each way to old San Juan is $20 each way and it starts to add up if you want to make the trip more than once a day. There is a city bus that runs downtown, and I think that would be the more economical way to make the trip during the day (the bus service ends at 8:30). On the up side, the airport is only a ten minute cab ride away. The Water Club is in an older building and is probably the smallest of the beach-front hotels in Isla Verde. I suspect that in high season, when it is crowded, it has a much different feel. But in the early-June low season, the hotel has a relaxed, intimate feel. As other reviewers have noted, the hotel dÃ©cor goes for a hip â€œSouth Beachâ€� feel, and of course, there is the ever present waterfall theme, but they donâ€™t go overboard on the theme. The hotel staff upgraded us to an oceanfront room on the third floor. It was a bit small, but clean and well-decorated, with a very comfortable king-sized bed. (No closet though). The hotel has a very nice but small rooftop pool. In addition, there is a bar/nightclub on the rooftop terrace. Drinks are expensive ($7 for a beer and $9 for a mixed drink), but the view is amazing. The restaurant in the lobby (Tangerine) is also very pricey (and they charge a lot for just the breakfast bar). There is music playing in the lobby, elevator, and halls, but it isnâ€™t too loud and they play a good variety of styles. I was there the weekend that the water went out, and it was a bit of a drag. But it is hard to complain since most of San Juan was without water. In additon, the Water Club had their reserve water tank filled the next day, so we werenâ€™t without water for long. By itself, I would rate the hotel above average, but its location and service raise it to excellent. The Water Club sits at the end of Calle Tartak, right next to Isla Verde beach. Yes, itâ€™s a public beach, but it was never crowded when we were there. Most of the waves break further out, so the water is very calm. The Water Club has a free towel, lounger and umbrella service, as also offers bar service on the beach. The beach staff is great. On Saturday, I left my sunglasses out by the lounger. The staff found them and brought them in to the hotel even before I reached the elevator. Likewise, the hotel staff really goes the extra mile to help you. The Water Club isnâ€™t for every one, but the great service and unique feel of the place make it special.

Reviews.Title: “The Water Club”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Water Club in San Juan this past weekend. We booked our trip online, via the Water Club web site. We are both very busy people, travel frequently and love the web for it's versatility and convenience. Unfortunately, this common medium must be nouveau to the Water Club. When we arrived, they had no idea that we paid in full ahead of time (a feature I would think they would encourage) and we argued incessantly, even with proper documentation, that we had already paid. The hotel insisted that we owed for the room in full, again. This process took 45 minutes, including speaking with 3 managers, including the general manager of the managing company. Finally, I was assured that the proper authentication had taken place and we went to our room. I should add that I modified the bill, crossed out the erroneous charges, initialed the changes and then signed the documentation. Needless to say, when we checked out, there were more erroneous charges including, ironically enough, the $40 breakfast that was complimentary for our inconvenience. When I arrived home, I used my trusty internet to check all my charges for the trip and sure enough, the Water Club charged me double for my room. I've spoken with both the travel agency who handles the web site and the general manager, yet there has been no action on their part. While the Water Club is a charming hotel, I suggest sticking to the competent, as well as, internet savvy Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “No peace at the Water Club”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Water Club at the beginning of May to attend a friend's wedding there. The big positives for the hotel are the proximity to the airport and having the beach right across the street. Other than that, it was not a pleasurable experience. My husband and I arrived and were pleased to be "upgraded" to an oceanfront room rather than a partial ocean view room. We walked into the room and were shocked at the poor use of space and the strangely appointed furniture. The bed is on an angle in the middle of the room! There was no closet, only a little hanging rod in the mini bar cabinet that was so short, I couldn't hang any of my dresses or pants in there. The bathroom was small and had one of those half shower doors that does not keep the water inside. But we did have a great view of the ocean so we tried to ignore these issues. Then came night time. We were on the 9th floor and the bar/club is on the roof which is the 11th floor. Well, the music might as well have been right in our room. Until 2 in the morning. It was just miserable. Our hosts had provided us with earplugs in our gift bags and we thought it was just a joke but we really needed them. Even with the plugs in, it was incredibly loud. On our final night there, we were up until 2 am with the roof music, finally got to sleep and then at 6:30 am, we were awakened by people outside on the street blasting music, talking, laughing. For an hour. We were about to complain but they finally went away. I can't believe the hotel would allow that to go on in front of their building. We also decided to have breakfast there one morning and couldn't believe the prices. It was ridiculous for the amount and quality of food that was served. We understand it's a "hipster" hotel but you have to be able to back up the prices on the menu with food that is up to par. We did enjoy having the beach right there and being able to use the lounge chairs and umbrellas. We thought we might try out the pool but it looked like it was just for show--it was very small and useless. The beach was lovely though and the staff came around frequently to take orders for food and drinks. Overall, I would NOT recommend this hotel if you are looking for a peaceful getaway. We checked out the Intercontinental and the RItz and would definitely stay in either one of those if we choose to return to San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely stylish, hip, and well-located. But aside from the interesting decor, this hotel offers very little for a big pricetag. Our room was poorly maintained--phone didn't work (wires hanging out of the phone jack), the bathroom was drab and unattractive (almost seemed dirty), the windows were dirty (eclipsing the ocean view). Also, the elevators were not working well and one was out of order. There appears to be no service elevator so everyone, including housekeeping and room service is riding up and down in two tiny elevators along with guests--this makes for long waits. The staff was indifferent and not well informed (the rooftop restaurant was closed for a private party, but the person at the desk didn't seem to know that when she told us we could get lunch on the roof until 6pm.) Overall, a huge disappointment. Go there for a drink and enjoy the rooftop pool/lounge, but save your money for a better room just about anywhere else in Isla Verde.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just had to drop a line to counter some of the negative postings on this hotel. The Water Club is certainly not as nice as the El San Juan Hotel and Casino or the Ritz. However, it is much cheaper than these hotels. If you are a young couple looking for a nice Miami/beach/party-atmosphere, this place is for you. Food is incredible, roof top bar is awesome, and the roof top pool is beautiful (though a bit small). Noise was not a problem for us, but then again we are from New York City. There was music playing but it was certainly NOT pumping or blasting, in fact it was quite mellow and relaxing. Also, there is a very down-home outdoor bar/restaurant right next door that is really cheap and has excellent food if you get tired of the chic atmosphere. I spent a long weekend in February '06 at the Water Club and I just booked another weekend at the Water Club for July. If you are a young couple (this place is not for children or seniors) you can't beat the value. (Most travel websites will give you a great deal on this hotel plus airfare.) Hope this helps anyone who may be on the fence.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Water Club for 1 night at the end of our week stay in P.R.- should not have done it, not worth the money. Old hotel which has been made hip and trendy by simple tricks, like a thin layer of paint, neon lights, music everywhere and curtains all over the place. Rooms are small. The sheets on our bed where really dirty and black hairs in the bed. Took hours to get different sheets. Bathroom very small and had not been part of the make-the-hotel-look-like-a-boutique-hotel process. Make sure you don't accidently give a debit card at check in, in stead of a credit card. The hotel takes a deposit of your accout and it takes very long to get it back. They are much quicker making sure they take the final amount of your account than returning your deposit. Not very service oriented, front desk and reservations give you different answers to questions regarding reservations and billing- no one seems to have a clue. Roof top is only reason to go to this hotel, but you don't have to stay there to enjoy the rooftop!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not for the price”
Reviews.Author: KlausTheInspector
Reviews.Content: Had a 5 night stay at the Water Club, San Juan in March 2006. If a hotel were to undergo a refurb by MTV's "Pimp My Ride", this is what it would look like. Basically they have taken a very average 3 star hotel (sort of thing you find in any main Spanish / Greek resort), and pimped it to maximum effect. The result is a hotel that on first impression looks both luxurious and incredibly chic. The design and imagination that has gone into the hotel and its aquatic theming is striking, with a waterfall on every corridor, illuminated by blue neon lit Mediterranean-style drapes and scented vanilla candles. The blue glow continues into the very large bedrooms, with good views of the beach through white venetian blinds. The bathrooms are a little less inspiring however. With a name like The Water Club, you would think the bathroom and shower would be the talking point of your stay, but unfortunately they are decidedly ropey, with dodgy tiling and decoration, and a shower that looks and operates like it was reclaimed from a 1970's Russian guest house. Rooms certainly AREN'T dirty as some reviewers on TripAdvisor have commented. Another sore point for me was the guest parking which is valet only and an uncomfortable $20 a day. Few rooms have balconies, and no fridge in the room, meaning chilled drinks have to be purchased from the bar for an extortionate $18 for a beer and one G&T ! I suggest buying some from the supermarket and keeping them chilled in an ice filled sink... If you weren't staying here, like many of the evening bar guests, your journey upstairs would take in the best bits of the hotel - the lobby, Tangerine restaurant, the elevator and the roof top bar. For that reason many people who haven't actually stayed here might have a misleading or better impression of the hotel than it actually deserves. The roof-top pool, although small and dated looking, is saved by the adjoining bar and double bed loungers. This place really comes alive at night and turns into one of the hottest venues in San Juan with a young, moneyed crowd listening to resident DJ's play house. Most nights this bar hosts parties (Moet champagne promotion party when we were there), and the 2nd floor occasionally has local bazaars. Like most trendy businesses in San Juan, The Water Club have nailed the soundtrack, and EVERYWHERE you go in this hotel, hidden speakers pipe either whooshing wave sounds, Cafe del Mar chill out beats, or in the evenings, soft beach house. (You can buy their own cd's from reception). Free towels and loungers are available on the beach adjacent to the hotel, and all the staff are professional, helpful and generally affable. Close to airport (10mins & $12 in a cab), but the trip into Old San Juan, home to the best restaurants and clubs that will make you feel you are REALLY in Puerto Rico is a little longer. Either take the A5 bus on the main road ($0.75 coins only), or take a cab for about $25 plus tip. Buses take about 30mins depending on traffic, but finish at about 8.30pm, so a round trip in two cabs can add $$$ to your night out. Overall, The Water Club have realised they can't compete with the large chain hotels that dominate the San Juan area. Because of this, they are offering a completely unique style of accommodation and experience. It works well, but not at the price you will pay. For us almost Â£200 a night - simply too much for the quality of room we received.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing....”
Reviews.Author: dcharles
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the hotel was a disappointment. It is trying to be a hip South Beach boutique hotel but unfortunately doesn't pull it off. To me it comes off as a cheap IKEA version. (and room rates are not inexpensive). Everything seemed broken, chipped, damaged, and run down. My room was not in great shape. The blinds are a joke - the room was BRIGHT at 7:00am. The bathroom was about 20+ years old. They need to do major renoavations to everything; instead they cover it up with blue lights, white curtains and scented candles. The tables at the restaraunt were scratched and chipped. The upstairs lounge/pool area is a cool idea but the pool is very small. They blast "lounge, ibiza chill-out" type music all over the hotel all day and night. The beach in front of the hotel is very nice and not too crowded compared to the other parts of the beach (the beaches are all public so beware...we had a group of 20 year old guys set up shop 5 feet from us blasting music, drinking beers and dancing). The hotel has old cheap beach chairs and a few umbrellas (which were gone each day before we arrived).

Reviews.Title: “Start by turning of the music!! - or - Adventures from room 208”
Reviews.Author: Jasonp718
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Water Club last weekend and felt compelled to write the following because it was such an extraordinary experience. We got to the hotel early and when we walked in it seemed OK. I was instantly struck by the loud music playing in the lobby and as it turns out they have non stop music everywhere at all times. This was annoying to the point of exhaustion. Our room was not ready which was fine because check in was not until 3:00 but when the room was not ready until 4:00 I started to have my doubts about this place. But this was certainly not enough to prepare me for the rest of my stay. When we checked in and they told me that we were on the second floor in room 208 I immediately asked if we could be on a higher floor. The hotel was booked solid so we were not able to switch. Room 208 was simply a disaster. For example; the trash cans were almost too dirty for my trash, there was a hole in the bathroom wall, the blinds in the bathroom and bedroom were broken and hanging to one side, there were no closets (only a small area about 4x3 not big enough to hang pants), when you flushed the toilet it sounded like the pipes were going to fall out of the ceiling, the toilet paper holder was held in place by a piece of broken plastic fork. ( I discovered this while sitting on the toilet...and when I pulled the piece of plastic fork out the whole thing fell in pieces on to the floor!), on Saturday they had not cleaned our room by 3:30 and when I called they told me they had not forgotten about us but were still not there by 4:00. When the cleaning lady came it took her 45 minutes to clean it. Another nice surprise was the kitchen staff putting out the recycling every morning at 7:30. Also, of note is the fact the the second floor is often rented out for parties which was the case the day we checked in. The music was so loud that it felt like the party was in our room but at that point I was not in the partying mood. I could go on and on about this place but if you have read this far hopefully you get the point.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disapointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Water Club had some of the better reviews for hotels in the San Juan area, so that's why we picked it. My girlfriend reserved a room with a "Partial" Ocean View, and that was true, when you leaned right up against the window and looked out to the right you could see it. This room was definitely not worth the price we paid for. If not for the rooftop pool and bar which granted was quite nicer the place would have been a disaster. But Puerto Rico in general just seems to be on a downward slide, from the upkeep of the city, to the incredible lack of service we found everywhere we went. Next time, we'll pick a smaller, more intimate island.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: upsidedownside
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were very excited to stay at The Water Club after reading about it. The rooms are very nice and the ambiance of the whole hotel is amazing. However, the service was awful. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived so we went to the rooftop for a drink. The rooftop view is beautiful, but it took 45min to serve us 2 drinks. We weren't very happy. Our room still wasn't ready when they told us it would be so they upgraded us to a room with an oceanfront view. Very nice! We were now happy and ready to enjoy our vacation. We had dinner at their restaurant where the food is expensive, but very delicious. Have the deep-fried cheesecake for desert. The general manager was very attentive and kept an eye on us. Unfortunately, he was the only one. We returned to the rooftop after dinner for more drinks and ordered some sushi. This time it arrived in time, but the salmon on the sushi had gone bad. The manager whisked it away and we noticed that salmon had been taken off the menu the following day. All and all, we loved the hotel...just wish the service was better. It really made us realize how you can be in an incredible place, but if the service is bad...it can really be a drag.

Reviews.Title: “What a joke”
Reviews.Author: elizabeth1975Atlanta
Reviews.Content: I've been to san juan three times in the last 2 years...and this hotel has been the only negative experience. Since we had stayed at the Ritz Carlton and Intercontinental before, we decided to try a boutique hotel, bad idea. The staff is clueless and unresponsive, maybe they had been hanging out with the passed out couples on the rooftop deck lounges...this was at 10am by the way! Spend your money at a hotel where the staff has been trained, not plucked from the local dance club.

Reviews.Title: “Very good overall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First time poster, felt it was necessary to counter the chronic complainers who gave this hotel a terrible review...Room very comfortable and cool-looking. Most guests were couples on vacation...no gaggles of seniors babbling in the hallways at 5:45 a.m. This hotel is on the better part of the beach. Restaurant and roof-top bar/pool very nice for daytime/nighttime lounging..note--pool is very small. Water was off for an hour one day. Service on the beach: drinks, towels, chairs was friendly, but not always there 100% of the time. Breakfast in the hotel restaurant was very well done.

Reviews.Title: “Badly injured on broken pool tile”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would warn everyone to stay away from The Water Club. On our last day there we decided to use the roof top pool for the first time. The pool has a tile overhang that isn't clearly marked and I came up underneath it and cut the bridge of my nose very badly on a broken, jagged pool tile. My nose bled and became very swollen. All hotel staff who were contacted were very rude about the whole situation, accusing me of causing the accident and implying that I was drunk (I had had no alcohol at all). The assistant manager wrote up an accident report and assured us that the manager would speak with us before we left the next morning. No suprise that the manager and assistant manager disappeared and could not be reached after that, even though I insisted on speaking with them before we left. The injury was very painful and ruined the trip for us. I also had to pay a large hospital bill at home. I contacted the manager and assistant manager and got no reply.

Reviews.Title: “Barely Holdnng On...Doesn't Bear Scrutiny”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If it weren't for the 20-something staff this place would implode! They are, with rare exception, well- intentioned, pleasant and very eager to please. They are clearly poorly trained and poorly paid. Far too many things are broken and in disrepair. Broken CD player, broken reading lights, stained mattress pads no closets and the furniture needs to be replaced. It is also clear that the establishment is barely holding on financially as they open parts of the hotel to the public while paying guests are barred from using this space. One evening the roof lounge-bar-restaurant was closed to hotel guests as they hosted a corporate event which resulted in a pretty noisy late-night kiddy show! Also, the main dining space off the lobby is empited of its furniture and transformed into a Friday night disco open to the general public. This should not be the case in a boutique hotel. Be aware that the hotel is on the beach...a public beach so don't expect a private slice of Carolina beach for yourself. It's only because San Juan is so beautiful and has so much to offer that you can stand this flea bag. Had enough? I'll never return to this place.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, comfortable, welcoming”
Reviews.Author: NJ_Voyageur
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the Water Club, and don't understand the negative comments. The staff was unfailingly pleasant and helpful from the moment we arrived. The room was small --- it's a "boutique" hotel --- but extrmely comfortable and nicely appointed. We would definitely stay here again. Our $165/night rate was through an Internet "deal." We would be less enthusiastic if we had paid the $300-400 that we have seen quoted. The "water" theme can be a bit much --- waterfalls in the elevators and at the ends of hallways, blue lights behind sheer curtains in the bedrooms --- but it's the TROPICS for heaven's sake! Enjoy yourself! High points: The beach is at your doorstep and is wonderful, with accommodating and helpful guys setting up lounges and umbrellas (if you're early enough). The rooftop bar at sunset is absolutely worth the high price of the very well-made drinks. Glitches: From outh 8th-floor room, if we listened carefully (we didn't), we could hear the band on weekend nights. One night there was no water in the entire hotel --- problem solved in time for the pre-dinner shower, fortunately. (The next night, there was no water at the two restaurants we visited in Old San Juan. It's the TROPICS, remember?) An Isla Verde issue, generally; this has nothing to do with the Water Club in particular: Isla Verde is rife with high-priced hotel restaurants and strip-mall joints. No good-quality independent restaurants that we found. Visitors who want to sample San Juan's really good indigenous restaurants --- in Old San Juan or the Condado --- should figure in an extra $35-45 on the price of dinner for cabfare.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: TresSirenas
Reviews.Content: Living on the West Coast of Puerto RIco, where we own a small Inn, we often travel to San Juan for business, a quick getaway, and to pick up family and friends. I know this Island, and am a very discerning guest. We have stayed everywhere in Isle Verde and Condado, as well as old San Juan, the El convento is among our favorites, but a return visit to the WaterCub will be for me a must. My visit was for only one night, this is a hip hotel with a very groovie feel, kind of along the Ian Schrager hotel lines, the W or the Royalton in NYC, it's small, which we liked, no tourists in shorts and CAmera's looking for buffet's. WE were greeted by enthusiastic, handsome young doormen, who later helped us pick out some great baubles from their well stocked, ecelctic gift shop, not your run of the mill chachka, loved it, spent a lot! The staff at the front desk were very accomodating, and upgraded our room to ocean view which was very nice, we got an excellent rate of $200 per night through travelocity, well worth it. I was also greeted by a manager who gave me her business card, this impressed me and confirmed my sentiment that the staff were here to make my stay special.
