The room has a monastic futuristic feel, when you turn off the light I did notice some wear on the furniture, the sheets and towels were exquisite, and spa toiletries were provided, great views of the beach accross the street. We showered, made ur way to the rooftop bar, geat music, very attentive, excellent champagne and suhi, the house even bought us a glass of champagne, I have never had this in PR where I present myself as just another tourist. The executive manager made his way through the bar greeting all the guest's, stopped breifly with us, offered sincere compliments on our dress which was very nice, and moved on so we could go back to our conversation, very attentive. The atmoshere is great, and gives you agood pulse for the energy of the 20 somethings of PR who are very trendy and European in style, mind you I am 50 and still fit in very well here. The bartender called the restaurant and made reservations for us for dinner, the food was excellent, the decor fun, a good nights rest was had, and the very precios pool by got u chairs on the beach, and we were served a hot carafe of coffee, while we lounged. Wow, hated to leave. Recommend for 1 or 2 nights, a week here might be too fast. In all very well done, will certainly return

Reviews.Title: “Bad attitude left bad taste”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were so excited when we read about this hotel online. We chose it as our honeymoon stay. Granted, we live in California but I am originally from Puerto Rico, and not in a million years I would have expected such a terrible attitude from staff. First, we purchased a honeymoon package, which included several items. One night we asked for our wine and cheese and the front desk had no idea what we were talking about and gave us a terrible attitude (like we were bothering them) once we asked if she could speak with a manager that could help her. The next day, when we walked downstairs to the breakfast area - which by the way, served the exact same menu every morning for our 5 day stay, we felt that all the staff were looking at us and pointing at us like we were out of this world. Come to find out that, the manager, whom we had to talk to about not getting the things from our package and getting attitudes that were tasteless; did speak to that one particular staff and aparently the rest of the staff saw us as the bad guys, and how dare we tell on another fellow staff member. I could go on and on with other details. We felt we were paying for luxury but landed at IKEA. All decor came from IKEA! There are no closets in the rooms. (They could have told us that especially knowing I was going to bring a long wedding gown and needed space. Who is the service for, the guests or the staff? That is the question. I wouldn't recommend this dump not even to my worse enemy. You are better off at a Holiday Inn or something like that.

Reviews.Title: “Versace meets Wal-Mart”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel 50 weeks out of the year and have stayed in nice hotels all around the world from no stars to 6 stars. I normally like to stay at the Caribe Hilton in Puerto Rico. All hotels were sold out and all I found was the Water Club. I was very excited but that didn't last long. I walked into the room and I thought, Versace went to Wal-Mart. The floors are fake wood, the TV are old 20' Zenith, the stereo was a terrible Audiovox, the alarm clock a cheap GE. I could always hear running water and the neighbors room. Women, the hot water only lasted about 5 minutes. I will say that other than that the room was awesome !!! A great place to be with a significant other but no more than 2 nights !! The food and drinks were overpriced and very very slow althougth there weren't even 10 people in the place. There are much nicer beaches on the island and carribean but it is nice. I would only recommend this hotel to couples that want to have a good time for 2 days. For business, leisure, luxury, and romance there are much nicer places in Puerto Rico. If the room equipment was nice, a little insulation was added, and a real service-oriented staff took care of the place then it could be a FANTASTIC PLACE !!!!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Dallas, Texas and New York, NY
Reviews.Title: “Needs Help!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is a mess. We had three rooms while at our two day stay at the Water Club. There are towels that need to be replaced, staff that isn't helpful and it isn't directly on the beach. Once we arrived we were so dissapointed to find that our room wasn't ready even though we were late (delayed flight). Then they gave us the wrong room, which a TV that didn't even work. So we moved to our second room. The second room had a shower that leaked all over the bathroom. Our second night there we arrived home to find out the the entire bathroom ceiling was leaking all over! The hotel manager asked us to leave ASAP. Since we could get hurt with water dripping on the light switch and outlets. The third room was had a sink that didn't drain. That was the end of it for us. We were outta there. Good luck if you attempt the Water Club. We decided that we are only going to stay at the name brand hotels after this. We never want to have a Water Club Part II vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent Service/Bad building”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs a considerable amount of work before anyone should go there. The service is completely inconsistent. The building is in constant disrepair and everyone on staff seems to be woefully unprepared for how to deal with any complaints. The hotel boasts its original reviews which are plastered over the walls and on their websites. What they haven't done is maintain the level of service or status of when those reviews were written.

Reviews.Title: “Oh what it could have been”
Reviews.Author: sockster
Reviews.Content: Stayed in an oceanfront suite at the WC. When we got to the room on a Wed., the staff was very attentive and enthusiastic. As the week progressed into the weekend and the hotel got more crowded, the staff seemed overburdened. Even though there were plenty of people working it seemed. So here's a recap of the good things we found and bad things we found during our stay at the Water Club. Good: Great room. Great view from the top of the hotel. Nicely made drinks too. Nice Beach. Bad: That great drink took about half an hour to get even though there were few customers in the bar. At the beach, there is one attendant for the whole hotel crowd. That means that on Wednesday, one person was no big deal. But by Saturday, it took an hour in the morning to get towels for the chairs, another hour to get an umbrella, and I am still waiting for the waitress to take my lunch order! Did I mention that on Wednesday, once we did manage to order lunch, the waiter told us the food would be out in 20-30 minutes, but it took well over an hour!! NOT GOOD. More bad: no wi fi in rooms. You had to schlep your laptop to the roof or 2nd floor office, where the wifi worked most of the time. Not much in the way of hot water in the rooms and the shampoos and soaps were never replaced...Bring your own! On Saturday night was an 80's party. When we got back to the hotel after dinner, we had to wait on line to get into the hotel, then were questioned whether or not we were guests so we wouldn't have to pay the "cover" charge. For the high rates they charge, there should be a hotel guest door! The Water Club is a great example of a hotel that could be awesome, but management just doesn't care. If someone really ran this place well, it could be world class. Instead, they look to nickel and dime their guests for everything. I don't think we'll be back there.

Reviews.Title: “Fading fast... don't waste your time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days at the water club and were pretty disapponted with the overall experience. The hotel seemed to have a pretty cool design, but when you really look, it was a little gross. All of the indoor wall/fountains had gross bacteria growing in them... there were nasty stains on everything in the room... I had a limited amount of hot water for my shower.(ironic given that it is called the water club). Even the club, which seems to be highly touted, was a bit lame. The service, though, was extremely attentive and caring (although a bit slow).

Reviews.Title: “Very Good - getting better”
Reviews.Author: RSBJGB
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at the Water Club. In short, the WC turned out to be a delightful spot that we very much enjoyed. In light of the many criticisms heaped on the WC, it's worth initially mentioning that new on-site management just came on board and is immediately addressing some of the deficiencies prior reviews have listed. I spoke with the new manager and I am confident that the shortcomings of the property will be corrected. In fact, we witnessed several improvements just during the week we were there. He seems quite competent and experienced, which bodes well for future visitors. I'll hit some items: Design/Decor - if you like the cool, minimalist modern design style, you'll appreciate the property look. With little space to work with, the lobby, restaurant, rooftop bar, rooms, and common spaces have a hip, well conceived style and design. The design provides a unique and enjoyable ambiance to the property. You can immediately assess is you like the style by checking out the hotel's website. Prior postings have mentioned the poor upkeep on the property, along with the Best Western-like bathrooms. Our bathroom was remodeled. Its not a Four Seasons bathroom, but nicely styled in accord with the hotel and very functional. I assume that all the bathrooms are in the process of being updated. The halls and some vacant rooms were also getting fresh paint while we were there. With that said, the place does need some sprucing up - mainly minor things like tears in the duvet, worn floor spots, broken treadmills, etc. These are very correctable problems that I assume the new management is addressing and needs to do so. Rooms - The rooms are small, but comfortable and well appointed with sat. TV, comfy bed, small desk, safe, cool blue mood lighting and quality bathroom amenities. View of the beach/ocean were excellent and joy to wake up to. Again, with some referbrishing, the accomodations are quite nice. A mini fridge would be nice. Restaurants/Bars - Tangerine serves breakfast and dinner. Both well done, especially dinner. My recommendations are the salmon benedict for breakfast and the snapper for dinner, which was sensational. Breakfast is expensive and priced like a big city hotel. Dinner was also expensive, but worth at least one visit. The rooftop bar serves a decent, but limited lunch menu. Beach - A definite high point is the beach in front of the hotel. It is the nicest stretch of an otherwise very nice beach. Powdery sand, warm, blue/green caribbean water, nice breeze - can't ask for much more. One note of caution - while the whole beach is combed every single morning, it is public and you do find the occasional piece of glass in the sand. Keep your eyes peeled and wear sandles if you are walking off the shoreline. It isn't Turks/Caicos or Anguilla, but its quite fine a joy spend the day on. There are hotel owned chairs and towel service available at no cost. There is food/drink service as well. It is also uncongested, which is not the case in front of the other big botels on the beach (El San Juan and Intercontinental). The roof top pool is small and unheated - go to the beach! Service - The service, top to bottom, was consistently superb. It is on par with what you'd expect at a Four Seasons or Ritz. We were often greeted by name, our requests were promptly addressed, and we were upgraded without cost or request. I have not had better service anywhere, period. General Recommendations: Do not stay on the top floor (10). The night club goes late into the night and unless you like be lulled to sleep with pulsing techno music, you will not be happy. They also rearrange the furniture to convert the roof top lounge back into its daytime configuration - which is noisy. I would also avoid rooms next to the elevators - noisy. We stayed on 9th floor, ocean front - perfect. I'd recommend floors 6-9 for optimal view and less noise. If you're a breakfast eater, go to the Golden Bagel in the strip mall across the main street. Its nothing special, but decent food/coffee without spending $40. If you are a sushi eater - go to Shogun, which is a five minute cab ride. Excellent. (We went twice.) I'd also recommend the beachfront restaurant in front of the neighboring InterCont. for its tasty pizzas and beer right off the beach. One last thing - we did an excurion on the East Wind catamaran. It goes to Icacos or Culebra. Great boat, well run - very fun. The hotel desk will arrange it for you. If you are looking for a non-resort, unique spot to stay on a great stretch of beach - you will not be dissapointed witht the WC. Feel free to email with any questions. Bob

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with a few rough edges”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just had a wonderful 5 night stay at the Water Club and really enjoyed it. We liked: The fact it is small and not a huge resort, the location on Isla Verde which is a beautiful beach, wonderful friendly and good looking staff, the roof top bar with good drinks and fabulous view. The hotel has a very chic minimalist design but does show some wear. We had an ocean front room on the third floor and our sliding glass door would not work. We had to battle with it to get it to open. Although we were told it would be repaired, it never happened. The sound of the ocean in our rooms was great! The bathroom was small, and the caulking and paint jobs in there were not great. The fireplace in the roof top bar does not work! There is no jacuzzi and the roof top pool is small and cold, but the view is wonderful and this is a great place to spend some time. New management is busy improving the details & we would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice- Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: collazo333
Reviews.Content: There's not much more that I would want from a hotel. Rooms were clean and modern.The bar on the roof, which is where we spent most of our time has a great relaxing atmosphere during the day, and gets a little more active at night, but you can relax on the other side of the bar if you wish. We stayed on the 3rd floor and based on former reviews, asked them not to place us near the elevator which they did. We stayed from Dec 28- Jan 4th. The room is great for 2. The bed has nice fluffy pillows and bedsheets. The beach is great and the staff was absolutely great and helpful. I could not believe that others had complained about the staff, they were all great. Walking distance to the El San Juan Hotel which can provide great nightime casino entertainment. If you don't want to stay in Condado, with that traffic who would, this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel with Great Employees”
Reviews.Author: JerseyGirl205
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 5 nights at Water Club. After reading posts on this forum, I was expecting the worst.We are well traveled and have stayed at some of the best resorts in the Caribbean. The Hotel is a great hotel. The rooms (2-because we were moved due to a leaking hot water heater) were very clean and in decent condition. We are used to NYC hotels, so we were not expecting a large room. There was sufficient storage and the bathroom might be in need of fixing up, but it was clean and met its purpose. The major asset of the hotel were the employees. They were incredible and could not do enough to please you. We had a great trip and will definetly return to the Water Club.I can say that the reviews that I read on this board, were not fair or accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Okay but wouldnt go back!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Water Club was okay. I only stayed for one night and that was plenty for me. I didnt think it was as nice or as clean as it looked in the pictures. The rooms were so small and the bathroom needed renovation. I would not consider this hotel a 4 star. The thing the made me the most mad was the loud hammering at 8am on a Sunday morning. There were a few things I liked about the hotel, everyone was friendly, the beach is great, the decor is neat (maybe a little over done though) but I was not sad to leave by any means!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wasted potential”
Reviews.Author: Adman2588
Reviews.Content: There is much about the Water Club to like: the rooms, although small, are nicely decorated; the beach is lovely and uncrowded; the front-line staff is very friendly and accommodating; the pool is delightful, with a panoramic view of the beach that it shares with the rooftop bar. Unfortunately, all this is overshadowed by management that seems clueless (at best) or indifferent (at worst) about how to meet the needs of its guests. The failures ranged from the ridiculous (the constant lack of towels at the beach) to the offensive (the noisy construction on the 9th and 10th floors that started every morning, including Sunday, at 7:30; the resulting filth everywhere; the party co-sponsored by the hotel that kept my family awake with impossibly loud music from 1 to 4 one morning). Overall, I can't recommend this property: the problems completely overwhelmed the positives. The third day into our stay, we moved to the nearby Holiday Inn, which, although not nearly so chic, was clean and quiet. At half the price of the Water Club, we were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck without a room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had prepaid reservations, already charged to my credit card. Tried to check in at 8pm on arrival day but they had overbooked. "Sorry, no more rooms are available.". Called us a cab and asked the driver to take us to the Best Western in the airport terminal. Instead of an ocean-front view had a view of the runway. Just during checkin we saw 2 other couples that were not given rooms, even though they also had reservations. Front desk said it happens all the time. Did stay subsequent nights and it was o.k. Definitely not worth the headache. Noisy "mostly working" air conditioner. Neat idea with waterfalls in halls but they're loud, crusty, and water spays over the poor exposed wiring job. Bad service overall. Stop by the rooftop bar if you want to get a feeling for the hotel, don't waste your money staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Design isn't everything”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Water Club for one night and really looked forward to my stay due to the fact that several magazines (i.e. Conde Naste) rate this hotel to be one of the best hotels in the Caribbean. To say it bluntly: if this is one of the best... I don't want to image what the others are like. The rooms are furnished rather cheaply, the bathrooms need refurbishment and the minibar in my room was located in a drawer (yummy: warm Champagne!!!) The service staff is friendly but scarce which results in very slow service. I only "enjoyed" drinks and a snack at the roof top pool bar and the breakfast in their "restaurant" and was disappointed on both occasions. In fact the breakfast is a ripoff - I have never seen such a sad display of food items in my life... This hotel could be one of the best and coolest hotels in the Caribbean, if they get their act together and pay attention to details. It seems to me that weekends seem to be holy days-off for management as I only saw line staff during my stay. And that even due to the fact that they were sold-out. The Water Club should not rest on the awards achieved. I paid around US$300 for my stay and felt ripped off. The only reasons why I didn't ask for a refund were the friendliness of the staff and that I had an early check-in to my room (eventhough my reservation seemed to have gotten lost somewhere). I guess this hotel is for people who don't care too much about service and are satisfied with a cool design & ambience and spectacular views of San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “From the sublime to the ridiculous...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The ocean is sublime... The hotel is ridiculous. The hotel is obviously catering to local party-goers than to its clientele. The second you walk into this establishment you're bombarded by the loudest and worst taste in music (really it's noise) I have ever encountered. And this NOISE follows you everywhere, all day and night. The hotel staff have absolutely no customer service skills, rather they stand around as if waiting to be discovered by the next great Hollywood agent. The hotel is not kept clean and obviously neither are the rooms. The bedding is questionable, the furniture is worn and filthy, the bathrooms can use a thorough sanitizing. I could go on, but I think you'll get the picture. The food - the only thing I can say is WHY? Why on an island like Puerto Rico which can boast one of the best traditional cuisines in the world, would this hotel serve such bad and expensive food? The answer - this hotel wants to be as trendy as possible. Well as we all know a trend is just a trend - just passing through for a short while.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK... nothing more.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't go back but we did have an enjoyable weekend. The rooms (we moved so stayed in a couple) were fine ... after the first night spent in a very small room without a view we were moved to a larger, quieter one which had a lovely view. I felt sorry for anyone staying anywhere near the bar on the top floor - although fun to go to late at night - it was incredibly noisy. The staff were young and fairly inexperienced but they were pleasant enough. Service at the bar though was incredibly slow and the food was forgettable. The rooms were OK - furnished rather cheaply. The bathroooms need refurbishing but the beds were comfortable and the rooms were clean. We booked through expedia and so got a special rate and so weren't too bothered by the many small annoyances but had we paid full price I think we'd have felt robbed !

Reviews.Title: “It was nice... might have been nicer in another room”
Reviews.Author: JATraveler
Reviews.Content: I went to the Water Club with my boyfriend for Labor Day weekend. It was the first time either one of us had been to Puerto Rico, and we used Tripadvisor reviews to help us pick a hotel. The Water Club had mixed reviews, and now I know why. First, let me say that the place is really nice... Very cool and trendy. Blue lights bathe the hallways and guest rooms, and the cool pebble photo tiles, waterfall elevator, and soothing piped in sounds made for a really unique atmosphere. Our room was impressive at first, but then disappointing. We were right next to the elevator shaft so all day and all night, we heard loud sounds from it-- it sounded like somebody dragging dumpsters across the floor. It was hard to sleep. We requested to switch rooms the next day, but ended up in the same situation on a higher floor. I think if we had a room closer to the end of the hall, we would have been much happier. We had a room on the 7th floor, and on the weekend, we could hear the music from the club loud and clear. We didn't mind that noise, but I could see how it could bother older guests. The rooms looked like they started the renovations then stopped once they got to the bathrooms. The bathrooms looked like they were leftover from a previous incarnation of the hotel. I didn't see any of the really high-priced rooms, but they're probably gorgeous. The rooftop lounge was great. Really nice place to sip a martini and listen to music. You can look out at the city and the sea and enjoy the breeze. Not many people were dancing when we went though. The location of the hotel was perfect. We were right across the street from the beach, which was beautiful. Very clean with warm water. The hotel is near to the main strip of Isla Verde. There were a lot of people out over the weekend. Overall, we really enjoyed Puerto Rico. We took the 25-cent bus over to Old San Juan a few days for shopping and sightseeing. It was nice experience. You see more of the "real" San Juan from riding the bus than you probably would have in a chartered bus or taxi. And the fort in Old San Juan is a cool tour for $3.

Reviews.Title: “Sensual and Relaxing Paradise in Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Words are not enough to express the wonderful time we had during our recent vacation at the Water Club in San Juan, Puerto Rico! On an island of many hotels of to choose from, the Water Club is an oasis paradise of its own, tucked away on a serene dead-end street, right at the doorstep of San Juan's white sand beaches. The Hotel is beautifully appointed with its whitewashed walls, wooden floors, waterfall elevators, sensual bars and lounges that are designed for mingling or bringing couples closer - much closer. The chefs and bartenders are creative if not a bit eccentric in their preparation and presentation of foods and drinks, always with just the right touches of sophistication and allure. The Water Club provides a relaxing atmosphere for those who wish to stretch their legs and breathe in the warm salty air, as well as the choice of various upbeat, fun, sexy venues, especially the rooftop bar/restaurant where we enjoyed great food (wonderful sushi) and deliciously wicked drinks amidts a funky and diverse crowd who knows how to have fun to great music, especially on the week-ends, when the place is hopping! The rooms are immaculate, creatively designed and offer guests day or night time dreams away from home. From the minute we arrived to the minute we left, we received excellent services starting from the bellmen, the reception, parking attendants, food and beverage personnel, the cleaning staff, and the General Manager. The multi-lingual staff ensures that each guests leaves happy, and if there is anything amiss or not to the client's liking, they immediately react to satify every (reasonable) desire. As such, most importantly, what impressed us most was the attentiveness of the Hotel's personnel, including the Manager of Food and Bevarages and its General Manager post an injury suffered by the writer. The Hotel called in a Doctor to do a thorough examination and followed up to ensure that further care was not needed. This was most appreciated and allowed us to enjoy our vacation notwithstanding the accident and, in addition to already really loving the Water Club for all its amenities and excellent services, we developed a deep respect for its management and the way they envelop their clientele with humanity and caring. Not to mention that the price was right and the Hotel is only a 3 1/2 hour plane ride from NY and a 5 minute taxi ride from San Juan's International Airport! We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Location and staff will bring us back”
Reviews.Author: trvllisted
Reviews.Content: This was our first time visiting PR, and we were very pleased with staying at the Water Club and in Isla Verde. It was a great stretch of beach with the Water Club located at the end of a small side street. Upon arrival we checked out the rooftop bar/pool (with great views) which was filled with lounge chars and beds to stretch out on. Prompt service from the bartender and the waitresses, however you sort of had to strike up some conversation with them and they did not stray far. The F&B manager and all front desk agents were very sweet and were very helpful to us for the entire stay. Dining and drinking at the Water Club is fairly pricey. But if you are not a fan of spending the $ the location is perfect there are several smaller local bars along the Isla Verde beach area (stay away fom the big hotels) that we ended up visiting on a daily basis. These places had good food, good portions, great views, great prices. I think a good majority may have huge expectations for this hotel, please remember you are not in South Beach but rather a nice friendly beach town in PR. We would not hesitate to visit the WC again.

Reviews.Title: “Telling it like it is...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okay...so I just got back from a week long stay with my fiance at the Water Club. After reading so many mixed reviews, I decided to take the plunge. Here are our thoughts. Good feature- The Water Club is located on a great beach and the the hotel supplied an umbrella, towels, and lounge chairs. We did not have to pay for this and on Thursdays thru Sundays a waitress comes around to take your orders. We had cocktails and lunch without even leaving the beach (can get pricey...but convenient). The room looked like it did in the pictures..though smaller than I had thought. Still fine for two people and comfortable. Keep in mind it is a boutique hotel. I thought the atmosphere was really cool...def a must to hang out at Wet and Tangerine. The view from the top is amazing. The pool is small but everyone goes to the beach so we lucked out on two days being the only ones up there. I have to say the customer service was exceptional...maybe they were getting alot of negative feedback..but the beach staff, store staff, front desk, housekeeping etc.. all greeted us each time they saw us and answered all questions. Some glitches- The first morning we had no hot water..called the front desk and within minutes someone was up to fix it. We stayed on the fifth floor...and with the air conditioning we really could not hear what went on in the other guests rooms. Exception...the weekend gets crowded I think many people come from Friday to Sunday... we had very loud neighbors...I think above us? But all in all in was a positive experience.. it is a pricey hotel and I did stop in some other hotels furthur down the beach and was wowed. However, Water Club definetly has its own unique style. I recommend this hotel for twenty and thirty somethings....no families... and older people who are well traveled and have stayed in variety of accommodations. Oh... and El Yunque and Old San Juan are must sees... The hotel will hook you up with the rainforest tour but skip the Luquillo Beach add on (Isla Verde is much nicer!!). Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Never, nver again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I surprised my fiance' with a trip home to Puerto Rico, this was his first trip home to see his family in 26 years. I searched the internet for just the right accomodations and thought I had found it, they offered everything I was looking for to make his trip home quite memorable. After our arrival, all seemed well, until we noticed things missing from our luggage. Each room has a mini wet bar, which we never used, but items became missing from it daily, and we were charged for it at check-out. They also do not tell you that you must pay $15.00 per day for valet parking, beg for soap and towels and check behind the maid everyday. The valet wrecked our rental car and promised to have it cleaned and the scratches removed before we returned it, he never did and we still were forced to pay $1800.00 for a week of pure hell, plus deal with the rental car company for damage caused by the hotel's valet parking attendant. Take my word for it and stay on the western side of the island, where people are friendly, the ocean is more beautiful, the traffic is not so bad and the room rates are much less expensive and the amenities are better.

Reviews.Title: “It's an OK/Great looking Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jilly912
Reviews.Content: THE WATER CLUB>> This hotel is quite nice. It is a beautiful Decor. However the rooms are really small for the price you are paying, but you are paying for all of the decor of the hotel than the rooms. The TV did not work in our room, called it in and never got a new one. NO parking in there area, Things in the room were crazy expensive for the robe in teh room hanging so nicely next to the bathroom it was $100.00, The bottles of liquor were like 10 each for a PINT mean while walk to the corner and make a left you will find a supermarket that sold fifths for 10.00, bathroom not the cleaness but it was good,we had the room on the third floor Center Balcony. Room service was good, room was always clean when we came back, the house ladies are extremely nice. Staff is really Nice as the upgraded us to that room when we got there. Paid 169.00 a night stood 5 nights. Isla Verde had lots of places to go but you needed to do some walking thats it or rent a car from Charlie's very cheap. And eat Mama Cita food is great. Other wise this hotel is the type that you pay for the out side look the location on the beach and decor so it lives up to what the are showing us. Would I go back yes and no.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time or money”
Reviews.Author: sibcamp1
Reviews.Content: Not at all what I expected. They have a great concept but did not follow through. Food was horrible, service was good one minute bad the next. Cheap dirty furniture. Had a decent time but having stayed at other nice hotels this one just does not cut it. DOnt waste your money, spend a little more and stay at the Intercontinental, great rooms, wonderful pool, great staff. Also did not like isla verde that much, next time will go to Condado

Reviews.Title: “Trust these reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my honeymoon (we're both in our early 30s and like unique boutique hotels not mega resorts with casinos). We stayed one night here before heading off to Vieques for the duration of our stay (the quiet, romantic Wyndham - great place). I, too, read these reviews and thought it can't be that bad, it looks great on their website. But not true. The room was tiny, and not clean...bathroom floor was sticky, the wooden furniture had so many nicks in it, it was like they picked it up at Good Will, and stains on the upholstered chair in the room, and on the bedskirt. The bedding seemed ok though I found a couple of strange hairs. This area of San Juan is dirty and unattractive. We strolled on the (dirty) beach, and ventured out for some food. We could not wait to get out of there an on to Vieques. Oh, the reviews about paper-thin walls and noise is also true. The only good thing was that I mentioned while booking at the water club that it was the first night of our honeymoon so they had two small bottles of champagne, and two (both bruised) apples waiting for us in the room. A nice gesture. But heck, it was a whopping $200 a night. SO not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice change from chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrizo
Reviews.Content: I was here 1 night, 5/23-24 on a Tuesday. Checkin was smooth, courteous, after a long day driving through monsoon's from Aguadilla, so I mentioned I did not need any more "water", got a chuckle from the staff. The room was very nice, style was cool but not so functional. The "desk" was a tiny glass shelf hidden behind the bed. Bed was super comfortable but the A/C blew right in my face. The patio door would not open, and was stuck about 1/2 inch open also. The Liquid lounge at the roof is s w e e t. Nice wait staff and comfy couches/lounges. The hotel was awesome for the $120 I paid on priceline. Did not try the food, but overall service was great.

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant surprise.”
Reviews.Author: Shelly
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 night stay at the Water Club. After reading many of your reviews, I was not expecting very much. We were travelling with a group of 5 couples for a special birthday celebration. I must say that we were ALL very pleasantly surprised with our entire experience. The hotel is very stylish and aesthetically pleasing. The rooms are medium sized and very comfortable with great air conditioning. The views are terrific. Ask for an ocean front room with a small balcony. If not, all of the rooms are very nice. The beach and ocean are beautiful and very well groomed. A beach guy is there at all times to help set up chairs and to give you clean towels. They also have waitress service on the beach. The rooftop bar is beautiful. The pool, however, is really quite small, so don't count on doing much swimming in the rooftop pool. The bar area has fantastic views. I do not suggest eating at the hotel as the food is weak and the prices are high. The gourmet pizzas for lunch, however, are quite good. There are so many restaurants nearby, especially for breakfast, that it is not a problem. I suggest going to Old San Juan for dinner. The staff was always pleasant and helpful. The club music does get loud at night, but as soon as you get in your room and turn on the air-conditioner. you can't hear the noise. Ask for a room between the 3rd and 7th floors to be sure not to hear the music. Overall, the Water Club is a great place to get away for a long weekend. Just don't bring the young kids. I hope to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough wonderful things about the Water Club. My boyfriend and I just got back and we had a perfect stay at this beautiful hotel. The staff were all friendy and sweet, the room was immaculate, the ambiance amazing. This is not a place for families, it's more couple oriented. I would recommend this hotel to all young, hip couples that like to party. Even when the 2 "clubs" were going it was quiet in our room, there was no doors "banging" or early morning staff noise in the hallways. The girls at the front desk were attentive, even to the point of providing us with a small refrigerator for my boyfriends medicne that needed to be kept cold. They took care of our car and dinner reservations. There isn't enough room to speak of how much we enjoyed our stay. My boyfriend and I are definitely going to make the Water Club our "Home Base" for our return trip(s). The beach was beautiful and clean, the beach staff very friendly and nice. I wish I were still there! Thanks to all the staff at this great hotel, thanks for the chocolate chip cookies and the Red Bull!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as they say.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from San Juan, where I stayed in the Water Club Hotel. Like all traveling I do, research is an important thing to do. Let's just say I did not research enough. They say all beds are facing the ocean. What good is it when you cannot see it. It is said they will do almost anything to please you. Well they did give me a different room after I compained about the bathroom sink cover was cracked in two parts when I arrived. Oh yeah, the window shades did not work also. The next room had a phone that did not work properly. If you feel like sitting in your room and relaxing, try the beach because every time someone on the same floor as you enters or leaves their room you will hear and feel the door close. I cannot leave out something very important like food. When it is time for a meal, you might want to take a walk or a cab ride to have it. When I am on vacation, it is a must that I eat good meals. The food in the Water Club is really not all that. I was told in Puerto Rico the Water Club Hotel is rated 3 stars. Coming from a New Yorker, I give it 2 stars. A friend of a friend had told me today that he was there at the Dance Club Liquid inside of the hotel and he really enjoyed it and I had said that was because he did not stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible decor, awesome beach, very nice staff!!”
Reviews.Author: JacquelineOnyc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, early 30's stayed at this hotel from May 1 - May 7th, and got a great deal with airfare through orbitz, average per night we paid was about $145, and let me tell you, we were absolutely blown away, we arrived at the hotel very early, (11am) and were treated very nicely by staff, we lounged at the beach until our room was ready, at about 2:30pm, early considering check in was later than that, we were upgraded to partial ocean view, on the 9th floor, awesome view of the coastline, very clean modern decor, very friendly staff, after by the second day, front desk staff two girls in particular greeted us by name, everyone greeted with a smile, when asked for assistance, staff always ended conversation with "my pleasure" in a genuine way, the guys out front we very helpful as well, i have to tell you, that after i booked, i also panicked reading the negative reviews, but my husband and i are so glad we stayed, very convenient location, best beach, we also went to Condado, just to check it out, not as nice as isla verde where water club is, we also went to Luquillo, very nice, tranquil, but not as nice as isla verde, also hotel staff on beach set up umbrellas, lounge chairs and beach towels free of charge each time, refused to take our tips, said it was "my pleasure", very attractive staff, reminded us of when we stayed in south beach miami, also walgreens is across the street, various restaurants within walking distance, Oyster bar, is awesome location for drinks dance music (mixed) for all crowds and live band on Wed, i just cant say enough, also when i asked for more shampoo from housekeeping, due to my long curly hair, my request was granted with 5 travel size shampoos and conditioners each morning!! also when we wanted to go to culebra island to snorkel, front desk staff searched for tour companies that were going out to culebra for us until they found a tour company that was going. very accomadating, one downside i do have to admit, the food at tangerine was expensive, an expresso for $8.00, a pancake platter for $12.00, we opted to go to "mi casita" down the block for an awesome puerto rican breakfast that left our mouths watering for more, I honestly can not believe the negative reviews are from people that actually stayed at the hotel, it was clean consistently throughout, the rooftop lounge was beautiful i will post pictures at a later date, when my husband probably posts his review, the drinks are reasonably priced *$8.00 pina colada which tasted fantastic!!! the music upstairs on the rooftop is turned down at midnight, the dj on friday night was awesome with the house tracks, very cool, this is more of a lounge atmosphere, where you can lay back relax enjoy sea breeze, to dance go to oysters after hours, for live salsa go to shots down the block, do your research, you can also get directions to all excursions like the yunque, caves, etc. from water club, if you want to rent a car, across the street is charlies rental, very convenient location, the bus to old san juan, just 25 cents also right down the block to get this bus.... i absolutely recommend without hesitation, only i advise to look up best rate from orbitz. expedia, hotels, so that you get the best rate, enjoy your stay, it's beautiful, throughout, it's for couples, definetly romantic atmosphere, not for families or children, thank goodness we left our kids back in NYC for this getaway..... i would say 3.5 stars for sure.....

Reviews.Title: “One word- Wyndam”
Reviews.Author: jerseygirl10577
Reviews.Content: PLEASE, whatever you do, so not spend $300 a night on this renovated by Ikea hotel. I booked this trip on Orbitz thinking the pictures were spectacular only to find out they gutted some old hotel, put some posh decor in it, and called it "contemporary luxury". The rooms we small and had no view at all. The TV was a 19" and there was no dresser at all for your clothes. We won't even talk about the bathroom. Such a joke. Could have stayed at the Ritz or the Wyndam for a couple bucks more and been SO much happier.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Water Club every Feb. for the last few years. The employees treat us great. The hotel has been doing some renovations the last few years which keeps us going back each year. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at this dump”
Reviews.Author: MiamiMommytraveller
Reviews.Content: I just came back from San Juan and had the misfortune of staying at the Waterclub. Thank goodness for only one night. I travel often to PR for business and had visited the lounge upstairs several times-- (The only wonderful thing about this hotel)-- it is a great place to relax at night and enjoy a drink while soaking in the Caribbean breezes... so I was excited to finally stay at this chic hotel. My stay was aweful!!! My room was dirty, the sheets on my bed had lipstick stains, the floor in the bathroom had sand. I pointed this out to the staff and they changed my room. In the next room my key did not work. I had to have housekeeping let me in to my room. I returned at 11:15PM after a full day working to learn that room service ended at 11:00PM so no dinner for me. Oh and of course to a room without a functioning A/C unit. And so at 11:30PM -tired and hungry, I changed rooms again to a room with a somewhat functioning A/C unit that by 7:00 AM was an oven. So if you are going to enjoy wonderful San Juan stay at the Ritz Carlton for great service and a nice beach or at the Wyndham Condado if you are on a budge andfor great views- (for Wyndham by request members they have two floor assigned to you and always give you a room with a balcony and amazing view).

Reviews.Title: “Treated like Royalty”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at SJU friday morning at around 2am, my girlfriend and I were dead tired. After we landed, we took the Avis courtesy bus to pick up our rented car for the week and we drove to Isla Verde to the hotel. Once we arrived there, the valet attendant thought we were there to party and had advised us that the bar was closed. I informed him that we had room reservations and he quickly helped us with our luggage and parked my car. Check-in was great! Fast... just the way I liked it. When I made reservations for the hotel, I asked the consierge to have a bottle of Moet Chandon Brut to suprise my girlfriend. As soon as we walked in the hotel, there was the champagne waiting for us on ice!!! The following days to come were wonderful with friendly staff always smiling and always willing to go the extra mile. Besides the hotel, the beach right in front is garbage. But the hotel staff make it great. There's a guy there who gives you a free chair, table, umbrella and towels and sets you all up for FREE!!! The lounge upstairs is great for drinking and relaxing, the price for drinks are the same as in a NY night club and what I expected. Knowing that the beach was ugly, I drove my girlfriend to Luquillo beach which is beautiful!!! YOU NEED A CAR, its the only way you can get from point A to B w/o getting jerked by a cab. The only thing is that everything is written in spanish so if you can't read spanish, its a little difficult. I read all the bad reviews about this hotel and they are wrong!!! I stayed at the Ritz, the Plaza (NYC), four seasons (Santa Barbara) and let me tell you, this hotel is great. Dont be scared, its worth the buck$!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend it under any circumstances.”
Reviews.Author: ElizaDenver
Reviews.Content: I am frankly suprised the Water Club gets away with the price charged. In no way is this a $300 a night stay. The rooms are not exactly dirty, but the old-fashiond ceilings are moldy and stained, the baseboards are poor quality and dirty and give the whole room a cheap feeling, the furniture is strictly (cliche) style over quality. Don't get me started on the bathrooms--water doesn't drain from the tub, grout is filthy, tile floors are old and ugly, and they didn't even have shampoo. The water wall in the elevator is covered in scale from hard water. Oddly, there's no ceiling in the elevator either... And the blue glow that permeates the building is not chic or cool, just annoying, We're in our late 30s, so the 20-something crowd at the hotel wasn't appealing. In general, the hype on the Web site is just that.... I can't imagine anyone with any travel experience--say Donatella Versace and Madonna, both reputed to be guests--would stand for this kind of experience. Like other guests, we didn't complain. I seriously doubt it would accomplish anything. We simply thanked the stars that we were there for only one night en route to an infinitely better destination.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel possible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend ( March 10-March 14)--I am in my early 30's. If you are used to cleanliness in the rooms- if you have any time of allergies- DO NOT EVEN THINK OF THIS HOTEL. My asthma got worse because the hotel is not ventilated well or cleaned well. The rooms are so tiny with IKEA furniture in each room. Their double beds are good for only one person to sleep on. The beach in front of the hotel is terrible-- all the locals go there because the best resorts are a few doors down. Also, the ROOM service is disgusting. I never in my entire life was served mud for coffee. Furthermore, the service is horrible and the only good thing in the hotel is the Tangerine restaurant. If you are used to LUXURY when going on vacation- stay far from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and chic with a twist”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The pool area is rather fabulous. There are "beds" instead of lounge chairs which are comfortable and fun. For a Sunday - Tuesday stay, it was not very busy. The food at the pool side bar is so sparce; it may be delicious but it will leave you hungry and broke! The rooms are small but very clean and lovely. The staff is friendly but doesn't seem to bring their "A" game - which seems to be a trend with Puerto Rican hotel staff. The beach is very dirty - there is a great view of the ocean from the roof-top pool, that's as close as I'd get. The restaurant offerings are few and the in-room internet takes some servicing before it will work.

Reviews.Title: “Stay out of the Water”
Reviews.Author: nickijags
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? Pitiful beach area with grimy sand and lots of garbage. Bath tub like pool on the roof can only hold 4. Tiny rooms. Overpriced food. Loud, loud, loud. Because of the club upstairs, don't expect to get any sleep on a Thurs, Fri or Sat. This is billed as the first boutique hotel in PR; if it sets any precedence, it is likely to be the last.

Reviews.Title: “Just don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm only writing this review because I read other reviews that suggested others not to stay here unless you are 24. My husband and I stayed here last January (I know its been a while now). At the time we were only 22 celebrating our 1yr anniversary. Luckily we were only there for one night, before we boarded a ship on Royal Caribbean. We love nice things! We loved the photos and 360 images we saw. We thought every bad review we had read, were because people leaving them were losers. We arrived 30 mins before our room was supposed to be ready. We waited almost 4hrs before we were given a room. I witness others at who had similar problems. What makes it worse the view we had waited 4 hrs for was the wrong view. They were trying to give us only a partial not what we paid for. I had read about this, and overlooked this because I had verified my reservation and view multiple times. I had a fax confirmation with me, so they gave us a suite at no additional cost because they did not have a full ocean view available. This was their second chance. We were excited, because we had seen the photos of the suite, and knew this was a 700 room. Still it was horrible! The telescope was broken, the bathroom smelled like mildew, air unit leaked all over the floor, and room service food unbearable. The whole place was dirty and smelled. You can't get this from looking at the pictures. The hallways were also loud. I really don't care about any of this, to throw a fit. We didn't even mention how unhappy we were. I think they knew because we waited for ever for a room after traveling all day. The beach wasn't even clean. We have pretty pictures to show our friends and family, they think were crazy when we share how horrible this place really was. I should have known from the start, the ownerâ€™s dog or managerâ€™s dog (I think the dogs name was buddy love) had black knots all over him. I felt so bad for him. Please donâ€™t stay here. If you chose to, I hope you have a better experience. But I hear great things from the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “The Water Club”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Water Club is a "trendy" hotel that does not quite live up to its reputation. The rooms are small, but relatively comfortable, service is not up to par with the price of a room, beach chairs cost $8 (it is $4 50 ft. down the beach), waitresses are hard to come by on the beach. There is a tiny pool. If you are looking for a pool scene, do not go here. For the same money per night, it would be much better to stay at 1 of the larger hotels. The hotel is not terrible, but too expensive for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “Not with the children......”
Reviews.Author: diversitylady
Reviews.Content: Having missed a Caribbean connection, we (2 adults, 3 kids - 12, 9, 4) were booked into this hotel overnight by American Airlines. We arrived and left in the dark so couldn't tell much about the location, except that it is clearly close to the sea and not far from the airport. The kids thought the decor "cool" - blue water effects everywhere and the elevator has no roof. The reception staff were friendly and tried their best to accomodate us in relatively adjacent rooms, given our late and unexpected arrival. The beautiful model/hostess of the trendy restaurant kept making eyes at our 4 year old whilst escorting chic Miami types to their tables, as we stood around in our travelled-in shorts at reception feeling overweight and out of place. Superficially, the rooms are very nice. Cool whites and neutral colors, interesting geometrical patterns and ceiling to floor glass windows (don't bring the kids). However, the finishes were poor and the bathrooms tacky. We decided to order room service, not daring to venture into the restaurant with the kids and our garb. Unfortunately, nothing was particularly suitable for tired, picky kids and after some negotiation, I was offered three smallish pieces of chicken with rice and a bottle of water for US $108. It was delicious though! I expect this place is wonderful for a romantic getaway if you have the right clothes and credit cards, but don't bring the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: beth2120
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Water Club for one night post-cruise (12/18). We got the room through hotwire, so we did not pay an arm and a leg for it. I have stayed in various hotels in San Juan and am fully aware I should not expect "greatness," as sub-par is pretty much the norm for San Juan. We arrived at 9am... which is obviously well before the 3pm check-in time. The staff was super friendly (quite the opposite to what I have read in other reviews). The front desk clerk checked us in right away! We were very pleased to get into our room early -- we were tired and not in the mood to kill time for 6 hours. We had an ocean view room on the 7th floor. Rooms are very "ikea" like, but not at all offensive. In fact, my fiance thought the room was very cool and was very much pleased with the accomodations. I had signed up for the "water club desires" program prior to our stay, so when we arrived, we had 2 diet cokes and two large cans of planters p-nuts in our room, as well as a few cd's we had requested. I thought this was a nice touch (and no charge, I might add!). We spent the rest of our day lounging by the rooftop pool -- the deck is filled with lots of bed-like loungers and towels are available as well. We did not have food/drinks or anything at the pool bar, but another couple sunning next to us did and commented on how good the food was. The hotel is conveniently located to a Walgreens and every fast food restaurant in existance. If you are not in the mood for Taco Bell or Burger King, there is a Ruth Chris steakhouse in the Intercontinental hotel within walking distance, as well as a Palm Restaurant (and others) in the Wyndham El San Juan, also within walking distance. The rooftop bar was closed in the evening for a private party, which was kind of a bummer... I would have liked a happy-hour drink up there, but oh well. I will say that there was noise in the hallways at times, but it was not unbearable... in fact, I cannot think of many hotels I've stayed in where I *didn't* hear noise. In my opinion, noise is expected in hotels (and I have stayed in many, many hotels of all star levels). I can agree that this hotel is not for everyone... for example, I could not see my parents staying here! It reminded me of that expedia commercial when the girl is booking a hotel room for her parents and she envisions them in this super hip, modern hotel! All in all, our stay was very pleasant and I have no complaints at all. Would I stay here again? Yes -- If the price were right, but when in San Juan, I prefer staying in *Old* San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “trendy but limited”
Reviews.Author: jeanki
Reviews.Content: I stayed with friends at this trendy hotel on the main Isla Verde strip near the airport. It was smaller than I expected and is not a large resort-style or even full-service hotel in terms of having a spa on site or more than 1 restaurant, but is still a very nice boutique hotel. The architecture that they tout is indeed very cute and trendy, much like the W hotel chain, with the fun waterfall elevators and neat design throughout. The top floor patio is a wonderful place to relax with the sun beds, although the pool is woefully small. I was disappointed that the main restaurant did not have lunch service, and the upstairs bar lunch menu was very small and overpriced. The food overall was good though, the breakfast in the main restaurant exceptional (the vanilla bean waffles are heaven), and there are cheaper dining options a short walk away and a Walgreen's. The beach is right across the street. The water is not that clear because the sand gets stirred up by the tide, but is warm and blue. I found the hotel quiet because it wasn't that crowded during off season, although you can hear your neighbors' TV sometimes. The service was pleasant, albeit typically slow in PR. There were some minor glitches (the shower curtain was too short and leaked water onto the bathroom floor, the shades were broken). The rooms are not that large. If you want small hip and trendy, this is your hotel. If you want a large, gracious full service resort, this isn't it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect to get much sleep...”
Reviews.Author: dmarcus
Reviews.Content: This was perhaps the worst hotel we've ever stayed at. I could tolerate the cheesy faux-modern furniture, and the highly ineffectual staff, but the noise level at this club (oops, I mean hotel) was out of control. I knew we were in trouble as we were awakened from a 6 PM nap by workers in the hallway, banging away and shouting. There was ZERO sound proofing throughout this place. It literally seemed as if there were guys swinging a hammer 2 feet from our bed. Every time the door to another room closed, it BOOMED shut. Of course, later that night, around 3 AM, the other drunken guests on our floor returned and woke us up. You could hear every sound from the room next to us, above us, and each sound in the hallway was maginified by the uncarpeted floor. We complained to the front desk and the sound died down in about 45 minutes. The next morning upon checkout, I tried to adjust our bill or at least lodge a major complaint, but I was told that there was no manager to speak to. Save your $$$ and stay far away from this place, unless you're 24 years old and like to party all night.

Reviews.Title: “Coming with your family? stay away! Under 30? - come on in!”
Reviews.Author: Burgercj
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Water Club with my wife and four of our friends in July - all in our mid-20's, and had a blast. This is not a great place to take your family, but if you are young and/or single, this is a great place! The decor is a bit cheesy (trying too hard to be like South Beach hotels), but I found it interesteing regardless. Very modern, fung-shei. I found the staff helpful - we arrived at 10:30 am and were able to check in immediately. On the rooftop they have these outdoor couches where you can relax, have a few cocktails, and watch the sunset. At nighttime, it livens up. The bar at the top floor of the hotel is great fun. We stayed up drinking all night long, and had a blast - the exact reason I would recommned it to the young, but tell those with youngsters to avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Desires? Oh boy, do I have a few!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really should have read the reviews from this site before booking my one night stay at The Water Club, but I figured since this place was featured in Travel and Leisure magazine it would be worthwhile, boy was I wrong. "Desires...?": ("Desires?" is their coy way of having you list your requests on a small glass bulletin board in your room) How about removing the mold in the bathtub (and regrouting the tile for good measure)? Having windows that close? Mopping the dusty floor once in a while? NOT moving chairs and furniture around at 6:00am at the upstairs bar (where we were sleeping on the floor below)? Perhaps hiring personel that do NOT lose your credit card info, making you check in twice? Maybe consider putting a plexiglass cover on the elevators, so that God forbid something falls down the shaft, it won't hit you? And lastly, getting locked (because whoever locked up for the night didn't bother to check to see if anyone was still there) out on the rooftop pool area at night may have been romantic for some, but since we thankfully had to leave the next morning, my husband and I had to pull a MacGyver and crawl through a narrow window to get to the elevators. Since they couldn't bear to just give us another room, the hotel did send someone up to our room to install new window fixtures, WHILE WE WERE THERE TRYING TO RELAX, so if any of you potential visitors to this "Too Cool To Care" hotel get room #1006, your windows now close thanks to us! For all this fun 'n adventure, we paid just $250 for one night! This may be a good place for people who don't care about quality, but for the rest of us who do, don't waste your time or money.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad & the ugly!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Good...The Water Club is a great alternative to the many super-chain hotels in the San Juan area. With only a fraction of guests, it's much more intimate. Upon check-in, we received an upgrade to a suite, at no additional charge. During the day, the practically empty roofdeck, bar & pool were quiet and relaxing. The amazingly comfy sun "beds" were reason enough to choose the pool over the beach. The Bad...which became The Ugly! Upon checking in and getting past the trying-to-hard, cheesy Miami-esque decor, I rang the front desk for a wake-up call for a business meeting. It rang and rang and rang, until finally I relied on my cell phone for an alarm. It took 3 calls to get a 2nd robe, 3 calls for an iron...and 3 calls until I gave up on help from the concierge with a restaurant recommendation. It was 2 times that we were locked out of our room and each time, we waited for them to make multiple trips down to the lobby for the master key. It was 2 times, after placing lunch orders at the roofdeck bar that we were forgotten about and after 40 mins., found out our order was never even put in to the kitchen. After ALL that - when we asked for a late check out, they offered only 1 HOUR or, $75 to stay until the early afternoon (how generous!). I could go on, but you get the idea... Next time I visit Puerto Rico, I'd opt for the Ritz or the El San Juan - even if it means being surrounded by kids doing cannonballs into the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read reviews on the Water Club after I booked it and was upset with what I was reading, some of the reviews were terrible. I panicked and called my travel agent to change my hotel for another, unfortunately there was no availability for July. I arrived at the Water Club with an open mind and was so surprised. The staff was welcoming, pleasant, helpful & accomodating. I never had a problem with the staff throughout my stay. My husband said that I did good by choosing the Water Club. He liked it immediately. The Water & color themes were soft, romantic & relaxing. The room was impeccably clean with the view I requested, you open your eyes and the first thing you look at is that beautiful beach & the Carribean. I must say the reviews were right about having no closets and there is just a little space to hang a few garments & three small drawers. Everything else was fine so we did not mind at all. The Terrace on the top floor where the pool is (very tiny) was just beautiful with breathtaking views, the decor was so lovely with flowing drapes & nice furniture with plenty of room to relax. I cannot say enough about the Terrace. The Tangerine restaurant was ridiculous in price but I read it has excellent food. I thought it was to pricey so we did not try it. I would not rate the Water Club a five star. It was not top of the line luxury but I would definately go back one day especially if there were other restaurants added on. I would rate the Water Club about 3 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe ....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: how many reviews there are for this overated boo-tique hotel and how some people just thought it was the worst hotel, and to others, a nice place. This hotel must have friends writing about their stay, because when my family visited, I must admit, there was not one thing I liked about it. Very unfriendly people, pool was locked up, breakfast very pricey, and just okay, room was terrible. I stayed one night and that was enough for me. Will never return and never-ever would recommend it. Stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Water Club Chic? Not so much”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Water Club began with a left turn down a dusty, construction filled dead-end road. "Le Boutique" was at the end of the road across the street from the beach. Although there was so much dirt and sand covering the road, I can see why the hotel believes it is "on" the beach. While checking in my wife noticed that we were assigned to a smoking room. Innocent mistake I thought, but when I brought it to the clerk's attention, I was told that she was only trying to get us into a room as soon as possible. (Thanks for the effort, but we prefer not to spend our week in "paradise" sleeping in an ashtray). Upon entering the elevator we were a bit surprised to see that the hotels "waterfall" was little more than water trickling down a pain of glass. Look up and you'll notice that the top of the elevators are removed allowing you to view the entire shaft. This allows the elevators to double as a sound transfer system. During the evening you will be able to hear everything that is happening in the hotel from your bedroom. It was so loud we couldn't sleep our entire first night. In addition to the noise, the room was small, the bathroom dirty, and there was no where to put your clothes, no dressers, no closets. Our room did face the ocean but the view was obscured by the small, dirt encrusted windows. Apparently some one forgot to install our floor to ceiling windows. After a midnight battle with management we were given a suite on a higher floor. The suite was nice, with larger windows, but of course it was a smoking room. We made every attempt to leave after the second day however, we could not get a reservation elsewhere. We decided to make the best of it. We would stay off the beach to avoid having our rented chairs and towels stolen a second time. (I also did not have a nice bullet proof vest like all the cops were wearing, while patroling the sands.) We decided to take advantage of the roof top bar/lounge/pool area, which was actually very nice. Unfortunately after one day of frolicking, the hotel closed the pool for three days and the bar for a day and a half. If your looking for nice accomodations, service, safety, and some acknowledgement that you are a guest in a hotel, go to the Ritz down the block, it was only $20 more a night.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the worst hotel that I have ever stayed in. Don't be fooled by the website! The hotel is extremely noisy and the service sucks. We were constantly being woken up by loud, drunk patrons leaving the Wet bar. The rooms were small and the windows filthy. There weren't even any drawers to put your clothes in. I complained to management several times and to no avail. We had tried to move to another hotel, but unfortunately they were all booked and we had to stay a full week at the Water Club (what a nightmare!!). I highly recommend staying anywhere but the Water Club.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid the Water Club at all costs....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews and took the plunge into the Water Club in early June for a 4 night stay. It was just awful. Although technically "on" the beach, it really does not feel that way. It is tucked at the end of Tartak Street and there is a lot of noisy construction just outside the front door. The property is dirty and the sheets are some sort of 50/50 blend. The bathroom was full of mildew. In sum, it is just not a nice place. The rooftop bar attracts a crowd in the evenings and this lead to drunks roaming the halls making noise all night. I canceled my reservation after the first night and hopped on a puddle jumper and flew to Vieques just off the coast and salvaged the trip, so all was not lost.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid a Long Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The interior design and atmosphere, at first sight, is very hip; however, with time you will notice the important details that were ignored. Do not stay more than one or two nights; the awful service, undersized rooms (no closet), and the absence of real amenities will wear heavily on you. Weekend nights, the rooftop club patrons are more important to the hotel than actual guests (astonishing!); so, be prepared for many inconveniences those nights, including being frisked when entering the hotel. Also, the hotel claims an ocean view from every room; this is a stretch, few rooms have true ocean views. If you have stayed at other boutique hotels (e.g. the W Hotels or Ian Schrager Hotels), do not expect this hotel to meet that standard of design and service.

Reviews.Title: “Really wanted to like it...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like the Water Club. And if I return to San Juan, I will most likely stop by the bars here, as they were fun and attractive. However, we seriously contemplated moving hotels. The Water Club is a wonderful example of how great marketing (hip places, trendy decor, celebs) of a poor product (an awful, outdated hotel that was re-vamped without much concern to quality or substance) can make a lot of money. We paid for an ocean view room and my favorite part was being able to see the ocean while laying in bed. I didn't enjoy hearing the entire conversations of the neighbors. (The adjoining doors were shut, but provided no soundproofing whatsoever). While the fake wood floors in the rooms and tile floors in the hallway were attractive, they simply amplified all the noise. We weren't expecting it to be silent. We are a mid-20s couple who enjoy going out. However, we were woken up at 3 or 4 am on several occasions. (Liquid (the downstairs bar) letting out, etc.) One night, the fire alarms in the building went off at about 3:30 am. We all ran down the stairs and met outside. The hotel never announced what was going on or when it was safe to go back to our rooms. Totally unprofessional. As far as I could tell, the bathrooms had not been renovated, apart from new light fixtures, since the hotel was built. Not only were they tiny (two people could NOT be in the bathroom at the same time, unless one was physically in the tub/shower). The bathroom was no nicer/different than what you would expect at a Days Inn. The "pool" on the top of the building is approximately 6 feet x 10 feet. Not exactly made for swimming. However, there are nice lounge beds/sofas on the roof. If you go, take money. We couldn't believe that on a rainy day, when asked to borrow a game (from a list they had), we were charged $16 for UNO. We visited many of the neighboring hotels/casinos and I will not return to the Water Club. It isn't worth the price, simply to seem cool and hip in a crappy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Chi-Chi without substance”
Reviews.Author: DaBeatman
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Water Club while on a business trip at the beginning of March. To The Water Club will appeal to the same people who go to chi-chi lounges in SoHo (NYC) to see and be seen rather than get a nice meal and drinks at a decent price. A warning to business travelers: do NOT stay here. The Water Club's rooms are small without a large desk and have no room to work; there is no business center, either. Not to say that The Water Club ever claims to be that kind of hotel; just be forewarned. It is a place full of art deco design, where stunningly beautiful young women work on staff, but are not very efficient. Most of the young women working there are gorgeous, and they know it, too. You can cut the attitude and pretense with a butter knife. They don't smile or say hello to you when you walk past them or through the lobby. They are more comfortable walking down the runway catwalk. If you're looking to be attended to as a hotel guest, do not stay at The Water Club. You'll have to ask for towels or other amenities several times and will finally give up. A few things to note: (1) do NOT eat in the rip-off lounge on the lobby level. Breakfast for one can come out to $30 for a lousy omlette and some fresh fruit!; (2) check your folio VERY carefully before checking out. I was billed for valet parking every day...and I didn't even have a car!!; (3) expect to hear the "drip, drip, drip" recording of water in the very dimly lit hallways...it can get annoying after awhile, not to mention the fact that the three votive candles that were supposed to illuminate the hallway did not do the job. Those who will enjoy The Water Club are young couples looking for a break from the hustle-bustle of home and want to masquerade as part of the "in crowd" of beautiful people. The Water Club is a bit dirty in places, too. When I checked into my room there were long, black hairs on the bathrobe and bedsheets. There were also hairs and some "scumb" in the shower, too. The sheets and pillowcases on the bed were all wrinkled, indicating that the sheets had not been changed when the last people in my room had checked out. To be sure of this, I drew an "X" on an inconspicuous spot of the bedsheet and then asked the front desk to make sure my sheets were changed. When I returned to the room later that day, I noticed the "X" was still on the sheets. However, the chamber maid swore she had changed the sheets but said she'd do it again if I wanted her to. The gym downstairs is a dark room with The Water Club's trademark blue neon lights...absolutely no other lighting other than that, which gets maddening by the time you reach your third mile on the treadmill. One good thing about The Water Club is that the beach area in front of it is very nice. But, would I stay there again? Definitely not.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the many reviews here, I was apprehensive about staying at the Water Club. Now that I've been there, I think there are a lot of misconceptions out there. I'll try to address them....First, this is a boutique hotel, not a resort. That means it is a fairly standard hotel, but with lots of stylish twists. Water Club is over-the-top in it's stylish themes, but my main message is NOT to expect a resort. Aside from the IKEA look, the rooms are pretty standard hotel fare - average in size, with average amenities. You are paying for the style and - more importantly - the proximity to the beach....A lot of people complain that their reservations were messed up, but mine were right on. I would suggest calling the hotel itslef (not going through an agent). I got a better rate calling them myself, and they were quite friendly through and through. Also, know that an Ocean View room will not be on the Ocean. If you want to open your window directly in front of the beach, pay the extra $$$ and get the Ocean Front. I found the hotel staff to be delightful, but I am an easygoing person. I notice a lot of people being snotty with the hotel employees, and I don't care how much you are paying, it doesn't make it right to be impolite. That's not to say that everyone who complained in their reviews didn't have a legitimate beef, but I would suggest that travellers bear in mind that they are dealing with another human being when they have a complaint. A content employee will be a lot more inclined to help than one who's been scolded....All in all, the Water Club is a bit pricey, but it costs WAY more to stay at the resorts in the same area of San Juan....Some tourist tips: Don't expect yummy eating, we were wholly disappointed with every meal in San Juan (although my wife like the sushi in the Water Club's rooftop bar). Don't hail a cab into Old San Juan for $20-$30, take the bus for 25 cents!

Reviews.Title: “Hated It!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before I left this past Jan., and thought it can't be that bad...the Water Club is a boutique hotel? Wrong! The hotel staff isn't friendly. I had to wait 2 hours to check into my room, because I arrived before they offically allow you to check in. When I finally did get a room, it had an odor, the sheets could have used some bleach and the bathroom was a mildew heaven. There is no closet, so if you plan to stay for an extend visit you have no place for your clothes. Thankfully, I only had to spend one night in this overpriced boutique hotel, before I could check into another hotel. Any postive review about the hotel/rooms is obviously written by hotel management. (The restaurant and bar are the only decent thing about the Water Club.)

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Holy cow... I should have read the reviews first. Where do I start. The rooms are awful. They are cramped, and believe it or not, there are no closets and really no chest of drawers. The bathrooms at across the street at Taco Bell are nicer. The stucco plaster was pealing of the cieling, there are rust stains all over the tub... a complete disater.
