Also, the sheets are at least 50-50. Expect a poly rash. The bed springs were sticking out and there was more a less a crater in the middle. This placed is a complete fraud. I am surprised they are still in business.

Reviews.Title: “Have a drink at the rooftop bar and stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the reviews posted here. This hotel looks really cool -like something right out of South Beach. A drink at the rooftop bar is definitely worth it. However, staying at the hotel is a whole different story. Has all the ambience of a cheezy nightclub, in fact the staff makes may as well be bouncers - they sure act like them. The front desk is staffed with clueless 23 yr old girls. Rooms are small and painted all white, furnished with IKEA furniture that is well hidden with black lights. Dont be fooled, its just a blacklight! During my first time at this place, I checked in at 11 PM after a long flight only to be told they were overbooked and I had no room. They had made 0 attempt to find me a decent room in San Juan so it was up to me to call hotels. Sound like a poorly run hotel? It is - stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Water Club during Christmas week. My husband puts it best: "It was like MTV was filming the Real World and gave all its cast members a hotel to run." No one looked over 30 years old, which was good and bad. I was very scared when I read some scathing reviews on this website, but really, the hotel is not that horrible! If you expect luxury, you will not get it here, but while the staff was inexperienced, they made up for it in courtesy. We made many requests, from broken blinds to a missing t.v. remote, all of which were met/fixed almost immediately. The hotel is steps from the beach and while the pool is not what you'd find at a resort, why travel to PR to sit around a pool? The beach wasn't wall to wall people, like in front of the other hotels. The rooftop bar was fun. The restaurant, Tangerine, was very good, although the room service food and lunch at the bar were not. Yes, most things are overpriced, but you're paying for the view/location. Would I stay there again, probably not, because it was pretty pricey. It was refreshing, however, to stay at a "different" hotel. There weren't tons of kids and teenagers, which was especially pleasant being it was Christmas week. If you're looking for something different, this place is for you. If not, I'm sure you could stay at one of the resorts down the street for the same price as part of one of those "package deals."

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, Overrated and a Fraud”
Reviews.Author: iubitul78
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Water Club our last night in San Juan. We reserved an Ocean Front room, but were only given an Ocean View room at a rate that was $30 more than what was listed! The room had dirty window inside and out, a filthy bathrobe with coffee stains on it and no hot water. The front desk staff was friendly, but disorganized and seemed like they were still learning there jobs. It turns out they both had only been there a couple of months. They wound up double charging me for the room and I am still trying to get it straightened out. We were only there for 12 hours and it wasn't even worth the $339 we had to pay let alone the $738 that was charged to my credit card! Also, while it is true the hotel is on the beach, they do not provide beach chairs and the pool seemed to be perpetually closed. The food in the award winning restaurant Tangerine was less than stellar. The only good thing I can say about this place is that the rooftop bar with the leather mattresses to lay out on was quite nice. It affords an excellent view of the coastline and it is nice to have a drink and some sushi from the sushi bar and listen to the waves crash against the shore. Visit the rooftop bar (called Wet!) but DON'T stay at this hotel unless you want to feel taken advantage of and risk getting ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Checkin time is 3pm but we could not get into our room until 4pm The front desk is very unorganized and when we finally got to our room the maids were sitting around chatting and taking their time. When we were checking out the next day I mentioned that we had to wait for 1 hr to get into our room.. The front desk manager asked me if I had ever been in a Boutique Hotel before..the nerve...if you want a top notch Boutigue Hotel..go to Cabo and stay at Las Ventanas.... She should..as I am sure she would then know what service means...

HotelInfo.Name: San Juan Water & Beach Club Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 2 Tartak St, Isla Verde 00979, Puerto Rico
